English: Sleep in a Bearskin Bedroll while wearing a Wolfskin Coat, deerskin Boots, and Rabbitskin Mittens.
Nynorsk: Sov i ein bjørneskinnssovepose,medan du har på deg ulveskinnsjakke, hjorteskinnsstøvlar og vottar av kaninskinn.

English: Survive 10 days in a single Survival Mode game.

After a long walk around town, I found myself in front of St. Christopher’s again. Even with Father McGill gone many months now, I still find some joy in tending what’s left of the back garden and sweeping out the dust from the Sanctuary. It warms my heart that several of us have banded together to keep the place feeling alive, at least for now. I know our little chores have eased the feeling of being left behind. Ah, Milton.
Notes: Journal/Diary/Word processor doc by Anika Longmire, Female, 41

English: With the weather turning cold again, and Jason gone more and more, I have been walking a lot. It is a balm to the slow, freezing, stillness that creeps up on us every year. And sometimes, with a gentle breeze pushing my hair back as I look down over the Basin, I don’t miss Mass at all. God is with us here, in this place.
Notes: Journal/Diary/Word processor doc by Anika Longmire, Female, 41

English: Jason left again this morning on another trip. Americans out of Anchorage this time. Here to see just how wild it gets on Great Bear. You would think they'd get enough of that at home. They will get all they can stomach, and maybe more, but at least they have the best guide on the Island to show them the way. I try not to cry when he leaves, but I always see something of our little family in his tired face. And when I do, his belief makes my own stronger. So I cried a little, just for a moment. This time Steph saw me getting upset which seems to bother her more and more as she gets older. Even at ten, her resolve and sharp eyes warm my heart. I see her father in her face, too.
Notes: Journal/Diary/Word processor doc by Anika Longmire, Female, 41

English: I ran into Susan yesterday and asked her how the video chat sessions with Father McGill were going. She did not say much. But then again she didn’t come to our reading last week or the week before either. I know those of us left behind are not what she really wants, but it is all we have. I wish she could see that. It is so easy to be afraid of friends, and of love. And she has enough of her own grief after what happened. Out here, isolation can become its own special wound. I will check in on her again next week.
Notes: Journal/Diary/Word processor doc by Anika Longmire, Female, 41

English:
I walked Steph to the schoolhouse this morning, and then went up to the park on my lunch break. I brought some cheese and an apple, and read a bit at the benches up there. It was cold and bright, at first. Great weather for eating and thinking. The basin looked gorgeous, in that way you see all over Great Bear, where each day’s horizon feels unique somehow.

As soon as I tossed my apple core over the edge, it started lightly snowing. A vast, grey haze had settled over the valley below. A wolf howled, but from somewhere far away. Even as things have changed over the last years, and neighbour and friends have moved to the Mainland, I still do not regret our choice to remain here. I think Steph is starting to see this and understand it too. There is something wild, hard, and stubborn growing in her, but also kind. I smile when I think about it, perhaps selfishly. Rejecting pride also means finding ways to leave control behind, and let others, even your own daughter, find her own way from time to time. A good day. I hope my apple sprouts a tree this spring.
Notes: Journal/Diary/Word processor doc by Anika Longmire, Female, 41
"username" field for BankA text editor memories

English: Bear activity around the Mystery Lake Region is pronounced, although human interaction by all accounts is very rare. This is to be expected this time of year, and based on the available data we can make the following conclusions:
Suggests adaptation to the new seasonal high temperatures. Recommend further study to confirm shift in migration. Previous observations confirm their presence.

What a time to be out here, Shari! I made the right decision. Observations are going well, and I hope to be done with research here on the southern end of the island by the end of the week. Locals tell me I should have through the end of the month before any weather starts getting in the way of my plans to head north. Tell Dr. Chase the data look promising wrt his publication date.

Predatory species, if introduced could see a profound devastation of Mystery Lake’s local fish stocks. We will need to follow up to check whether there are attempts to introduce these invasive species deliberately.
Will be expecting their return this winter, but end results remain unknown. I hope to gather additional data on this phenomenon next spring. Continued logging could be a factor to consider.

Hi Dan, hope you are well. Have you had any luck getting any pharmaceuticals delivered out there in the Valley? My usual Mainland contact has stopped returning my calls and emails. Supplies are low, and people are starting to notice the delay.
 Peter.

15 Candy Bars, 10 packets of Beef Jerky, 5 cans of peaches, 15 bottles of Water. (Who knew kids could eat this much in a weekend?)
 **Add this to next order, please.**
Antibiotics, painkillers, antiseptic, whatever you have. We’re down to nothing and it’s all my fault.

Hank, I can barely get dog food delivered out this far right now. Quit asking me to restock the beer fridge. You’ll just have to wait like the rest of us. Believe me, when they arrive, I’ll buy you one myself.
 Peter.
The jumpseat's all there is, so I said sign me up. Got to get home ASAP. There’s a chance it’s too late anyway.
They're promising me a bumpy ride. Sounds about right. Nothing and no one left this far north.
I made it down somehow. Ankle’s twisted up good. This damn computer’s going to make it longer than me, looks like. Angie, I'm sorry.
One more trip up north. The way things are going it'll be the last, either way. But walking away right now feels good, if there's any good left in all of this.

Hey Geoff, just finished my shift. Couple things -- keep an eye on the windows in the Lower Dam. The wind’s really been picking up down there this week and those old windows don’t look too sturdy. Just stay safe when doing your rounds, brother. This whole place is falling down around us.
Notes: Email exchange between Geoff and Teddy Wallace, two brothers, 21 and 25, Dam employees

English: Teddy, just a heads up for when you clock in tonight, old McPherson finished off a whole bottle again and is sleeping it off in his office. Not the first time, I know, but the schedule is still the schedule. FYI I patched some concrete around Turbine #2 today. It might still be wet when you get here.
Notes: Email exchange between Geoff and Teddy Wallace, two brothers, 21 and 25, Dam employees

English: Geoff, please plan on backing me up when Mr. Clarke visits next week. McPherson won’t say it, but we need more help out here. You and I can’t get this work done on our own. Not sure why you can’t just see things my way for once.
Notes: Email exchange between Geoff and Teddy Wallace, two brothers, 21 and 25, Dam employees

English: Roger that on the meeting with Clarke, Teddy. It’ll work out. I’m still grateful for the work, even if this whole project is pretty crazy. Once I patch my boat this Spring you’ll see it was worth it. Back out on the water, finally! Have a good shift.
Notes: Email exchange between Geoff and Teddy Wallace, two brothers, 21 and 25, Dam employees

English: Geoff, don’t forget to talk with McPherson after you clock in today. Remember that trapper we hired to clear wolves from Winding River last Fall? McPherson found him lurking inside the fence line yesterday, uninvited. He slipped away as soon as McPherson spotted him, but we’ll want to keep an eye out, after what happened last year. We don’t want that guy just wandering around. He’s been out in the woods a long time, and is so...unpredictable. Creeps me out.
Notes: Email exchange between Geoff and Teddy Wallace, two brothers, 21 and 25, Dam employees

English: Vaughn left through the Winding River exit again without his safety harness. I’ve asked Teddy Wallace to check his gear next time Vaughn has work out on that side. Has my request for additional help been processed yet? Some of these guys are loose cannons.
Witnessed Benton improperly accessing service panel #7 on the second turbine. He will get himself killed, or lose an arm to an electrical burn the next time he does this.

he didn’t say, but what he did find was Hays on the ground in the main bathroom. He said he slipped on water from the ongoing leak we’ve been dealing with. A fractured elbow, which means we’re down a man during the refit.

Conduit D caught fire in the lower corridor, but the suppression system failed. The Wallace brothers were first to arrive and managed to contain it. I’d like to see their response recognized by the company, which you can read in the attached memo.

We spotted that local trapper again, our “ghost.” This time he was lurking out beyond the boundary of the Dam’s property. He seems to know some hidden trails to pass over to Winding River without dealing with our fence line. If in next quarter’s budget, please send some company reps to make contact with him. We badly need the local help, and he might be a good contact.

Notes: Title string for the Buffer Memory "E-Mail" application, Modern appearance

English: Barren catch today. Winds picked up and turned offshore, so I had to come in early. As expected.
Caught sight of another giant trawler today, maybe 10 miles off. Definitely American, but couldn’t tell you its home port. I bet they’re busier than I am.

With prices as they are, it pays to fish. But only if I can get the damn things into my boat. The funding and supplies to refit they promised if I helped with that fish survey don’t seem to be showing up. At this rate I’m better off them sending me chewing gum to patch up my dory.

With all the lines I put out today, I was happy to get some decent returns. Been a while since I put down numbers like that in my book. It’s not anything like a recovery, but it lines up with the idea I’ve been havin about the Mainland fleet and their movements.

My ropes are fraying so badly I don’t think another repair for some of these lines is going to do it. I wonder when I can expect delivery of the supplies I ordered. A sailboat without a sail doesn’t do anyone any good.

Quake activity getting worse. There’s a fine crack forming along the base of the structure. We need to bring out a crew again to fix it, and soon. None of the little quakes have knocked the lamp too bad, and we’ve had zero downtime, thank God.
Notes: Word processor "logbook", by Name Unknown, Lighthouse keeper, male, 41

English: Water is leaking through the floor around the drive mechanism up top. The sealant up there looks shot. I went down to Hibernia the other day to see if they had a bit of something I could patch it with, but no luck. A useless bunch, like always. But the fellows there have their own problems, by the looks of it.
Notes: Word processor "logbook", by Name Unknown, Lighthouse keeper, male, 41

English: The main drive jammed up last night, but no damage to the lens or other components as far as I could tell. A lot of grease and some work with the mallet got it going again. That’s the third time this month we had a breakdown at night. Seas are rough enough this time of year. Anyone coming around the point doesn’t need us making it harder on them.
Notes: Word processor "logbook", by Name Unknown, Lighthouse keeper, male, 41

English: An odd fellow turned up yesterday, banging on my door. He was frozen solid, and said he’d come through the old mine, up the coast from the Townsite. I warmed him by the fire and gave him hot tea, some of my last. He had dark stories about goings on around the rest of the island, and claimed he was heading north up the highway. The worst of things since the Collapse hadn’t reached us down here at the Point yet, he said. I warned him about the damage to the road and bridges he was going to run into, but it didn’t faze him. He was sleeping right there on the damn floor in front of the stove when I left him. When I came back down after working some on the lens, he was gone.
Notes: Word processor "logbook", by Name Unknown, Lighthouse keeper, male, 41
"username" field for LighthouseA text editor memories

English:
Mr. Dennis,

I took one of the trucks over the Muskeg last night. I think you should know there’s some strange stuff going on over there on the run in to Mystery Lake. I saw a man on the tracks, but he bolted before I could get very close. A couple minutes later as I got closer to the tunnel, some idiots started throwing stones at my rig. Charlie took the truck back out to the Shed this morning, as I’m staying over here at the Breyerhouse Camp near Carter Dam to finish up. But if you’re wondering why the windshield has a big ‘ol crack in it, that’s why. 

Jerry Baltimore, Crew No. 2

Mr. Dennis,

We were out in the hills above the Coastal Highway this morning when we saw a couple guys messing with our truck. We chased after them but they had a head start and scampered away before we could get back up there. We found an old knapsack nearby with some papers in it talking about “Forest Talkers”. Some kind of new green group, I bet. They must have done something to the truck, as it was bucking and lurching after that on the drive back to the Lake, including over the trestle! We figured water in the gas tank, but no matter. Was damn scary. 

What does management plan on doing about these guys messing with us? Are you going to back us up?

J. Baltimore, Crew No. 2

Mr. Dennis,

Thanks for getting back to me. It’s good to know you passed on the word to management about getting more security out to the Shed. Even if we can’t always keep an eye on everything when we’re out working, it’s good to know our gear should be safe overnight there. 

Jerry, Crew No. 2

Mr. Dennis,

The tremors are getting worse. Any word from above on whether we still have to take the short way to Coastal Highway? Even with a stable trestle, it’s a nervous-enough trip as it is. And our gear is already out in the open over there for the eco hippies still running around the woods this year. I know it’s more gas, and a longer trip, but if we take the long way ‘round, me and the guys would feel a lot better about things. We all thought you should know.

Jerry
Look, you'll just have to go out there. If we don't keep this contract, we're done. That’s it.
He wasn't kidding. This old marsh goes on forever. Swallow me right up.

Sector 13 Tower Failure. Requires remote service. Predator deterrents recommended. Reconnect upon fulfillment.
 Partner Specialist 81926.
Mail today! First piece in three days, all the way from the east coast even. Gives me something to do, finally.
Higgins wasn’t at his spot this morning. Odd. Can’t remember the last time that happened.

After three years here, it’s starting to feel like home. Still, we get fewer and fewer pieces of mail. For all the letter writing folks in Milton get up to, it’s a shame they receive so few responses.

A small package came in this morning and it’s been in shipping limbo for a while, by the look of it. No surprise these days, but a minor miracle it got all the way here from Toronto. If freight has opened back up again, that’s a great sign.

Zero customers today, a new record! Just as well. The morning was better spent out on the dock with my binoculars. More and more ships passing, heading south. What will they find on The Mainland, I wonder. A warmer welcome? Not likely.
Notes: Word processor Journal, by Barbara Quincy, Garage Owner, female, 62

English: Tanker truck finally made it down here from up-Island. Wasn’t our regular driver, rather some guy they drafted into the job at the refinery it sounds like. He couldn’t say when the next trip down would be. It doesn’t seem too bad, seeing as we don’t get too many passing through these days. Bothers me more that the refinery is having trouble filling their orders. I can’t imagine propane and heating oil are in good shape if they can’t even ship out their gasoline on time. Even with more and more electric cars making their way out here, finally, we still need that delivery.
Notes: Word processor Journal, by Barbara Quincy, Garage Owner, female, 62

English: Apparently a small tree tipped over in the storm last night. It was leaning up against the side of the Garage when I pulled up this morning. And what did I see walking around up there? A wolf. I almost choked on my coffee. I left her be, and when I went out later she was gone. Bill Farney stopped to fill his truck with some of his crew and they were able to chop it up. I paid them in timber. Even now, the Island still has a few tricks I haven’t seen before. Folks at my old plant on The Mainland would have lost it if they saw this.
Notes: Word processor Journal, by Barbara Quincy, Garage Owner, female, 62
"username" field for QuonsetGasStation text editor memories

English: First day on the job! Besides the usual reports, the weather service asked me to keep a personal log of some kind. It sounds like the fellow who was here before me had a touch of cabin fever towards the end, and they thought it would be good for me to write a bit. And with the interference the weather service guys have been seeing this year getting the emergency weather warnings out, there might be some downtime anyway. But the good news is that when we are on the air, they are going to let me broadcast a little bit of music as well. Should be fun.
Notes: Word processor logbook, by Sarah Easton, Female, 29

English: Found myself whistling Richard Strauss tone poems the whole way up the hill this morning. Maybe Don Quixote a little later today? Then again, that’s more a piece for the Mainlanders these days. No windmills out here, only wind. We’ll go with Zarathustra instead. It’s been nice to get airtime between weather reports to broadcast some music, something to perk up the sleepy days out here in the Valley.
Notes: Word processor logbook, by Sarah Easton, Female, 29

English: After a long shift, these notes start to feel more and more like a confessional. Tough for whoever the weather service ends up replacing me with up here. They’ll have to read through these things! Then again, I’m starting to mumble and sing to myself while I work, Glenn Gould-style. It’s probably better to write some of it down...haha.
Notes: Word processor logbook, by Sarah Easton, Female, 29

English: My folks were pretty down and out this morning before I left. I promised my dad I’d see about switching up the playlist a little today. Maybe some Beatles would cheer him up? It’d be nice if the store at the Crossroads could get coffee delivered back up here to the Valley, finally. I miss that little mocha machine we had at the Conservatory. The practice rooms were tiny, even smaller than this Hut. A hot cup always made the hours drift by a bit quicker. Still, even spending all day in this weather station, I don’t miss the Mainland.
Notes: Word processor logbook, by Sarah Easton, Female, 29

English: Great news! I got word yesterday there might be a piano again down in Milton. Only a dusty old upright, it sounds like, but still. The manager at the Credit Union pulled some strings and had one delivered from the Mainland, so the school could do sing-alongs and stage some plays. I had been down there a few times to play some Bach on the Church’s old organ, but it’s just not the same. I have to gas up my dad’s truck tomorrow, so I might drive down there and take a look. I hope it’s been tuned since it came off the ferry!
Notes: Word processor logbook, by Sarah Easton, Female, 29
"username" field for RadioControlHut text editor memories

English:
Request extraction. Wolves everywhere. Chased out of the Muskeg to the coast. All predator deterrents failed.
No food left. Going to check out the work site down below tower 12, for supplies -- use code 1540 to bypass security doors. Hurry.
...
        Sector 12 Tower Failure. Remote service for Automated Relay. Extreme Predator Threat.
        Partner Specialist 81926

Dear Marie,

It was great to hear from you, and yes, I am still out on Great Bear! It’s been a brutal early winter. We’ve had one road closure due to avalanches already, which in all my years here I can’t remember ever coming this early. Farmers didn’t even have time to get their hay in from the fields, the snow moved in so quick. At least I hope it’s the weather. There are other stories floating around that aren’t so easy to understand these days.Thankfully the late autumn deliveries were decent enough this year, and the store is as stocked as I could hope at the moment. But there are some desperate people here in the Valley. They don’t talk to me very often about how things are going for them, but I can see it on their faces.

Give my best to Greg and the little ones,

Danny
Notes: Emails from Dan Presnell, Shopkeeper, Male, 57

English:
Dear Mr. Galveston,

My last shipment from Better Food Vendors was incomplete. Although they are clearly listed on the invoice, I couldn’t for the life of me locate any Pinnacle Peaches or Big Moose Kicks Coffee in the pallet delivered to my shop. With winter coming soon, it’s very important that I get these missing items delivered as soon as possible. We’re a small community, but my stock runs out fast, and with shipping already so bad...Fruit, not to mention coffee, is rare out here on Great Bear Island. But they might as well be staples to us. This might be hard to imagine, but we Islanders have little by way of comforts and these items are cherished. I hope you understand the predicament this error puts me in.

If you could please look into this issue and let me know how we can clear it up, I would appreciate it very much.

Regards,

Dan Presnell
Notes: Emails from Dan Presnell, Shopkeeper, Male, 57

English:
Dear Service Manager,

I am confirming disconnect of our single, J735 model ATM at our store here on Great Bear Island. It’s been more than a year, and an empty ATM is about as useful as you can imagine. It’s kind of a bad joke just letting it sit there empty these days, but I don’t really mind. More to the point, it’s your property, so please let me know if you have any other service trips planned to Great Bear this year. I could even truck it down to Milton if it would be easier to pick up there.  

Please update me on if this is possible or not, at your earliest convenience.

Regards,

Dan Presnell, Customer No. K35812
Notes: Emails from Dan Presnell, Shopkeeper, Male, 57

English:
Hey Doug!

Hope you’re good. I wanted to ask you about old Tom Joplin, do you remember him? He lives over on Skeeter’s Ridge. He’s started saying some funny stuff the last couple weeks whenever he visits the store. He doesn’t look well, but you know, we’ve never gotten along really well. Especially since Linda got sick. She knew him best, from Milton. 

Does he have any other family on the island that you remember? I’d rather not head over there and check on him myself. He might not even see me if I did. 

It’s not the same here since you and Denise moved away! I guess I could get down to The Mainland to visit more often. I think about leaving for good more and more. With no one left to talk me out of it, it’s looking more likely than ever. But there’s still the winter ahead, no matter what I decide.

Just let me know about Joplin if you can. And remember brother, don’t be a stranger!

Danny
Notes: Emails from Dan Presnell, Shopkeeper, Male, 57

English:
Mr. Galveston,

Forget the Peaches and Coffee, your man didn’t even make it out here this month! When can I expect him? Do I have to remind you I pay in full and in advance for these shipments? I pay what I do because they are vital for our daily lives way out here. In the past the money was enough to remind you of this fact, but times have changed it looks like. 

I am available anytime, please email me. Phones are unreliable out here. 

Dan Presnell
Notes: Emails from Dan Presnell, Shopkeeper, Male, 57

English: Responded to the railroad worker near the ravine. Bad encounter with a Wolf, they said. His leg took the worst of it but I couldn’t do much.
Their Antiseptic was expired, and they had no other meds on-hand. Used most of my kit treating him, but even then I expect a poor outcome.
The hike up to overlook after the call came in over the radio was uneventful. It had started to snow, which didn’t leave me confident about an evac if we needed it.
Was clear they had tried to fashion a crude splint for the patient’s leg. It was ineffective, and he was suffering badly. The wolf bite had gone right to the bone, which was visible.
For future attacks, we'd benefit from some kind of follow-up protocol for these remote workers. They don’t trust us, but it could be a way to build something.

I just landed at Great Bear Island. DeepWild flew me out from the Mainland by float plane. Should be quite the trip. Remember, I’ll be out of reach for the next two weeks. If it’s all they promised, I’ll be a new man when I get back.

We are sorry to inform you that due to ongoing instability in our fuel supply chain, we will have to re-time your planned extraction from our DeepForest Experience on majestic Great Bear Island.
 Please be aware, it may take up to 7 business days before we can reschedule. 
 Thank you for your understanding and patience,
 DeepWild Adventure.
I was told exit plans for this trip were guaranteed! “Gold Plated Exit,” you told me. What happened to that promise? When can I expect a response?
Greg, when you get this, contact my lawyer and fill them in on what’s happening out here. I can’t get a response from DeepWild and at this point I don’t expect one.
I’m still holed up with some locals. I’m not sure they’ve ever left this island or would even know how to. They seem to be losing patience with me. Have you had any luck?

English: "A dirt path well worn in by children with big imaginations"
"Start on tomorrow for Back's Fish River."
"Courage is knowing what not to fear."
"All alone in space and time. Nothing's here, but what's here is mine."
"Gari the Cat, my lonely friend, not grateful enough for the time we spent"
"I promised her we'd build our house here."
"Continuing the selfless spirit of Nanny Sylv."
"He was here with his sister Natalie"
"A great son, a better man. Godspeed."
"Find me where the cedars meet the sea"
"For all who take on the struggle for love and inclusion."
The signed in profile has changed.
Notes: xbox 1 cert string for Profile Changed event
xbox 1 cert string for Profile switch in MainMenu

Nynorsk: Du treng ikkje … la oss ikkje …

English: Will! Shut up for a second. Something’s wrong!
Nynorsk: Will! Hald kjeft eit sekund. Noe er galt!

English: I know. I know. And I wouldn’t be here if it weren’t important.
Nynorsk: Eg vet. eg vet. Og eg ville ikkje ha kommet om det ikkje var viktig.

English: No, not me. But I need to get to someone who is.
Nynorsk: Nei, ikkje jeg. Men eg må komme meg til nokon som er det.

English: I need your help. There’s an isolated community in the Northern part of Great Bear. Someone there is very sick and...
Nynorsk: Eg treng hjelpa di. Det er eit isolert samfunn på den nordre delen av Sværebjørn. Ein person der er veldig sjuk og …

English: There’s an isolated community in the Northern part of Great Bear. Someone there is very sick and...
I know...but, I have to get there.
Nynorsk: Eg vet, men eg må komme meg dit.

English: I didn’t come here to fight about the past. I need a pilot to take me somewhere remote.
Nynorsk: Eg kom ikkje hit for å krangle om fortiden. eg treng ein pilot som kan ta meg til eit avsidesliggende sted.

English: Someone who won’t ask too many questions. Someone I can trust.
Nynorsk: En som ikkje stiller for mange spørsmål. Ein eg kan stole på.

English: Are you going to help me or not?
Nynorsk: Vil du hjelpe meg eller ikke?

English: There’s that thing about no questions, remember.
Nynorsk: Eg tror eg nevnte noko om spørsmål, viss du husker.

English: No, you don’t know, Mackenzie. You don’t know. Anything.
Nynorsk: Nei, det vet du ikke, Mackenzie. Du vet ikkje noe. Ingenting.

English: Are you going to take me or not? The longer I wait the worse it’ll get.
Nynorsk: Vil du ta meg med eller ikke? Jo lenger eg venter, jo verre vert det.

English: Dammit, I don’t have time for this...
Nynorsk: Helvete, eg har ikkje tid til dette …

English: I see you’re still wearing it.
Nynorsk: Eg ser du fortsatt går med den.

English: It’s ok. I’ve kept busy. I’ve moved on.
Nynorsk: det er greit. eg har hatt nok å gjøre, og eg har lagt det bak meg.

English: No...I’m, not working at the Centre anymore.
Nynorsk: Nei, eg jobber ikkje ved senteret lenger.

English: I’m working on my own. Freelance, you could say.
Nynorsk: Eg jobber for meg sjølv. Frilans, kan du si.

English: I don’t question your life choices, Mackenzie.
Nynorsk: Eg stiller ikkje spørsmål ved dine valg i livet, Mackenzie.

English: Plenty of things you could be doing besides hanging out in your dad’s old plane...and drinking in the daytime...
Nynorsk: det er mykje du kan gjera foruten å henge i flyet til faren din … og drikke på dagen.

English: I know. OK. I know. I’m not here to fight. Really.
Nynorsk: Eg vet. Ok. eg vet. eg kom ikkje for å krangle. Helt sant.

English: A locked case. Well, that is interesting.
Nynorsk: Eit låst skrin. det var interessant …

English: What I did. The choice I made. I did it for us you know.
Nynorsk: det eg gjorde. Valget eg tok. eg gjorde det for oss.

English: No, it’s important that you hear this. There’s things I need to say...
Nynorsk: Jo, det er viktig at du hører dette. det er noko eg må fortelle deg …

English: Power’s gone. Whole electrical system looks fried.
Nynorsk: Strømmen er borte. Hele det elektriske systemet har tatt kvelden.

English: No power means we’re going down. Hald tight.
Nynorsk: Ingen strøm betyr at vi styrter. Hald deg fast.

English: Jackrabbit Remote Air Transport. Mackenzie speaking.
Woah woah...slow down, Maureen. What are you talking about?
Nynorsk: Hei, hei, rolig nå, Maureen. kva snakker du om?

English: It’s ok, Maureen. I’ve got it from here.
Nynorsk: det er greit, Maureen. eg tar meg av det.

English: Yeah...years. I haven’t heard from you...since...
Nynorsk: Ja, flere år. eg har ikkje hørt frå deg … sidan …
Vel, hvorfor er du … eg mener …

English: Great Bear? There’s nothing there anymore. Not since...
Nynorsk: Sværebjørn? det er ingenting der lenger. ikkje sidan …

English: Still trying to save the world, huh?
Nynorsk: Du prøver fortsatt å redde verden?

English: Wait...questions? Astrid. Are you in trouble?
Nynorsk: Spørsmål? Astrid, er du i trøbbel?
Hva har du i skrinet, Astrid?

English: Look. The weather out there is bad. BAD.

Nynorsk: det er eit møkkavær, og det vert plassig verre.
Du kjem spaserende inn her etter … flere år.

English: I could have been dead. You could have been.
Nynorsk: Eg kunne ha dødd. Du òg.

English: Then you show up, and you want me to just risk my life flying you into the middle of the great Northern nowhere, to deliver you and some mystery metal case to some remote wilderness outpost.
Nynorsk: Så dukker du opp og ber meg om å slippe alt og risikere livet for å fly deg nordover inn i ingenmannsland, slik at du kan ta med eit mystisk metallskrin til ein øde utpost i villmarken.

English: Just because you walked in here and asked me to?
Nynorsk: Bare fordi du kom valsende inn hit og ba meg om det?
Du kan ikkje bringe han Attende.

English: I know how hard it’s been...
Nynorsk: Eg vet at du har hatt det tungt …

English: You don’t think I feel it too?
Nynorsk: Du tror ikkje eg òg kjenner på det?

English: Why do I have a feeling you’re not talking about the weather?
Nynorsk: Hvorfor har eg på følelsen at du ikkje snakker om været?

English: Throw your bags in the plane. I’ll get started on pre-flight.
Nynorsk: Sleng bagene dine i flyet. eg gjer klart for avgang.

English: Better buckle up tight because it’s going to be a rough ride...
Nynorsk: Fest sikkerhetsbeltet, for det vert ein humpete tur.

English: Oh...yeah. I mean...I just forgot to take it off.
Nynorsk: Å … ja. eg glemte å ta den av.

English: I thought you wanted to forget.
Look...I should have looked for you.
Nynorsk: Du, eg burde ha lett etter deg.

English: You sure? Because this all seems pretty familiar.
Nynorsk: Sikker? For dette føles veldig kjent.

English: You still working with that researcher? Dr...what’s his name.
Nynorsk: Jobber du fortsatt sammen med den forskeren? kva heter han?
Frilans lege? det høres … lovlig ut.

English: Hey...we had a lot of good times in this plane.
Nynorsk: Kom igjen, vi hadde mykje moro i dette flyet.

English: I think about him all the time, you know.
Nynorsk: Eg tenker på han hele tiden.

Notes: setup as test for TLD-13482 only

English: Well, that trip was a waste. [TEMP]
Notes: setup as test for TLD-13482 only
setup as test for TLD-13482 only

English: Damn! Why can’t I get anything... [TEMP]
Notes: setup as test for TLD-13482 only

English: Collect all four bloody pages from the Blackrock Archives.
Learn the truth behind all three Blackrock rumours.
Escape Blackrock and Complete Episode Four.
Uncover the latest Forest Talker Plans.
Just...leave me alone. I'm not opening this door for anyone.
Thank you, stranger. You may not care, but you've made a huge difference to our cause.
Yeah...I'm still weak. Going to rest up here, until I'm ready to move on.
I am... but I'm not letting you in, they killed my friend. How do I know you aren't one of them?
I'll die out here without my gear.
We left most of our supplies at the old Logging Camp while we fished here. Can you get it for me?
Yeah. In that abandoned dam...we found evidence that proves there shouldn't be logging in Mystery Lake. I need that evidence.
Documents nobody wanted to be found. We hid them until we could retrieve them. Under a floor tile at the bottom of the stairwell.
If you can help me get the documents back...wow, it would be a huge win for the environment.
If you care about, you know, living in the world.
Here's the key to the trailer where we stashed our supplies. I'll slide it under the door.
Did you find our stuff yet? The supplies? And the documents? I need both.
Hey...that's great. Thank you. But...hey, I hope you understand if I ask you to just leave them outside the door.

Controls which Image Filter is active -- either monochromatic Noir, or Heritage, for a vintage look.

Note: Heritage mode is inspired by classic National Film Board content from the 1970s and 1980s.
Day 1: Wildlife have vanished -- use this time to explore and gather supplies for the long nights ahead. Survive at least two real-time hours to make progress towards 4DON Rewards.
Notes: Added "Survive at least two real-time hours to make progress towards 4DON Rewards."
Nynorsk: Dag 1: Dyrelivet har kvorve; nytt denne tida til å utforska og å samla forsyningar for dei komade nettene. Overlev minst to timar i sanntid for å gjera framsteg mot 4DON vederlag.

English: Day 2: Wolves have returned to Great Bear Island, watch out! Survive at least two real-time hours to make progress towards 4DoN Rewards.
Nynorsk: Dag 2: Ulvane har returnert til Sværebjørn, ver å vakt! Overlev minst to timar i sanntid for å gjera framsteg mot 4DON vederlag.

English: Day 3: With the Aurora in the sky, wolves are even more dangerous. Beware! Survive at least two real-time hours to make progress towards 4DON Rewards.
Nynorsk: Dag 3: No med nordljoset på himmelen er ulvane endå farlegare, pass deg! Overlev minst to timar i sanntid for å gjera framsteg mot 4DON vederlag.

English: Day 4: A monster blizzard has arrived. Don't stray too far from your fire, or else! Survive at least two real-time hours to make progress towards 4DON Rewards.
Nynorsk: Dag 4: Eit fæla uvêr har komen. Går ein langt vekk frå bålet varar ein ikkje lenge! Overlev minst to timar i sanntid for å gjera framsteg mot 4DON vederlag.

English: Low-volume fuel source designed to help start fires; ex. lighter fluid.
Nynorsk: Lettenneleg væske, kjem vel med når ein kjapt skal få fyr på bålet.

English: Medium-volume fuel source designed to help start fires; ex. charcoal fuel.
Nynorsk: Lettenneleg væske, kjem vel med når ein kjapt skal få fyr på bålet.

Notes: Title for a Controls option that turns out "click+hold" interactions to just a single click; meant for people with Carpal Tunnel Syndrome.

English: Toggle between interactions like opening doors and containers being On Hold, or on Click/Press.
Nynorsk: Byt mellom å halde inne eller å trykkja for å gjera hangligar, t.d. å opna dører og behaldarar.

English: Converts all "press and hold" actions into press actions, for people with CTS or similar considerations.
Notes: descriptive text for the Accessible Interactions control option.
Nynorsk: Alle «trykk og hald»-handlingar gjerast om til trykkhandlingar. For spelarar med karpaltunnelsyndrom e.l.

English: Toggle between interactions like opening doors and containers being On Hold, or on Press.
A crusty flatbread cooked with Acorns.
Nynorsk: Eit knasande flatt brød laga av eikenøttmjøl.
Ein kopp fylt med kaffi laga av eikenøtter.

English: Eat them as a snack or hammer them into Acorn Grounds for coffee.
Nynorsk: Steike eikenøtter ein kan knaska på eller mala til eikenøttmjøl.

English: Nuts from an Oak Tree. Prepare the Acorns to remove their leathery shell prior to Cooking.
Nynorsk: Nøtter frå eit eiketre. Førebu dei for å fjerna skalet før steiking.

English: Ground Acorns. Makes for a wholesome, but very weak, cup of coffee.
Nynorsk: Mjøl av malne eikenøtter. Kan nyttast som erstatning for kveitemjøl og kaffipulver.
Gode gamle pannekaker, laga av eikenøttmjøl.

English: Shelled Acorns. Must be cooked prior to eating or hammering into grounds for coffee.
Nynorsk: Skrella eikenøtter. Må seikjast før dei kan verta mala til eikenøttmjøl.

English: The wireless controller is no longer connected. Please reconnect the controller and press a button to continue playing.
Nynorsk: Den trådlause kontrollaren er ikkje lenger tilkopla. Kopla til kontrollaren og trykk på ein knapp for å fortsetja spelet.

English: The controller is no longer connected. Please reconnect the controller and press a button to continue playing.
Nynorsk: Kontrollaren er ikkje lenger tilkopla. Kopla til kontrollaren og trykk på ein knapp for å fortsetja spelet.

Notes: Feats are a benefit that the player receives, this is the header for the screne where they choose which ones to enable and disable. It follows the words "Choose Your".

English: Select which unlocked feats you'd like to activate for this Sandbox game.
Nynorsk: Vel kva bragdar du ynskjer å aktivera for sandkassespelet ditt.

English: Return {name} to the Community Hall before attempting another rescue
Adjust the slider until The Long Dark logo is barely visible, and the wolf disappears completely.
Nynorsk: Juster glidebrytaren til The Long Dark-logoen knapt er synleg, og du ikkje kan sjå ulven lenger.

English: Move further away from the Darkwalker.

Notes: cause string will be appended, so format will be 'Caused By: Wolf Bite'

English: Move further away from the Darkwalker.
You are running out of air to breathe. Find a pocket of clear air or equip a Respirator before you die.
Nynorsk: Du går tom for luft å pusta. Finn ei lomme med frisk luft eller ta på deg ei vernemaske før du døyr.

English: Seeing the helicopters come over the mountains again this year. I counted three last month, and two already this month. Always as the weather turns colder. I know they can’t all be tourists. Not anymore and not for a long while anyway.
A loose piece of typewritten paper.

Mission status unclear. Pilot activity appears routine and as predicted in my initial briefing.

Business here at the field hardly registers as cover for any activity grander than mail delivery or solidarity in this godforsaken place.

12 June 1991

Poppy always talked about the beauty out here. And after a few weeks on this survey I can see that. It cost him a lot, all this endless sky. Still haven’t reached the mine yet. My own work keeps getting in the way.

He always said they were the one group you could never refuse, that company. You’d never work again.


But he got sick and all I’ve found out here are the bones and whispers of a dead company. Even the name seems forgotten. No sense to it yet.

Welcome Associate!

Here at Field 31 we take pride in being a pilot’s best resource in the wilderness. From refueling to resupplying to a hot cup of coffee, our goal is to be a welcome waystation for all visitors.

From time to time, sensitive and hazardous cargo will pass through our hands and we need to make sure all precautions are taken to safeguard it while it’s in our care. Your supervisor will direct you in all work tasks that may or may not intersect with such cargo. Otherwise, it’s nothing Field Associates need to concern themselves with. This is for your safety!

Similarly, any off-field visitors you may see handling unlabeled cargo are not to be engaged or noted in any way. Their clearance is pre-checked before they arrive.

We hope you find your work at our little outpost rewarding!

– Dayshift Supervisor
I’ll keep writing as long as my hands hold up. The old road can’t be all broken. I didn’t fly in here and there’s no way they can make me fly out. No matter what the hell they say is going on.

For advanced players. Once an active entry point for the Far Territory's wild interior, Forsaken Airfield lives in the shadow of better days, long departed. Its broken landing strip and support buildings sit wedged between various natural obstacles, including frozen fields, a broad lake, and sheer cliffs along the Region’s perimeter. Travelers here need guile, and warm clothes.

Connects to Transfer Pass.
A piece of paper torn out of an old logbook.

[...illegible…]to say for certain what security will be like out here. Told the boss a single exit point at the current air strip would never satisfy our usual standard for evac. Nowhere else in the world would we set him up for a risk like this. But his eyes are open. And so are mine.

The build has the green light.

25.9.82
A handwritten message on greasy paper.
WE’RE LEAVING! Can’t stand the lights any longer. No sleep. Just no sleep. We’re walking out of here.
Still frozen solid, this food tray has all the tasty charm you could expect from reheated chicken, only without the heat.
Nynorsk: Enno gjennomfrosen. Dette brettet med mat har all sjarmen ein kan forventa av attvarma kylling, berre utan varmen.

English: Bits of frozen broccoli and something that resembles mashed potatoes is visible under the wrapper. The veggie option never looked so good.
Nynorsk: Bitar av frosen brokkoli, samt noko som minnar om potetstappe, er synleg under plasten. Vegetarvarianten har aldri sett so god ut.

Notes: {chance-val} will be replaced by a number

English: A bottle of Antibiotics. Take it to stop infection from spreading.
Nynorsk: Ei flaske antibiotika. Førebygger at infeksjonar spreir seg.

English: A bottle of Hydrogen Peroxide. Useful for cleaning wounds.
Nynorsk: Ei flaske hydrogenperoksid. Praktisk ved rengjering av sår.

English: For feedback and help, visit[FFFF00] www.hinterlandforums.com[-]
Nynorsk: Viss du treng hjelp eller ynskjer å gi respons, kan du gå til[FFFF00] www.hinterlandforums.com[-]

English:
Bow sway reduced by {sway-bonus}
Arrow damage increased by {damage-bonus}
Nynorsk:
Bogesvaiing redusert med {sway-bonus}
Pilskade auka med {damage-bonus}

English: You are new to archery and have no special skills or knowledge. Although you can successfully fire an arrow from the bow, it feels awkward in your untrained hands.
Nynorsk: Du har ingen erfaring med bogeskytelse og er uten spesielle dugleikar eller kunnskap. Sjølv om du kan skyta ei pil frå bogen, kjennast det rart i dine utrente hender.

English: As your use of the bow increases it feels less awkward in your hands. Your aim is a little more steady and your shots deal more damage.
Nynorsk: Etter kvart som du nyttar bogen, kjennast det mindre rart å halde i han. Du er litt stødigare når du siktar, og pilane dine gjer meir skade.

English: You're turning into a decent archer. Your aim is increasingly more precise and with this you have a greater chance of inflicting critical damage.
Nynorsk: Du er i ferd med å verta ein god bogeskyttar. Du vert plassig meir presis, og du har auka sjanse for å gjera kritisk skade.

English: You have become a skilled archer. You have a steady, accurate aim and a powerful shot. Your improved efficiency helps keep your equipment in good condition for longer.
Nynorsk: Du er vorte ein dyktig bogeskyttar. Du er stødig og presis, og det er kraft bak kvar og ein av pilane dine. Den auka effektiviteten gjer at det tek lenger tid før utstyret utslitast.

English: You are one with your bow - it feels like an extenstion of your body and you are able to use your bow while crouched. Your eagle-eyed aim is deadly accurate. You are the hunter.
Nynorsk: Du er i eit med bogen din – den kjennast som ein forlenging av kroppen, og du kan nytta han på huk. Presisjonen din er døyeleg nøyaktig. Du er ein jeger på nivå med Ull!

English: During the aurora, collect Buffer Memories from across Great Bear Island at the locations listed in your Journal.

In the Quiet Apocalypse, fragments of the old world are few and far between.
During the aurora, collect Buffer Memories from across Great Bear Island at the locations listed in your Journal.
Collect a Buffer Memory from every location on the list.
In the Quiet Apocalypse, fragments of the old world are few and far between. Collect all the Buffer Memories you can find, to preserve their echoes.
A home-made Arrow, created by combining an Arrow Shaft with Crow Feathers and an Arrowhead.
Nynorsk: Ein heimalaga pil, laga ved å setja saman eit pilskaft med nokre kråkefjør og ein pilspiss.

English: A crude Arrow hardened in a fire. Fragile, but simple to Craft. Only effective against small game.
Nynorsk: Ei enkel pil herda over flammar. Lett å laga, men skøyr. Eignar seg best til smøvilt.

English: Sharp metal tip for an Arrow, improvised from scrap.
Nynorsk: Kvass metallspiss til ei pil. Laga av skrapmetall.

English: A straight wooDen arrow, cut and shaped from a cured Birch sapling. Combine with Crow feathers and Arrowhead to make a usable Arrow.
Nynorsk: Eit rett pilskaft, laga frå turka ungbjørk. Fest ein pilspiss i eine enden og nokre kråkefjør i andre enden so har du ei flott pil!

Notes: Astrid ( firstname of our male character)

English: A small pack, the kind you grab when you are in a hurry.
Nynorsk: Ein liten ryggsekk, den du tek med deg i hast.

English: Made of strong but supple leather, these boots are built to last.
Nynorsk: Laga av mjukt og slitesterkt lêr, laga for å vara.

English: Lightweight gloves. Not too warm, but very flexible.
Nynorsk: Lette vottar. Ikkje so alt for varme, men særs tøyelege.

English: A thin shell lined with sheep's wool, this jacket is lightweight with good insulation.
Nynorsk: Tynn jakke fôra med saueull, lett og har god isolasjon.

English: Simple jeans. Not fit for winter survival, but better than nothing.
Nynorsk: Ei enkel olabukse. Ikkje høveleg til vinterbruk, men betre enn ingenting.

English: A thin sweater. Great for layering but no great comfort on its own.
Nynorsk: Ein tynn genser. Kjekk som endå eit lag, men ingen komfort i seg sjølv.

English: Warm and durable, perfect for the wilderness.
Nynorsk: Varm og slitesterk, perfekt for villmarka.

English: Code that unlocks a door inside the aurora hatch.

Deb,
If you’re reading this it’s because I’ve left the Island and the last treatment didn’t work. You’re probably still out there somewhere in the woods, doing what you’ve been doing. I always admired that about you, even if I didn’t agree. Hopefully what’s left of my old bunker can be of some use to you.
Just because you hide, doesn’t mean you’re lost.
Remember that, and this number -- 0794. That will let you in.
- G.

Notes: Buffer Memory refers to a piece of data "stuck" in a computer's memory.
Autosave slot on the load game screen
Label for Autosave minutes Slider in Options

English: Press the auto walk button to keep going in the currrent direction until you want to stop. Stop again by either pressing the button again or by moving any direction but forward.
Nynorsk: Når ein trykkjer går ein av seg sjølv. For å stoppa trykkjer ein igjen, eller går ein anna veg enn fram.

English: A warm, durable hat favoured by pilots operating in the frozen North. Stylish, to a point.
Nynorsk: Ei varm og slitesterk hue elska av pilotar i arktisk. Stilig til eit visst punkt.

English: Special thanks to Backer #{num-value} for this contribution.
Nynorsk: Ein spesiell takk til sponsor #{num-value} for dette bidraget.

English: Full wool head covering with holes for the eyes and mouth. Warm, even if a bit sinister looking.
Nynorsk: Strikka hovudplagg som dekkjer hovud og hals og har ei lita opning for auge og munn. Varm, men gjer at du ser litt skummel ut.

English: You're armoured up. Wearing the Ballistic Vest gives you outstanding physical Protection.
Nynorsk: Den skotsikre vesten gjev deg makelaus vern mot fysiske påkjenningar.

English: Law-enforcement body armour. Great Protection, but very heavy. You won't win any sprints wearing it.
Nynorsk: Skotsikker vest nytta av politi. Meget tung, men tolar ein god støyt. Truleg so møter ein ikkje på ulv med pistol, men vesten er god mot både klør og tenner òg!

English: Bandage suitable for stopping blood loss or binding to constrict movement on an injury.
Nynorsk: Bandasje høveleg til å stoppa blødingar, og som forbinding for å hindre rørsle ved skade.

English: Bank Managers House Key. Will unlock one of the Houses in Milton.
Nynorsk: Husnyklen til banksjefen. Ein nykel høyrar alltid til ein lås, passar truleg til eit av husa i Milton.

English: A crusty flatbread. Food for the road.

Notes: piece of bark from a birch tree

English: Birch tree bark. Lightweight and flamable, this bark can be used as tinder
Nynorsk: Bjørkenever. Lett og brennbart, kan nyttast som knusk.

English: Why would anyone wear one of these in the Winter?
Nynorsk: Du må vera passe dum for å gå med denna på vinteren!

English: Rugged leather hiking boot. designed to last for long-distance journeys on rocky terrain. Leather upper and heavy rubber sole.
Nynorsk: Solid fjellstøvel av skinn. Laga for å tåle lange turar i steinete terreng. Overlær, tjukk gummisåle.

English: Basic ski gloves, made of synthetic materials.
Nynorsk: Enkle skihanskar laga av syntetiske materialar.

English: Basic winter coat with some wind-blocking capability and basic synthetic filler. Good for an afternoon at the ski hill.
Nynorsk: Enkel vinterjakke med syntetisk fyll. Gjev nyttande vern mot vind. Høveleg til ein ettermiddag i skibakken.

English: Simple knitted cotton hat. Not as warm as wool, but better than nothing.
Nynorsk: Ei enkel hue av bomull.  ikkje like varm som ull, men betre enn ingenting.

English: A hand-knit thick wool scarf. Nice and warm.
Nynorsk: Eit tjukt, handstrikka skjerf. Behageleg og varmt.

Notes: Text displayed on the HUD next to the bar indicating how much battery power is remaining

English: A bloody ear from a bear.
Nynorsk: Det blodige øyret til ein bjørn.

English: Take this back to Jeremiah as proof the Old Bear has been vanquished.
Nynorsk: Ta øyre med til Jeremiah som bevis på at Gamlebjørn er daud.

English: Freshly harvestad fur and skin of a Black bear.
Fur and skin of a Black bear. Can be used for crafting and repair.
Nynorsk: Pels og skinn frå ein svartbjørn. Kan nyttast til å bøta og laga ting.

English: Cooked Bear meat. Heavy duty food.
Nynorsk: Steikt kjøt frå svartbjørn. Solid kost.

English: Black bear Meat. Dark and dense. Tends to taste like whatever the bear was eating.
Nynorsk: Kjøt frå svartbjørn. Mørkt og seigt. Smakar gjerne av det bjørnen hadde til middag.

Notes: Piece of animal that's been sectioned from a carcass

English: Section of a Bear carcass. Cut from the carcass to make transporation a bit easier. Harvest for usable meat.
Nynorsk: Stykke av eit bjørnekadaver. Skore av for å gjera det lettare å bera. Gjev deg etandes kjøt.

English: Bedroll crafted from Bear Skin. Heavy, but very warm. The smell might scare animals away.
Nynorsk: Sovepose laga av bjørneskinn. Tung, men veldig varm. Lukta kan skremma vekk dyr.

English: If it's good enough for the Bear, it's good enough for you. Heavy, bulky, but very warm and one of toughest things around. You may not run from much, but you may not need to either.
Nynorsk: Viss han er bra nok for ein bjørn, er han bra nok for deg. Tung og stor, men særs varm og slitesterk. Du kan ikkje springa frå noko, men det treng du kanskje ikkje heller.

Notes: Title of gear item Bear Spear

English: A broken spearhead attached to a salvageable maple shaft.
Nynorsk: Ein knekt spjutspiss på enden av eit nyttande løneskaft.

English: A large defensive weapon, designed to pierce the thick hides of charging predators. For those with the heart to wield it.
Nynorsk: Eit svært forsvarsvåpen, laga for å trengje gjennom det tjukke skinnet til rovdyr som kjem til åtak. For dei som er djerve nok til å handtera det.

English: An ordinary Bedroll, but stuffed to bursting with harvested down feathers. Toasty.
Nynorsk: Ein vanleg sovepose, men stappfull av ekstra dun. God og varm.

English: Package of Beef Jerky. Tasty and pretty much lasts forever.
Nynorsk: Pakke med turka kjøtstrimlar. Velsmakande og med ekstrem lang haldbarheit.

Notes: UI label to describe time-to-craft an item with the player's best tool.

English: An old Key to a Lockbox in Bleak Inlet.
An old Key to a Lockbox in Bleak Inlet.
Dried Birch Bark, suitable for brewing into a restorative tea.
Nynorsk: Turka bitar av bjørkenever. Nyttast til å koka ein lækjande te.

Notes: Tea made from the bark of a birch tree.

English: A natural tea, brewed from prepared Birch Bark. Drink to gradually restore some lost Condition.
Nynorsk: Ein naturleg te koka på bjørkenever. Drikk for å gradevis betra helsa di.

English: Freshly harvestad birch sapling. Needs to be cured before it can be used for crafting and repair.
Nynorsk: Nyhogd ungtre av sorten bjørk. Må tørkast før han kan nyttast til å vøla og laga ting.

English: Small birch sapling that has been cured. Can be used for crafting and repair.
Nynorsk: Turka ungtre av sorten bjørk. Kan nyttast til å vøla og laga ting.

English: Paper torn from a daily planner.

Hard to believe we’re getting more inmates this week. And in winter, besides. The talk is that the warden’s going to open on C Block again. And guess who’s going to have to requisition all we need to stock those cells? Yours truly. Should have never come out here. Debts or no debts this isn’t living. It’s just counting days.

Thank god I’ve got Timberwolf coming up. Even with the big storm coming, I can’t wait to try the summit route again.
Crude handwriting is scratched in the margins of an old, faded office memo.

Find me at the mine. East and up the hill, looking up at the mountain. I got a lead on this door.

-- M
A loose leaf of paper with handwriting scrawled on it.

Found the backpack I was looking for. I expect you’ll be along soon to read this. The workshop code’s gotta be 3445. I’ll meet you back down at the gate so we can crack open that shop when the lights show up again.

I just gotta check something out on the lower level.

-- M

For intermediate players. Home to Blackrock Penitentiary, this Region’s icy rivers, deep ravines, and challenging weather act as a natural extension of the notorious prison. Its many caves and winding roads offer additional security if a storm moves in.

Connects to Pleasant Valley and Timberwolf Mountain.
A bloody, handwritten scrap of paper.

We broke into the store rooms. There was lots to grab. More than we expected.

From the look of the place, it went real bad here. And I don’t think we’re the first to get inside. I’m going to scout the perimeter again, just to be sure. See what else you can find.

-- J
A piece of paper torn from a journal.

Can't tell who’s coming and going, even from up here. It looks empty but I’m going to wait it out for a couple days and see if whoever followed me over the river was headed up here too.

This place must be cursed at this point. Even a fire couldn’t change that.
Transmitter covers Blackrock, Ash Canyon, and Timberwolf Mountain Regions
You are bleeding from a wound. If left untreated, you will continue to weaken until you die.
Nynorsk: Du blør frå eit sår. Viss det  ikkje vert behanlda, vil du verta svakare og svakare til du døyr.

English: Marine Flares are extra bright and loud, and may even ward off a Timberwolf.
Nynorsk: Marine naudblussar er særs ljose og høglydte, kan kanskje til og med jaga vekk ein varg.

Notes: details on how to craft items and clothing, not related to plans for a building
water was boiled until it all evaporated

English: A heavy tool designed to cut through metal bolts and chains.
Nynorsk: Eit solid verktøy laga for å kutta gjennom metallboltar og kjetting.

English: A detailed guide to hunting with bows. Researching it will improve your Archery Skill.
Nynorsk: Ein detaljert rettleing i jakt med pil og boge. Les ut for å verta ein betre bogeskyttar.

English: detailed information about the best way to butcher animal carcasses. Researching this will improve your Skill.
Nynorsk: Detaljert informasjon om korleis du slaktar dyrekadaver. Les denne for å auke dugleikane dine.

English: Detailed information about the best way to butcher animal carcasses.
Nynorsk: Utførleg informasjon om korleis ein best skal slakta dyr.

English: Tips and tricks on how to prepare food in the wilderness. Researching this will improve your Skill.
Nynorsk: Tips om korleis du lagar mat i villmarka. Les denne for å auke dugleikane dine.

English: Eventually, a source of knowledge. For now, something to burn when you are freezing.
Nynorsk: Ei kjelde til lærdom, men for augneblinken noko å brenna når ein frys.

English: Field Dressing Your Kill, Vol. I
Nynorsk: Korleis gjera det sikkeleg - Slakting, 1. bok

English: Handbook with information on wilderness survival. Researching this will improve your Skill.
Nynorsk: Handbok med rettleiing om korleis du overlevei villmarka. Les denne for å auke dugleikane dine.

English: A do-it-yourself guide to gunsmithing techniques, intended for hunters but loved by the security-minded. Researching this will improve your Gunsmithing Skill.
Nynorsk: Ei gjer-det-sjølv rettleiing i våpensmiingsteknikkar. Tiltenkt jegrar, men òg elska av dei vernelyndte.

English: An instructional manual on ice fishing. Researching this will improve your Skill.
Nynorsk: Ei rettleiing til isfiske. Les denne for å auke dugleikane dine.

English: An instructional manual on ice fishing.
Everything you ever wanted to know about maintaining your clothing. Researching it will improve your Mending Skill.
Nynorsk: Alt du treng å veta om å vedlikehalda klede. Les ut for å verta flinkare å bøta klede.

English: Everything you ever wanted to know about maintaining your clothing.
Nynorsk: Alt ein nokon gong treng å veta om å bøta klede, og litt til.

English: A manual with details on effective handgun shooting and maintenance. Researching this will improve your Revolver Firearm Skill.
Nynorsk: Ein manual som omhandlar god skytetekknikk, samt vedlikehald av handskytevåpen.

English: Packed full of advice and technical details about how to be a better shooter. Researching this will improve your Skill.
Nynorsk: Full av råd og tekniske detaljar om korleis du vert ein betre skyttar. Les denne for å auke dugleikane dine.

English: Packed full of advice and technical details about how to be a better shooter.
Nynorsk: Stappfull av råd om korleis ein skal verta ein betre skyttar.

English: Reprint of a late 19th-century handbook about shooting, meant for green pioneers. Researching this will improve your Skill.
Nynorsk: Ny utgåve av ei handbok frå 1800-talet om skytelse, meina for nybyggarar. Les denne for å auke dugleikane dine.

English: Reprint of a late 19th-century handbook about shooting, meant for green pioneers.
Nynorsk: Opptrykk av ei handbok frå slutten av det 19. hundreåret. Omhandlar skyteteknikk, tiltenkt urøynde nybyggjarar.

English: A light and durable manufactured Bow. A trusty companion on or off the archery range.
Nynorsk: Ein lett fabrikkprodusert boge. Fungerer like bra på blink som på anna.

English:
Crafted at a master's Work Bench. Every shape and angle reflects a careful and knowing touch.

A more durable and agile Survival Bow.
A simple, improvised bow, suitable for hunting small game.
Nynorsk: Ein enkel improvisert boge, eigna for jakt på småvilt.

English: Gut that has been cured and looped to serve as a suitable bow string.
Nynorsk: Turka tarm som har vorte laga om til ei bogesnor.

English: Bow wood, cured and shaped to maximize its power. Combine with Bow String.
Nynorsk: Bogetre, turka og forma for å gje maksimal styrke. Fest ei bogesnor i kvar ende so har du fått deg ein flott boge!

Notes: branch, fallen from a tree, small - can be broken by hand
A large fallen fir tree branch, needs a hatchet to break it up
A large fallen cedar tree branch, needs a hatchet to break it up

English: The Brand is a burning stick that serves as a small torch. Provides a bit of light, and might be useful against wildlife.
Nynorsk: Ein brennande pinne, fungerar som ein liten fakkel. Gjev deg litt ljos, og kan vera grei å ha viss du møtar på dyr.

Notes: Setting in the options menu, refers to screen brightness

English: An old Key to a Lockbox in Broken Railroad.
An old Key to a Lockbox in Broken Railroad.
A broken arrow. The arrow-head and some of the feathers may be salvageable.
Nynorsk: Ei øydelagt pil. Skaftet er det ikkje mykje bruk for, men pilspissen og fjøra kan ein bruka om igjen.

English: A broken Fire Hardened Arrow. Harvesting these crude weapons may yield some feathers, but nothing more.
Nynorsk: Ei øydelagt flammeherda pil. Ein kan kanskje nytta fjøra om att, men det same kan ikkje seiast om skaftet.
{item-name} er for øydelagt til å kunne repareres.

Notes: An empty  bed frame with no matress, so can't sleep on it
A door panel broken off, seperate from door way

English: One or more of your ribs are broken. You cannot climb, and your mobility will be reduced until this injury heals.
Nynorsk: Ein eller fleire av ribbeina dine er brotne. Du kan ikkje klyva, og det vert vanskelegare å lea på seg fram til kroppslytet vert lækt.

English: Jeremiah's broken rifle. Will need special tools to fix it.
Nynorsk: Jeremiah si øydelagte børse. Du treng spesialverktøy for å fikse han.

Notes: bonus a player receives from a beneficial item

English: Projectile component of Rifle or Revolver Ammunition. Can be Crafted from Scrap Lead.
Nynorsk: Ladekomponent til patroner, for både rifle og revolver. Kan verta støypt frå skrapbly.

English: Prepare the root for a crunchy bite or as the base of an antibiotic tea.
Nynorsk: Førebu rota for å knaskast på eller nyttast i ein antibiotisk te.

English: Cleaned and cut Burdock. Edible on its own, or suitable for brewing into a natural antibiotic tea.
Nynorsk: Reinsa og opphakka kardeborrerot. Etandes som den er, men kan òg nyttast i ein antibiotisk te.

English: A tea brewed from prepared Burdock Root. A natural antibiotic.
Nynorsk: Ein te kokt på kardeborrerot. Naturleg antibiotisk.

English: You haven't completed researching this book. Continue?
Nynorsk: Du har ikkje lest ut boka. Vil du fortsetta?

English: Du har pådrege deg alvorlege brannsår. Kondisjonen din vil vera redusert til du behandlar brannsåra, eller dei lækjast av seg sjølv.
Nynorsk: Du har pådrege deg alvorlege brannsår. Din generelle helsetilstand vil vera redusert til du behandlar brannsåra, eller dei lækjast av seg sjølv.

English: Minutes before coal can be added: {minutes}
Nynorsk: Minuttar før du kan legge i kol: {minutes}

Notes: Used to advance to next line of dialogue in Dialogue Mode

English: You've been indoors so long you feel like the walls are closing in. You will be unable to sleep indoors for {time-val} hours.
Nynorsk: Du har vert inne so lenge at du kjennar deg klaustrofobisk. Du kan ikkje sova inne på {time-val} timar.
Du har kome deg etter brakkesjuka.

English: You've been indoors so long you are starting to feel very uneasy. Spend some time outdoors before it gets worse.
Nynorsk: Du har vert inne so lenge at du byrjar å kjenna deg klaustrofobisk. Ver litt utandørs før det vert verre.

English: Do not sleep indoors for {time-val} hours. Spend some time outdoors to recover.
Nynorsk: Ikkje sov inne på {time-val} timer. Ver litt ute for å koma deg.

English: Items from Jeremiah's cabin have been returned to you
Notes: On screen notification to add clarity to players that their items are rerturned after Jeremiah (NPC) kicks the player out of his cabin.
A pile of rocks meant to serve as a trail marker.
Piles of stones that serve as location markers. This is for a list of the number the player has found out of the total in the world.
format is "calories burned 999", showing how many calories will be burned by performing an action

English: A note sent to the WarDen of Mystery Lake Provincial Park.
Nynorsk: En melding til oppsynsmannen for parkområdet i Løyndomsvatnet.

English: "Due to unusually cold weather this year, we're shutting down Mystery Lake provincial park a little earlier than usual. Make sure all the campers are packed up and ready to bug out by rail-truck. Anyone left behind will have to get out on foot -- not a nice prospect. As per the usual procedure, lock up all lake cabins and make sure all provisions are stored in bear-proof containers. And please take the flag down this year -- we had to replace it after last Winter. The winds just tear it to shreds. After you're finished closing down the camp, make sure to check in at the Forestry Service Lookout as requested. Apparently those guys think someone's been using their lookout to store hunting gear, and drying old animal skins? Man, I don't envy you that backwater posting. Great Bear has sure gone downhill since the quakes."
Nynorsk: På grunn av det usedvanlege kalde vêret i år stenger me parkområdet ved Løyndomsvatnet litt tidlegare enn elles. Syrg for at alle campingturistane har pakka og er klare til å fera med stormobil. Viss nokon vert igjen, må dei koma seg ut til fots. Det er ikkje anbefalt. Flyg dei vanlege prosedyrane og lås alle hyttene ved vatnet, og syrg for at all proviant er lagra i bjørnesikre behaldare. Og husk å ta ned flagget i år – me måtte skaffa eit nytt etter sist vinter. Vinden riv det i fillebetar. Når du har stengt leiren, må du huska å stikka innom Skogbruksetaten sitt utkikkstårn, sånn som du er vorte bedt om. Dei trur at nokon har brukt tårnet til å lagra jaktutstyr og turke gamle dyreskinn. Eg misunner deg ikkje dette oppdraget. Det har sanneleg gått nedover med Sværebjørn sidan jordskjelvene.
Treng filter for å ta på

English: Sweet, crisp, preserved Corn in a can. A treat in winter.
Nynorsk: Hermetiserte og søte maiskorn. Godt som gull!

English: Fully-cooked and ready to eat. An acquired taste, but safe and portable.
Nynorsk: Eteklart kjøt i ein hermetikkboks. Trygg turmat.

English: A hand-written copy of a message that probably originated as an email.
Nynorsk: Handskriven kopi av ei melding, truleg opphavleg ein e-post.

English: A dusty piece of paper, the writing faded and scratched.
Nynorsk: Ein støvete papirlapp med blass og rablete skrift.

English:
[names scratched out]
That old radio tower is supposed to relay the weather, but half the time the damn thing is offline. And since the landslide last summer we can’t even get up the road anymore to check out what’s going on.
Burt is pretty sure the only way through is on the other side of the mountains, somewhere off the ravine between the provincial park (Mystery Lake I think it's called?) and the highway along the coastline.
What’s management going to do about this? Without a way to check on the equipment, all the automation in the world won’t do us much good out here.
I know there’s a technician kid someplace on the Island attached to that tower company -- maybe they could help us out?
And don't forget to get a copy of the workshop's door code while you're up there.
[illegible name]

Once home to a thriving industrial Cannery, seismic instability has cut Bleak Inlet off from the rest of the Great Bear mainland. Inaccessible and in the heart of Timberwolf territory, exploring Bleak Inlet is not for the faint of heart. The Cannery industrial complex holds a useful treasure for those hardy enough to access it. Connects to Forlorn Muskeg and the Ravine transition zone.
A bloody piece of notebook paper.
Nynorsk: Eit blodig ark ut av ei notatbok.

English:
RHEA COMSAT CANADA
Wolves won’t let up. I put up a track to get above them, but they won’t leave. Most food here is spoiled. Going to try and rig up something in that old Cannery workshop but I’m starin’ down a deep hole here guys. Can only hope you reach me soon.
Just leave this here in case it goes even worse.
Cannot add any more fuel to this fire right now
Nynorsk: Det kan ikkje leggjas meir brensel på elden no

English: Cannot Build Ice Fishing Hole Indoors

Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje byggja ei snøhole inne

Notes: Player is carrying too much weight and cannot climb.

English: Cannot climb with a broken rib
Notes: Message displayed when trying to climb with a broken rib affliction
Nynorsk: Kan ikkje klyva med eit brote ribbein
Du kan ikkje klyva med ein rengja ankel

English: Niks, handa er fortsatt for svak.
Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje klyva med eit rengja handledd

English: No items in inventory can be cooked with selected item
Nynorsk: Ingenting i ranselen kan kokast med vald gjenstand

English: Cannot craft item with selected tool
Nynorsk: Tingen kan ikkje lagast med den valde reiskapen.

English: Cannot craft item without a required tool
Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje laga tingen utan dei naudsyte reiskapa.

Notes: (note) decoy is a piece of food dropped to distract wildlife

Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje taka på deg dette her

English: You're not healthy enough to focus on Research.
Nynorsk: Du har ikkje god nok helsa til å konsentrera deg.

English: The Banish Glyph cannot be removed
Cannot repair a tool with itself
Nynorsk: Reiskapen kan ikkje vøla seg sjølv

English: Cannot repair item with selected tool
Nynorsk: Tingen kan ikkje vølast med den valde reiskapen

English: Cannot start a fire on a wood surface
Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje laga eld på ei overflate av tre

English: Cannot start a fire on straw
Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje laga eld på strå
Du kan ikkje laga bål inne
Eit reiskap til å opna hermetikkboksar med.
Boksen vart slått i stykke. {%-value}% gjekk tapt

English: A page torn from a climber's notebook.

Guiding these Mainland tourist climbers isn’t worth all their moaning.
After we hit the High Meadow I’m going to bow out and head for that old gold mine my dad showed me. I’m already a week overdue on this trip…
A faded piece of notebook paper, partly crumpled.

Glad I had my good pack with me on this trip. Some chest pain on the trek past the high falls, but I expected that after the last surgery.
Just going to hunker down in here until the storm passes. Tomorrow -- high point at Wolf’s Jaw and then head for home!
A diary page, faded with age and heavily watermarked.

Just about run out of excuses for keeping my mouth shut. Those miners might look down on me now, but if they keep on digging like they are…
Too deep if you ask me. Much too deep.
A crumbling page from an old logbook, only partially legible.

...
It’s gold all right! Can’t believe how much. Jesse wants to go even deeper, but we’re all waiting on the Foreman to give us the thumbs up. 
The vein we opened looks like it could go on and on. Just have to be careful how we…
...

All the way up this high plateau. Only to spot a half dozen more towers to climb.
What a day!

Can’t believe I have to go BACK over that dang bridge. 
View was worth it!

For advanced players. A climber’s paradise dotted with narrow ravines, towering cliffs, and multiple high plateaus. Its burnt forests and mining settlements also hint at a darker history.
Connects to Timberwolf Mountain.

Notes: Label for xp episode mode: Capable

English: Useless in the abandoned vehicles around Great Bear Island, car Batteries can still be Harvested for Scrap Lead.
Nynorsk: Ikkje mykje til nytte i køyretøya her til lands. Ein kan henta ut skrapbly frå det, om ikkje noko anna.

English: Cannot Harvest Carcass with Bare Hands

Nynorsk: Grunnleggjande dugleikar i å slakta kadaver
{duration-bonus} reduksjon i tida det tek å skjera av kjøt

English:
{meat-bonus} reduction in Meat Harvesting times
Can harvest {frozen-threshold} Frozen carcasses by hand
{hidegut-bonus} reduction in Hide or Gut harvesting times
Notes:
25% reduction in Meat Harvesting times
Can harvest 50% Frozen carcasses
10% reduction in Hide or Gut harvesting times
Nynorsk:
{meat-bonus} reduksjon i tida det tek å skjera av kjøt
Kan slakte kadaver som er {frozen-threshold} frosen
{hidegut-bonus} reduksjon i tida det tek å skjera av skinn og innvollar

English:
{meat-bonus} reduction in Meat Harvesting times

Kan slakte kadaver som er {frozen-threshold} frosen
