English:
{meat-bonus} reduction in Harvesting times
Can harvest {frozen-threshold} Frozen carcasses by hand
{hidegut-bonus} reduction in Hide or Gut harvesting times
Nynorsk:
{meat-bonus} reduksjon i tida det tek å skjera av kjøt
Kan slakte kadaver som er {frozen-threshold} frosen
{hidegut-bonus} reduksjon i tida det tek å skjære av skinn gg innvollar

English: You have a lay-person's understanding of harvesting a dead animal. Meaning, you are clumsy and unskilled. Don't cut yourself!
Nynorsk: Du har knapt slakta noko i heile ditt liv, og er nybyrjar i høgste grad, men du kan i all fall sjå forskjell på kjøt og innvollar.

English: You're a bit more comfortable with how to handle a carcass. You can tell which parts provide the best meat, but you still destroy a lot of it while harvesting.
Nynorsk: Du er vorte litt meir komfortabel med handsaminga av kadaver. Du ser kva stykke som gjev best kjøt, men du øydelegg fortsatt ein god del kjøt medan du flår.

English: You know your way around a carcass. You're quick and can get the best parts without wrecking them. You don't waste time or meat.
Nynorsk: Du byrjar å kjenna dyrekadavre inn og ut. Du er rask, og du skjer av dei beste stykka utan å øydeleggja dei. Du kastar verken vekk tid eller kjøt.

English: You're an artist when it comes to cutting up a carcass. You can get all the best parts and you know what to do with them. You waste very little.
Nynorsk: Du er den reinaste kunstnaren når det gjelder å slakta kadaver. Du sikrar deg alle dei beste stykka, og du veit kva du skal gjera med dei. Særs lite går tapt.

English: Your skills are legendary. Carcasses pray you'll be the one to harvest them. You don't waste a movement, and can practically strip a carcass with your eyes closed.
Nynorsk: Dugleikane dine er legendariske. Kadaver ber om at det er du som skal slakta dei. Du gjer ikkje ein eineste unødvendig røyrsle. Andrimne har vorte ein god kompis.

English: Carcass more than {percent} frozen (cannot use berre hands)
Notes: was: "Carcass more than 50% frozen (cannot use berre hands)"
Nynorsk: Kadaveret er meir enn {percent} frosen (reiskap naudsynnt)

English: You can't Quarter a Carcass that's more than {percent} frozen
Notes: A % amount that tells the player they cannot quarter this carcass b/c it is too frozen.
Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje partera eit kadaver som er meir enn {percent} frose.

Notes: Used when searchinng a door on a cargo crate

English: Cotton pants with reinforced areas. Will take a bit of punishment.
Nynorsk: Bomullsbukser med forsterka områder. Tålar ein støyt.

English: A root vegetable useful in many recipes.
Nynorsk: Allsidig totgrønsak nytta i mange oppskrifter.

English: Your pack feels lighter because of something you ate.
Your pack feels heavier because of something you ate.

Nynorsk: Legg i frå deg personen fyrst

English: A bundle of cash. Pretty much worthless these days. Useful as tinder.
Nynorsk: Ein seddelbunke. Ikkje verd noko særleg i våre dagar. Kan brukast som knusk.

English: The Cat Tail's head can be used as tinder. Its stalk is tough, not very filling, but edible...!
Nynorsk: Blomen på dunkjevlen kan nyttast som knusk. Stilken er seig, ikkje noko god mat, men etande!

English: Tough, not very filling, but edible...!
Nynorsk: Seig,  ikkje særleg mettande, men etande!

English: The Cat Tail's seed head, can be used as tinder.
Nynorsk: Blom frå dunkjevle. Kan nyttast som knusk.

English: Bandage wound and warm the cave up first
Nynorsk: Bandasjer såret og varm opp hola fyrst

English: Cedar burns with an aromatic glow, but doesn't burn for long.
Nynorsk: Seder brenn med ein aromatisk skjær, men  ikkje særleg lenge.

Notes: noun, as in a challenge mode

Nynorsk: Merker som delast ut for å fullføra utfordringar.

Notes: Switch between multiple categories of craftables

English: A piece of charcoal, typically found in burned out campfires. Useful for sketching.
Nynorsk: Ein bete med trekol, vanleg å finna i utbrende leirbål. Praktisk viss du skal teikna.

English: You are poisoned from an environmental hazard. The toxins have temporarily reduced your Condition.
You risk Poisoning by spending time inside a Chemical Hazard.
Avoid Chemical Hazards or equip a Respirator to reduce vulnerability.
Wait it out or use an Emergency Stim to aid in healing.

Notes: To be used when the "Choose Your" is followed by a plural string

English: An old, finely-crafted cross. Museum-worthy in its quality.
A request for any information on the missing Church Artifact.

The investigation into our missing artifact continues.
Please contact Father Thomas directly with any information you have.
-- Parish Council.
A piece of old paper, neatly folded.

My Cindi,
 What now, honey?
 No cash, nothing coming. I had to do something. Everyone’s gone.
 I don’t know where this ends, but I’m sorry either way. Thing’s up above on the Ridge, in that empty basement. Maybe we can trade it for a way out of here.
 - Sam.
A newspaper report regarding the stolen Church Artifact.

...stolen from a church in Thomson's Crossing, the artifact was gifted to the parish by a prominent local landowner decades ago, according to Father Thomas, the local parish priest.
''Although its monetary value is considerable, for members of our church it is a spiritual matter as well'' he said...
A letter from Father Thomas thanking the anonymous returner of the Artifact.

I can only thank you for what you have done for us, and for letting God's light shine through you. Whoever you are, I sense that you have endured worse than a storm or two in order to return this humble treasure of ours. We will never forget you. -- Fr. Thomas.
A letter updating Father Thomas on the investigation into the stolen Church Artifact.

From: Diocese of the Northern Coast
To: Fr. Thomas, Thomson’s Crossing Parish 
Re: Break-in and Missing Property

We were saddened, all of us, to hear about the recent theft. 
I've spoken with a constable here, and his initial phone call inquiries suggest something to do with an old homestead near a place called Skeeter's Ridge. Do you know it?
Has he not been in contact? He promised me he would look into it further, but it would mean travel to Great Bear, and well, you know what that means these days. 
 
Do keep in touch,
Bishop Stevens.

Notes: improvement in rifle condition as a result of cleaning
how good player is at cleaning a rifle

Nynorsk: Tingen treng ikkje å verta pussa.

Notes: prompt for climbing a rock wall

Nynorsk: Ei side frå ein fjellklatrar si dagbok

English: A page from a climber's journal found near the base of Timberwolf Mountain.
Nynorsk: Ei side frå ein fjellklatrar si dagbok, funne nærma foten av Vargafjellet.

English:
Sept 5th
Arrived at the base of Timberwolf Mountain. Looks like there are some nice cracks, just like Clive said. Going to set up a top rope and do some bouldering until the others show up. Hopefully soon.

Sept 6th
Wondering if my friends got lost as they still haven't arrived. Woke up in the night to a deafening noise, and fire on the mountain. Went to check it out but the weather got nasty and I couldn't find my way.

Sept 7th
Clear day. I went out again. Found some metal cargo crates. They look like they might have come from a plane. There's still smoke coming from the summit. I'm heading out to see if I can make it to the peak and learn more about what's going on.
Nynorsk:
5. september
Kom fram til foten av Vargafjellet. Ser ut til å vera nokon fine sprekkar her, akkurat som Clive sa. Planen er å festa eit topptau og klyve litt på eiga hand medan eg ventar på dei andre. Forhåpentleg kjem dei snart.

6. september
Eg lurer på om venane mine har gått seg vill, for dei har ikkje kome endå. Eg vakna midt på natta av eit enormt smell og brann på fjellet. Eg gjekk for å sjekke, men vêret blei dårleg, so eg fant ikkje fram.

7. september
Blå himmel. Eg far ut igjen. Fant nokon metallkassar. Det ser ut som om dei kan ha kome i frå eit fly. Det kjem fortsatt røyk frå fjelltoppen. Eg fer for å sjå om eg kan koma meg til topps for å finne ut kva som skjer.
Forsterka ullabbar i høg kvalitet. Som skapt for ekspedisjonar.

English: Cloth used for crafting and repair, as well as for creating bandages.
Nynorsk: Stoff som kan nyttast til å bøta og laga ting, som til dømes bandasjar.

Notes: button to access additional actions for clothing items, like repair
{pack-val} etc. represents a variable that is filled in through code. Final output will look like "2.5 kg in pack | 1.2 kg worn"
button to open screen where you can manage your clothing items
the rating for protection against damage offered by clothing

Nynorsk: {roll-bonus} % sjanse for å lukkast med bøtinga

English:
{roll-bonus}% Chance of Successful Repair
Repair time decreased by {time-bonus}
Nynorsk:
{roll-bonus} % sjanse for å lukkast med bøtinga
Bøtetida redusert med {time-bonus}

English:
{roll-bonus}% Chance of Successful Repair
Repair time decreased by {time-bonus}
{cond-bonus} greater item condition increase
{sewing-bonus} reduction of sewing kit wear

{roll-bonus}% Chance of Successful Repair
Repair time decreased by {time-bonus}
{cond-bonus} greater item condition increase
{sewing-bonus} reduction of sewing kit wear
You have little knowledge or skill with mending cloth items. Although you can make basic repairs, your use of a sewing kit is clumsy and slow.
Nynorsk: Du har lite røynsle om og dugleikar i å bøta klede. Sjølv om du kan utføra enkle vølingar, er du treg når du syr.

English: Your sewing skills are improving. You are now making fewer mistakes and making your repairs a little more speedily.
Nynorsk: Du er vorte betre til å sy. Du gjer færre feil, og bøtingane dine går raskare.

English: You're getting good at mending cloth items. Your repairs are faster than before and more efficient. Mistakes are rare.
Nynorsk: Du begynnar å verta god til å bøta klede. Du bøtar raskere og meir effektivt enn før. Du gjer sjeldent feil.

English: An expert with a needle and thread. Your sewing skills allow you to keep your clothing in top condition using less time and less resources than before.
Nynorsk: Du er vorte ein ekspert med nål og tråd. Med dei nye dugleikane dine kan du halde kleda dine i god stand, og du nyttar kortare tid og færre ressursar enn før.

English: You have mastered the use of a needle and thread. You are fast, efficient and repair cloth items with ease.
Nynorsk: Du har meistra bruken av nål og tråd. Du er rask og effektiv, og du bøtar klede utan vanskar. Viss bestemor hadde sett deg hadde ho vert stolt.

Notes: refers to a special legend screen where icon meanings are explained

English: Explore the world to find the route that leads to this region!
Nynorsk: Utforsk omgjevnadane for å finna vegen til denne regionen!

English:
For intermediate players. A weather-battered coastline rich in shelters and resources. Watch out for wildlife. 

Connects to Mystery Lake, Kosedalen, and desolation Point.
Notes: REMOVED: You've found your way to the Coastal Highway, which winds its way around a weather-battered coastline, with small clusters of habitation to be found along the way.
Nynorsk:
For spelarar med ei viss erfaring. Ein vêrhard kyst rik på ly og ressursar. Pass deg for dyrelivet!

Er forbundet med Løyndomsvatnet, Kosedalen og Einsemdneset.

English: A tin of ground coffee. Who knows how long it's been sitting here? A drink that can take the edge off fatigue, and warm your insides on a cold night.
Nynorsk: Ein boks med kaffipulver. Kven veit kor lenge den har stått der? Ein drikk som kan hjelpe når du er utkøyrd, og varmar deg innvendeg ei kald natt.

Notes: Description for the buffer memories description
will look like "#21 of 100" in game
Menu item displayed on the collections panel

English: Recipe Cards with details on unique and potent Great Bear Island dishes.
All named locations surveyed according to regions discovered
Boots designs for war zones. Too bad they weren't made for Winter. Heavy-duty leather with good ankle support. Would offer fair resistance to animal bites.
Nynorsk: Støvlar laga for krigssonar. Berre so synd at dei ikkje er meina for vinteren. Solide skinnstøvlar med god ankelstytte. Toler muligens eit dyrebitt eller to.

English: Heavy duty military pants, with reinforced knees and articulated for good mobility. designed to take a beating.
Nynorsk: Solid feltbukse som er forsterka over knea og leddelt for å gje god rørseevne. Toler ein støyt.

English: A compression bandage, used to constrict movement on an injury.
Nynorsk: Trykkbandasje, nyttast til å førebyggja at sårflatar rører seg.

Notes: Interaction label for Buffer Memory computer terminals

English: Sweetened, thickened milk in a can. Keeps forever.
Nynorsk: Søt, fortjukka mjølk i ein boks. Held seg for evig.

Notes: A "buff," or gameplay boost that resores a player's condition.

English: You'll gradually recover lost Condition over time.
Nynorsk: Helsa di vert gradvis betre over tid.

Notes: header for a stats counter, condition refers to health of the player

English: Carcass Condition too low to harvest
Nynorsk: Kadaveret er for dårleg til å slaktast

English: Are you sure you want to quit? Any unsaved progress will be lost!
Nynorsk: Er du sikker på at du vil avslutta? All framdrift som ikkje er lagra, vil gå tapt!

English: To avoid items being confiscated, hide them out of sight in containers or places far away from the convicts.
Hide your items out of sight of the convicts to avoid confiscation
{item-name} is ruined and cannot be opened
Nynorsk: {item-name} er øydelagd og kan ikkje opnast

English: Container cannot hald that much weight
Nynorsk: Behaldaren kan ikkje halde på so mykje vekt

English: Continue to {episode} now or continue to {episode} from the Main Menu by resuming your save game.
Nynorsk: Hald fram til {episode} no eller hald fram til {episode} frå hovudmenyen ved å fortsetja ditt lagra spel.

English: A big meal from a big fish.
Nynorsk: Eit svært måltid frå ein kolossal fisk.

English: Cooked Burbot. A firm and buttery white fish.
Salmon, cooked on a fire. One of life's better things.
Nynorsk: Laks, steikt over eld. Noko av det bedtre livet har å by på.

English: Cooked Goldeye. A bland flavor on its own.
Nynorsk: Steikt gullauge. Mykje godt smaklaus for seg sjølv.

English: Cooked whitefish. A bit tasteless, but better than nothing.
Nynorsk: Steikt sik. Litt smaklaus, men bedtre enn ingenting.

English: Cooked flesh from a Moose. Tastier than you would expect.
Nynorsk: Steikt kjøt av elg. Smakar betre enn ein ville forventa.

English: Cooked and ready to eat. A delicious staple.
A bit scorched but wonderful tasting.
Cooked Red Irish Lord. An improved appearance, it must be said.
Nynorsk: Steikt panserulk. Han ser jo ikkje ut!

English: Cooked Rockfish. Lean flesh with a nutty, agreeable flavor.
Nynorsk: Steikt uer. Magert kjøt med nøttete smak.

English: A feast as good for the soul as for the stomach.
Nynorsk: Eit festmåltid både for sjel og mage.

English: {cal-bonus} Calories from any cooked food item

Notes:
+10% Calories from any cooked food item.
Cooking times reduced by 10%

English:
{cal-bonus} Calories from any cooked food item
No calorie loss when smashing open cans
Cooking times reduced by {time-bonus}
Never get Parasites or Food Poisoning
Nynorsk:
{cal-bonus} Kaloriar frå steikt mat
Ikkje noko kaloritap når du slår opp boksar
Koke- og steiketid redusert med {time-bonus}
Du er immun mot matforgiftning og tarmparasittar.

English: If you were still enjoying civilization's warm embrace, you might be able to cook a hotdog over a fire without burning it.
Nynorsk: Mor di har alltid laga mat til deg, so du har ikkje hatt behov for kunna det. Det beste du kanskje kan få til er å steika ei pølse utan å svi han.

English: You're getting better at cooking with camp tools. You don't burn things so much, including yourself.
Nynorsk: Du vert betre og betre til å laga mat med turutstyr. Du brenn ikkje ting so ofte, inkludert deg sjølv.

English: You're a pretty good cook. You've figured out some good ways to improvise around the lack of modern utensils and appliances.
Nynorsk: Du er ein ganske bra kokk. Utan moderne spisereiskapar og utstyr er du vorte god til å improvisera.

English: You can make anything feel like a meal. You have perfect timing and you don't waste anything.
Nynorsk: Du kan få alt til å kjennast som eit måltid. Du har perfekt berekning, og du kastar ikkje vekk noko.

English: You're an amazing cook. If people still had dinner parties, you'd be the talk of them. You know how to prepare anything, and your food never makes you sick.
Nynorsk: Du er ein fantastisk kokk. Viss folk ennå arrangerte middagsselskap, ville du ha vorte midtpunktet. Du kan laga til som helst, og du vert aldri sjuk av maten din. Du er vorte ein god ven av Andrimne.

English: A basic cooking oil. Nothing fancy.
Nynorsk: Vanleg matolje til å steikja med. Ikkje noko spesielt.

English: A sturdy pot for melting snow, boiling water, and cooking food.
Nynorsk: Ei solid gryte laga av støypejern. Ein kan smelta snø, koka vatn og laga mat i ho.

Notes: text when hovering over a spot where cooking can happen, like a stove burner or rock next to a campfire -- Send to KW
Time and calorie cost to Harvest
Time and calorie cost to Quarter

English: Hooded cotton sweatshirt. You know, the kind that passes for high fashion with game developers these days.
Nynorsk: Hettegenser av bomull. Den typen som går for å vera på moten med spelutviklarar no til dags.

English: Stretchy cotton underwear designed to fit under regular pants.
Nynorsk: Elastisk bomullsunderklede som nyttast under vanlege bukser.

English: Thin cotton scarf designed more for looks than utility. Will keep the wind off your neck.
Nynorsk: Tynt bomullsskjerf laga for å sjå fin ut, ikkje for å halda på varmen. Held vinden vekke frå nakken.

English: A simple cotton button-down shirt you'd wear to a boring office job. Good thing computers don't seem to work anymore!
Nynorsk: Ei enkel skjorte som passar best til ein keisam kontorjobb. Kanskje like greitt at datamaskinar ikkje ser ut til å fungera lenger!

English: Thin cotton socks. Not very warm and useless when wet
Nynorsk: Tynne bomullslabbar. Ikkje veldig varme, og unyttelege viss dei vert våte.

English: The warmest sweater around. Inspired by the traditional sweater conceived by the Cowichan First Nation on Vancouver Island, Canada. Treat it like an old friend.
Nynorsk: Verda sin varmaste genser, inspirert av den tradisjonelle genseren til cowichanfolket på Vancouver Island, Canada. Handter han som ein gamal ven.

English: You must be at the correct location to craft this item.
Nynorsk: Du må vera på rett plass for å kunna laga denne tingen.

Notes: UI label for a game «buff» when you have the Crampons item equipped. Better tractions!

English: The Crampons' steel spikes give you better traction in icy terrain. They make rope climbing easier, Sprains less frequent, and Weak Ice more forgiving.
Nynorsk: Stålbroddar gjev deg betre fotfeste i isete terreng. Ein vrengjer anklar og handledd sjeldnare, tauklatring vert lettare og tynn is er meir tilgjeveleg.

English: Traction, for your feet. Rope climbing drains less Stamina, Sprains are less frequent, and you can travel with more confidence over Weak Ice.
Nynorsk: Broddar av stål til å festa på undersida av skor. Gjev deg støtt fotfeste kvar enn du går.

Notes: large, natural, rock covered area, cave like
cave in the base of the chasm
Two small peaks sit next to trail into Chasm
Two small peaks sit next to trail into Chasm
Crash debris -  a section of plane with tail
Crash debris -  a piece of landing gear
Crash debris -  a section of wing
Clearing at base of mountain, with deer
large mountain lake in front of the lodge

English: Explore the world to find the route that leads to this region!
Nynorsk: Utforsk omgjevnadane for å finna vegen til denne regionen!

English:
For advanced players. An isolated alpine region with very few shelters or resources. A true test of wilderness survival skills.

Connects to Kosedalen.
Nynorsk:
For avanserte spelarar. Eit avsidesliggjande fjellområde med særs lite ly og ressursar. Ein verkleg test av overlevingsdugleikar.

Er forbundet med Kosedalen.

Notes: Shelf area partway up mountain (secluded spot, has cave tunnel access)
Area at top of mountain (where crashed plane tail sits)
small peak you can reach the top of, view towards lake
Waterfall found part way up crash mountain

English: Crew-neck sweater made of heavy cotton. Will take the edge off on a windy day, but not very warm.
Nynorsk: Bomullsgenser med rund hals. Er litt til hjelp når det blæs, men er ikkje veldig varm.

English: You cannot interact with the Survivor while crouching here
A feather from a Crow. Add it to an Arrow Shaft to make a usable, stabilized arrow.
Nynorsk: Ei fjør frå ei kråke. Fest nokon til enden av eit pilskaft for å laga ei stabil pil.

Notes: as in the challenge mode that is currently being played
Native name of each language, so the name of the language in that language. For example, English is "English" and German is "deutsch".
mission popup for the active mission
Added qualifier "Reduce" to the beginning of this tooltip.

English: Stick, Branch, and Stone Spawn Frequency
With this enabled, you will never Freeze when sitting near an active Fire, no matter how cold it is beyond that fire.
Likelihood of spawning indoors at game start. Indoor start spawns tend to be easier.
Turns the Survivor monologue on or off. NOTE: Turning this off may negatively impact gameplay, as it removes a vital piece of player feedback.
Influences how often the Aurora appears.
Determines the base availability of any spawnable resource, including shelters and gear items. Sets a baseline level of challenge which can be modified using more granular settings.
Affects potential Bear population in the game.
Affects whether or not you can get Broken Ribs.
Determines whether you will risk the Cabin Fever affliction when remaining indoors for too long.
Affects how quickly you begin to Starve.
The level of Condition recovery when not suffering from an affliction or low status (ex. Freezing, Starving, etc.). Makes the game easier.
Modifies the rate of Condition recovery you gain from each hour of Rest.
Modifies the length of a game day. 1x is the current default (1 game day = 2 real hours), with each multiplier slowing down in-game time by increasing the ratio of real hours to each game day.
Affects potential Deer population in the game.
Affects whether or not you can get Dysentery from drinking non-potable Water.
Chance of a container being empty. High chance reduces overall resources in the world.
Enables an endless night. The sun will never rise.
When enabled, an endless night persists for the duration of a Custom Mode game. NOTE: To unlock this setting, you must earn Escape the Darkwalker -- Umbra Badge (2020).
Affects how quickly you become Exhausted.
Affects your chance to catch Fish.
Affects whether or not you risk getting Food Poisoning when eating low-Condition food items.
Affects how quickly you lose Warmth and begin to Freeze.
Affects how quickly you get Frostbite.
Affects how cold the world becomes over time.
Determines how long it takes to recover from Hypothermia. Fewer hours makes the game easier.
If you start to Freeze when asleep, you will wake up. Helps prevent death by freezing in your sleep.
Affects how quickly items lose Condition over time.
Modifies the amount of gear that spawns outside of Containers. Low chance reduces the amount of gear you find in the world.
With this turned on, you will wake up when fully Rested, which limits your ability to recover Condition. Makes the game more challenging.
Affects potential Moose population in the game.
No Predators will spawn in the first 24 hours of your game, allowing you some time to establish yourself.
Affects whether or not you can get Intestinal Parasites from eating certain types of Meat.
Affects how many harvestable plants will spawn in each game.
Affects potential Rabbit population in the game.
Modifies the amount of gear you find in each Container that is not empty.
The rate at which the wildlife population diminishes over time, making the later game more challenging due to reduced resources.
Toggles whether Revolvers spawn in your game, or not.
Determines if Rifles spawn or not. Removing Rifles from the game makes it much more challenging.
Affects how strongly Scent is emitted from raw meat or Blood. Higher scent attracts predators from further away.
Affects whether or not you can Sprain your wrist or ankle.
Affects the quality and amount of gear you start the game with.
Fixes the starting time of day for every new run of this Experience.
Fixes the starting weather type for every new run of this Experience.
Affects the availability of these resources in the world.
Affects how much damage your Clothing will take during a Wildlife Struggle.
Affects the types of damage outcomes from Wildlife struggles (ex. Blood Loss, Clothing Damage, etc.)
Affects the amount of Condition damage you receive during a Struggle.
Modifies how effectively you Fight Back during a struggle. More effective means the Struggle is shorter and you take less damage, etc.
Affects how quickly you become Dehydrated
Lower to reduce weapon and item effectiveness at damaging Timberwolf Morale. Raise to increase weapon and item effectiveness.
Fires automatically set the Air Temp to just above freezing, no matter how much fuel you add or how cold it is outside. Windchill is still in effect.
Determines how often the weather will change. More variation can be harder to adapt to.
Makes wildlife more or less aware of your presence.
Affects the chance that Wildlife will flee when Detecting you. Makes hunting more challenging, but also means Predators attack less.
Notes: This variable won't be made visible for the December update.

English: Affects whether outdoor Rest could be interrupted by Wildlife attacks. Does not apply to wildlife currently Stalking you when you begin Resting.
Wildlife will not attack, and will generally flee from you, unless you provoke them directly.
Affects how often wildlife spawns are refreshed within a valid spawn area.
Modifies the range at which Wildlife can detect you based on Scent (i.e. they do not have to see you to detect you).
Affects how often the wind changes speed and direction, which can have an impact on shelters and Wind Chill effects.
Affects the chance that Wolves will flee when detecting you, rather than hunting you.
Affects potential Wolf population in the game.
Affects how far away wolves may spawn when you enter or exit an interior. Closer means they are more likely to catch you unawares.

Notes: This variable won't be made visible for the December update.
Using bolt cutters on a lock/chain

English: Carter Hydro Dam -- Safety & Shutdown Notice

Official looking notice, written on Carter Hydro Dam letterhead. The letter is damaged and some of the words are hard to make out. It is dated from some time in the 1990s, although the exact date is illegible.
Nynorsk: Eit notat som ser offisielt ut, skriven på Carter-demningen sitt brevpapir. Brevet er skada, og nokon av orda er vanskelege å tyda. Brevet er datert ein eller annen gong på nittitalet, men den eksakte datoen er uleseleg.

English: "I'm sure this will come as no surprise to you, but ever since seismic activity on the Island has become such an issue, it's been almost impossible to run Carter Dam profitably. Besides that, the recent eco-activism -- or, let's call it what it is: terrorism -- has introduce new risks that have brought plant and worker safety into question. Therefore, I'm sad to report that after years of trying to modernize Carter Dam, and after the failed attempts of its original creator, the eponymous Richard Carter, it's finally time for me to also admit defeat, as he did those decades ago. No ambition of mine justifies putting your lives in danger. All workers will be transported out as soon as we can guarantee your safety. In the mean time, please keep an eye out for any suspicous activity in or around the Dam -- the so-called "Forest Talkers" are still active in the area. Thank you for your dedication to the cause. Yours truly, Robert Clarke, CEO, Carter Hydro Energy."
Nynorsk: Dette vil sikkert ikkje koma som ein overraskelse, men heilt sidan den seismiske aktiviteten på øya begynte å verta eit problem, har det nesten vert umogleg å drive Carter-demningen med profitt. Miljøvernaktivistmen har i seinare tid – forresten, lat oss kalla det for det det er: «terrorisme» – ført med seg nye fareelement som er ein trussel mot tryggleika til verket og arbeidarane her. Derfor må eg dessverre dela at eg òg, etter å ha streva i mange år med å modernisera Carter-demningen etter dei mislukka forsøka til den opprinnelege eigaren, Richard Carter, som ga demningen sitt namn, omsider er naudt til å innrømma nederlag, slik som Carter gjorde flere tiår sidan. Ingen av mine ambisjonar rettferdiggjer å settja dykkar liv i fare. Alle arbeidarar vil verta transportert ut so snart me kan garantera for tryggleika. I mellomtida må de sjå opp for mistenkeleg aktivitet i og rundt demningen. De såkalte Skogpratarane er fortsatt aktive i området. Takk for innsatsen for saken. Mvh. Robert Clarke, administrerende direktør i Carter vasskraft.

English: Carter Hydro Staging Area Gate Key
Key for the gate in the fence surrounding the Carter Hydro Dam staging area.
Notes: A key for the fence gate outside the Dam
Nynorsk: Nykel til porten i gjerdet rundt transittområde ved Carter-demningen.

English: Letter found in garbage can in the bathroom at Carter Hydro Dam.
Nynorsk: Eit brev funne i bosdunken på badet i Carter-demningen.

English: "I'm so ****ed off at you. You told me the Forest Talkers were legit and that we'd be doing "good work" out here. All I've seen is a ragtag bunch of dumbies who are disorganized and have no plan. It's way too cold to be out here this time of year, and the wildlife -- I mean, you didn't tell me there would be *actual* wolves out here. This is crazy. You can hear them outside at night, howling. It's making me crazy. What are we doing out here? People said Great Bear was hit hard by the quakes but man, I had no idea it was so stuck in the...dark ages. You owe big time for bringing those supplies, and if the weather doesn't warm up soon, I'm outta here, and you will not be seeing me again any time soon."
Nynorsk: Eg er dritsur på deg. Du fortalte meg at Skogpratarane drev på reieleg vis, og at me skulle gjera «viktig arbeid» her ute. Det einaste eg har sitt, er ein lurvete gjeng uorganiserte idiotar utan ein plan. Det er altfor kaldt her på denne tida av året, og dei ville dyra … eg meiner, du sa ingenting om at det var ekte ulvar her. Dette er galskap. Du kan høyra dei ute om natta, ulvane. Eg vert sprø. Kva gjer me her ute? Folk sa at Sværebjørn fekk gjennomgå under jordskjelva, men eg ante ikkje at øya var satt attende til … middelalderen. Du står i stor gjeld til meg for at eg tok med dei forsyningane, og viss det ikkje vert varmare i vêret snart, fer eg, og då ser du meg ikkje igjen på ei stund.

Nynorsk: Ein nykel til medisinskåpet i Carter-demningen sin fyrstehjelpstasjon.

English: A page torn from a notebook.
...do I give in to its will? That may be the only way back. But not yet, not yet. As long as I paint, I live...

Glyphs of Power and their Uses:
Lure -- Attract the Darkwalker
Ward -- A shield, if only for a little while.
Dispel -- Push back the choking fog. But only once.
A page torn from a notebook.
...can’t see it, can’t fight it...only running. My heart, a black echo in the forest, always hunting for a green fire...
A page torn from a notebook.
The poison in my blood draws it closer...and now that poison fills the air...the formless hunting a form.
A page torn from a notebook.
...the signs hold it at bay, or lead it away from me...but who is the Glyph-maker?
A page torn from a notebook.
...dead and dreaming, my only friend, the faceless moon who won’t look away. There is no sunrise on Ganymede...
A page torn from a notebook.
I crept upon the nameless city, stars in my eyes. But those eyes no longer see the world...just a choking mist. Over the horizon, that is where I escape.
A page torn from a notebook.
...a pale river, turned in on itself, a rush of blood to my head. Only the crooked path leads me away...
A page torn from a notebook.
I discarded the farsighted mask, and only bone remains. The gate is closed. Will it come for me now?
A page torn from a notebook.
The gnashing, the grinding, a thing from the stars. But no beauty sets down from that endless void...
A page torn from a notebook.
I climbed the tall mountain, but it wormed in the earth below me. There was no escape, not even high above...my delirium has become its feeding ground.

English:
-- DISCLAIMER --

Hinterland Studio Inc. does not condone the wanton destruction of wildlife. 

As the result of the geomagnetic disaster which serves as part of the fictional foundation of the game, we have taken liberties with the portrayal of wildlife behaviour. We are not attempting to create "realistic" wildlife behaviour in the game. We know that Wolves do not typically attack people.

The Long Dark is a survival experience, and we strive for realism in many areas, but it is NOT a replacement for actual survival training or experience in the wilderness. In the end, our goal is to provide an interesting set of choices for you to play with safely. It is not a wilderness survival training simulation.

Contact us for more information:

info@hinterlandgames.com

*** DO NOT ATTEMPT TO USE WHAT YOU LEARN IN THE LONG DARK, IN REAL LIFE. DOING SO COULD RESULT IN INJURY, ILLNESS, or even deATH. ***
Nynorsk:
-- ANSVARSFRÅSKRIV --

Hinterland Studio Inc. stytter ikkje føremållause drap av dyr. 

På grunn av den geomagnetiske katastrofen som tjener som ein del av spelet sitt oppdikta fundament, har me tatt oss friheiter i framstillinga av dyrelivet i spelet. Me har ikkje prøvd å atterskapa ei «realistisk» dyreåtferd. Me veit at ulvar vanlegvis ikkje går til åtak på folk.

The Long Dark handlar om å overleva, og på mange område strevar me etter å gjera opplevinga so realistisk som mogleg, men spelet er ikkje ei erstatning for faktisk overlevingstrening eller opplevingar i naturen. Målet vårt er å gi deg interessante val i eit trygt spel. Det er ikkje ei simulering av trening i overleving i naturen.

Ta gjerne kontakt dersom du ynskjer meir informasjon:

info@hinterlandgames.com

*** IKKJE PRØV Å BRUKA LÆRDOM FRÅ THE LONG DARK I DEN VERKELEGE VERDA. DETTE KAN FØRE TIL SKADE, SJUKDOM ELLER TIL OG MED DØD. ***

Hinterland Studio Inc. does not condone the wanton destruction of wildlife. 

As the result of the geomagnetic disaster which serves as part of the fictional foundation of the game, we have taken liberties with the portrayal of wildlife behaviour. We are not attempting to create "realistic" wildlife behaviour in the game. We know that Wolves do not typically attack people.

The Long Dark is a survival experience, and we strive for realism in many areas, but it is NOT a replacement for actual survival training or experience in the wilderness. In the end, our goal is to provide an interesting set of choices for you to play with safely. It is not a wilderness survival training simulation.

Contact us for more information:

English: DO NOT ATTEMPT TO USE WHAT YOU LEARN IN THE LONG DARK IN REAL LIFE. DOING SO COULD RESULT IN INJURY, ILLNESS, or even DEATH.

English:
A small percentage of people may experience epileptic seizures or blackouts when exposed to certain kinds of flashing lights or light patterns.

These persons, or even people who have no history of seizures or epilepsy, may experience epileptic symptoms or seizures while playing video games.
Immediately stop playing and consult a doctor if you experience any symptoms.

If you, or anyone in your family, have an epileptic condition, consult your physician prior to playing.

You may reduce risk of photosensitive epileptic seizures by taking the following precautions: keep your eyes as far away as possible from the screen, use a smaller screen, take regular breaks during play sessions, do not play when you are drowsy or fatigued.

English: WINTERMUTE as it was meant to be played - equal parts Story and Survival.

•  For players with some experience, and those looking for a balance between Exploration and Survival.
•  Wildlife is sparse, but can seek you out.
•  Survival elements are challenging but resources are plentiful.
Notes: Bullet desc for xp mode Capable

English: Use our custom toolbox to craft a unique balance between Survival and Exploration - an experience all your own.

•  For players looking for a unique experience separate from standard Survival Mode.
•  Adjust variables including Wildlife spawns, Resource availability, and Weather.
•  Give your Custom Experience Mode settings to fellow survivors using a special shareable code.
You are brand new to The Long Dark, or are more interested in Story and Atmosphere than Survival.

•  For new players most interested in pensive Exploration and Storytelling.
•  Most survival elements are tuned to be very forgiving.
•  Wildlife will not attack unless provoked.
Notes: Bullet desc for xp mode Fresh

English: You want a good Story, but you also want a more extreme Survival challenge along the way. Not for the faint of heart.

•  For veteran players looking for a punishing Survival experience.
•  Hostile wildlife is common, and will hunt you down.
•  All survival elements are tuned to be particularly challenging.
Notes: Bullet desc for xp mode Hardened

English: You are not part of Mother Nature's plan, and you will bear the full force of her wrath. The true test of Human vs. Nature.

English:
•  For expert players looking for the ultimate wilderness Survival challenge.
•  You start with the most minimal resources, and have to craft everything you need to survive.
•  The world becomes more hostile the longer you survive.
•  Allows for 2 active Feats.
Nynorsk:
•  For eksperter som er ute etter den ultimate utfordringa i naturen.

•  Jo lenger du overlev, desto meir fiendtleg vert naturen.

English: Your demise waits behind every hilltop, shelter, and tree. Only the strong survive.
Notes: Flavour text for the Stalker experience mode.
Nynorsk: Dauden ventar bak kvar knaus, ly og tre. Berre dei sterkaste overlever.

English:
•  For veteran players looking for a punishingly challenging Survival experience.
•  Hostile wildlife is common, and will hunt you down.
•  All survival elements are tuned to be particularly challenging.
•  Allows for 3 active Feats.
Notes: This text describes the selected experience mode (in this case, Stalker).
Nynorsk:
•  For veteranar som ynskjer ein nådelaust og vanskeleg kamp for å overleva.
•  Det er vanleg med mannevonde dyr, og dei vil jakta på deg.
•  Alt i spelet er justert for å gjera det ekstra vanskeleg å overleva.
•  Tillet tre aktive bragder.

English: Equal parts hunter and hunted, your struggle to survive will eventually lead to mastering the elements.
Notes: Flavour text for the Voyageur experience mode.
Nynorsk: Du er både jeger og bytte. Kampen for å overleva vil til slutt læra deg å meistra omgivelsane.

English:
•  For new or experienced players looking for a balance between Exploration and Survival.
•  Wildlife is sparse, but can seek you out.
•  Survival elements are challenging but resources are plentiful.
•  Allows for 4 active Feats.
Notes: This text describes the selected experience mode (in this case, Voyageur).
Nynorsk:
•  For nye eller erfarne spelarar som ynskjer balanse mellom utforskning og overleving.
•  Det er ikkje mange dyr å sjå, men nokon kan oppsøkja deg.
•  Det er utfordrande å overleva, men du har nok av ressursar tilgjengeleg.
•  Tillet fire aktive bragder.
Du lukkast ikkje i å laga eld.

Notes: noun, you had a fall (fell down)

English: Bank deposit box key belonging to the Farmer. Will open a deposit box in the bank vault.
Nynorsk: Bankboksnykel som tilhøyrar bonden. Med denne kan du opna ein bankboks i bankkvelvet.

English: You are too fatigued to climb
Nynorsk: Du er for trøytt til å klatra

English: You're feeling more wakeful and energized. Temporarily reduces your Fatigue.
Nynorsk: Du kjennar deg meir våken og drivande. Reduserar trøttleikkjensla mellombels.

English: From now on, all your Survivors start with a Level {number} Fire Starting skill.
You've successfully started {count} fires. From now on, all your Survivors start with a Level {number} Fire Starting skill.
Nynorsk: Du har kveika eld {count} gonger. Frå no av vil du starta med nivå {number} av dugleik i eldkveiking.

English: You've sprinted {distance}. Sprinting now burns {bonus} fewer Calories.
Nynorsk: Du har sprunge {distance}. Springing forbrennar no {bonus} færre kaloriar.

English: You are less Fatigued at night, but more Fatigued during the day.
You've collected 6 Escape the Darkwalker Diary Pages in a single game. Now you are less Fatigued at night, but more Fatigued during the day.
Notes: UI label, Do not translate «Escape the Darkwalker»

English: You've collected 6 Escape the Darkwalker Diary Pages in a single game.
Notes: UI label, Do not translate «Escape the Darkwalker»

English: You've travelled {distance} in the game. Your Stamina bar recharges {bonus} faster.
Nynorsk: Du har gått {distance} i spelet. Trottlinja fyllast {bonus} raskare.

English: Speed reduction for walking into wind reduced by {bonus}.
You've spent {days} days outdoors during blizzards. Speed reduction for walking into wind reduced by {bonus}.
You've spent {days} days outdoors during blizzards.
From now on, you gain {bonus} more benefit from each completely researched book.
You've completed {hours} hours of Research. From now on, you gain {bonus} more benefit from each completely researched book.
Nynorsk: Du har lest i {hours} timar. Frå no av får du ein forbetring på {bonus} for kvar bok du les heilt ut.

English: You are now less susceptible to the cold, and get a permanent {bonus} bonus to Air Temperature.
You've spent a total of {days} days outside. You are now less susceptible to the cold, and get a permanent {bonus} bonus to your Feels Like temperature.
Nynorsk: Du har vert til saman {days} dagar ute. Du tålar kulDen betre enn før, og «Kjennast som»-temperaturen din har fått ein permanent bonus på {bonus}.

English: You've spent a total of {days} days outside.
Your body has adapted to these tough conditions. You now consume {bonus} fewer calories.
You've survived {days} days. Your body has adapted to these tough conditions. You now consume {bonus} fewer calories.
Nynorsk: Du har overlevd i {days} dagar. Kroppen din har tilpassa seg dei vanskelege vêrforholda. Du forbrenn no {bonus} færre kaloriar.

English: Your Snares are now {bonus} more effective.
You've snared {number} Rabbits. Your Snares are now {bonus} more effective.
A straight wooDen arrow, cut and shaped from a cured Birch sapling. Combine with Crow feathers and Arrowhead to make a usable Arrow.
Nynorsk: Eit rett pilskaft, laga frå turka ungbjørk. Fest ein pilspiss i eine enden og nokre kråkefjør i andre enden so har du ei flott pil!

English: Badges awarded for Feats that can be completed across many Sandbox games.
Nynorsk: Merker som delast ut for bragder som kan fullførast over mange rundar.

English: You now experience the effects of Coffee, Energy Drinks, and Emergency Stims for {bonus} longer.
Use or consume {number} Coffee, Energy Drinks or Emergency Stims. You now experience the effects of Coffee, Energy Drinks, and Emergency Stims for {bonus} longer.
Use or consume {number} Coffee, Energy Drinks or Emergency Stims.

Notes: item category for items that can be used to start fires

English: A large axe of the kind used to break down doors during fires.
Nynorsk: Ei stor øks som nyttast til å bryta seg igjennom dører ved husbrannar.

English: Firelog made of chemicals and compressed shavings. Doesn't throw off much heat.
Nynorsk: Vedbrikett laga av kjemikal og samanpressa spon. Gjev ikkje frå seg noko særleg varme.

Notes: refers to how long a fire will continue to burn

English: Særsvasstette støvlar laga av syntetiske materialar. Fôret innvendig slik at føttene dine holdes varme. Støvlene er tunge, og dette sinker deg.

Nynorsk: Sjanse for å lykkast i kveike eld

English:
{roll-bonus}% Chance to Start Fires
Fires last {duration-bonus} longer
Notes:
+15 to Firestarting roll
Fires last 10% longer
Nynorsk:
{roll-bonus} % sjanse for å kveike eld
ElDen varar {duration-bonus} lenger
Kan kveike eld utan knusk

English:
{roll-bonus}% Chance to Start Fires
Fires last {duration-bonus} longer
Can start fires without Tinder
Nynorsk:
{roll-bonus} % sjanse for å kveike eld
ElDen varar {duration-bonus} lenger
Kan kveike eld utan knusk

English:
{roll-bonus}% Chance to Start Fires
Fires last {duration-bonus} longer
Can start fires without Tinder
Nynorsk:
{roll-bonus} % sjanse for å kveike eld
ElDen varar {duration-bonus} lenger
Kan kveike eld utan knusk

English:
{roll-bonus}% Chance to Start Fires
Fires start {speed-bonus} faster
Fires last {duration-bonus} longer
Can start fires without Tinder
Nynorsk:
{roll-bonus} % sjanse for å kveike eld
Det går {speed-bonus} raskare å kveike eld
ElDen varar {duration-bonus} lenger
Kan kveike eld utan knusk

English: You have no special knowledge or skill at starting fires, yet.
Nynorsk: Du har ingen spesiell lærdom eller dugleikar i å kveike eld.

English: You're quite good at starting fires now. Your fires start better and they last longer.
Nynorsk: Du er ganske flink til å tenne eld no. ElDen din startar raskare og varar lenger.

English: You have well above-average experience in starting fires now. You're becoming very capable.
Nynorsk: Du har over gjennomsnittlig røynsle i å kveike eld. Du held på å verta veldig flink.

English: Very few can match your skill. Your fires burn faster and for longer. You have woodsmoke in your veins.
Nynorsk: Ikkje mange kan dette lika godt som deg. ElDen din starter raskare og varar lenger. Du er eit naturtalent.

English: You have a spark at your fingertips. Your skills are legendary. You're the fire whisperer.
Nynorsk: Det gneistar av fingertuppane dine. Dugleikane dine er legendariske. Du har vorte god ven med Surt.

English: Metal tool designed to help start fires in the wilderness.
Nynorsk: Metallreiskap som påliteleg lagar gneistar. Nyttast til å starte eld.

English: While not technically a hardwood, Fir burns like one.
Nynorsk: Gran er teknisk sett ikkje eit lauvtre, men det brenn som eit.

English: Crispy cakes of fish, traditional style. Salty.
Nynorsk: Sprø kake av fiskefarse. Ekte tradisjonsmat.

English: A satisfying pie made from the day's catch. The taste of the sea.
Nynorsk: Ein nydeleg pai laga av dagens fangst.

English: Heavy cable-knit wool sweater, of the kind worn by people on cold boats. High necked and generally very warm. Also, heavy.
Nynorsk: Tung tjukk ullgenser med flettemønster, ofta nyttt på sjøen. Høg hals og særs varm, men òg tung.

English: Basic fish bait. Useful for catching larger fish.
Nynorsk: Fest på enden av kroken for å lokka fram større fisk.

English: A solid, enticing lure. Improves the odds when fishing.
Nynorsk: Ein solid og appetittvekkjande sluk. Aukar oddsen for at noko bit på.

English: A very basic lure, but might help you attract a few more fish.
Nynorsk: Ein veldig enkel sluk, men kanskje dei svaksynte fiskane bit på?

English: A hook and line used for catching fish.
Nynorsk: Krok og snøre til å fange fisk.

English: Jeremiah's Rifle, now repaired. The old trapper will want it back.
Nynorsk: Jeremiah si børse, no reparert. Den gamle pelsjegeren vil nok ha han attende.

English: A powerful flare. Loud enough to scare wildlife.
Notes: Was: A throwable flare. Loud enough to scare wildlife.
Nynorsk: Ein kraftig bluss. Kraftig nok til å skremma dyr.

English: An emergency beacon fired from a Distress Pistol.
Nynorsk: Ein naudbluss som kan skytast frå ein signalpistol.

English: A device used to launch an emergency beacon into the air. Fires Flare Shells.
Nynorsk: Nyttast til å skyte naudblussar opp i lufta.

English: Useful for getting someone's attention in an emergency. Fires Distress Pistol Shells.
An industrial Flashlight. Equipped with a larger, more-efficient battery.
Nynorsk: Ei lommelykt laga for arbeid i mørke gruver. Har eit større batteri som varar lengre.

Notes: Displayed when the user tries to turn on the flashlight and the battery has no power remaining.

Nynorsk: Lita handlykt med batteri, krev straum.

English: With the Aurora out, use this high-powered Flashlight to deter wolves.

Notes: Text prompt to show on-screen for enabling the high beam of the flashlight

English: Basic fleece mitts. Pretty warm, but useless when wet.
Nynorsk: Enkle fleecevottar. Ganske varme, men unyttande når dei vert våte.

English: Synthetic micro-fleece mid-layer. Light, but not particularly windproof.
Nynorsk: Syntetisk mellomplagg av fleece-stoff. Lett, men ikkje spesielt vindtett.

English: Its thick leather and heavy stitching keep bush pilots warm at altitude. Also offers good protection when operating at ground level.
Nynorsk: Tjukt lêr og sterke saumar held pilotar varme i høgda. Vernar òg godt på bakkenivå.

English: Flint and steel striker to create hot sparks and ignite tinder.
Nynorsk: Flintstein og stål nyttast til å laga gneitrar som set fyr på knusk.

English: All purpose flour. A base ingredient in many recipes.
Nynorsk: Mjøl av kveite som eignar seg til det meste. Ingrediens i mange oppskrifter.

English: Something you ate has made you very sick. You will weaken until you treat it, it passes, or you die.
Nynorsk: Du har ete noko som har gjort deg veldig sjuk. Du vil verta svakare til du behandlar den, den går over, eller du døyr.

English: You feel sustained after eating a meal.
Nynorsk: Du kvikna til etter eit måltid.

English: You feel weighed down after eating a meal.
Nynorsk: Du kjenner deg nedtyngja etter eit måltid.

English: Hardy stuff in an emergency, but not a fancy meal.
Nynorsk: Mettar til nauds, men ikkje gourmetmat.

English: Visual quality of the footprint decals used. Setting does not affect footprint density or distance. Has no effect on gameplay.
Nynorsk: Den visuelle kvaliteten på fotspora i spelet. Innstillingen påverker ikkje fotspora sin tettleik og avstand. Dette har ingen effekt på spelet, du vil sjå like mange fotspor uansett.

English: A dense pie made from foraged vegetables. Rough around the edges.

Notes: followed by time and calories that will be spent

English: Official looking documents, soaked in blood.
A variety of documents, some with barely-visible Breyerhouse logos on them. Soaked in blood to the point of being ruined. Whatever useful info they contained is now lost.
Nynorsk: Ulike dokument, nokon med knapt synlege Breyerhouse-logoar. So blodstenkte at dei nesten er øydelagte. Eventuell nyttig informasjon i dokumenta er no tapt.

English: Forest Talker note found next to a corpse and distress pistol in the Dam

Phil,
Jackson’s seen some wolves around the area, and last week Emily said she thought she saw a bear skulking around the camp. I’m not convinced it isn’t those Breyerhouse thugs trying to scare us off, but just in case, keep this flare gun handy. It’s the closest thing we have to a firearm.
John

Nynorsk: Håndtrykket flygeblad med reklame for Skogpratarane.

English: It's time to rise up! We can no longer stand idle and watch our beloved Great Bear continue to be raped by the resource companies. If you care about saving this island, meet up at the old lodge on the outskirts of Mystery Lake provincial park. Cell service and satphone access is spotty so use the sneakernet! Remember, they're watching, so be careful who you trust.
Nynorsk: Me må stå i mot! Me kan ikkje lenger halde oss passive og sjå på medan ressursselskapa voldtar vår kjære Sværebjørn. Viss du vil bidra til å redde øya, kan du møte opp i den gamle hytta i utkanten av parken ved Løyndomsvatnet. Mobil og satellittelefon har dårlig dekning, so nytt snikarnettet. Husk at dei overvåkar oss, so ikkje stol på kven som helst.

English: Documents found by the Forest Talkers. They think they are important to their cause.
Nynorsk: Dokument funne av Skogpratarane. Dei trur dei er viktige for saka deira.

English: "We finally have the evidence we've been looking for. All the photos of the logging we skanind on social media have been totally ignored -- and I mean, who can blame them. Nobody believes what they see anymore. BUT, we stole some documents from a logging camp that prove that Breyerhouse is here *illegally*. Like, they don't actually have the correct permits or even permission to be here. And they are cutting down OLD GROWTH trees out here. It's exactly the kind of ammunition we need to take them down. Even if the lawyers and the corporate shills try to bury this -- and they will -- we'll be able to use this to drive up our recruitment, as well as cash for our crowdfunding campaign. With this, we can finally takes things to the *next level*."
Nynorsk: Endelig har me bevisa me leitte etter. Alle bildene me la ut på sosiale medier av tømmerhogsten, er vorte fullstendig ignorert, og det kan me eigentleg ikkje sei so mykje på. Ingen trur på det dei ser lenger. Men me har stole dokumentar frå ein tømmerleir, og desse bevisar at Breyerhouse ikkje har lov til å vera her. Dei har verken dei naudsynte konsesjonar eller løyve til å vera her. Og dei hogg ned URSKOG der ute. Dette er akkurat den ammunisjonen me treng til å stoppa dei. Sjølv om advokatane og kapitalistane skulle prøva å begrava dette – og det vil dei – so kan me nytta dette til å sitja fart på rekrutteringa og skaffa kontanter til crowdfunding-kampanjen vår. Med dette kan me endeleg ta ting til neste nivå.
Notat med kart til leiren til Skogpratarane

English: Written note and map showing the location of the “Forest Talker’s Camp” at the old Lodge building in the hills beyond the Maintenance Shed
Nynorsk: Eit notat og kart som visar posisjonen til leiren til Skogpratarane ved den gamle hytta på åsen bortanfor vedlikehaldsskuret.

English: Meet up at the abandoned hunting lodge on the outskirts of Mystery Lake park, GPS coordinates [unreadable]. We have to stop those Breyerhouse corporate [expletive].
Nynorsk: Me møtas ved den etterlata jakthytta i utkanten av parken i Løyndomsvatnet. GPS-koordinatar [uleseleg]. Me må stoppa dei jævla Breyerhouse-kapitalistene.

English: A sheet of paper, waterstained but crisply-folded.

[a leaf of paper -- written as a letter but undated and unsigned]

We built out a waystation of sorts in an old mine in the shadow of Blackrock Mountain. It’s not far from the Penitentiary, so we figure it’ll sit undisturbed as a stockpile. There’s a powerful energy to the place that I can’t quite describe. I feel renewed each time I visit.

Our other hope is that since the mine is more modern than many of the other workings on Great Bear, we’ll be able to scrounge some valuable gear there, too.

Maybe even more high explosives.

We’ve got to cut them off from the Mainland. Resilience is the only way forward for us. Dependence on Mainland support will only mean more ecological devastation.

The time for half-measures is over.
Faded writing on old Forest Talker letterhead.

We finally reached the mine and found the supply cache. If that last transmission was right, this could be what I've been looking for all along.


We know that 18 was the last number in the padlock combination, now I just have to find the other two. There must be more clues left behind.


There's a creeping darkness in here. I hate it. But I have to go deeper.
Faded writing on old Forest Talker letterhead.

The gas, my god.


There's some kind light system rigged up to deliver one of the numbers for the padlock.


I have to find a way to reach the right spot on the second floor so I can see it and decipher the number from the flashing light. The others went on without me. Just need to rest here a while.
Faded writing on old Forest Talker letterhead.

High explosives. Toxic gas. Bottomless pits.

A fool's errand, but we did decipher the final part of the padlock combination -- they marked the signs leading to the elevator. Clever!

Now to get the hell out of here.
A stack of three Forest Talker Notes.

Notes on a dark riddle:

- Last number is 18.
- One of the numbers involves a light system on the second floor. Find the marker to see the light.
- One of the numbers is connected to the yellow markings found on some of the signs.
A collectible with details on Forest Talker activity in Pleasant Valley

...pristine wilderness, with barely a hint of humanity to spoil it. If we can bring our message here, and succeed, it will show the rest of Great Bear what is possible. Pleasant Valley is where we make our stand.
A collectible with details on Forest Talker activity in Pleasant Valley

...people aren't ready for this kind of change. They live among nature, but not with it. Inviting the machines in, well, they'll see how that goes for them down the road. It's on the road where we'll make our stand.
A collectible with details on Forest Talker activity in Pleasant Valley

...as the years fall away in front of us, so fall the boulders from the hills. All this will look like a victory for Great Bear. Even as Mother Nature recovers Pleasant Valley, whoever remains will be forced to adapt, die, or move on.
A collectible with details on run ins between the Forest Talkers and Pleasant Valley residents.

This might be our one chance to survive out here, as a community again instead of individual homesteads. The mines aren't producing any more. Timber is plentiful and access is easy. We need those jobs!
A collectible with details on run ins between the Forest Talkers and Pleasant Valley residents.

Parnell was out checking road conditions for his next delivery, and saw some of those tree speaker maniacs lurking near the highway passes in and out of the Valley. He wasn't sure what they were doing, but we need to stay vigilant!
A collectible with details on run ins between the Forest Talkers and Pleasant Valley residents.

It all happened during a storm, so we'll never know exactly what the hell went on out there. All we do know is we're cut off from the highway now. Tonnes and tonnes of rock stand between us and the rest of Great Bear. An earthquake? Maybe.

Notes: This note is left if you gave the FT all the supplies you found.
This note is left if you took the ammo before dropping off the FT supplies.

English: A note left for you by the Forest Talker in the Lake Cabin
Nynorsk: Ein beskjed til deg frå skogprataren i hytta ved innsjøen.

English: "While I appreciate what you've done to help me, stealing ammo may be my death sentence out here. I have a long way to go and with hungry wolves and angry people out there, I have no idea how far I'll get. I hope you can sleep at night. Remember: As You Sow, So Shall You Reap."
Nynorsk: Sjølv om eg sett pris på alt du har gjort for å hjelpa meg, so kan du ha dømt meg til døydden ved å stela skota mine. Eg har langt å gå, og med svoltne ulvar og sinte mennesker der ute anar eg ikkje kor langt eg vil koma. Eg håpar du får sove om natta. Som man sår, høster man. Husk det.

English: A note left for you by the Forest Talker in the Lake Cabin
Nynorsk: Ein beskjed til deg frå skogprataren i hytta ved innsjøen.

English: Thank you for helping me, not everyone would have done that. I left this item for you, it belonged to my friend, hopefully you'll be able to make use of it? Maybe our paths will cross again.
Nynorsk: Takk for at du hjelpte meg – ikkje alle ville ha gjort det. Eg har lagt igjen noko til deg, Noko som tilhøyrte ein ven. Eg håpar du får nytta av det. Kanskje me møtast igjen.

English: A Logging Camp trailer key given to you by a Forest Talker.
Nynorsk: Ein nykel til ei brakke i tømmerleiren, gjeve til deg av ein skogpratar.

English: A few old pages with instructions on how to Craft a few items using the Forge.
Nynorsk: Nokon gamle ark med instruksjoner om korleis du lagar forskjellige ting ein avl.

Notes: A heading for the temperature required before the forge can be used to craft items
displayed as title on Forging UI

English: An endless night has arrived on Great Bear Island. Use your wits, and whatever you can find, to survive.
Adjusts the game camera field of view. Wider field of view shows more of the scene. Reducing field of view (smaller number) may help players susceptible to motion sickness.
Nynorsk: Endrar på synsfeltet til spelkameraet. Vidare synsfelt gjer at ein ser meir, men smalare kan hjelpa personar som lett vert "sjøsjuke".

English: Sets maximum frame rate. Targeting a lower frame rate will increase display quality. Targeting a higher frame rate will increase performance, but may decrease display quality.

Notes: Label for xp episode mode: Green

English: You have sustained Frostbite. Your general Condition is permanently reduced.
Nynorsk: Du har fått kaldbrann i deg. Din generelle helsa er permanent redusert.

English: Your skin is directly exposed to the cold. If it remains exposed for long enough, you'll get Frostbite.
Nynorsk: Huden din er blottlagt for kulda. Viss du ikkje gjer noko med det vil du få kaldbrann i deg.
Du risikerer ikkje lenger å få kaldbrann

English: Cover up the afflicted area or find someplace warm before Frostbite develops
Nynorsk: Dekk til dei utsette områda eller finn ein varm plass før du får kaldbrann i deg.

English: A porridge fortified with fruits and syrup. A pilot's favourite after a long flight.
Nynorsk: Graut med frukt og sirup. Ein favoritt av pilotar etter ein lang flytur.

English: Content to be unlocked in the future.
Notes: description in Episode Selection UI when selecting a locked Future Episode (ie 3,4,5)

English: More regions are on their way.
Nynorsk: Det kjem fleire regionar etter kvart.

English: Attempt to Save game FAILED. Check that sufficient storage is available.
Notes: error text for when the game cannot be saved due to lack of hard drive space.
Nynorsk: Kunne ikkje lagra spelet. Pass på at du har nok lagringsplass.

English: Heavy duty neve coverings that extend part way up the arm. Leather outers and wool liners. Warm and tough, just like you want to be.
Nynorsk: Solide, lange hanskar som dekkjer underarmen. Lær utanpå, ull inni. Varme og slitesterke, akkurat som du ynskjer å vera.

English: Search for radio parts and medicine
Corrupted Save Data detected - Player Data
Pearls that once belonged to the Grey Mother's daughter Lily
Nynorsk: Perler som ein gong høyrte til dattera til Gråmor, Lily.

English: A box containing the Grey Mother's stolen item.
Nynorsk: Ein boks som inneheld Gråmor sin stole ting.

English: Sweet carbonated drink. Full of high-fructose corn syrup.
Nynorsk: Søt, kullsyreholdig drykk. Full av maissirup med mykje fruktsukker.

English: I found the water, like I promised. Where the rivers meet the sea. A bitter and empty place. You were right.
We were all so cold. More than we could take. No escape from it. Please forgive me.
I left you behind. My guts freezing, my feet on fire. Each step a hundred years. It was too far, too far.
Why couldn't you hold out? Why couldn't I let go? Are you at rest? Is there sky above you where you are?
The world falling away. Did you know already, somehow? Before you left us? The lights, they just go on.
A package of fragrant tea. The label promises restorative benefits and more peaceful rest.
Nynorsk: Ein pakke velluktande te. Etiketten lovar lækjande eigenskapar og rolegare kvile.

English: Especially rugged boots given to you by the Grey Mother, for earing her Trust.
Nynorsk: Ekstra slitesterke støvlar Gråmor gav deg med ein klapp på skuldra og eit "Lukke til".

English: An elderly blind woman, and possibly the last remaining survivor in Milton. She seems to know something about where Astrid might have gone.
Nynorsk: Ei eldre, blind kvinne som muligens er den siste overlevande i Milton. Det verkar som ho veit noko om kvar Astrid kan ha fare.

English: Key to open the trunk in Lily's room at Grey Mother's house
Nynorsk: Nykel til kisten oppe på Lily sitt rom i huset til Gråmor.

English: Grey Mother now trusts you less.
Nynorsk: No stolar Gråmor mindre på deg.

English: Grey Mother now trusts you more.
Nynorsk: No stolar Gråmor meir på deg.

English: density of grass and other detail vegetation.
Nynorsk: Tettleik til gras og annan vegetasjon.

English: Shorter distance means you may see grass and other terrain details popping in as you move.
Nynorsk: Kortare avstand betyr at du kan sjå gress og anna terreng dukke opp medan du beveger deg.

English: The gun is not currently loaded.
Explosive powder. A valuable ingredient when Crafting Ammunition. Also handy as a fire accelerant.

Nynorsk: Nyleg teke tarmar frå eit dyr

English: Gut that has been cured. Can be used for crafting and repair.
Nynorsk: Turka tarm. Kan nyttast til å vøla og laga ting.

English: Heavy-duty saw made to cut through metal.
Nynorsk: Handsag med utskifteleg sagblad, tiltenkt saging av metall.

Notes: 2n line displayed when hovering an empty Hanging Tree during the Bear Hunt

Nynorsk: Det krev ein kode for opna opp bunkeren, heldigvis har du fått tak i han: 45 – 18 – 32

English: Some hand-written pages from Hank's Journal.
Nynorsk: Nokon handskrevne sider frå Hank si dagbok.

English:
I've spent a lot of years in this damn lookout tower, watching the forest around Mystery Lake, and it's given me nothing but time to think about my life and the world around me and what I hear is happening. Sitting in a tower like this for days, weeks, months on end is enough to drive anyone crazy. Even if I didn't have anyone to talk to on the radio -- and just let me say I wish that chatty lady would shut up once in a while. I mean, I came out here to be alone, to be away from other people. It's almost enough to make you wish all the radios, all the satellite phones and internet and stuff...would just...disappear. 
 
 Anyway, I've been putting aside some supplies every season, leftovers or whatever I can spare, and it's added up to quite the little stash of food and equipment. Hopefully I never need it. But if I do -- the ends justify the means, right? I don't think anyone needs that weird old bunker thing I found, and it makes the perfect place to hide out if the SHTF, you know what I mean?
Nynorsk:
Eg har vert mange år her oppe og overvakt skogen rundt Løyndomsvatnet i dette forbaska utkikkstårnet, og det har ikkje gitt meg anna enn tid til å tenkja over livet mitt og verda rundt meg, og på kva eg høyrer om det som skjer. Å sitte i eit tårn som dette dag ut og dag inn, veker og månar i strekk kan gjera einkver person gal. Sjølv om eg ikkje hadde hatt nokon å snakka med på radioen … Og la meg berre sei at eg skulle ynskja den skravlesjuke dama ville halde kjeft innimellom. Fordi eg kom her for å vera alene, på god avstand frå andre mennesker. Det er nesten nok til å ynskja at alle radioar, alle satellittelefonar, internett og den slags … berre ville verta vekke. 
 
Uansett, eg har heile tida lagt til side litt forsyningar, det vera ting som har vorte til overs, eller som eg ikkje har hatt bruk for, og dette utgjer no eit fint lite oppbevaring av mat og utstyr. Eg håpar eg aldri får bruk for det. Men om eg skulle, so helliger målet middelet, ikkje sant? Eg trur ikkje nokon treng den rare gamle bunkaren eg fant, og det er ein perfekt plass å skyla seg når ting går til helvete. Skjønner du kva eg meniar?

English: More rambling notes from Hank, written in his signature chicken-scratch.
Nynorsk: Fleire desperate notat frå Hank, skriven med hans sedvanlege kråkeføtter.

English: Things have not turned out the way I hoped. I guess that's why they say "hope is not a plan". I was on my way to drop some supplies off in the bunker, but wolves hunted me the whole way here and I couldn't escape them. One managed to take a chunk out of my leg just before I could get in here and slam the hatch door. It feels like it's on fire -- I think it's infected. And now I hear something like scratching on the hatch door. I'm afraid to open up. Angela -- I pray to god it isn't you or your mother. But it can't be -- it's just too soon. I'm just going to hald out down here for a bit, and will check when it's daylight again. Just have to find a way to keep track of the time down here...
Nynorsk: Ting har ikkje gått som eg håpa. Det er vel derfor dei seier at «håp ikkje er ein plan». Eg var på veg til bunkeren med nokon forsyningar, men ulvane var etter meg heile vegen, og eg slapp ikkje vekk. Den eine klarte å ta ein bete av beinet mitt nett før eg kom meg inn her og fekk smekka igjen luka. Det kjennast ut som beinet brenn, og eg trur det har gått infeksjon i såret. Og no høyrer eg noko som skrapar på luka. Eg tør ikkje opna han, Angela, og eg ber til gud om at det ikkje er deg eller mor di. Men det kan det jo ikkje vera, det er for tidlig. Eg skal halde fortet her nede ei stund, so skal eg sjekke igjen når det vert ljost ute. Eg må berre finna ein måte å halde oversikt over tida på her nede…
Ein nykel til Hank sitt metallskrin.
Eit brev til niesa til Hank.

English:
dear Angela,
 
 You know I always told you that a time might come where you'd need to hide out for a while? 
 
 I figured it might be because of the quake, but I didn't really think about how bad things might get on Great Bear later on. It doesn't matter what the reason is -- if you ever need to hide out for a while, if things get too bad for you in the city or when you're visiting your mom here on the island, use this info to get into the supply cache I've set up. I know, I know. Your mom told you Uncle Hank was a crazy old coot and to stay away from me. Too much research on the internet, right? All those "crazy prepper sites". Well, I won't say it to you but I'll say it to her next time I see her: "told you so".
 
 Your loving uncle,
 
 Hank
Nynorsk:
Kjære Angela
 
Huskar du eg sa at det kunne koma ei tid då du måtte gå i skjul i ein stund? 
 
Eg antok at det ville verta på grunn av jordskjelvet, men eg ante ikkje kor gale det ville verta på Sværebjørn i etterkant. Det spelar ingen rolle kva årsaka er, men viss du nokon gong har behov for å skjula deg i ein periode, viss ting går dårleg for deg i byen, eller på besøk hos din mor her på øya, so kan du nytte denne informasjonen til å få tilgang til forsyningsoppbevaringa eg har gjort klart. Eg veit, eg veit. Mor di sa at onkel Hank er ein gamal tulling som du må halde deg langt vekke frå. Som har gravd litt for mykje på internett, ikkje sant? Lest alle slags «klin kokos preppersider». No ja, eg skal ikkje sei det til deg, men ho skal få høyra det neste gong eg møtar ho: «Kva sa eg?»
 
Eg er glad i deg.
 
Hilsen onkel Hank.

English: A protective case. It looks like it could survive just about anything.

Nynorsk: Fullfør Jaga, del 1 for å låse opp denne utfordringa.

Nynorsk: Kroppstemperaturen din var for låg for lenge. Du vil vera fysisk svakare til du har haldt deg i plussgradar i {time-val} timer.

English: Your body temperature is very low. If it remains low, you'll get Hypothermia.
Nynorsk: Kroppstemperaturen din er særs låg. Viss han fortsett å vera låg, får du hypotermi.

English: Find someplace warm before Hypothermia develops
Nynorsk: Finn ein varmt plass før du utviklar hypotermi

Nynorsk: Treng ein varm plass å kvila.

English: You don't really know what you're doing yet. You know which end of the line the hook goes on.
Nynorsk: Du veit fortsatt ikkje heilt kva du driv med. Du veit kva ende av lina du skal festa kroken, men ikkje mykje mer.

English: You're getting more comfortable with fishing in the Winter. You're better with your fishing gear, and you're developing a feel for when a fish is on the line.
Nynorsk: Du begynnar å verta vant til å fiska om vinteren. Du er flinkare med fiskeutstyret, og du har begynt å forstå når du har fisk på kroken.

English: You're quite good at ice fishing. You rarely break your lines now, and you catch more fish per hour.
Nynorsk: Du er ikkje so verst til å fiska på isen. Lina ryk nesten aldri, og du får fleire fiskar.

English: You are fantastic at ice fishing. You seem to catch fish more often, more quickly, and somehow you get the bigger ones too!
Nynorsk: Du er særs dyktig til å fiska på isen. Du får fisk oftare og raskare, og av ein eller annen grunn er fiskane større òg!

English: You are the Pied Piper of ice fishers. You barely have to clear the ice hole for fish to nearly jump out of the water. You catch bigger fish, more often, and in less time.
Nynorsk: Du er kongen over isfiskarane. Fisken kjem omtrent sprettande ut av vatnet når holet vert laga. Du får fisk oftare og raskare, og når du før dei er dei større. Njord er dessutan vorte ein god ven.

English: Ice Fishing Hole Requires Suitable Ice

English: You have an infection that could kill you if left untreated.
Nynorsk: Du har ein infeksjon som kan ta livet av deg om den ikkje vert behandla.

English: You sustained a wound that could result in infection if left untreated.
Nynorsk: Du har pådrege deg eit sår som kan føra til infeksjon viss det ikkje vert behandla.

English: A discarded note with details on infirmary medical supplies.

Dr. Childs,

We got a call from the main gate about some kind of accident down the hill. I turned over our emergency kit to one of the officers who was going to take a truck down and check it out. What with all the wolf activity lately.

The thing is, that kit has just about the last of our morphine and our “good” antibiotics.

Please make sure to check inventory and put a restock order in as soon as you can.

Thanks,

Bud

Eg var på veg til bunkeren med nokon forsyningar, men ulvane var etter meg heile vegen, og eg slapp ikkje vekk. Nynorsk: Isolerte bukser med vindtett nylon ytterst. Laga for dei som ynskjer å vera ein dag i snøen uten å verta alt for våt!

Nynorsk: Syntetisk ytterklede som varmar overkroppen, men ikkje armene.

Wait until tomorrow to take another dose.
Nynorsk: Vent til i morgon før du tek ein ny dose.

English: You ate infected game meat and now have Intestinal Parasites. Recovery requires multiple daily treatments! You will continue to weaken until treatment has run its full course. [Maximum 1 dose/day.]
Nynorsk: Du åt infisert vilt og har no tarmparasittar. Helsa din vert gradvis dårlegare til behandlinga er fullført. For å koma deg må du gå på ein dagleg antibiotikakur. [Maksimalt 1 dose per dag.]

English: Game meat from carnivorous animals may be infected with parasites.
Nynorsk: Kjøt frå rovdyr kan vera infisert av parasittar.

English: Risk of Intestinal Parasites has passed
Nynorsk: Du risikerar ikkje lenger å få tarmparasittar

Nynorsk: Ikkje et meir kjøt frå rovdyr.

English: It's too windy to start a fire there
Nynorsk: Det er for mykje vind til å laga eld

English: An old office memo, missing pieces and water-stained.

[heading on the letter is smudged and unreadable]

We are pleased to inform you that your paper, “Black Hole Collisions and a New Architecture for Dark Energy Cosmology” has been accepted for evaluation and potential publication in Canadian Physics Review.

As the publication process moves forward, we will be in touch with you should any issues arise.

Warm regards,

B. Tonkov
Editor-in-Chief

Nynorsk: Ein tøff gamal pelsjeger og einebuar. Han bur ålene i villmarka til Løyndomsvatnet. Han latar ikkje til å vera so glad i folk.
