Out in the wilderness, clothing is like armour against the elements. Wear layers to stay warm. And remember, wind is your enemy! Clothing offers different protection from cold and windchill. Your clothes can get wet from blowing snow or if you fall into water, which makes them ineffective and increases your risk of hypothermia or even frostbite. Keep your clothes as dry as you can! Finally, clothing can protect you from physical injuries as from falling or tangling with wildlife. Balance all these factors against the weight and mobility cost of your combined clothing.
Nynorsk: Ute i naturen fungerar kleda som eit panser mot vêr og vind. Ta på deg fleire lag for å halde varmen. Og husk at vinden er ein fiende! Ulike kledeplagg gjev deg ulik vern mot kulde og vind. Kleda dine vert våte om det snør eller om du dett ned i vatn. Dette gjer dei ineffektive og auker faren for hypotermi eller frostskadar. Hald kleda dine so turre som mogleg. Klede kan òg beskytte deg mot fysiske skadar, viss du dett eller om eit dyr kjem til åtak. Du må vurdera alle desse faktorane opp mot vekta av kleda du har på, sidan fleire og tunge klesplagg gjer deg mindre mobil.

English: Clothing protects you against the weather, as well as predators.

Nynorsk: Klede er din rustning mot kulda.

English:
Use the radial menu to select "Status", then go to the clothing tab to view clothing items you have equipped, see their staus and equip new clothing items.

Tip: clothing does not auto-equip so don’t forget to put additional items on!
Use the Radial Menu to select "Status", then go to the clothing tab to view and equip Clothing items.
Search all the containers you find, as you never know when one might hald life-saving supplies! You can also store things in Containers, to be retrieved later.
Nynorsk: Leit gjennom alle behaldarar du kjem over, sidan du ikkje kan veta kva av dei som inneheld livsviktige forsyningar. Du kan òg oppbevara ting i behaldarar, og henta dei seinare.

English: Search containers in the world for extra supplies.
Preparation and self-control are vital to your survival. Check your Controls menu if you're unsure of how to do something. This could save your life.
Nynorsk: Forbreding og disiplin er viktig for å overleva. Sjå i «Knappeval» dersom du er usikker på korleis du gjer noko. Dette kan redda livet ditt.

English: Check the Controls menu for more details on how to do something.

A frozen corpse brings Great Bear Island’s harsh reality front and centre. 
 Leave them in peace, or search search the body for supplies to help you avoid their fate.
Search frozen corpses for life-saving supplies.

Blood loss will kill you unless you stop it. A simple cloth Bandage might save your life. Use the Crafting Menu to make a Bandage from Cloth, which you can find in the world. Or Harvest it from existing Clothing items.
Nynorsk: Blodtap tek livet av deg viss du ikkje stoppar blødinga. Ein enkel stoffbandasje kan redda livet ditt. Nytt lagemenyen til å lage ein bandasje av stoff. Du kan òg nytta stoff frå eit av kledeplagga dine.

English: Find Bandages or Craft them from Cloth to treat Blood Loss.
Craft Them to Stop the Bleeding!
Nynorsk: Lag bandasjar for å stoppa blødinga!

English: Occasionally you'll encounter an obstacle in your path. Crouching might help to get under it. Crouching also makes you less obvious to wildlife, from a distance. You move more slowly, but also more silently, so you might get closer.
Nynorsk: No og då vil du støyte på ein hindring på din veg. Då kan du prøva å gå ned på huk for å koma forbi. Går du ned på huk gjer det òg vanskelegar for dyra å oppdaga deg på avstand. Du beveger deg seinare, men òg stillare, sånn at du kan koma deg tettere på.

English: Crouching makes you less obvious to wildlife, and lets you move under certain obstacles.

Occasionally you'll encounter an obstacle in your path. Crouching (using {Crouch}) might help to get under it. Crouching also makes you less obvious to wildlife, from a distance. You move more slowly, but also more silently, so you might get closer.
Crouching ({Crouch}) lets you move under low obstacles.

Pay attention to your surroundings and you might glean information that's important for your survival. For example, a murder of Crows circling up ahead might suggest an animal carcass -- or even a human corpse -- might be nearby!
Nynorsk: Flyg med på omgjevnadane so kan du få med deg informasjon som kan hjelpa deg å overleva. Ein flokk kråker som sirklar i lufta, kan bety at det er levningar etter eit dyr – eller kanskje eit menneske – i nærleiken.

English: Circling Crows suggest a carcass or corpse is nearby.
Your Ears Are Your Best Survival Tool
Nynorsk: Øyrene dine kan redda livet ditt.

English: Place a Banish Glyph inside the circle
You can start conversations with characters you meet in the world. Choose topics that interest you to learn more.
Talk to characters you meet to learn more about Great Bear Island.
Keep away from electrical hazards, especially when near water!
Keep away from electrical hazards. Nearby water can become electrified too.
When over-encumbered movement speed is slower than normal and sprinting is out of the question. Go into the inventory to drop some of that excess weight
When over-encumbered movement speed is slower than normal.
Notes: A tutorial for when you character is carrying too much gear in their inventory.
A tutorial for when you character is carrying too much gear in their inventory.

English:
Make sure you have completed all other missions and tasks before returning to the Prison.

This is the point of no return.
Complete all tasks before returning to the Prison

Use the Campfire option in the Radial Menu. You'll need all the fixings: a Firestarter, Tinder, and Fuel. Accelerant speeds up the process. Fuel types impact burn time and heat production. An active fire can be used to Cook and Boil Water, as well as keeping you from freezing to death.
Nynorsk: Vel leibål frå sirkelmenyen. Du treng fyrtøy, knusk og brensel. Tennvæske gjer det raskare å laga eld. Elden sin levetid og varmeproduksjon er avhengig av kva du nyttar til å fyre med. Eld kan nyttast til å laga mat og koke vatn, og den hindrar dessutan at du frys i hel.

English: Use Fires to Melt snow, Cook food, and keep from freezing to death.
Fire Provides Heat, Water, Food, Protection
Nynorsk: Eld gjev varme, vatn, mat og vern.

English: There are many ways to die in the wilderness. Medical treatments -- man-made or harvestad from the natural world -- will save your life. Use the Status screen to check on your health. Apply a Treatment using the First Aid Radial menu. You can also use Treatments from your Pack menu.
Nynorsk: Vel leibål frå sirkelmenyen. Du treng fyrtøy, knusk og brensel. Tennvæske gjer det raskare å laga eld. Elden sin levetid og varmeproduksjon er avhengig av kva du nyttar til å fyre med. Eld kan nyttast til å laga mat og koke vatn, og den hindrar dessutan at du frys i hel.

English: Apply First Aid treatments through the Radial Menu.
Study Your Treatments and Learn to Triage
Nynorsk: Studer behandlingsmetodar og lær deg å prioritera skadar.

English: As you explore the world, you may discover that some electrical tools that have been inert since the First Flare, like Flashlights, are brought to life by the strange aurora lights in the night sky. The Flashlight can help you find your way in the darkness. It may also have unexpected effects on wildlife.
Nynorsk: Etter kvert som du utforskar speluniverset, vil du oppdaga at noko elektriske reiskap som har vert unyttande sidan det fyrste ljosken, vekkast til liv av mystiske nordljos på nattehimmelen. Lommelykta hjelp deg å finna veg i mørkeret. Den kan òg ha uventa innvirkning på dyrelivet.

English: Flashlights come to life during an aurora.

Use the forge to melt down scrap metal and craft various items. Forges need to be very hot before you can use them!
Tip: different fuels burn at varying temperatures, coal burns the hottest.
Use a Forge to Craft improvised tools and weapons.

Current Afflictions can be viewed by pressing {OpenRadial} and clicking on the status icon in the centre of the Radial Menu.

Click on each Affliction to discover the treatment requirements.
Click the Status icon in the Radial Menu to check your current Afflictions and how to treat them.

To light a fire you need Fuel, Tinder and Matches.

Tip: Your chances of lighting a fire depend on the type of Fuel and Tinder you use, among other factors.
Use Fuel, Tinder, and Matches to light a fire.
Use the Radial Menu to select "Campcraft," then choose a Cooking Pot to place on a lit stove.
Place Cooking Pots directly from the Radial Menu under Campcraft.

Interact with the placed Cooking Pot to choose what Cooking actions you want to perform (including Melting snow and Boiling water).

Tip: With a Cooking Pot you can Melt snow or Boil water at any fire.
Select a Pot or Can at a fire to Melt Snow and Boil Water.
You can select an item you are Cooking to use the "Pass Time Until Ready" option to shorten the waiting time.
You can Pass Time Until Ready to shorten Cooking wait times.
While Cooking, you are free to spend your time doing other things. But be careful not to burn your food or overboil your water!
You can spend your time elsewhere when Cooking, but don't burn your food or overboil your Water.

Use the Radial Menu to select "Campcraft" then choose a Cooking Pot to place on a lit stove or fire.

Interact with the placed Cooking Pot to choose what Cooking actions you want to perform (including Melting snow and Boiling water)
Place Pots or Cans directly onto fires from the Radial Menu under Campcraft.

Treat Afflictions by selecting First Aid through the Radial Menu.

Tip: Take care to apply items to the relevant Affliction to avoid wasting resources.
Treat Afflictions by selecting First Aid through the Radial Menu.

Use the Radial Menu to quickly eat Food items by pressing {OpenRadial}.
Or use use the Backpack screen to see all your Food items and eat from there.

Tip: From your Backpack, you can assign your favourite Food to the radial menu for quick access.
Eat quickly by selecting items under Food in the Radial Menu.

Don’t forget to check on items you have left Cooking on a fire or stove!

Overcooking food or drinks risks ruining them and damaging your Cooking Pot.
Overcooking food and drinks will ruin them, and damage your Cooking Pot.

As you learn things about the world -- either through your own actions, or through interacting with people -- you unlock Knowledge about People, Places, Things, and Actions. deeper Knowledge can be revealed when you gain the Trust of other survivors you meet. This Knowledge is tracked in your Journal, for future reference.
Nynorsk: Etter kvert som du lærar meir om speluniverset, enten gjennom egne handlingar eller møte med folk, so låser du opp røynsle om folk, stadar, ting og handlingar. Meir inngåande røynsle kan avdukes når du oppnår tilliten til andre overlevande du møte. I dagboka di finn du ein oversikt over denne røynsla.

English: Check your Journal for Knowledge about People, Places, Things, and Actions.
What You Know Can Save You

Make sure you have completed all other missions and tasks before exploring the mine.
This is the point of no return.
Be sure to complete all other missions and tasks before exploring the mine.

You may need to improvise Light Sources to see in the dark. You can Craft Torches out of available materials. Flares provide a one-off light source. Lanterns last longer, but use up Oil. Darkness hides dangers, and also prevents you from Crafting, Repairing your gear, and other actions.
Nynorsk: Det kan vera at du må laga improviserte ljoskjelder for å sjå i mørkeret. Du kan nytta tilgjengelege materialar til å laga faklar. Faklar gjev deg ein eingongskjelde til ljos. Oljelampar varer lenger, men brukar opp olje. Mørkeret gjer det vanskeleg å sjå farar, og du kan heller ikkje laga og vøla utstyr osv.

English: Use Flares, Lanterns, and Torches to hold back the dark.
Each Light Source has Pros and Cons
Nynorsk: Kvar ljoskjelde har både fordelar og ulemper.

English: Some locked containers or doors can be opened using a Prybar.

When your Condition gets too low, you'll start to become dizzy, your vision will blur, and eventually you'll lose fine motor controls. This is all a warning that you improve your situation ASAP. Every hour of Rest will restore lost Condition, and you'll also gain a bit of Condition for every hour you don't have an affliction risk or low status in Hunger, Thirst, Cold, or Fatigue. Your Status screen can help you keep track of your Condition, any current Afflictions, as well as help you understand how to treat injuries you may have sustained. Check it often.
Nynorsk: Du har ein helsemålar, og når verdien vert for låg, vil du kjenna deg svimmel, og etter kvert minka dei motoriske evnene dine. Dette er ein advarsel om at du må gjera noko SNARAST. Kver einaste time med kvile forbedrar kondisjonen din, og verdien stig òg for kvar time du ikkje har lidigar eller dårlege verdiar for svolt, tyrst, kulde eller trøyttleik. På statusskjermen finne du ein oversikt over kondisjonen din og eventuelle lidingar, og du får òg hjelp til å forstå korleis du kan behandla skader du har pådratt deg. Sjekk denne ofte.

English:
Raw meat can be cooked on any cooking surface, either use a large cooking pot or place directly on the cooking surface.

Use radial menu to select "food" and place the meat from there.
Cook Raw Meat directly on any cooking surface, or by using a Pot.

Any time you have a fire, you can melt snow to produce water. But melting it alone isn't sufficient to ensure it's potable. If you have the fuel to do so, it's better to Boil it after to make sure any bacteria, parasites, or impurities are removed. Water treatment pills let you purify non-potable water without using up valuable fuel resources.
Nynorsk: Når du har eld, kan du smelte snø for å få vatn. Men det er ikkje nok å smelte snøen for å gjera han drikkande. Viss du har nok brennefang, er det betre å koke vatnet etterpå for å ta livet av bakteriar, parasittar og andre ureinheitar. Med vassreinsetablettar kan du reinse ukokt vatn om du har lite brennefang.

English: Melt Snow at a Fire with a Can or Pot.

View your Journal and current Mission objectives through the Radial Menu. 

To show the Radial Menu, press and hold {OpenRadial}.
View current Mission Objectives by opening the Radial Menu, or in your Journal for more details.
Noisemakers can be used to effectively scare off wildlife. Use with care to avoid injury!
Noisemakers are highly effective at scaring wildlife
Old Man's Beard Lichen has long been appreciated for its anti-bacterial properties. First, prepare it to be used for treatment. Then, apply it to injuries to reduce Infection Risk.
Nynorsk: Strylav har lenge vert verdsatt for sine antibakterielle eigenskapar. Fyrst må det klargjerast for bruk til behandling. Deretter legg du det på skadar for å redusera faren for infeksjon.

English: Use Old Man's Beard dressings on wounds to reduce Infection Risk.

When starving, you may feel desperate enough to take your chances, but in general eating raw meat is a bad idea. Cook it over a fire to avoid getting Food Poisoning, or Parasites. Cooked meat also lasts longer, and attracts fewer predators.
Nynorsk: Når ein er svolten, vert ein fort so desperat at ein tek uturvande sjansar, men generelt sett er det ikkje lurt å eta rått kjøt. Steik kjøtet over eld for å unngå matforgiftning eller parasittar. Steikt kjøt har òg lengre haldbarheit og tiltrekk seg færre rovdyr.

English: Cook Raw Meat before eating to avoid dangerous Afflictions.
Everything You Eat, Can Kill You
Nynorsk: Alt du et, kan ta livet av deg.

English:
Revolvers are powerful defensive weapons, and not efficient to use while Hunting. 
You can fire quickly from the hip or aim down sights to take a more accurate shot. Revolvers can also be used during Wolf struggles, where you'll have a chance to fire off a shot to wound or kill the predator.
Keep your Revolver clean for best results.
Revolvers are great for scaring away Wolves, but weak Hunting weapons.

Rifle condition affects its reliability. Use a Rifle Cleaning Kit to keep it in good-working order. Take care of your rifle, and it'll take care of you. You wouldn't want it to jam when you need it most.
Nynorsk: Børsa si stand påverkar pålitelegheita. Nytt pusseutstyr til å halde børsa i god stand. Ta vare på børsa di, so vil ho ta vare på deg. Du vil ikkje at ho skal låsa seg akkurat når du treng det mest.

English: Clean your Rifle, or it will be more likely to jam.

Sometimes Mother Nature is your pharmacist. Craft Rose-hips into a preparation that can be boiled in water to produce a tea with pain-relieving properties. Keep your eyes open for other natural remedies.
Nynorsk: Av og til trår naturen til som farmasøyt. Klargjer og kok nyper i vatn for å laga te. Nypete er smertestillande frå naturen. Hald utkikk etter andre naturlege medisinar.

English: Pick Rose Hips and craft them into a painkilling tea.

Look at the map to view the areas where the lost survivors might be. Once inside a search zone you can also signal to a survivor using a Distress Pistol, and look for their reply to help pinpoint their exact location.
Use your map to locate areas where the Survivors might be.
Use the journal to track side mission progress.
Check the journal for incomplete side missions

You can use your energy chasing Rabbits and trying to stun them with stones, or you can use a more long-term strategy: Snares. Look for areas of high Rabbit activity, and place a Snare nearby. Check on it daily. You may get lucky and catch a Rabbit. You can set up multiple snares to increase your chances. A well maintained Trapline can be an excellent long-term source of food. Just remember, it may attract other wildlife!
Nynorsk: Du kan bruke kreftane dine på å jakte kaninar og svimeslå dei med steinar, eller so kan du utnytta ein meir langsiktig strategi: snarer. Sjå etter plassar der det er kaninar, og sett ut ei snare. Ta deg ein tur og sjå om du har fått noko kvar dag. Viss du er heldig, har du fanga ein kanin. Du kan setta opp fleire snarer for å auke sjansene dine. Godt vedlikehaldte snarer kan gje deg ei god matkjelde. Men husk at snarene kan tiltrekkja seg andre dyr òg!

English: Place Snares where Rabbits are active to catch them.

Å traska gjennom snøen med ein tung ransel kan vera tungt nok, men nokon gongar er du berre naudt til å springe. Spring for å flykta frå ville dyr, unngå tynn is eller koma deg raskere i ly. Husk at du forbrenn flere kaloriar når du spring enn når du går, og at trottuge er avheng av kleda du går i. det tar ein stund å komme til hektene etter ein spurt, so ikkje overdriv!
Nynorsk: Å traska gjennom snøen med ein tung ransel kan vera tungt nok, men nokon gongar er du berre naudt til å springe. Spring for å flykta frå ville dyr, unngå tynn is eller koma deg raskere i ly. Husk at du forbrenn fleire kaloriar når du spring enn når du går, og at trottuge avheng av kleda du går med. Det tek ei stund å koma til hektene etter å ha sprunge, so ikkje overdriv!

English: Sprinting can help you escape bad weather or dangerous predators.

When you bring up the Quick Stats or the Radial Menu, you'll get a preview of your current Condition, as well as information about how Cold, Tired, Hungry, and Thirsty you are. Any time one of these status indicators is empty and red, this means you're losing Condition. Lose all your Condition, and you'll die.
Nynorsk: Når du opnar statistikken eller sirkelmenyen, får du sjå di noverande helse, og dessutan informasjon om kor kald, sliten, svolten og tyrst du er. Viss ein av målarane er tom og rød, betyr det at kondisjonen din forverrast. Når kondisjonen din når null, døyr du.

English: Your Quick Stats give you vital information on your current Condition.
Status is Your Early Warning System

Look at the pressure gauges to see the steam pressure for each pipe.


Without enough pressure, the steam won't be flowing through the pipes to thaw them.
Look at the pressure gauges to see the steam pressure for each pipe.
You can pick up small Stones and use them to stun Rabbits. Equip them, and throw them to hit a Rabbit, then grab it while it's stunned. If you can kill it, you can eat it.
Nynorsk: Du kan plukka opp steinar og nytte dei til å svimeslå kaninar. Hiv steinane mot kanina og ta dyret medan det er svimeslått. Viss du kan drepe han, kan du ete han.

English: Find and equip small Stones to throw at Rabbits to stun them.
Aim True and You Won't Go Hungry
Nynorsk: Sikt godt, so går du ikkje svolten.

English:
While Carrying Survivors on your back, your mobility will be limited. The Survivors will depend on you to keep them alive -- that means warm, hydrated, and away from predators.
You can also Treat their injuries en route by Placing them on the ground and Diagnosing them. Once you've started Carrying a Survivor to safety, you won't be able to go indoors without them, or try and rescue more than one Survivor at a time.
When carrying survivors, keep them warm, hydrated, and away from danger.
To search for Survivors, fire a Distress Pistol shot once inside a search zone (indicated on your map). Look for the response.
Fire a Distres Pistol in a search zone and look for a response.

Timberwolf packs have Morale, indicated by the meter. Timberwolf Morale can be broken by shooting or throwing things at them.
Packs with broken Morale will flee, but may return once they recover.
Notes: Morale = the mental and emotional condition, in this case of a pack of Timberwolves.

English:
Timberwolves are relentless hunters. You must break their resolve by reducing Pack Morale. You can also try and take refuge indoors, if you have no other way to defend yourself.
Timberwolves can be scared off using a variety of actions -- flares, gunfire, torches, even stones. Break their morale and the Pack will retreat...for a while.
Watch out for Timberwolves, they hunt in packs.
Pockets of suffocating gasses can accumulate in deep mines. Avoid remaining in those areas too long.
Pockets of suffocating gasses can accumulate in deep mines

Many people you meet will be suspicious of you. But most of them have needs they may not be able to fulfill without your help. Helping them will earn you Trust, which will in turn unlock useful Knowledge, Locations, Items, and more. Check the character's Trust entry in your Journal to learn more about them, their needs, and how they can help you.
Nynorsk: Mange av dei du møtar, vil vera mistenksomme. Men dei fleste har behov som dei kanskje ikkje klarer å få oppfylt utan hjelpa di. Viss du hjelper dei, får du tillitspoeng, som deretter låsar opp nyttig kunnskap, stadar, ting og meir. Sjekk folka sine tillitsoppslag i dagboka di for å lære meir om dei, behova deira og korleis dei kan hjelpa deg.

English: A Hard Thing to Come By These Days
Nynorsk: Ikkje so lett å finna no om dagen.

English: Cars can serve as shelters, protecting you from deadly wind and wildlife. You might even find supplies left inside the glove comparments or trunks.
Nynorsk: Køyretøy kan gje deg ly, og verna deg mot vind og farlege dyr. Det kan til og med vera du finn forsyningar i hanskerommet eller bagasjerommet.

English: Use vehicles as shelter from weather and wildlife.

When your clothese get Wet, they don't protect you from Wind or Cold as well, and can lead to Hypothermia or worse. Keep an eye on your Clothes Screen to monitor how wet your Clothing is. Try to use dry interiors and fires as an opportunity to dry your wet clothing.
Nynorsk: Når kleda dine vert våte, beskyttar de ikkje like godt mot vind og kulde. Då er du meir utsatt for hypotermi og det som verre er. Flyg med på klesoversikta for å sjå kor våte kleda dine er. Det er lurt å turke kleda inne eller ved bål.

English: Dry your wet Clothes next to a fire.
Stay Warm and Dry, or Die in the Cold
Nynorsk: Hald deg varm og tørr, ellers døyr du i kulden.

English: Wolves are not dogs and out here they are very dangerous. They normally avoid humans, but do you want to take a chance? Like most things in nature, Wolves are afraid of Fire. Campfires, Torches, or Flares can keep them at bay. Thrown Torches or Flares might scare them away. But there are no guarantees. In the end, the best way to avoid tangling with Wolves is to give them a wide berth. Remember, they are attracted to Blood and Raw Meat.
Nynorsk: Ulvar er ikkje tamme hundar, og her ute er de særs farlege. Vanligvis skyr dei mennesker, men tør du ta sjansen? Som dei fleste andre dyr er ulvar redde for eld. Leirbål, faklar og blussar kan halde dei på avstand. Å hive ein fakkel eller bluss mot dei kan vera nok til å skremma dei vekk. Men du har ingen garantiar; til sjuande og sist er det nok best å halde seg på avstand. Husk at dei liker luktan av blod og rått kjøt.

English: Destroy the dens with fire to clear a wolf packs from an area for an extended period of time.
Destroy the den to clear a wolf pack from an area
You were unable to forage any usable wood
Nynorsk: Du klarte ikkje sanke noko Nyttande ved

Notes: 2n line displayed when hovering a Hanging Tree with bait during the Bear Hunt
as in: unload ammo from a gun
Unlocking a door with a key

English: The signed in user has changed.

Nynorsk: Du må ha koden til bankhvelvet

English: A light but satisfying stew made with vegetables. Fresh from the gardens of Pleasant Valley.
A game pie made from harvested deer meat.
A tangy and powerful stew made from harvested deer meat.
Flesh from a deer. Cook to eat safely.
Nynorsk: Hjortekjøt. Må steikast for å kunna etast trygt.

English: Disabling increases framerate but may introduce some visual artifacts.
Nynorsk: Skru av for å auka ytinga, men kan føra til "screen tearing".

English: A Memento with a survival hint.
I'll be away awhile. Raid my catch, as you please.
A Memento with a survival hint.
If you wanna climb, you gotta start at the bottom. No better place than the road to Wolf's Jaw.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Storm goes on. Was it only ever the mine? [...writing trails off...]
An old Key to a Lockbox in Ash Canyon.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Ask Sue about grandpa's fishing kit. Did she have it in her truck?
A Memento with a survival hint.
Some help, if you need it.
A Memento with a survival hint.
I left it for you at the very top. Shoot it at midnight so I know you're there. -- Robyn
A Memento with a survival hint.
It's the best way down. Which means the best way up, too.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Grab yer junk before you go. Crazy bastard. -- L
A Memento with a survival hint.
Clean out your old stash outside the wall. I heard wolves last night. -- Gates
An old Key to a Lockbox in Blackrock.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Reminder -- don't forget to check Don's lockbox.
A Memento with a survival hint.
He wandered off. We might check his old back up stash behind the lake.
A Memento with a survival hint.
I told him not to head that way, but stubborn and stupid sometimes ride the same wagon.
A note with a survival hint.
They're biting fierce right now, I can feel it. Meet me at my boat tomorrow, early light.
A Memento with a survival hint.
You tell me why he keeps his junk under that stump. Just clean it out.
A Memento with a survival hint.
No ship came. No use to me where I'm goin'. I leave it to you.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Please look for your brother and his friends. I don't know what to do.
A Memento with a survival hint.
I used to go here to get out of town, before the quakes. It was some peace, anyway.
An old Key to a Lockbox in Desolation Point.
A Memento with a survival hint.
We made it this far, I left some gear for you to find.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Just resting in the hollow stump of the tree he planted. But they were my grandfather's best work.
A Memento with a survival hint.
I hope you find this. I'm heading back to town, through the basin. Safe travels, love.
A Memento with a survival hint.
The last of my prizes, now locked away. I leave it to you, wandering fool.
A Memento with a survival hint.
I stashed it in a place you'll know. Might do you some good out here.
A Memento with a survival hint.
They went in but never came out. I waited five days. No more.
An old Key to a Lockbox in Hushed River Valley
A note with a survival hint.
A new cave has opened up to Milton. Near the old Trapper's place. Earthquake?
A Memento with a survival hint.
We found T's stash in that cave on the upper ridge. So many rounds left! Holding out on us.
A Memento with a survival hint.
I can't stomach the things, but plenty of MRE's down there in the Dam. The broken window room.
An old Key to a Lockbox in Mystery Lake.
An old Key to a Lockbox in Mystery Lake.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Lexi swapped in some new gear at Lockbox #4. Might come in handy.
A Memento with a survival hint.
I know you can't help but try and go. Just be safe. Love you.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Remind me to clean out my practice stash from behind the organ. Not much use anymore, sorta like me.
An old Key to a Lockbox in Mountain Town
A Memento with a survival hint.
[continues from a missing page]...to return mom's things. No blame. I did what I could. A sturdy rock above the field.
A Memento with a survival hint.
Way up to the old Dam seems open again. Better check it out soon.
A Memento with a survival hint.
She's been hoarding those stims and hiding them in the piano. God knows why. Deal with it?
A Memento with a survival hint.
Have to make the Canyon before dark. The howling went all night. [...illegible writing...]
A Memento with a survival hint.
Corpse with computer found, these coordinates. Can't be a local. Pitiable.

Nynorsk: Endrar volumet på snakkinga til spelaren og NPC-ar.

Notes: Label for canned food/drinks warming up

English: That warm food goes straight to your core, heating you from within. Protects against Cold while active.
Nynorsk: Den varme maten går rett til kjerna og varmar deg innanfrå. Beskyttar mot kulDen medan effekten er aktiv.

English: Plastic bottle that holds up to 1L (34 oz) of liquid.
Plastic bottle that holds up to 500ml (17 oz) of liquid.
Water that is safe to drink.
A packet of water purification tablets. Can help prevent dysentery. One tablet treats 1L/0.26 gallon of non-potable water.
Nynorsk: Ei øskje vassreinsetablettar. Kan førebyggja dysenteri. Med ein tablett kan du reinse 1 liter forureina vatn.
Du treng {quant-value} vatn ({qual-value}) for å laga det.

English: Water that may make you ill.
Nynorsk: Ureinsa vatn, kan innehelde bl.a. bakteriar som kan gjera deg sjuk.

English: You've managed to prevent starvation for 72 consecutive hours. You're full of energy and can carry more gear. You're also better able to face the physical trials ahead -- your Condition is increased as a result.
Nynorsk: Du har ungått å svelta i 72 timar på rad. Du kan derfor bera meir før du vert nedtyngja og har betre helse.

Notes: Coast highway, blocked by another rockfall/landslide
Broken road bridge in whaling station region
Church name in whaling station region
Small, secluded, cliff surrounded corner, not on the main path. There's the remains of someone having camped here
location name for truck crashed off bridge into ice below
Island off coast of whaling region
Light house name in whaling station region
This mine links up to the burned highway
Tall waterfall, near broken bridge and cave.

English: Explore the world to find the route that leads to this region!
Nynorsk: Utforsk omgjevnadane for å finna vegen til denne regionen!

English:
For intermediate players. Several key shelters, plenty of hostile wildlife, and harsh weather conditions to be found around these remnants of a once-thriving whaling industry.

Connects to Coastal Highway.
Notes: REMOVED: You've found your way to desolation Point, a stretch of highway featuring the remnants of a once-thriving whaling industry.
Nynorsk:
For spelarar med ein viss erfaring. I nærleiken av det som ein gong var eit livleg kvalmottak, finn du fleire praktiske ly, rikeleg med farleg dyreliv og vanskelege vêrforhold. 

Er forbundet med Kystvegen.

English: Transmitter covers Desolation Point and Coastal Highway Regions
You didn't prepare for the Whiteout in time. You'll never survive it...
Nynorsk: Du har ikkje forberedt deg på snøstormen. Du kjem ikkje til å overleva.

English: The storm arrives in 30 days. Stockpile enough food, water, and supplies in the Coastal Highway Quonset Garage before it hits.
Nynorsk: Stormen kjem om 30 dagar. Lagra nok mat, vatn og forsyningar i Quonset bilverkstad i Kystvegen før det brakar laus.

English:
You've learned of an incoming monster blizzard. Can you stockpile enough supplies before it hits?

You have 30 days to stockpile enough food, water, and supplies in the Coastal Highway Quonset Garage before the superstorm lands.
Nynorsk:
Du har høyrt at ein uhorveleg snøstorm er på veg. Kan du hamstra nok forsyningar før det braker laus?

Du har 30 dagar på deg til å lagre nok mat, vatn og forsyningar i Quonset bilverkstad i Kystvegen før stormen kjem.

English: Stockpile the food, water, and supplies listad in your journal. Store them in the Coastal Highway Quonset Garage (the starting location).
Nynorsk: Hamstra maten, vatnet og forsyningene som er lista opp i dagboka di. Lagra alt i Quonset bilverkstad i Kystvegen (der du starta).

English: A monster blizzard is on the way. Will you be ready when it arrives?
Nynorsk: Ein voldsom snøstorm er på veg. Vil du vera klar når han kjem?

English: The Whiteout is here. Will your stockpiled supplies be enough to survive it?
Nynorsk: Snøstormen er her. Har du nok forsyningar til å overleva?

Notes: Will ( firstname of our male character)

English: The boots you were wearing when you crashed in your plane.
Nynorsk: Støvlene du hadde på deg då flyet ditt styrta.

English: Flexible all-leather boots for flying and operating in wild places.
The pants you were wearing when you crashed in your plane.
Nynorsk: Buksene du hadde på deg då flyet ditt styrta.

English: Comfortable pants, for a bush pilot.
The coat you were wearing when you crashed in your plane.
Nynorsk: Jakken du hadde på deg då flyet ditt styrta.

English: Light and sturdy, but very also very warm. The ideal flight jacket for a Canadian bush pilot.
The shirt you were wearing when you crashed in your plane.
Nynorsk: Skjorten du hadde på deg då flyet ditt styrta.

English: A light shirt, perfect for a typical day at the Jack Rabbit Transport hangar.
The sweater you were wearing when you crashed in your plane.
Nynorsk: Genseren du hadde på deg då flyet ditt styrta.

English: Warm on its own, but also good to layer under a winter coat.
The Toque you were wearing when you crashed in your plane.
Nynorsk: Lua du hadde på deg då flyet ditt styrta.

English: Cheap nylon outer layer that's good for blocking wind and that's about it.
Nynorsk: Billig nylonjakke som gjev god vern mot vinden, men ikkje meir.

English: Winter's Embrace Canadian Feast Badge (2020) is Unlocked.
Winter's Embrace Canadian Feast Badge (2020) is Locked.
Winter's Embrace Winter in July Badge (2020) is Locked.
Winter's Embrace Winter in July Badge (2020) is Unlocked.
Winter's Embrace Winter in July Badge (2020)
This Summer, survive an even colder and harsher edition of The Long Dark's Quiet Apocalypse.

A deep cold has descended on Great Bear Island. Frequent, enduring storms ravage the region.

And even the best shelters won’t be the same refuge they once were. There is only one goal -- survive.  

You’ve entered Winter’s Embrace.
A bundle of scavenged Wires. Old, but intact.
Flesh from a wolf. Cook to eat safely.
Nynorsk: Ulvekjøt. Må steikast for å kunna etast trygt.

English: Toggles the Timberwolf Morale Meter (UI) on or off. Note: Does not change Timberwolf attack behaviours.
Nynorsk: Vel om moralen til vargar skal visast på skjermen eller ikkje.

English: Freshly harvestad fur from a Wolf. Warm, and striking to look at.
Nynorsk: Nyleg flådd pels frå ein ulv. Varm, og flott å sjå på.

English: Fur from a Wolf. Warm, and striking to look at. Can be used for crafting and repair.
Nynorsk: Pels frå ein ulv. Varm, og flott å sjå på. Kan nyttast til å bøta og laga ting.

Notes: Piece of animal that's been sectioned from a carcass

English: Section of a Wolf carcass. Cut from the carcass to make transporation a bit easier. Harvest for usable meat.
Nynorsk: Stykke av eit ulvekadaver. Skore av for å gjera det lettare å bera. Gjev deg etandes kjøt.

English: Handcrafted fur and skin outer layer will keep you warm and remind Wolves that they should keep their distance. Not the way the Wolf expected to end up.
Nynorsk: Handlaga jakke av pels og skinn som vil halde deg varm, samt minna ulvene på at dei bør halde seg på avstand. Det var ikkje sånn ulven hadde sitt for seg å ende opp.

English: Wool longjohns make a great underlayer for your legs. Warm but not very sturdy.
Nynorsk: Strømpebukse laga av ull er noko beina dine setter pris på. Varme, men ikkje veldig slitesterke.

English: A heavy insulated wool shirt designed to keep you warm in the Winter. Retains good warmth when wet.
Nynorsk: Ei tung og varm ullskjorte som held deg varm om vinteren. Held på mykje varme når den er våt.

English: Wool socks. Tough and warm. Try to keep a couple of pairs handy.
Nynorsk: Slitesterke og varme ullabbar. Kan vera smart å ha eit ekstra på på lur.

English: A thick cotton cap that covers the head but not the face. designed to be layered under something warmer.
Nynorsk: Eit tjukt skaut av fleece. Dekkjer hovdet, men ikkje ansiktet. Meint å nyttast under noko varmare.

English: Longer wool scarf that can be wrapped around the entire head. designed for cold weather.
Nynorsk: Eit langt ullskjerf som ein kan tulla rundt heile hobudet. Laga med tanke på kaldt vêr.

English: Steel-toed work boots. The kind you'd find on a construction site. Tough but not warm.
Nynorsk: Arbeidsstøvlar med ståltupp. Den typen du ser på byggjeplassar. Slitesterke, men ikkje varme.

English: Heavy leather gloves designed to protect the hands on the worksite. Unfortunately, not really designed for warmth.
Nynorsk: Tunge skinnhanskar som beskytter nevane på arbeidsplassen. Dessverre er de ikkje spesielt varme.

English: A heavier duty type of jean, with some reinforced patches. Worn by construction workers the world round.
Nynorsk: Ein meir slitesterk utgåve av olabuksa, med forsterka lappar. Nyttast av bygningsarbeidarar over heile verda.

English: A key found in the workshop. Opens another door in and out from the building.
Nynorsk: Ein nykkel funne i verkstaden. Opnar ei anna dør inn og ut frå bygget.

Notes: header for a stats counter, stat is a percent
Displayed for saves that are over 1 year old

Key: GAMEPLAY_You are too full to eat
English: You are too full to eat
You are too full to eat
Nynorsk: Du er for meitt til å eta

English: You are too full to eat
Nynorsk: Du er for meitt til å eta

English: Reducing this distance is better for performance but will cause trees to visibly pop in.
Nynorsk: Å redusere denne avstanden gjev betre yting, men gjer òg at du ser når trær dukker opp.

English: This is Milton. A small town in the mountains. You're far from home.
Nynorsk: dette er Milton. Ein liten by på fjellet. Du er langt hjemmefra.

English: Crawled in after the night with the lights. I heard them. Murmurs in town. I still had ears in town, the gossips. They were scared.
Nynorsk: de kom krypende etter natten med lysene. eg hørte dem. Mumling i byen. eg hadde fortsatt ører i byen, hørte alle ryktene. de var redde.

English: Some were from the highways. Said there were others. Already frozen. Already...dead.
Nynorsk: nokon kom frå riksveiene. Sa det var andre. Allerede frosne. Allerede … døydde.

English: School house. The old school house. Still had a coal stove. They slept in the school house...waiting.
Nynorsk: På skolen. Den gamle skolen. der var det fortsatt ein kullovn. de sov på skolen … og ventet.

English: You'll understand when you find it.
Nynorsk: Du forstår når du finner det.

English: I'm warming up. Now I'm hungry. You wouldn't let an old woman starve, would you? You wouldn't abandon me like the others?
Nynorsk: Eg byrjar å verta varm. No er eg sulten. Du lar vel ikkje ein gamal dame sulte? Du forlater meg vel ikkje slik de andre gjorde?

English: Get me some food. Fill my pantry. Then we'll talk more.
Nynorsk: Skaff meg litt mat. Fyll spiskammeret mitt. Da kan vi snakke mer.

English: Have you found the food I need? It'll be a long Winter yet. Keep looking.
Nynorsk: Fant du maten eg trenger? det vert ein lang vinter. Fortsett å lete.

English: Fill Grey Mother's pantry and she'll see what memories she can dig up from her old mind.
Nynorsk: Fyll spiskammeret til Gråmor, so vil hun grave frem nokon minner til deg frå sitt gamle sinn.

English: So, tell me Mainlander. Did you do what I asked? Did you ransack the gas station? Did you clean them out?
Nynorsk: Så fortell meg, fastlending. Gjorde du som eg ba deg om? Gjennomsøkte du bensinstasjonen? Fikk du med deg noe?

English: Your words are harsh but there's no heart behind them. You're a kinder soul than I would have believed, Mainlander.
Nynorsk: Ordene dine er kalde, men du mener det ikke. Du er ein vennligere sjel enn eg hadde trodd, fastlending.

English: I may be blind but I can still see the lies on you, Mainlander. If you'll lie to me about that, what else will you lie about?
Nynorsk: Eg er kanskje blind, men eg kan likevel se løgnene i ansiktet ditt, fastlending. Viss du lyver om dette, kva ellers vil du lyve om?

English: Might makes right, huh, Mainlander? You might just have what it takes to survive this long Winter after all.
Nynorsk: Den sterkestes rett, ja, fastlending? Kanskje du likevel har det som trengs for å overleva den lange vinteren.

English: You're wherever you're supposed to be, Outsider. The Maker in his great wisdom has put you here with me. But what is his purpose?
Nynorsk: Du er der du er ment å være, fremmede. I sin visdom har skaperen plassert deg her sammen med meg. Men kva er formålet hans?

English: Well...I...guess I misjudged you, Mainlander. Over the years...I have learned that most people disappoint you, given the chance.
Nynorsk: Eg tok visst feil av deg, fastlending. I løpet av årene har eg lært at de fleste skuffer deg, om de får muligheten.

English: Not now, Mainlander. Leave me to my thoughts for a while.
Nynorsk: Ikkje nå, fastlending. La meg få vera i fred med tankene mine i ein stund.

English: Mountain blizzards blow through here from time to time. People get stuck indoors, or...worse.
Nynorsk: Snøstormeir frå fjellet kjem blåsende frå tid til annen. Folk verta værfaste, eller … verre.

English: They wander in circles, only to die within reach of their homes. Even when they are right there in front of them.
Nynorsk: de går rundt i sirkler, berre for å dø i gåavstand frå sitt eget hjem. sjølv når det ligger rett foran dem.

English: And they say Grey Mother is blind! Ha!
Nynorsk: Og de sier at Gråmor er blind! Ha!

English: They never take long to move in, once the people leave.
Nynorsk: Når folk drar sin vei, tar det aldri lang tid før ulvene flytter inn.

English: My rifle stays with me. But, there might be other ways.
Nynorsk: Børseet vert her hos meg. Men det kan finnes andre måter.

English: Old Henry Mcdermott used to be with the police. He kept a service Revolver somewhere in his house.
Nynorsk: Gamle Henry Mcdermott var politi ein gang i tiden. Han hadde ein tjenesterevolver eit plass i huset.

English: Henry was always worried about kids getting their hands on it, so it won't be easy to find.
Nynorsk: Henry var alltid redd for at barn skulle få tak i den, so den vil ikkje verta lett å finne.

English: In the old days, we used to scare them off with fire. A Torch would do the trick.
Nynorsk: I gamle dagar pleide vi å skremme dem vekk med ild. Ein fakkel bør òg gjera susen.

English: We used to make them out of pieces of wood, and a rag dipped in kerosene.
Nynorsk: Vi pleide å lage dem av trebiter og ein fille dyppet i parafin.

English: It's been a while since Grey Mother had anyone to cook for. Take some soup before you go...
Nynorsk: det er ein stund sidan Gråmor hadde nokon å lage mat til. Ta litt suppe før du drar …

English: You have a sense of her passing there?
Nynorsk: Du føler på deg at hun gikk forbi der?

English: A world from the old days. Why would she write that?
Nynorsk: Eit ord frå gamle dagar. Hvorfor skrev hun det?

English: Why? Because you matter so much to her?
Nynorsk: Hvorfor? Fordi du betyr so mykje for henne?

English: I'm not interestad in your story, Outsider. I'm cold. Prove your worth to me and I'll think about telling you what I know.
Nynorsk: Eg er ikkje interessert i historien din, fremmede. eg fryser. Vis kva du kan, so skal eg vurdere å fortelle kva eg vet.

English: There is a town. Far to the North. Perseverance Mills.
Nynorsk: det fins ein by. Langt til nord. «Trottug Møller» heter den.

English: Maybe she was showing you the way.
There is no way now. By car, perhaps. On foot? No path that Grey Mother knows.
Nynorsk: det går ikkje nå. Bil, kanskje? Til fots? Ingen sti som Gråmor kjenner til.

English: I'm old. Sometimes the mind wanders, Outsider. Travels to other places. Other times.
Nynorsk: Eg er gamal. nokon ganger vandrer tankene av gårde. Reiser til andre steder, andre tider.

English: I think about her. Cold and alone.
Nynorsk: Eg tenker på henne. Kald og alene.

English: My fire will be out soon. Fetch me some firewood, and then maybe we'll talk more.
Nynorsk: IlDen slukker snart. Hent litt ved til meg, so kan vi kanskje snakke mer.

English: Yes...on the other side of town. The old Barker Farm.
Nynorsk: Ja, på andre sidan av byen. Barkers gamle gård.

English: Yes. A liar and a thief, mostly.
Nynorsk: Ja. Stort sett ein løgner og ein tyv.

English: Bah. Bank from the Mainland. Never belonged here.
Nynorsk: Huff. Ein bank frå fastlandet. Har aldri hørt til her.

English: The branch closed years ago. The Collapse took everything.
Nynorsk: Avdelingen stengte for mange år siden. Samanbrotet tok alt.

English: Some of us still use the old paper. Or barter.
Nynorsk: nokon av oss bruker fortsatt de gamle papirpengene. Eller driver byttehandel.

English: You ask questions when you should be finding answers.
Nynorsk: Du stiller spørsmål der du burde lete etter svar.

English:
Now get me the safety deposit box. 

Then, everything will become clear to you.
Nynorsk:
Skaff meg no innholdet i bankboksen. 

Da vil du forstå alt.

English: No more questions until you find some answers.
Nynorsk: Ingen flere spørsmål før du finner nokon svar.

English: Not from the bank. From the farmer. Barker.
Nynorsk: Ikkje frå banken. frå bonden. Barker.

English: So...he left with the other cowards, then?
Nynorsk: Så han dro med de andre feigingene?

English: You'll find her at the Graveyard.
Near the Church. You would have passed it on the way into town.
Nynorsk: Like ved kirken. Du kom nok forbi den på vei inn til byen.

English: The liars call me Grey Mother.
You'll find her there. And your answers.
Nynorsk: Du finner henne der. Og svarene dine.

English: Ok...this better help me find my friend...
Nynorsk: OK, dette bør helst hjelpe meg å finne henne …

English: Do what you've been asked to do. Then, in turn, Grey Mother will help you.
Nynorsk: gjer som du er bedt om. So skal Gråmor hjelpe deg.

English: Leave me, Outsider. Your fate in this world is no longer tied to mine.
Nynorsk: Forlat meg, fremmede. Skjebnen din i vår verDen er ikkje lenger knyttet til min.

English: I have nothing to say to you until you make amends.
Nynorsk: Eg har ikkje noko å si til deg før du gjer bot.

English: You should call me Grey Mother also.
Nynorsk: Du skal òg kalle meg Gråmor.

English: What would you like to talk about?
Nynorsk: Hva ynskjer du å snakke om?

English: So...the outsider wants to know more about Milton.
Nynorsk: Så den fremmede ynskjer å vite meir om Milton?

English: To understand Milton you have to understand the Collapse.
Nynorsk: For å forstå Milton må du forstå Sammenbruddet.

English: Pilot like you has probably lived a pretty comfortable life.
Nynorsk: En pilot som deg har sikkert levd eit komfortabelt liv.

English: Out here, people understand the value of hard work, good tools, and working with their hands.
Nynorsk: Her ute forstår folk verdien av hardt arbeid, gode reiskapar og det å jobbe med hendene.

English: Hmph. We'll see. They say the most important tool out here is a good hatchet or knife.
Nynorsk: Hmf. Vi får se. de sier at det viktigste reiskapet her ute er ein god øks eller kniv.

English: But keeping 'em sharp is the secret.
Nynorsk: Men hemmeligheten er å holde dem kvasse.

English: You can't imagine it, Mainlander. We were already on our knees.
Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje forestille deg, fastlending. Vi var allerede på knærne.

English: Exactly. Leit me tell you how it was.
Nynorsk: Nettopp. La meg fortelle deg korleis det var.

English: Ha! We do what we always do -- we take care of our own.
Nynorsk: Ha! Vi gjer som vi alltid har gjort, vi tar vare på våre egne.

English: I can see you'll need help.
Nynorsk: Eg kan se at du vil trenge hjelp.

English: I heard gossip that the Miller's kept some kind of supply kit hidDen in their back garden.
Nynorsk: Eg hørte rykter om at Miller-familien gøymde forsyninger i hagen bak huset.

English: Goods they smuggled in from the Mainland, and didn't want anyone to know about.
Nynorsk: det var varer de hadde smugGransknn frå fastlandet og ikkje ville at nokon skulle kjenne til.

English: If you can find them, you should take them. You'll need them.
Nynorsk: Bare ta varene om du finner dem. Du vil trenge dem.

English: Watch out. People say they can smell your fear.
Nynorsk: Vær forsiktig. det sies at de kan lukte frykten din.

English: You'd leave an old lady defenseless so you could protect yourself?
Nynorsk: Vil du gjera ein gamal dame forsvarsløs slik at du kan beskytte deg sjølv?

English: Old Henry Mcdermott used to be with the Coast Guard. He kept a Distress Pistol around just in case.
Nynorsk: Gamle Henry Mcdermott var i kystvakten ein gang i tiden. Han hadde ein signalpistol liggende for sikkerhets skyld.

English: Right. Henry was always worried about kids getting their hands on it, so it won't be easy to find.
Nynorsk: Ja. Henry var alltid redd for at barn skulle få tak i den, so den vil ikkje verta lett å finne.

English: If you want to survive out here, you have to learn to be self-sufficient.
Nynorsk: dersom du har tenkt å overleva her ute, må du lære å verta sjølvforsynt.

English: When I was growing up, we understood what that meant.
Nynorsk: Da eg vokste opp, forsto vi kva det ville si.

English: When something wore out, we couldn't just go online and order a new one...
Nynorsk: Når noko ble utslitt, kunne vi ikkje berre gå på nett og bestille ein ny –

English: ...have it magically "drone delivered" to your door. Bah.
Nynorsk: – og få den «dronelevert» på døren på magisk vis.

English: As a little girl, I already knew how to hunt Rabbits, and turn their skins into clothes.
Nynorsk: Allerede som liten jente kunne eg jakte på kaninr og lage klede av skinnet.

English: I'll tell you how it's done.
Nynorsk: Eg skal fortelle deg korleis det gjøres.

English: Nothing you can't read in the history books.
Nynorsk: Ikkje noko du ikkje kan lese i historiebøkene.

English: Oh for goodness sake. Take this one.
Nynorsk: Åh, for guds skyld. Ta denne.

English: You won't get far in this rugged terrain if you don't have the right footwear.
Nynorsk: Du kjem ikkje langt i dette kuperte terrenget uten riktig fottøy.

English: You may have to take what you find left behind.
Nynorsk: Du må kanskje ta det du finner etterlatt.

English: They're afraid of me. And even if I could have left, I wouldn't. I was born here. I'll die here. This is the way it has to be.
Nynorsk: de frykter meg. Og eg ville ikkje ha dratt sjølv om eg hadde kunnet. eg ble født her. eg skal dø her. det er slik det må være.

English: Don't be so stubborn, Mainlander. Here...
Nynorsk: Ikkje vær so sta, fastlending. Her.

English: Take these old boots. They belonged to my...oh, nevermind. Just take them.
Nynorsk: Ta disse gamle støvlene. de tilhørte min … åh, glem det. berre ta dem.

English: They are some of the best you can get for climbing.
Nynorsk: Du finner knapt betre til klatring.
de vil komme til god nytte på turen.
Du kan ikkje forstå deg på lojalitet, fastlending.

English: Five days since the lights in the sky. Five days of hell.
Nynorsk: Fem dagar sidan lysene på himmelen. Fem dagar med helvete.

English: Surely a big strapping man like you can find some firewood in a forest.
Nynorsk: En stor og sterk mann som deg finner sikkert ved i skogen.

English: Take the axe in the woodshed out back, if you must. I know some of the townsfolk cut wood on the edge of town.
Nynorsk: Ta øksa i vedskjulet bak huset, om du må. eg vet at nokon av de som bor i området, hogger ved i utkanten av byen.

English: None of your business, Outsider. Just stay out of my private things and don't try to steal from me.
Nynorsk: det har ikkje du noko med, fremmede. ikkje bland deg inn i mine private ting, og ikkje stjel frå meg.

English: Or you'll never find out what I know about your...friend.
Nynorsk: Ellers finner du aldri ut kva eg vet om … venninnen din.

English: Nothing more to say until you do what I asked. I need fuel for my fire, Mainlander. Get to it.
Nynorsk: Eg sier ikkje meir før du har gjort som eg ba deg om. eg treng noko å fyre opp i peisen med, fastlending. Sett i gang.

English: First they thought they'd be safe and then they realized -- they weren't ready for the end. So they fled.
Nynorsk: Først trodde de at de ville vera trygge, men so skjønte de at de ikkje var klare for slutten. So de flyktet.

English: After the lights went out...a blizzard blew in. People got scared. Were afraid of being trapped. Or...more trapped.
Nynorsk: Da lysene slukket, kom ein snøstorm blåsende. Folk ble redde. Redd for å verta sittende fast. Enda meir fast.

English: They panicked. Some left to see what they could discover from the outside.
Nynorsk: de fikk panikk. nokon dro ut for å se kva de kunne finne ut.

English: None of them will make it.
Nynorsk: Ingen av dem vil klare seg.

English: We needed help ten years ago. During the Collapse. When you Mainlanders were sitting pretty, and the others raped our Island.
Nynorsk: Vi trengte hjelp for ti år siden. Under Sammenbruddet. Den gangen satt dere fastlendinger stille og so på medan de andre plyndret øya vår.

English: Took what they wanted. We needed help ten years ago, and it didn't come then.
Nynorsk: de tok det de ville ha. Vi trengte hjelp for ti år siden, men det kom ingen.
Hvorfor skulle det komme hjelp nå?

English: Ha! Not for us. Not for Great Bear. Not for Grey Mother.
Nynorsk: Ha! ikkje for oss. ikkje for Sværebjørn. ikkje for Gråmor.

English: You're an outsider. Mainlander. You're one of them. You don't belong here.
Nynorsk: Du er ein fremmed, fastlending. Du er ein av dem. Du hører ikkje til her.

English: Years ago, when the Collapse happened...we lost everything. The young people didn't understand how dependent we'd become.
Nynorsk: For mange år siden, da Samanbrotet skjedde, mistet vi alt. de unge forsto ikkje kor avhengige vi var blitt.

English: Some people may have accepted dependence on the Mainland. But I don't want the scraps from your table.
Nynorsk: Enkelte godtok kanskje å vera avhengig av fastlandet. Men eg vil ikkje ha smulene frå deres bord.

English: I'm not surprised. You Mainlanders have always been focused on your own story.
Nynorsk: det overrasker meg ikke. dere fastlendinger har alltid fokusert på deres egen historie.

English: It was...windy. The blizzard was already waking up. But I heard yelling. A scream.
Nynorsk: det … blåste. Snøstormen hadde allerede våknet. Men eg hørte roping. Eit skrik.

English: Later, I heard from the gossips that someone had passed through town in the night. More than one person.
Nynorsk: Senere hørte eg rykter om at nokon hadde kommet innom byen om natten. Flere enn ein.

English: A woman, and some men. One of the men was found...
Nynorsk: En kvinne og flere menn. Ein av mennene ble funnet …

English: See? No, I can't. But I know what I hear. Sooner or later all their words, all their lies, find their way up to me.
Nynorsk: Se? Nei, det kan eg ikke. Men eg vet kva eg hører. Før eller sidan vil alt de sier, alle løgnene deres, finne veien til meg.

English: They found him dead the next morning.
Nynorsk: de fant han død neste morgen.

English: I'm not sure. The voices were...thin. Far. The blizzard was waking up. Soon there was only wind and...darkness.
Nynorsk: Eg er ikkje sikker. Stemmene var … spede. Langt unna. Snøstormen hadde våknet. Snart var det berre vind og mørke.

English: I don't know. I don't remember. It's all cloudy now.
Nynorsk: Eg vet ikke. Husker ikke. Alt er tåkete nå.

English: The town...it's abandoned. They've left me to starve. I'll need food to survive this.
Nynorsk: Byen er forlatt. de har etterlatt meg til å sulte. eg treng mat for å overleva dette.

English: I'll worry about that. You worry about finding me food to keep me alive.
Nynorsk: La meg bekymre meg over det. Du kan fokusere på å holde meg i live ved å finne mat.

English: Maybe so. But it’s fair. They stole from me all those years and now it’s their turn.
Nynorsk: Kanskje. Men det er berre fair. de stjal frå meg i alle de årene, og no er det deres tur.

English: Nevermind that! Food. Find me food. Ransack the gas station on the edge of town. There's always food there.
Nynorsk: Ikkje bry deg med det! Finn mat til meg. Leit på bensinstasjonen i utkanten av byen. det er alltid mat der.

English: Owner has a "special supplier" from the Mainland. You're a Mainlander so stealing should come naturally.
Nynorsk: Eieren har ein «spesialleverandør» på fastlandet. Du er ein fastlending, so stjeling burde vera lett for deg.

English: Or...if you're feeling guilty...bring me only what Nature has to offer. It'll be more work but maybe you'll sleep better at night.
Nynorsk: Viss du får dårlig samvittighet, kan du isteDen skaffe meg det naturen har å by på. det innebærer meir arbeid, men kanskje du sover betre om natten.

English: Take the Prybar from the shed, if you haven't already. You might need it to get into some of the more...stubborn...places.
Nynorsk: Ta brekkjernet frå skuret, om du ikkje allerede har gjort det. det kan vera du treng det for å komme deg inn på nokon av de mer … gjenstridige stedene.

English: The mainland, of course. Where else?
Those days are in the past. We became dependent on the Mainland just like you wanted us to. Then, when things Collapsed...you cut us off.
Nynorsk: de dagene hører fortiDen til. Vi ble avhengige av fastlandet akkurat som dere ønsket. Og så, da Samanbrotet kom, lot dere oss seile vår egen sjø.

English: Until you found things you could take, things you could sell to...the others. The ones in the South.
Nynorsk: Helt til dere fant ting dere kunne ta, ting dere kunne selge til … de andre. de i sør.
nokon prøvde seg på jordbruk, men …

English: Bah! The cities. You got what you deserved. You'll get no sympathy from Grey Mother.
Nynorsk: Pøh! Byene. dere fikk som fortjent. dere får ingen sympati frå Gråmor.

Notes: xbox 1 string for Hero Stat Bear Attacks Survived
xbox 1 string for Hero Stat Blizzards Survived
xbox 1 string for Hero Stat Days Survived in Survival Mode
xbox 1 string for Hero Stat Distance Travelled
xbox 1 string for Hero Stat Wildlife Bow Hits
xbox 1 string for Hero Stat Wildlife Rifle Hits
xbox 1 string for Hero Stat Wolves Killed

English: Your ability to aim successfully is affected by Cold, Fatigue, and Breathing. Kneeling confers added stability.
Fatigue affects your ability to aim when using Rifles and Bows.
Cure Birch Saplings and Forge Arrowheads to craft Arrows.
The Aurora seems to disturb wildlife. Be extra wary of predators at this time!
If you find bones in a cave, this may mean it's a Bear Den. Watch out! Resting in these caves might earn you a nasty surprise.
Drink Birch Bark Tea to restore lost Condition over time.

Notes: Tea made from the bark of a birch tree.

English: Academics sometimes visited Blackrock Penitentiary to explore its vast records archive. The unique combination of geographic and social isolation has led to various scientific studies,  of its staff as well as its inmates.
New officers always bunked in the Blackrock Barracks. One of their tasks was supplementing the meager food supply at the Penitentiary -- a thankless and often dangerous job.
Over the years, the extensive damage to the roads and bridges around Blackrock were seen as a bonus security feature of the infamous Penitentiary.
Blackrock's bus drivers have what many consider to be the cushiest and safest job at the Penitentiary.
Dr. Childs has been medical director at Blackrock for decades. It's rumoured that due to his research on Penitentiary inmates he's never been able to secure another position on the Mainland.
While seismic activity has damaged or the destroyed many of the roads and bridges around Blackrock, the earthquakes left the Penitentiary itself largely untouched.
It is rumored a faction of Forest Talkers has been active around Blackrock Mountain in recent years. The Penitentiary grounds serve as a constant reminder of Great Bear Island's ties to the Mainland.
Forest Talkers are experts at finding ways to make use of Blackrock Region's abandoned infrastructure.

It's said that Blackrock's original foundation was built on the site of an old trapping community. The trappers' cabins were destroyed to make way for the Penitentiary, a move that defined the history of the place ever since.

Although officially discouraged, gold panning has always been a pastime for Blackrock's staff. Locals suspected the Penitentiary banned the activity because they didn't want to lose any officers, should they strike it rich.

An uneasy truce exists between the Penitentiary staff and the local population on Great Bear. Long a source of jobs and revenue for remote communities, resentment still endures for the imposition of Blackrock on the Island.

Blackrock's mine was said to be the brainchild of a Mainland consortium. With newer technology, for its time, they hoped to delve deeper than any other mine on the Island. It remains unknown if the mine's ambitious goal is in some way connected to its shuttering.

Mules were essential to all mining activity on Great Bear, and no mine demanded their labour more than Blackrock's. Pulling the ore-laden carts would have been impossible without the sturdy beasts, even as the animals themselves founds the harsh climate on the Island intolerable.
The dramatic peak dominates the landscape around Blackrock Penitentiary and played a role in establishing the prison's fearsome reputation.
Improvised explosives have been a notorious problem for officers and staff at Blackrock. Some of the more enterprising inmates have used the devices as a kind of currency.

One of Blackrock's longest-serving officers was famous for playing a piano deep into the night. Some wardens tolerated his playing as a form of therapy for the inmates, while others saw it as a special punishment.

After a few decades of operation, it became clear the Penitentiary needed its own source of electricity. The Warden at the time made it his personal mission to make Blackrock self-sustainable in an emergency.
The electrical stanchions that snake through the Region are a survival tool for Blackrock staff. If lost in a storm or whiteout blizzard, they could always follow the lines to find shelter.

While the region surrounding Blackrock Mountain is home to all the usual Great Bear Island predators, it is especially friendly territory for Timberwolves. Marine Flares and Noisemakers are very effective at breaking Timberwolf Morale.
Blackrock has attracted a variety of Wardens over the years. Some were kind, some cruel, but all were men who relished the extremes of life on Great Bear Island.
Blizzards are deadly and enduring storms. They also freeze and damage your Clothing.
Bandages treat Blood Loss and can be found or Crafted from Cloth.
After completing 250 hours of Research, you gain 10% more benefit from each completely researched book.
Cure Maple Saplings and Gut to craft a Survival bow.
Treat Broken Ribs with Painkillers, Bandages, and Rest.
The Aurora can bring old Computers back to life, restoring old data left in their memory banks. These artifacts provide a glimpse of Great Bear before the lights went out.
Burns reduce your overall Condition. Use Painkillers or Rose Hip Tea for quickest recovery.
Opening cans using a Can Opener{ico_canOpener} maximizes the Calorie value of the food inside.
First opened in the 1960s, seismic activity on Great Bear Island proved to be a major obstacle for its builder, the industrialist Richard Carter.
Cat Tails are a tough, but edible source of calories. Use the Cat Tail Heads as Tinder.
Spent fires produce Charcoal, which you can use in Survival Mode to update your world map with a Survey.
Clothing can offer Protection against physical harm - whether it be falls or wildlife attacks.
After spending a total of 100 days outside, you are less susceptible to the cold. You get a permanent +2C bonus to your Feels Like temperature.
Early-21st century economic instability in North America and Europe was a key factor in accelerating The Collapse.
Cooked Food and Meat is generally safer to eat.
To produce non-potable Water, place a Can or Pot on an active cooking surface and Melt Snow. Boil the Water to make it safe to drink.
To Cook without a Pot, place raw food directly on hot stones, a grill, or a stove top.
Drinks and Canned Food can be placed on or near a fire to warm them.
Eating warm Food or Drinks will give you a buffer against the cold.
Hot Food and Drinks Warm You Up
Clothing you make from wildlife hides can offer unique survival advantages.
Cure your Fresh Hides and Green Saplings indoors to Craft unique items.
Create Improvised Tools at a Forge from Scrap Metal.
Keep an eye out for these valuable crafting locations. The items you make with them are often better than the ones you find in the world.
If lost or Freezing in the wilderness, build a Snow Shelter to escape the wind and keep warm.
Cold and remote, the massive mountain dominates the landscape. The summit may hold valuable resources for those brave enough to face it.

The first man to attempt escape from Blackrock, Bill Cutty is a something of a local legend. No trace of him was ever found. Word of his possible success only reached the prison by way of the cryptic letters received by his former cellmates.
A quick way to lose Condition. Keep Water on hand to quench your thirst.
Distress Pistol rounds can be an effective deterrent against hostile wildlife. They are the only thing that can reliably deter a charging Bear.
Drinking Unpotable Water can lead to Dysentery. Take Antibiotics or Reishi Tea, then Rest to recover.
After surviving 500 days, your body has adapted to the tough conditions. You consume 10% fewer calories.
Energy Drinks grant a Boost to Stamina and reduce Fatigue for a short time. Useful in precarious places.
Energy Drinks temporarily reduce Fatigue and boost Stamina. Their potent ingredients will cause Headaches, so use only when needed.
A silent killer. Everything is harder when you're Exhausted. Find a safe place to Rest and recover.
Uncovered skin can become Frostbitten. Check your Clothing interface to watch for areas of Frostbite Risk.

The remote Penitentiary never used to lack for food. Post-Collapse life on Great Bear, however, has meant lean Winter months for inmates and staff at Blackrock. Clever cooks at the prison have become known as much for their farming prowess as their kitchen skills, as they toil to keep their pantries full.
Accelerants are a great way to start a fire when you can't afford to fail, but are a rare resource.
Wood burns more slowly when it's extremely cold.
Each Fuel type affects your chance to start a fire and how long the fire will last.
Successfully start 1000 fires, and all your Survivors start with a Level 3 Fire Starting skill.
Every Fish you cook produces oil that you can use in Lanterns.
Thrown Torches and Flares have a chance to scare away hostile wildlife.
Dense fog can blanket Great Bear Island, making navigation difficult.
Use Antibiotics or Reishi Tea to recover from Food Poisoning.
You can get Food Poisoning by eating low-Condition food items.
After Sprinting 50 km, Sprinting burns 25% fewer Calories.
Freezing is the fastest way to die on Great Bear. Warm up by getting out of the Wind, getting near a fire, or getting inside a shelter.
Frostbite injuries are permanent. Keep exposed skin covered to avoid this debilitating Affliction.
Already dependent on The Mainland, the effects of The Collapse intensified the Island's remote character.
Hacksaws let you Harvest Scrap Metal for Crafting and Repair. You can also use them to Harvest wood from tree limbs.
Hatchets are the best Tool for Harvesting large amounts of wood.
Some afflictions or even first aid actions can leave you with a distracting Headache.
A Hunting Knife is a key tool for harvesting meat from carcasses. It can also protect you against hostile wildlife.
Hypothermia happens when body temperature stays too low for too long. Keep an eye on your temperature using the Status screen.
Use a Tool to break the ice hole in an Ice Fishing hut. It will freeze up again over time!
As a last resort, Craft Improvised Head and Hand Wraps to protect yourself from weather and wildlife.
Antiseptic helps treat Infection Risk resulting from Struggles with Great Bear Island predators.
Infections can be deadly. Treat with Antibiotics or Reishi Tea, and Rest.
Blackrock's Wardens have traditionally kept a home not far from the Penitentiary grounds. After the Collapse, arsonists set fire to the empty building. No motive was ever disclosed.
A varied region where human industry collides with Great Bear’s wild landscape.
Look for landmarks to guide your way in the wilderness. Every region tells a story.
Lanterns are useful for casting light in dark areas, and also provide a bit of warmth when carried in-hand.
Layer your Clothing{ico_inv_clothing} wisely to take advantage of different Clothing attributes such as Weight, Windproofness and Protection against wildlife.
Wolves can often be heard before they are seen.
Largely cut off from the Mainland since The Collapse, Great Bear Islanders became even more resourceful in their isolation.
Earthquakes have decimated parts of Great Bear’s infrastructure, making travel across the Island difficult and dangerous.
Active for decades, the Forest Talkers are fierce defenders of Great Bear Island’s ecology.
Now abandoned, mines were a staple of local industry on Great Bear prior to The Collapse.
Keep your Clothing in good Condition or it will become Ruined.
Using any tool reduces its Condition. Maintain tools before they break!
Flat and frozen, the Muskeg is a broad marshland bisected by an old railroad line. Watch for weak ice!
Dropping decoys can distract predators, giving you enough time to escape their interest.
Founded as a coal-mining town in 1911, Milton's story has followed the boom-and-bust of the entire Island.
Use moonlight to Craft, Research, and Repair when outdoors.
If you see trees with scratched bark, this might mean Moose are in the area. Listen for them!
Timberwolf packs have Morale, indicated by a red meter. Timberwolf Morale can be broken by shooting or throwing things at them. Packs with broken Morale will flee, but may return once they recover.
Home to Milton, this region is now completely abandoned since the lights went out.
Harvest Old Man's Beard lichen to craft naturally disinfecting wound dressings.
Treat Parasites with Antibiotics or Reishi Tea and Rest.You can get Intestinal Parasites from eating certain meats.
Power workers man the Sub Station near the Penitentiary to ensure the gates and doors stay locked at Blackrock. A lonely job, the electricians and line workers who fill the position never last long.
Prybars are essential for forcing open locked doors and vehicles.
Don't have a fire? Use Purification Tablets to treat Non-Potable Water no matter where you are.
Quartering an animal carcass makes it easier to transport. But keep in mind, the quartering site may attract predators!
Rabbits are quick but plentiful on Great Bear. Use Stones to stun them for capture.
Craft and place Snares wherever you see Rabbits. Over time, the snares may catch Rabbits. Add multiple Snares to create trap-lines.
Press {OpenRadial} for a quick way to access a variety of critical game actions, as well as critical status information.
Raw Meat and Fish give off a scent that attracts predators.
Remote regions of Great Bear Island offer fewer human-made shelters. Come prepared!
Reishi Mushroom tea makes for an effective natural antibiotic. Useful against Intestinal Parasites and Infections.
A powerful defensive weapon, you can shoot the Revolver quickly from the hip to frighten wildlife, or aim down sights for more accuracy.
Use the Revolver to fend off Wolves during a Struggle. You'll have a chance to take a shot and wound or kill the animal.
The Rifle is a powerful Hunting tool, but ammunition is scarce! Use it wisely. Rifle shots can also scare wildlife away.
Dense, with sheer cliffs, this valley lacks any human settlements but may still have a few secrets to reveal.
Harvest and Prepare Rose Hips to brew a natural painkilling tea. Useful against Sprains and Burns.
With only a handful of key shelters, this vast region also plays host to some of Great Bear’s most unpredictable weather.
Keep an eye on your Scent Indicator{ico_inv_Materials} when carrying Raw Meat or Fish, or when Bleeding. Predators can smell you, and may come looking.
When you see the Sheltered Indicator {ico_sheltered}, this means you are currently protected from the wind.
When using a Rifle, a Revolver, or a Distress Pistol, cold temperatures can cause Shivering, affecting your aim.

Notes: Shivering, a reaction to cold weather.

English: Watch for a Slope Warning when traveling over steeper terrain. Your chance of Sprains is higher on steep or uneven ground.
After travelling 1000 km in the game, your Stamina bar recharges 20% faster.
Pain causes blurred vision and discomfort. Treat it, or let it heal on its own over time.
If Encumbered or Exhausted you are at risk for a Sprain on sloped ground. Drop gear or Rest to eliminate the Risk.
Sprained ankles and wrists affect movement and the ability to use certain Tools. Treat with Painkillers or Rest.
Skittish creatures, but a great source of Meat and valuable Crafting materials.
Starving is a slow and steady path to Condition loss. Eat enough to stay healthy, or your weakened condition can lead down many paths to death.
Use the small Stones you find on the ground to hunt Rabbits.
Blizzards and high winds can knock loose Sticks or drop tree Limbs which you can then Harvest later.
Use the sun's position in the sky to navigate Great Bear Island.
Time of day can dramatically affect the overall air temperature on Great Bear Island.
Harvest Sticks to make Tinder, a vital item for firestarting.
Keep your Tools in good Condition. Maintain them using a range of gear items, including Whetstones and Tool Kits. It could make all the difference in the wilderness!
Heavily damaged by earthquakes decades ago, this region's twisting paths can confuse distracted explorers.
Weather turning bad or predators nearby? Take shelter in a vehicle.
Vehicles may hold valuable supplies. Don't forget to check the trunk and glove compartment!
Locked trunks can be opened using a Prybar.
You can Rest or Pass Time in a vehicle, with or without a Bedroll.
Wet or Frozen Clothing can be deadly. Warm it by a fire to dry it out.
With plenty of human-made shelters and signs of Great Bear’s industrial past, this narrow coastline is a scavenger’s dream.
High winds will slow movement and exploration, as well as put out campfires.
Thrown Flares and Torches have a chance to deter Wolves. Keep them on hand if exploring.
As well as causing dangerous and deadly Afflictions, Wolf struggles can damage and destroy Clothing.
Keep your distance whenever possible. A Wolf struggle could be the end of your journey.
Wolves are attracted to your scent -- raw meat or fish, or bloody injuries, can draw them to you. Remain down-wind to help mask your scent.
Use your Hatchet or Hacksaw to harvest downed firewood from tree limbs or branches. Sticks are abundant and can be harvested without a tool.

Key: Interact with the placed Cooking Pot to choose what Cooking actions you want to perform (including Melting snow and Boiling water)"

English: Story's real simple. That bear and me, we have unfinished business.
Nynorsk: det er veldig enkelt. Bjørnen og eg har noko uoppgjort.

English: Rare supply boat from the mainland. That's really the only lifeline for the few folks that still live on Great Bear...
Nynorsk: En sjelDen gang kjem det ein forsyningsbåt frå fastlandet. de få som fortsatt bor på Sværebjørn, har egentlig ikkje noko annet å støtte seg til.

English: Old Man's Beard Moss -- you'll see it hanging from trees. You can wrap it in a bandage and use it to prevent bites from getting infected.
Nynorsk: Gubbeskjegg – du ser det henge frå trærne. Du kan tulle det inn i ein bandasje for å hindre at det går infeksjon i bitt.

English: Learn to identify each of these, cause they could save your life, Mackenzie.
Nynorsk: Lær deg å identifisere hver av disse, for de kan redde livet ditt, Mackenzie.

English: You ready to give it a shot?
Nynorsk: Er du klar til å prøve?

English: Then go to it, oh mighty killer of fuzzy animals.
Nynorsk: Så sett i gang, du store slakter av myke dyr.

English: Suit yourself. You're just postponing the inevitable.
Nynorsk: Som du vil. Men du utsetter berre det uunngåelige.

English: Old phone lines don't depend on power like the new systems do.
Nynorsk: Gamle telefonlinjer er ikkje avhengig av strøm, slik som de nye systemene.

English: It's one of the many ways the old infrastructure is better than what we have now.
Nynorsk: Det er ein av grunnene til at den gamle infrastrukturen er betre enn det vi har nå.

English: I'm serious. Everything's so integrated now. So linked. It's a house of cards. One system fails, they all fail.
Nynorsk: Eg mener det. Alt er so integrert nå. So sammenknyttet. det er som eit korthus. Svikter ett system, svikter alle.

English: Old analogue system could still work. No telling how the lines are set up. Call could be from anywhere on Great Bear, really.
Nynorsk: Gamle analoge systemeir fungerer kanskje ennå. eg aner ikkje korleis linjene er satt opp. Anropet kan ha vært frå kor som helst på Sværebjørn.

English: If you know what the lines and switches connect to, you could probably figure it out.
Nynorsk: Viss du visste kva linjene og bryterne er koblet til, kunne du sikkert finne ut av det.

English: Those old analog lines...bet nobody even knows they're still hooked up. You'd need an old phone company line map.
Nynorsk: de gamle analoge linjene. Skal vedde på at ingen vet at de fortsatt funker. Du treng eit av telefonselskapets gamle linjekart.

English: No idea where you could find one, though. Must be archives somewhere?
Nynorsk: Men eg aner ikkje kor du finner et. Kanskje det finnes eit arkiv eit sted?

English: Just the way we like it.
Nynorsk: det er slik vi vil ha det.

English: The old ways are the new ways again.
Nynorsk: de gamle måtene er de nye måtene igjen.

English: What do you want to tackle?
