Nynorsk: Hva har du lyst til å lære?

English: Survival takes focus. We'll continue when you're done your current lesson.
Nynorsk: For å overleva må du vera fokusert. Vi fortsetter når du er ferdig med den pågående timen.

English: I think you've shot enough deer for one day. You're done with that.
You know what you need to know about Ice Fishing now. Not much more I can tell you.
Thanks for fixing my coat. That'll do, as far as mending lessons.
You've proven you can hunt Rabbit effectively. Try something else.
I suspect you know how to find the plants you need now. Next subject.
You're from the mainland. You wouldn't understand.
Nynorsk: Du er frå fastlandet. Du forstår ikke.

English: Yeah. This place has always been ruined by greed.
Nynorsk: Ja. dette stedet har alltid vorte Øydelagt av grådighet.

English: What do you want to know?
Nynorsk: Hva har du lyst til å vite?

English: If you think a lesson on local history's going to help you out, here -- "fill your boots" as the Islander's like to say.
Nynorsk: Viss du tror litt undervisning i lokalhistorie vil hjelpe deg, so er det berre å «fylle støvlene», som øyboerne liker å si.
Ja. Enda flere enn det pleier å være.

English: Apart from staying far away, or shooting them if they get too close...
Nynorsk: Bortsett frå å holde deg på avstand eller skyte dem viss de kjem for nærme …

English: I know a place where you might be able to find some old flares.
Nynorsk: Eg vet eit plass kor du kanskje kan finne nokon gamle bluss.

English: They don't seem to like the noise. Throw one at 'em and they're likely to run.
Nynorsk: det virker som de misliker lyden. de stikker sikkert om du kaster eit på dem.

English: You're getting pretty handy out there. For a pilot.
Nynorsk: Du byrjar å verta ganske flink der ute. Til å vera pilot.

English: You won't get far without a good Hatchet or Knife, though.
Nynorsk: Men du kjem ikkje langt uten ein god øks eller kniv.

English: You know...you find a Forge and the right materials...
Nynorsk: Du vet … finner du ein smie og de riktige materialene, –

English: Yeah. The big quake years ago shut that nonsense down.
Nynorsk: Ja. det store jordskjelvet for mange år sidan fikk ein slutt på tullet.

English: ...you could probably fashion a half-decent Hatchet of your own.
Nynorsk: – kan du sikkert lage ein Nyttande håndøks sjølv.

English: There's an old Forge near the abandoned Spence Homestead...
Nynorsk: det er ein gamal smie i nærheten av den Etterlata  Spence-boligen –

English: ...over the other side of the Muskeg. You'll find most of what you need there.
Nynorsk: – på den andre sidan av sumpen. der finner du det meste av det du trenger.

English: Just enough to find my way through when I need to. The place is a mess.
Nynorsk: Akkurat nok til å finne veien gjennom når eg må. det er fullstendig kaos der.

English: Yeah, there's some odd local history about it. Great Bear's full of these stories.
Nynorsk: Ja, og det ligger litt underlig lokalhistorie bak. Sværebjørn er full av slike historier.

English: Just another example of people trying to make a buck out here, I guess.
Nynorsk: Bare nok eit eksempel på folk som prøver å tjene litt gryn her, vil eg tro.

English: It is! The best fur you can get out here, for warmth and protection.
Nynorsk: det er den! For varme og beskyttelse finnes det ikkje betre pels der ute.
Du kan få deg en, du òg.

English: Yeah. You only have to kill a bear.
Nynorsk: Jepp. det er berre å drepe ein bjørn.

English: If you're not feeling up to it, you can make some decent clothing...
Nynorsk: dersom du ikkje liker tanken, kan du lage Nyttande klede –

English: ...from deerskin. Supple with decent protective qualities.
Nynorsk: – av hjorteskinn. det gjev myke klede og Nyttande beskyttelse.

English: Oh yeah, and you haven't seen anything yet.
Nynorsk: Å ja, og du har ikkje sett noko ennå.

English: Wait until a blizzard rolls in. You could get caught out there...
Nynorsk: Bare vent til det kjem ein snøstorm. Da kan du verta gående –

English: ...wandering around in circles, for days. Or until you die.
Nynorsk: – i sirkler der ute i dagevis. Eller til du dør.

English: Well. If you have no other choice, dig a hole in the snow...
Nynorsk: Vel. Viss du ikkje ser andre utveier, kan du grave i snøen –

English: ...and set up an emergency Snow Shelter. Might save your life.
Nynorsk: – og lage deg ein snøhule. det kan redde livet ditt.
det treng du ikkje vite, pilot.

English: This place has its own history. Stuff outsiders don't know much about.
Nynorsk: dette stedet har sin egen historie. Ting fremmede ikkje vet so mykje om.
Jepp. eg har inntrykk av det.

English: You want to understand why people don't like outsiders here?
Nynorsk: Har du lyst til å forstå hvorfor folk ikkje liker fremmede her?

English: I need you to do something for me before you leave Mystery Lake.
Nynorsk: Eg vil at du skal gjera noko for meg før du forlater Løyndomsvatnet.

English: I have some old letters. Stuff I don't want anyone to get their hands on.
Nynorsk: Eg har nokon gamle brev. Ting eg ikkje vil at andre skal få kloa i.

English: I'm serious, Mackenzie. These letters are important to me.
Nynorsk: Eg mener det, Mackenzie – disse brevene er viktige for meg.

English: Nah. Just burn 'em. It'll be better that way.
Nynorsk: Nei. berre brenn dem. det er betre slik.

English: No peeking. Trust me, it's better if you don't.
Nynorsk: Ingen sniktitting. Tro meg, det er best å la være.

English: Old supply cache of mine. More like a bunker, I guess.
Nynorsk: I det gamle oppbevaringet mitt. det er meir som ein bunker.

English: I have my reasons. Burn the letters. And take whatever else you need from there.
Nynorsk: Eg har mine grunner. Brenn breva og tek det du treng derfrå.

English: Whole island's basically a perfect wilderness that's been slowly destroyed by industry over the past, oh...hundred years or so.
Nynorsk: Hele øya består av perfekt natur som langsomt er vorte Øydelagt av industri i løpet av de siste hundre årene eller der omkring.

English: Bah. It doesn't matter. Quake put an end to all that.
Nynorsk: det Spelar ingen rolle. Jordskjelvet fikk ein slutt på alt.

English: Yeah. You could call it a trade in kind. Every time we meet, we each leave with a little of the other's blood.
Nynorsk: Ja. Ein slags byttehandel, kan du si. Hver gang vi møtes, drar vi av plass med litt av den andres blod.

English: Haven't you noticed? Since the lights in the sky? The world is quiet now.
Nynorsk: Har du ikkje lagt merke til det? Etter lysene på himmelen? VerDen er stille nå.

English: Yeah, I keep to myself. Hunt a bit. Fish in the Summer. Keep my traplines full.
Nynorsk: Ja, eg holder meg for meg sjølv. Jakter litt. Fisker om sommeren. Setter ut feller.

English: Once every couple of months, I head down to Rupert's Landing. Trade for what I need.
Nynorsk: Med eit par måneders mellomrom drar eg ned til Rupertshavn. der bytter eg til meg det eg trenger.

English: No. Who do I need to talk to?
Nynorsk: Nei. Hvem skulle eg snakke med?

English: Look. You don't have a choice, pal.
Nynorsk: Hør. Du har ikkje noko valg.

English: Not with a blood-hungry bear on your ass, you haven't.
Nynorsk: Du hadde ikkje ein blodtørstig bjørn i hælene.

English: Trust me, Mackenzie. You really want to find your friend? There's miles of wilderness in all directions from here. You'll never make it.
Nynorsk: Stol på meg, Mackenzie. Vil du finne venninnen din? det er flere kilometer med vill natur i alle retninger herfra. Du vil aldri klare deg.

English: I'll teach you what you need to know.
Nynorsk: Eg skal lære deg det du treng å vite.

English: You'll have to do something for me.
Nynorsk: Du må gjera noko for meg.

English: I'm sure it will be. For one of us.
Nynorsk: det vil det helt sikkert bli. For ein av oss.

English: That part goes without saying. You don't kill the bear, we neither of us get out of here alive.
Nynorsk: det sier seg sjølv. Dreper du ikkje bjørnen, betyr det slutten for oss begge.

English: Yeah...could hardly sleep, it was so bright. There's something different about them. Not like the usual aurora borealis.
Nynorsk: Ja, eg fikk knapt sove, so lyst var det. Noe er annerledes med dem. de er ikkje som vanlige nordljos.

English: You sure? I didn't see anything like that.
Nynorsk: Er du sikker? eg so ikkje noko slikt.

English: Nope. I'm off-grid for a reason.
Nynorsk: Niks. det er ein grunn til at eg er frakoblet strømnettet.
det har ikkje du noko med.

English: You sure you haven't been into that Morphine, pilot?
Nynorsk: Sikker på at du ikkje har brukt litt av morfinen, pilot?

English: Didn't use to be that way. I told you before, something's stirring them up.
Nynorsk: det pleide ikkje å vera det. Som sagt er det noko som hisser dem opp.

English: You just stay focused on what I'm telling you. Watch out for the Old Bear. He's cunning as hell. Make a wolf look like a damn lap dog.
Nynorsk: Du klarer berre ikkje å konsentrere deg om kva eg sier. Pass deg for Gamlebjørn. Han er ein skikkelig luring. Får ein ulv til å virke som ein liten hund.

English: Wolves -- they hate fire, like most wildlife. Campfire'll keep them away from you at night, most of the time.
Nynorsk: Ulver hater ild, som andre ville dyr. Eit leirbål vil som regel holde dem unna om natten.

English: Everything hurts like hell. But I'll live.
Nynorsk: Alt gjer fryktelig vondt. Men eg overlever.

English: Improvise a torch if you have to. Flare will work too, you know one of those emergency ones for road accidents.
Nynorsk: Lag ein fakkel om du må. Bluss hjelper òg – du vet, slike som brukast etter trafikkulykker.

English: Sometimes, if you get lucky, even a stone to the head will scare them off.
Nynorsk: nokon ganger, om du er heldig, kan ein stein i hodet òg skremme dem vekk.

English: Then you wait until they're close, and hit them with anything you can. Knife. Hammer. Hatchet. Or your damn hands.
Nynorsk: Da venter du til de kjem tett på, so prøver du å treffe dem med det du har for hånden. Kniv. Hammer. Håndøks. Eller hendene.

English: And you don't stop hitting until one of you is dead.
Nynorsk: Og du slutter ikkje å slå før ein av dere dør.

English: Yeah. This is it: fight if you want to live. It's more Hobbes than Darwin.
Nynorsk: Ja. Kjemp om du ynskjer å leve. Meir Hobbes enn Darwin.

English: Oh yeah, I know all about the Talkers.
Nynorsk: Ja, eg vet alt om praterne.

English: Nothing like that. Eco-activists. Terrorists, some call them. They've been fighting for years, against further exploitation of Great Bear.
Nynorsk: Slett ikke. Miljøvernere. nokon kaller dem terrorister. de har kjempet i årevis mot videre utnyttelse av Sværebjørn.

English: Not usually...they'll spike the occasional tree. Tie themsjølves to logging or mining equipment in protest.
Nynorsk: Vanligvis ikke. de setter spiker i trær iblant. Binder seg fast til tømmer- eller gruveutstyr i protest.

English: Don't think they've ever hurt anybody. But I'm not really up to date on current events.
Nynorsk: Tror ikkje de nokon gang har skadet nokon. Men eg er ikkje helt oppdatert på kva som skjer.

English: No...I...yeah, I do. But...I'll be ok.
Nynorsk: Nei … jeg … ja, det vil jeg. Men jeg … klarer meg.

English: depends on your perspective, I guess. I try to stay out of politics.
Nynorsk: Kommeir an på korleis du ser på det. eg prøver å holde meg unna politikk.

English: One thing's for sure -- they've been doing a lot more than just talking" lately."
Nynorsk: det som er sikkert, er at de har gjort meir enn å berre prate i det siste.

English: Few nights ago, heard a lot of shooting coming from the other side of the Lake.
Nynorsk: For nokon netter sidan hørte eg masse skytelse frå den andre sidan av innsjøen.

English: Could have been hunters I guess, but they aren't usually up this time of year.
Nynorsk: det kan riktignok ha vært jegere, men de pleier ikkje å vera her på denne tiDen av året.

English: No idea. For their sake, I hope they got the hell out of the area before things got shut down.
Nynorsk: Aner ikke. For deres skyld håper eg de kom seg ut av området før ting ble stengt.

English: It won't be good for them, with Old Bear out there, and angry.
Nynorsk: de får det ikkje lett med ein sint Gamlebjørn der ute.

English: Only one way to go for you, pilot.
Nynorsk: det er berre ett plass å dra til, pilot.

English: You want to get to Perseverance Mills? You gotta pass through the guts of that Dam.
Nynorsk: Du har lyst til å komme deg til Trottug Møller? Da må du gjennom demningens innvoller.

English: That may be, but it's still the only way to get where you need to go.
Nynorsk: det kan være, men det er likevel den eneste veien dit du skal.

English: Not 'til I'm sure you can make it.
Nynorsk: Ikkje før eg er sikker på at du kan ta deg dit.

English: Morphine? Nah. That stuff's dangerous. Especially the old stuff. Addictive. Makes you feel...like you're floating. In a dream...
Nynorsk: Morfin? Nja. det er farlige greier. Spesielt gamal morfin. Avhengighetsdannende. Får deg til å … sveve, som i ein drøm.

English: Trick is to spot your target, get as close as you can, take a shot, and don't miss.
Nynorsk: Trikset er å finne eit mål, komme deg so nært som mulig, skyte – og ikkje bomme.

English: Pretty much. A few years of practice and you might have a clue.
Nynorsk: Så godt som. Du får det til etter nokon år med trening.

English: There's a clearing, a few hilltops over from here. I'll mark it on your map. Almost always a herd of deer that winter there.
Nynorsk: det er ein åpning nokon åskammeir unna. eg skal markere den på kartet ditt. Om vinteren er det nesten alltid ein hjorteflokk der.

English: Shoot one, and bring the meat back here, and we'll both know you can feed yourself in the wild.
Nynorsk: Skyt ein av dem og ta kjøtet med hit, so vet vi begge at du kan skaffe deg mat i naturen.

English: Remember -- if you hit one, but don't kill it, you'll have to track it til it drops. Look for blood in the snow, and follow its trail.
Nynorsk: Husk at viss du får inn eit treff, men uten at hjorten dør, må du følge etter til den faller. Se etter blod i snøen og følg sporet.

English: It'll fall, eventually. Then we both eat. Good luck.
Nynorsk: Den faller til slutt. Da kan vi begge spise. Lykke til.

English: Then good luck. Come back to me when you've bagged one.
Nynorsk: Lykke til. Kom attende når du har ein i sekken.

English: Ok, but don't wait too long. You won't get better at shooting just by thinking about it.
Nynorsk: Greit, men ikkje vent for lenge. Du vert ikkje ein betre skytter av å tenke på det.

English: You won't always have the means to hunt, so you need to know more than one way to feed yourself.
Nynorsk: det er ikkje alltid du har muligheten til å jakte, so du treng å kjenne til flere måter å skaffe mat på.

English: Protein's scarce in the Winter. Fishing might keep your dumb pilot ass from dying out there.
Nynorsk: det er knapt med proteiner om vinteren. Fisk kan holde den dumme pilotræva di i live der ute.

English: Head to the Camp Office at the edge of Mystery Lake. You'll find the gear you need for ice fishing.
Nynorsk: Fer til leirkontoret ved Løyndomsvatnet. der finner du utstyret du treng for å fiske på isen.

English: This whole area takes its name from Mystery Lake, nearby. Not much here. Some old cabins here and there.
Nynorsk: Hele området har fått navnet sitt frå Løyndomsvatnet, som ligger i nærheten. det er ikkje so mykje her. nokon gamle hytter her og der.

English: There's some huts on the lake. Bring back some fish and I'll know you won't die from starvation, at least.
Nynorsk: det er nokon hytter ved innsjøen. Skaff meg litt fisk, so vet eg i det minste at du ikkje dør av sult.

English: Nothing thinly veiled about it. Look at me, Mackenzie. That Old Bear wrecked me good. I won't hunt or trap this season.
Nynorsk: det er ingenting med planen som er dårlig tilslørt. Se på meg, Mackenzie. Gamlebjørn skadet meg stygt. det vert ingen jakt eller snarelegging på meg i vinter.

English: If me teaching you means we both survive...what's the harm?
Nynorsk: gjer det noko om undervisningen min holder liv i oss begge?

English: You want to try your neve at it?
Nynorsk: Har du lyst til å prøve?

English: Suit yourself. But you'll have to tackle it some time. Ha!
Nynorsk: det er opp til deg. Men før eller sidan må du gjera det. Ha!

English: It's damn cold out there, right? What you wear might make the difference between life and death.
Nynorsk: det er bitende kaldt der ute, ikkje sant? Klærne kan bety forskjellen mellom liv og død.

English: Wind or wet will kill you if you Granskt.
Nynorsk: Vind og vatn kan ta livet av deg.

English: Wear wind-blocking clothes on your outside layer if you can, and use natural shelter whenever possible.
Nynorsk: Ta på vindtette klede ytterst om du kan, og bruk naturlig ly når det er mulig.

English: Wind will drop your core temperature quickly and before you know it you'll have hypothermia, or worse.
Nynorsk: Vind reduserer kroppstemperaturen din raskt, og før du vet ordet av det, har du hypotermi eller det som verre er.

English: That one's obvious. You get wet from snowfall, falling through the ice, whatever -- in these Winters, you'll get frostbite in no time.
Nynorsk: det sier seg sjølv. Blir du våt av snø eller fordi du faller gjennom isen eller noe, får du frostskader på null komma niks i ein slik vinter.

English: Wear waterproof clothing if you can, especially on your feet. If your clothes get wet, dry them out by a fire.
Nynorsk: Ha på vanntette klede om du kan, spesielt fottøyet. Viss kleda vert våte, kan du tørke dem ved ilden.

English: Almost. Think about carrying weight -- the heavier your clothing, the less food and other supplies you can carry without getting tired.
Nynorsk: Nesten. Tenk på oppakningen din. Jo tyngre kleda dine er, jo mindre mat og andre forsyninger kan du bære med deg uten å verta sliten.

English: Railway passes through. Campground around the lake's closed for the season. Mostly dead most of the year.
Nynorsk: Jernbanen går gjennom området. Leirplassen rundt innsjøen er stengt om vinteren. det er dødt der stort sett hele året.

English: And remember, you want some tough layers to protect you from falls and animals, especially these days.
Nynorsk: Og husk at du bør kle deg i solide lag for å beskytte deg mot fall og dyr, spesielt i disse dagar.

English: Great. Remember though, it's not enough to have good gear if you don't take care of it. Needle and thread are your friends.
Nynorsk: Flott. berre husk at det ikkje er nok å ha godt utstyr dersom du ikkje tar vare på det. Nål og tråd er dine beste venner.

English: Keep your clothing in good shape and it'll take care of you. Sacrifice any shitty gear you find to keep your better gear in action.
Nynorsk: Hald kleda dine i god stand, so står de deg bi. Ofre dårlig utstyr for å kunne fortsette å bruke det bra utstyret.

English: Good. Now prove it. Take this old parka of mine. There's an old Lookout tower just off the railway.
Nynorsk: Bra. So bevis det. Ta denne gamle anorakken min. Du finner eit gamalt utkikkstårn like ved jernbanen.

English: Usually some Forestry Service gear in there. Use their supplies to repair my old parka.
Nynorsk: Som regel har Skogbruksetaten litt utstyr liggende der. Nytt det til å reparere den gamle anorakken min.

English: The only way to know it, is to do it, Mackenzie. Now get out there.
Nynorsk: Den eneste måten å lære det på, er å gjera det, Mackenzie. Kom i gang nå.

English: Too good to pick up a sewing kit, huh? You'll learn the hard way.
Nynorsk: For fin på det til å bruke sysaker, eller? dette vil du lære på den harde måten.

English: Yeah, and thank goodness. They're not hard to kill, and they taste great.
Nynorsk: Ja, og takk og pris for det. de er ikkje vanskelige å drepe, og de smaker fortreffelig.

English: Well...a lot of work for not much meat. But it's better than starving.
Nynorsk: Vel, det er mykje arbeid for so lite kjøt. Men det er betre enn å sulte.

English: Two ways to harvest Rabbits, really. The slow way, and the fast way.
Nynorsk: det er to måter å fange kaninr på. Den langsomme og den raske.

English: Slow way is to make Snares and place them wherever you see a lot of Rabbits. Next day, you'll probably find some caught in your snare.
Nynorsk: Den langsomme måten er å lage snarer og plassere disse der kor du ser mange kaninr. Den neste dagen har du sikkert fanget nokon.

English: Pretty much. Whole Island's mostly abandoned now. Few scattered groups left. No real industry.
Nynorsk: Så godt som. Øya er nesten helt etterlatanå. Enkelte grupper igjen her og der. ikkje noko industri å snakke om.

English: Hit the with a rock. Stuns them. Then break their necks.
Nynorsk: Slå kaninn med ein stein. det svimeslår den. So knekker du nakken på den.

English: What, you don't mind shooting a wolf but you feel squeamish about a little rabbit?
Nynorsk: Hva, du synes det er greit å skyte ein ulv, men du ynker deg over ein liten kanin?

English: This isn't the city, Mackenzie. You can't just waltz in and buy a prime rib. There's no room for sentimentality here.
Nynorsk: Du er ikkje i byen nå, Mackenzie. Du kan ikkje berre valse inn og kjøpe ein fyrsteklasses ribbe. Sentimentalitet har ingen plass her.

English: You either toughen up, or you die.
Nynorsk: Enten vert du tøffere, eller so dør du.

English: Good. Can't be afraid to get your hands dirty out here.
Nynorsk: Bra. Du kan ikkje vera redd for å skitne til hendene dine her ute.

English: I'm sure it's no coincidence that most of the animals out here are made of meat, Mackenzie.
Nynorsk: Det er nok ingen tilfeldighet at de fleste dyrene her er laga av kjøt, Mackenzie.

English: Well, yeah...most of the year, you can subsist mainly on plants you can harvest. Berries. Nuts. Mushrooms. But, not much grows in Winter.
Nynorsk: Vel, det meste av året kan du leve av spiselige planter. Bær. Nøtter. Sopp. Men det er ikkje mykje som vokser om vinteren.

English: definitely. Cat Tails -- they don't taste like much but they'll keep you from starving. You usually find them near water.
Nynorsk: Absolutt. Dunkjevler. de smaker ikkje noko særlig, men de hindrer deg i å sulte. Du finner som regel plantene i nærheten av vann.

English: Reishi Mushrooms -- they grow on tree stumps. You can make a tea out of them.  A good natural antibiotic.
Nynorsk: Lakk-kjuke, som vokser på trestubber. Du kan lage te av dem. Eit naturlig antibiotikum.

English: Rose Hips -- they look like little red berries. Also good in a kind of tea. Great for treating pain.
Nynorsk: Nyper – de ser ut som små røde bær. Du kan lage te av dem, og de er flotte å lindre smerte med.

English:
This is on the first line
This should be on the second line
Nynorsk:
Dette er på fyrste linja
Dette skal vera på den andre linja

English:
This is on the first line
This should be on the second line
Nynorsk:
Dette er på fyrste linja
Dette skal vera på den andre linja

English:
This is on the first line
This should be on the second line
Nynorsk:
Dette er på fyrste linja
Dette skal vera på den andre linja

English: I did like you asked me. I took whatever I could find. If the situation is as bad as you said, it's everyone for themsjølves.
Nynorsk: Eg gjorde som du ba meg om. eg tok det eg kunne finne. Viss situasjonen er so ille som du sa, so må alle klare seg sjølv.

English: But...where are we on Great Bear? My plane went down in bad weather, and...
Nynorsk: Men kor på Sværebjørn er vi? Flyet mitt styrtet i dårlig vær, og …

English: No, I couldn't do it. I thought about what would happen if people came back and...couldn't bring myself to steal from them.
Nynorsk: Nei, eg klarte ikke. eg tenkte på kva som ville skje om folk kom Attende, og jeg … fikk meg ikkje til å stjele frå dem.

English: I did. I feel bad about taking other people's stuff but right now you need it more, and I can't waste any more time -- I need to find my friend.
Nynorsk: Ja. eg liker ikkje å ta andres ting, men akkurat no treng du det mer, og tiDen er knapp. eg må finne vennen min.

English: I know you're angry about people abandoning you here, but if someone comes back and they find all their food found its way into your pantry...they'll be even less likely to help you.
Nynorsk: Eg vet at du er sint på de som etterlot deg her, men om nokon kjem attende og finner maten sin i spiskammeret ditt, er det enda mindre sannsynlig at de vil hjelpe deg.

English: And I have a feeling that if someone comes back, you're going to need all the help you can get to make it through the Winter.
Nynorsk: Og eg har ein følelse av at om nokon vender Attende, kjem du til å trenge all den hjelpen du kan få, ellers klarer du deg ikkje gjennom vinteren.

English: So no...I didn't steal the gas station's supplies.
Nynorsk: Så nei, eg stjal ikkje forsyningene på bensinstasjonen.

English: But I found enough food to help you make it through the next few weeks, and I'll be back to check on you when I can.
Nynorsk: Men eg fant nok mat til at du klarer deg i nokon uker, og eg kjem attende når eg kan.

English: There are a lot of wolves out there.
Nynorsk: det er mange ulver der ute.

English: Any idea where I might find a way to defend myself?
Nynorsk: Du vet ikkje kor eg kan finne noko å forsvare meg med?

English: I'm looking for someone. She crashed with me, but I think she walked out...would have been when the lights first appeared.
Nynorsk: Eg ser etter nokon. Vi krasjet sammen, men eg tror hun gikk av gårde … det må ha vært da lysene først dukket opp.

English: She was there, at the bus. I'm sure of it.
Nynorsk: Ho var der, ved bussen. det er eg sikker på.

English: I think she left a sign for me. A word: PERSEVERANCE""
Nynorsk: Eg tror hun etterlot ein melding til meg. Ett ord: «utholdenhet».

English: I don't know. Maybe...she wanted me to know she wouldn't give up?
Nynorsk: Eg vet ikke. Kanskje hun ville vise at hun ikkje gjev opp?

English: It has to mean something more.
No. Because she wrote it in her own blood.
Nynorsk: Nei. Fordi hun skrev det i sitt eget blod.

English: Perseverance Mills. How do I get there?
Nynorsk: Trottug Møller. Korleis kjem eg meg dit?

English: You seem...distracted. Tired. Are you ok?
Nynorsk: Du virker fjern. Trøtt. Går det bra?

English: Are you talking about my friend?
Tell me more about this bank.
Usually banks are pretty secure. Not sure I'll be able to get in.
Nynorsk: Banker er vanligvis temmelig sikre. Vet ikkje om eg vil komme meg inn.

English:
I haven't seen paper money in...years.

What of value could possibly be left in the bank?
Nynorsk:
Eg har ikkje sett papirpenger på mange år.

Hvilke verdier kan det i hele tatt vera igjen i banken?

English: Why did you get me to steal these pearls from the bank?
Nynorsk: Hvorfor fikk du meg til å stjele de perlene frå banken?

English: My name's Mackenzie. And you are...
Nynorsk: Navnet er Mackenzie. Og du er …

English: No. He's dead. Looks like wolves got him.
Nynorsk: Nei. Han er død. Virker som ulvene tok ham.

English: All this time I thought you were talking about my friend.
Nynorsk: Eg trodde hele tiDen at du snakket om vennen min.

English: You said everyone is gone. What happened here?
Nynorsk: Du sa at alle har dratt. kva skjedde her?

English: Why would she be waiting for me by the Church? You aren't making any sense.
Nynorsk: Hvorfor skulle hun vente på meg ved kirken? det du sier, gjev ikkje mening.

English: I'll see what I can do.
Nynorsk: Eg skal se kva eg får til.

English: So...if everyone left, why are you still here?
Nynorsk: Viss alle har dratt – hvorfor er du er ennå?

English: What's the story with this bear?
Nynorsk: Hva er det med deg og denne bjørnen?
Høres ut som ein dårlig deal.

English: You want something stronger than painkillers?
Nynorsk: Vi du ha noko sterkere enn smertestillende?

English: You seemed pretty excited when I mentioned Morphine.
Nynorsk: Du virket ganske opprømt da eg nevnte morfin.

English: The way it has to be?
Can you tell me more about the area around us?
Nynorsk: Kan du fortelle meir om nærområdet?

English: Sounds like a pretty quiet place.
Nynorsk: Høres ut som eit ganske rolig sted.

English: Seems odd to have a dam in such a pristine piece of wilderness.
Nynorsk: det virker rart å ha ein demning i slik urørt natur.

English: The dam looks like it's been abandoned for a while.
Nynorsk: det ser ut som demningen har vært etterlataein stund.

English: Well...that's a kind of progress right? People need jobs. Need to feed their families...
Nynorsk: Men er ikkje det eit slags fremskritt? Folk treng arbeid. de må jo fø familien …

English: You have some way to call out of here? Like a radio?
Nynorsk: Har du mulighet for å ringe ut herfra? ein radio eller noe?
Du er ikkje so glad i mennesker?

English: I really don't have time for this right now.
Nynorsk: Eg har virkelig ikkje tid til dette nå.

English: I've got this far without you, Trapper.
Nynorsk: Eg har kommet meg hit uten deg, pelsjeger.

English: Did you see the lights in the sky again?
Nynorsk: Så du lysene på himmelen igjen?

English: The lights...the aurora...seemed to power things up. Lights, mainly.
Nynorsk: Lysene … nordljoset … lot til å gi ting kraft. Først og fremst lamper.

English: You have anything electrical in here?
Nynorsk: Har du noko elektrisk her inne?

English: The wolves seemed scared of the light.
No. Lights. Like lights around buildings. They avoided the lights.
Nynorsk: Nei. Lys. Som lys rundt bygninger. de unngikk lysene.

English: So...fuel. Where can I find some?
Nynorsk: Så … brensel. kor finner eg det?

English: Sure are a lot of wolves around here.
Nynorsk: det er sannelig mange ulver i området.

English: Maybe a bear's not the biggest of our worries.
Nynorsk: Kanskje vi har større bekymringer enn bjørnen.

English: And if I don't have any of those things?
Nynorsk: Og viss eg ikkje har noko slikt?

English: There's a theme here, isn't there?
Nynorsk: det er eit tema her, er det ikke?

English: When I was out there...came across mention of the Forest Talkers". You know anything about that?"
Nynorsk: Da eg var der ute, var det nokon som nevnte Skogpratarane. Vet du noko om dem?

English: What are they? Some kind of band? Or cult?
Nynorsk: Hvem er de? ein slags bande? Eller sekt?

English: So, terrorists, or activists? Which is it?
Nynorsk: Terrorister eller aktivister? kva er de?

English: You think it was the Forest Talkers?
At some point I'm going to need to get out of here and find my friend.
Nynorsk: Før eller sidan må eg komme meg ut herfra og finne vennen min.

English: Doesn't seem possible. When I was in there, the whole place seemed locked down. The parts that weren't falling down, anyway.
Nynorsk: Virker umulig. Stedet so avstengt ut da eg var der. I alle fall delene som ikkje holdt på å falle ned.

English: Make it where? Through the Dam?
What can you teach me about hunting?
Nynorsk: Hva kan du lære meg om jakt?

English: I don't have a few years.
Nynorsk: Eg har ikkje nokon år på meg.

English: Yeah, I'll give it a shot.
Not quite yet, but I'll come back to this.
Nynorsk: Ikkje helt, men eg kjem attende til dette.

English: Fishing. Do we really have time for this?
Nynorsk: Fisking. Har vi virkelig tid til dette?

English: You sure have a way with words.
Nynorsk: Du har ordet i din makt, det må eg si.

English: Why do I feel this is a thinly veiled scheme to get me to feed you for the Winter?
Nynorsk: Hvorfor føler eg at dette er ein dårlig tilslørt plan for å få meg til å skaffe deg mat til vinteren?

English: I'll be back with the fish.
I think I'd like to try something else first.
Nynorsk: Eg tror eg har lyst til å prøve noko annet først.

English: What do I need to know about clothing?
Nynorsk: Hva treng eg å vite om klær?

English: I'm telling you, I understand about taking care of gear.
Nynorsk: Tro meg, utstyr kan eg ta meg av.

English: Alright, I'll be back with your damn coat. Good as new.
Nynorsk: Ålreit, eg kjem attende med den forbaska jakka. So god som ny.

English: I'd rather learn something else first.
Nynorsk: Eg vil heller lære noko annet først.

English: What can you tell me about Rabbits? I seem them all over the place.
Nynorsk: Hva kan du lære meg om kaninr? eg ser dem overalt.
Men … de er so hjelpeløse. Og myke.

English: Yeah. Let's get this over with.
Nynorsk: Ja. La oss få det overstått.

English: I'm not sure I'm ready for this.
Nynorsk: Eg vet ikkje om eg er klar for dette.

English: Seems if you have your way, I'll never be a vegetarian out here.
Nynorsk: Viss du får viljen din, vert eg nok aldri vegetarianer her ute.

English: Aren't there any plants I can eat?
Nynorsk: Finnes det ingen planter eg kan spise?
Næh, eg vil heller prøve noko annet.

English: I heard a phone ring...in an old hunting lodge...where I found the extra rifle.
Nynorsk: Eg hørte ein telefon ringe … i ein gamal jakthytte, der kor eg fant det ekstra børseet. eg svarte, men linjen var hakkete.

English: Any idea where the call could have come from?
Nynorsk: Aner du kor anropet kan ha kommet fra?

English: Where could I find that out?
Nynorsk: Hvor kan eg finne ut av dette?
Eg skal ha det i bakhodet.

English: Let's talk about some survival skills.
Nynorsk: Eg skal lære deg korleis du overlever.

English: This is a big house. You live here by yourself?
Nynorsk: dette er eit stort hus. Bor du her alene?

English: It's ok...I'm not here to take anytelse from you. Are you with the Forest Talkers?
You don't, but I'm not. Maybe I can help?
I have a feeling "the world" has bigger problems right now, but I'll see what I can do.
I've got your supplies and those documents you wanted here.
Sure, I get it. I'll leave everything here for you.
Right. I'll...uh...leave it all here for you, just like you asked.
Hey? You still alive in there?
Come back when you've sorted out my firewood situation. If you come back at all.
Nynorsk: Kom attende når du har skaffet ved. Viss du er i stand til å komme Attende.

English: Yeah. I'm curious about what happened here.
Nynorsk: Ja. eg lurer på kva som skjedde her.

English: I mean...I know about the quakes. We experienced them too, on the Mainland.
Nynorsk: Eg mener … eg kjenner til jordskjelvene. Vi opplevde dem på fastlandet òg.

English: I mean...no better than most people. No worse.
Nynorsk: Eg mener … ikkje betre enn folk flest. Eller verre.
Eg kan ta vare på meg sjølv.
Eg skal ha det i bakhodet.

English: You've mentioned the Collapse a couple of times. I know it's been rough, but...
Nynorsk: Du har nevnt Samanbrotet eit par ganger. eg vet at det har vært tøft, men …

English: I'd like to understand how it affected Milton and other areas more. I had no idea...
Nynorsk: Eg vil gjerne vite hvorfor det påvirket Milton og andre områder mer. eg ante ikke …

English: Milton seems very remote. What do you do in medical emergencies?
Nynorsk: Milton virker veldig avsidesliggende. kva gjer dere i medisinske nødssituasjoner?

English: There are...a lot of wolves around.
Nynorsk: det er … mange ulver i området.

English: You think I could...borrow that Rifle of yours?
Nynorsk: Du tror ikkje eg kan låne børseet ditt?

English: Of course not! But it would be nice to have a bit more protection out there.
Nynorsk: Så klart ikke! Men det hadde vært fint å ha litt meir beskyttelse der ute.

English: Surely someone else in this town must have owned a gun of some kind.
Nynorsk: det var helt sikkert andre i byen som òg eide eit våpen av eit slag.

English: What can you tell me about Great Bear?
Nynorsk: Hva kan du fortelle meg om Sværebjørn?

English: I only have what I had on me when I crashed.
Nynorsk: Eg har berre det eg hadde på da flyet styrtet.
det går bra med føttene mine.

English: Can you tell me more about this area?
Nynorsk: Kan du fortelle meg meir om området?

English: Is there anyone else left in town?
Nynorsk: Er det nokon andre igjen i byen?

English: Seems like the more I know about the area, the better chances I have of surviving.
Nynorsk: det virker som sjansen for å overleva øker jo meir eg vet om området.

English: There seem to be a lot of wolves around Mystery Lake.
Nynorsk: det ser ut til å vera mange ulver rundt Løyndomsvatnet.

English: You have any suggestions for how I should deal with them?
Nynorsk: Har du nokon forslag til korleis eg skal hanskes med dem?

English: I'm keeping my eyes open for them.
What do you know about the dam?
Seems like a weird place to build a dam, though.
Nynorsk: det virker som eit merkelig plass å bygge ein demning.

English: Your Bearskin coat -- it looks really warm.
Nynorsk: Bjørneskinnsjakken din ser veldig varm ut.

English: Seems like the weather can turn at any moment out here.
Nynorsk: det virker som været kan snu på eit blunk her ute.

English: I'd rather not, to be honest.
Nynorsk: det vil eg helst unngå, for å vera ærlig.

English: So...Great Bear. You lived here long?
Nynorsk: Så … Sværebjørn. Har du bodd her lenge?

English: Well...if I'm going to be stuck here, I'd like to know a bit more about what I'm up against.
Nynorsk: Vel, viss eg må verta værende her, vil eg gjerne vite litt meir om kva eg står overfor.

English: It's almost like Great Bear doesn't exist for the people who don't live here.
Nynorsk: det er nesten som Sværebjørn ikkje eksisterer for folk som ikkje bor her.

English: I guess people get...caught up in their own little world.
Nynorsk: Folk vert vel … opphengt i sin egen lille verden.

English: Don't tell me...correspondence from personals ads?
Nynorsk: Ikkje si det … korrespondanse frå kontaktannonser?

English: Ok. You want me to get them and bring 'em back?
Nynorsk: Ok. Du vil eg skal finne dem og ta dem med til deg.

English: Got it. Find them. Burn them. Where are they?
Nynorsk: Forstått. Finn dem. Brenn dem. kor er de?

English: What do you need a bunker for out here?
Nynorsk: Kva treng du ein bunker til her ute?

English: Surely...someone will come looking. Someone will send help. Search and rescue? The military? The government?
Nynorsk: nokon vil sikkert komme for å lete. nokon vil sende hjelp. Ein redningsaksjon? Militæret? Myndighetene?

English: You don't think help is coming?
Nynorsk: Du tror ikkje det kjem hjelp?

English: That was a long time ago. Things are different now.
Nynorsk: det var lenge siden. Ting er annerledes nå.

English: You keep calling me a Mainlander. Why?
Right...but I mean...you sound angry about it.
Nynorsk: Eg forstår … Men det høres ut som det gjer deg sint.

English: How do you know? I mean...you can't...
Nynorsk: Korleis vet du det? eg mener … du kan ikke …

English: I guess I don't know that much...about the history.
Nynorsk: Eg kan visst ikkje so mykje om historien.

English: Can you tell me more about the angry voices you heard?
Nynorsk: Kan du fortelle meg meir om de sinte stemmene du hørte?

English: And the woman? The one whose voice you heard?
Nynorsk: Og kvinnen? Ho du hørte stemmen til?

English: The scream...could it have been the woman?
Nynorsk: Skriket … Kan det ha vært kvinnen?
Eg hater å spørre, men … mat.

English: But...what if people come back? Won't I be taking what they need to survive?
Nynorsk: Men kva om folk kjem Attende? Tar eg ikkje det de treng for å overleve?

English: What did they steal from you?

Nynorsk: Eg skal se kva eg får til.

English: What is this place? This town?
Nynorsk: Hva er dette for eit sted? denne byen?

English: A town like Milton -- where do supplies come from?
Nynorsk: En by som Milton – kor kjem forsyningene fra?

English: I don't know. Local stuff. Farms? Producers on the Island?
Nynorsk: Eg vet ikke. Lokalt. Gårder? Produsenter på øya?

English: Times were hard for everyone back then. Still are. You aren't the only ones to have suffered. In the cities...
Nynorsk: det var vanskelige tider for alle den gangen. det er det fortsatt. dere er ikkje de eneste som har lidd. I byene –

English: You said there were others? Other...outsiders?
Nynorsk: Du sa det var andre? Andre … fremmede?

English:
All wildlife have vanished, but are they gone for good? Hunt for Candy Bars to sustain you, as well as any other resources that might keep you alive through the coming days. 

Look for special Supply Caches in each Region for extra help against the cold and the dark.

Wolves have returned to Great Bear Island. Use your wits, and whatever you managed to scrounge already, in order to survive. Along with calorie-rich Candy Bars, seek out special Supply Caches for tools and items to help you fend off predators.

The Aurora has filled the sky, provoking every wolf you run into. While hunting for Candy Bars and other survival gear, look for special, high-powered Flashlights to help keep the wolves at bay. 

With the Aurora out in force, a Supercharged Flashlight might make all the difference.

Wolves and the Aurora are gone, but a monster blizzard has moved in. In these frigid temperatures, being indoors wonвЂ™t save you. As you search for Candy Bars, Pumpkin Pies, and special Supply Caches, stay close to a fire...or else.

Can you survive the night?

4 Days of Night returns! Through Halloween, experience endless night in The Long DarkвЂ™s northern Canadian wilderness. This year weвЂ™ve created a unique game mode around the event, with dynamic daily challenges and exclusive rewards for those who survive multiple days. 
 
 When: Oct 27 (11 pm PDT) вЂ“ Oct 31 (11 pm PDT) 
 
 How to Play: During the event you will find the 4DoN game mode in the Main Menu alongside our WINTERMUTE, Survival, and Challenge Modes. All standard game modes remain unchanged. 
 
 Rewards: Master the darkness! Survive enough hours, over multiple days of the event, and earn special in-game Badges.
 
 Daily Challenge: You wonвЂ™t see a sunrise, but each day of the event brings a new set of challenges to survivors in The Long Dark. Beginning in Coastal Highway, explore a handpicked selection of Great Bear Island Regions as you seek out unique items to try and hold back the night.
What a shot, can't believe we got up there!
Bleak, desolate, sublime. A memory I [...smudged...]

I found a very special place today. It’s not the highest peak near Timberwolf, but it might have the sweetest view of Crystal Lake I've found up there. Just stunning.
- L.
Had a nice look at Mule Bridge and the falls, but from the other side. What a climb.
Found a higher spot to get a shot of the prison for you. Tried to make it scenic. Are power lines scenic?

Snapped a pic, thought you might like one.
Hard to believe how long we stuck it out in that damn fish biz. I swear I can still smell it sometimes!
- J.

WAAA-HOOOO!! Great Bear isn't what I expected. It’s even better. The locals look at me funny when I tell them my hobby, but I make do. So many ruins to pick through. I found this empty lookout tower near the coast that made for some spooky photos.
- B.

A ranger let me into this old Forestry Lookout near Mystery Lake. Didn't stay long. The wind sure howls up there at night!
- H.

The view up here is amazing! You can see the entire Lake region almost. A tough climb up all those ropes, but so worth it. I'll show you the spot next time we’re out there.
- B.

Hey bud! I was up and about the other day finally. Got all the way up above Milton, near the tower up there. Leg’s feeling great!
- Dad

Just past those old, rotting foundations up there, near the edge. One hell of a view.

– H

Took a wrong turn after leaving the Airfield. Found myself a little cave with a distant waterfall in sight. Peaceful.

– S

Some wandering last winter took me to the strangest, most desolate part of Great Bear. Looking out over this broken marshland, I couldn't help but think of you. What a time we had!
- C.

These lousy towers keep me so busy I snapped a pic just for you. This is what keeps me away from home all these weeks! But I'm almost done.
- L.

Look at this spot! Had to climb like hell to get all the way up there, but it was worth it. 
Even saw a rainbow. :)
- N.

This is what I see everyday at work! Weather service radio, with a touch of music when I get the chance.
Who needs the Mainland?
- S.

You wouldn't believe it if I told you where I've been today!! :)
All the way up Timberwolf. A slog, but I made it. Can’t believe how clear the sky is at night.
- A.

Name of a town in The Long Dark.

English: We need a...doctor… or medical assistance. Anything.

Wes,
I'm going to try to make it to Mystery Lake. I'm running low on everything, but  we can find enough to get us through 'til spring, and then we can try to make it back to Calgary. Meet me there...we'll stay for a while. Follow the tracks in from the Carter...you'll see the lodge building, but we'll make for the cabins across the lake. Bring anybody you can find. Bring food. And a deck of cards.

See you soon,
Heather

(Contributed by Backer #4675)

Beentsy and I came up this way in the summers, when we were knock-kneed goofy kids. We fished and played with swords made out of sticks, wove leaky baskets from the reeds.
You could row across the lake. Those little cabins at the far end, where the tourists came and fished, hunted the deer and had their parties. We stood behind the counter and watched Dad welcome them, looked at the guest book and read the names.
When the summer was nearing its end, and the cattails turned to fluff, we blew our wishes to the sky. Always to come back. Always. 

(Contributed by Backer #4675)

There's nothing left. The matches got wet, and I'm down to a couple of tins of peaches and a can of pop. I don't know what to do. I want to go...but where do I go? Those wolves...those WOLVES. Everywhere, scratching at the door, pawing at the windows...waiting. Waiting.
A dull knife. A rock. A length of rope. It's like one of those jokes you hear about, when three guys walk into a bar, and the bartender says, 'hey, you can't bring rope in here.' Something about a frayed knot. Something like that. 

(Contributed by Backer #4675)
Notes:
Heather Clitheroe  - 4675
GEAR_BackerNote1C
ML, outside lake cabin

English:
A flat sand or river stone, three inches in width, at least six inches long is ideal for sharpening your blade. Axe or knife, you will want to lubricate the surface with water to keep the filings in suspension, and your work will go faster. When no light is visible along the cutting edge, you’ve reached your mark. Strop along a piece of leather for final honing. The importance of a sharp tool cannot be overstated.

(Contributed by Backer #3781)
Notes:
Alex Doherty - 3781
GEAR_BackerNote2A
Hibernia, work bench

English:
As a plant goes to seed in the fall, a period of hibernation sets in until spring. As the weather warms, plant seeds into loose soil with plenty of sun. Keep moist but not wet. If the final frost has not passed, keep seedlings indoors at night, as a single shock of cold can stun if not kill young plants outright. Spread plantings out over several months to keep producing into the fall. Green leafy vegetables will survive the following winter indoors.

(Contributed by Backer #3781)

Bread is about 2 parts flour to 1 part water. Add equal parts salt and rising agent, a small pile about the size of a quarter (Yeast if you’re lucky, baking soda if you’re not.) Raw dough should be tacky but not wet after kneading. Heat at 400F/200C for 30 minutes if the oven works. If you only have a fire, drop the dough in a heavy, preheated pan, and rotate every 10 minutes until evenly brown, and you hear a hollow sound when tapping the crust.

(Contributed by Backer #3781)
Notes:
Alex Doherty - 3781
GEAR_BackerNote2C
PV Farmhouse kitchen

English:
Two more joined us today. Seems their horse couldn't go any further. One of them's called Sean. He’s from Ireland. Not quite home, but close enough. Apparently he came here for an acting career. Best thing though, is that he's got a bag of Fruit Pastilles that he's going to share just with me!
Probably for the best since everyone's so paranoid. The other idiots would probably think he was trying to poison them. I thought it would be safer this far north, less people and all. Maybe I should leave?

(Contributed by Backer #644)

We've lost a couple of people to hypoth hyperith the cold last night. There's only five of us left, but fortunately Sean's one of them. He's keeping me going and he even gave me his last Fruit Pastille. It's a shame we didn't know each other before The Event. He would have made a nice B/F.
I hate this place so much. I should have listened to mama. Doing the exchange student programme was the worst decision I've ever made.
I wonder if she's still alive?

(Contributed by Backer #644)

I keep hearing my mobile ring. Get excited every time. But it's just as dead as always when I check. I don't know why I still carry it around.
Sean's been my saviour, especially after Sue & Tori's suicide. He told me about how he always wanted to do Death of a Salesman. His American accent's pretty good too. We fell asleep in each other's arms last night.
Sean wouldn't wake up.

(Contributed by Backer #644)

You won't remember me. The world doesn't stop when the lights fade. This is how it begins. Stay calm. Observe. Survive. Your father saw this day. Don't believe what you hear. What he did was for a far off dawn. Maybe you can recall the fire? Your father understood that we dance for our children's children's children. My dear, one day you will feel the voices rise in your heart. Enter a cave and stand until stars appear. Climb the highest peak. Sing when the brutality hits. I'm here with you. The winter winds can only get so cold.

(Contributed by Backer #4783)

Do you see the stars? Do you see that you are there? It's a fault of the mind to perceive separation. The same fault creates time. Look around, observe. Your father was trying to preserve what we have. The boxes hold the seeds of the universe. Breathe deep and persist. Fix that goal in your mind. Concentrate on a single flower. You'll feel that warmth on your cheeks again. This is just a signal from beyond. It's just a passing cloud from another world. The songs of birds will fill pink skies. Remember, the weakest light breaks the deepest darkness.

(Contributed by Backer #4783)

The most violent storm always begins and ends in a whisper. I've left this place now because the last summer is coming. If you want to find me, I'm paddling across shattered ice, to the arctic sunset. These lights shouldn't be in the sky. It's a dance I don't know. Somehow we must progress from this. In a different age we walked out of the hot sands of the old continent. Now we're here again. The Long Dark is coming. All these tools will become useless. Take a step. Walk because it's your destiny to make it out of here. 

(Contributed by Backer #4783)
New Buffer Memory Added to Journal

English: The scrawled musings of a survivor who was here before you.
Nynorsk: Rabbel av ein overlevande som var her før deg.

Cloud files are newer than your local files. Do you want to download them?
Otherwise, your local files will be uploaded to Steam.
Your local files are newer than your Steam files. Do you want to upload them? Otherwise, your Steam files will be downloaded.
{Generic tag for setting up a first pass on new SS missions that check player statistics to add side content}
A note found at the Maintenance Shed with observations about the Aurora.

Those lights in the sky are doing some funny things to the machines around here. We found this old shed, and the computers started turning on by themselves, lamps lighting up. We’ve been trying to call down to the main office when the aurora or whatever it’s called is out, but we’re not getting through. Can’t tell if the phones even work. There are just a handful of us from the winter crew holed up here. Some of them want to try for the Coast and the settlements there. If you find this, that's where we've gone.
We’re still hoping Breyerhouse sends a team up before it comes to that. Even with the fire barrel we brought indoors, it’s a bitter cold.
Code needed to unlock the Bank Vault Door.
Nynorsk: Koden du treng til å opna bankkvelvet.

Notes: The coat the player needs to retrieve from trappers cabin

English: A bearskin coat that's seen better days.
Nynorsk: Ei bjørneskinnsjakke som har sitt betre dagar.

English: A piece of old newsprint, cracked and yellowed with age.

---

Five men, all serving life sentences at Blackrock Penitentiary, reportedly escaped the prison grounds last month.

Authorities revealed the escape in a leaked memo acquired by a coalition of media outlets currently investigating Canadian correctional facilities. Of the five, one returned on his own, one was found dead by pursuing officers, and three remain missing.

Prison officials seemed confident all three also died navigating the rough terrain that surrounds the notorious prison, according to the leaked memo.

---

We found more contraband noisemakers on the last sweep. Well-made, all things considered.

And with all the wolves moving into the region, maybe we can put them to good use. I bet they’re damn loud, so don’t go light them off unless you mean it!

-- K.
A torn, waterstained scrap of paper.

...something decent this time. Prices climbing.

Check possible bleed off down by that low creek -- warm day melts the shallow ice?

Red gold or something better? Gotta try.
A handwritten message with details on donated food rations.

Re: Donated food packs

We’re going to need some volunteers to dig into a few of these rations that got dropped on us.

We’ll be in the barracks tonight with the cook to open them up. If they’re any good we might just keep them for ourselves.

Show up at 7 if you’re interested.

-- Howie

Thinking of you out here, all alone.

Did it bring you something special? Leaving us like you did? And for what, for Blackrock?

We waited so long, papa. Did you think of us, at the end of things?

I’m glad I came all this way, finally. If only to see what it was all about, living in this defenseless place. I sat for a bit, listening for your voice. All I heard were wolves.

With a warm heart,

Bonnie
An old leaf of fine paper, covered in handwriting.

Maintenance Shift, #355

Staff reports instances of pressure loss when drawing power for internal detention cell control, notably in segregation units 4-7.

Check for adequate thermal regulation at steam junctions and valve switches. And see to scheduling any repairs as needed.
Official typewritten orders for Blackrock prison guards

TO: Officer Gray
FROM: Regional Deputy Commissioner Stevens
RE: Blackrock Transfer
Have we arranged additional officers for the upcoming inmate transfer? Roads and conditions are never good on Great Bear, and this year I am hearing they are even worse than usual. 
Let’s make sure we have enough help, where and when we need it. 
As you know, this bunch won't make it easy on us. 
 
Regards,
R. Stevens
Deputy Commissioner
Lyrics to the hymn DIES IRAE
Nynorsk: Teksten til salma «Dies irae» («Vreidedagen, han skal renna»)

English:
Latin column:
 
 Dies iræ, dies illa
 Solvet sæclum in favilla,
 Teste David cum Sibylla.
 
 Quantus tremor est futurus,
 Quando Judex est venturus,
 Cuncta stricte discussurus!
 
 Tuba mirum spargens sonum,
 Per sepulchra regionum,
 Coget omnes ante thronum.
 
 Mors stupebit eit natura,
 Cum resurget creatura,
 Judicanti responsura.
 
 English column:
 
 Day of wrath and doom impending.
 David's word with Sibyl's blending,
 Heaven and earth in ashes ending.
 
 Oh, what fear man's bosom rendeth,
 When from heaven the Judge descendeth,
 On whose sentence all dependeth.
 
 Wondrous sound the trumpet flingeth;
 Through earth's sepulchres it ringeth;
 All before the throne it bringeth.
 
 death is struck, and nature quaking,
 All creation is awaking,
 To its Judge an answer making.
Nynorsk:
Latin:
 
 Dies iræ, dies illa
 Solvet sæclum in favilla,
 Teste David cum Sibylla.
 
 Quantus tremor est futurus,
 Quando Judex est venturus,
 Cuncta stricte discussurus!
 
 Tuba mirum spargens sonum,
 Per sepulchra regionum,
 Coget omnes ante thronum.
 
 Mors stupebit eit natura,
 Cum resurget creatura,
 Judicanti responsura.
 
 Omsetjing:
 
 Vreidedagen, han skal renna 
 og til oske verdi brenna, 
 som Guds ord oss grant lèt kjenna.
 
 Redslerop mot himlen lomar når han kjem, 
 den høge domar.
 Tungt som klokkemalme det ômar.
 
 Domsbasun med tunge tonar
 stemner heimsens millionar
 fram for han som høgast tronar.

 Dauden og naturen tagnar,
 skræmde når til sist det dagnar
 og alt liv til domen vaknar.

English: A note to the congregation of St. Christopher's parish.
Nynorsk: En kunngjering til menigheita i St. Kristoffers kyrkje.

English:
dear Parishioners,
 
 It is with a heavy heart that I inform you of the Archdiocese's decision to withdraw me from St. Christopher’s parish, due to lack of activity. Though there have never been more than a few of you in recent years, your dedication to the Church and support of my efforts here will not be forgotten. Henceforth, services will be available via Skype only. Continued Latin lessons, also!
 
 Please accept my apologies. God bless.
 
 - Father Francis McGill
Nynorsk:
Kjære sognebarn
 
Det er med tungt hjarte eg forteller dette, men erkebispedømmet har bestemt at det på grunn av manglande aktivitet i menigheita i St. Kristoffers kyrkje ikkje lenger er behov for meg i prestegjeldet. Sjølv om de ikkje har vert mange dei siste åra, vil trugen dykkar til kyrkja og støtta til innsatsen min her ikkje verta glemt. Frå no av vil gudstjenestane berre vera tilgjengeleg via Skype. Dette gjeld òg latinundervisninga!
 
Eg beklagar på det sterkaste. Måtte Gud velsigne dykk.
 
 – Fader Francis McGill

English: I'm soakin right through this paper. All that's left of me those cowards. Like somethin jump up and bit me. Was wrong to follow Mathis. No leader. Don't trust him. Won't lead you home.
A handwritten note from one of the convicts.
Something out there huntin us. Didn't see em comin. Thought we lost the hacks down low by the road. Eyes open fellas or we'll never get outta here.
A handwritten note with the location of a hidden cache.
Use this stuff to push on up and and out of this place. No end to these hills but we got no other way. That thing is still out there.
A note describing a route to a hidDen cache of supplies.
Nynorsk: Ein lapp som beskriv vegen til ei skylt oppbevaring.

English:
This letter appears to have been written in charcoal and is smeared with dirt.
 
 "I've been stuck in this damn truck for eight hours while those wolves circle. Not sure I'll be able to get to the supply stash I left along the rail line in the marsh."
Nynorsk:
Dette brevet ser ut til ha vore skriven med trekol, sulka av mold.
 
I åtte timar har eg sete i den forbaska lastebilen medan ulvane sirklar rundt. Eg veit ikkje om eg kjem meg til oppbevaringa eg gjorde klart i myra ved toglinjene.

English: A hastily scribbled note pointing out a hidDen supply cache.
Nynorsk: Eit snøggt nedskribla notat som visar vegen til ein skylt oppbevaring.

English:
The penmanship on this note suggests the author was in a hurry.
 
 "I left it in the cave. Head back out from the dam. Follow the river. Look for a cave near a clearing with a hunter's blind."
Nynorsk:
Handskrifta tilseie at forfattaren hadde det travelt.
 
Eg lot tinga liggja igjen i hola. Fer ut av demningen. Flyg elva. Sjå etter ei hole i nærleiken av ei rydning med ein jakthytte.

English: Teksten på lappen er nesten ulesleg. Viss opplysningane var meina for nokon, vil han eller hun forhåpentligvis vera i stand til å tyde skriften. Heldigvis er det enkelte landemerker som kan gjenkjennes, samt ein tykk pil som peker mot ein stor X.

This small note looks to have been left for someone in particular. Hard to imagine, as the area is quite sparse.
 
 "A, 
 
 I'm heading to the clear cut - put some supplies aside for us. Away from prying eyes. If you need something, look for the old stump between two log piles.
 
 - K"
Nynorsk:
Det verkar som dette vesle notatet blei etterlaten til ein bestemt person. Det er litt rart, sidan området er tynt befolka.
 
 «A, 
 
Eg fer til den snauhogde opninga, la til side nokon forsyningar til oss. Vekke frå nysgjerrige folk. Treng du noko, so sjå etter den gamle stubben mellom dei to tømmerstablane.
 
 – K»

English: A crudely drawn map to a hidDen supply cache.
Nynorsk: Eit enkelt handteikna kart til ei skylt oppbevaring.

English: The text on this note is largely unreadable. If this message was meant for someone, hopefully they were able to decipher it. Fortunately, there are a handful of recognizable landmarks - and a bold arrow pointing to a large 'X'.
Nynorsk: Teksten på lappen er nesten uleselig. Viss opplysningene var meint for nokon, vil han eller ho forhåpentleg vera i stand til å tyda skrifta. Heldigvis er det nokon landemerker som kan gjenkjennast, samt ein tjukk pil som peikar mot ein stor X.

English: A neatly written note suggesting the location of some supplies.
Nynorsk: Eit fint skriven notat som antydar posisjonen til nokon forsyningar.

English:
The penmanship on this scrap paper seems out of place in this wilderness.
 
 "I never really expected to be back here. Nor truly expected that you would be here either. But I had hoped. If you find this, know that I left something for you. HidDen away from those who simply take what they will."
Nynorsk:
Handskrifa på denne lappen høyrar ikkje helit heima i denne ville naturen.
 
Eg trudde aldri eg ville koma attende her. Eg forventa heller ikkje at du ville vera her. Men håp hadde eg. Viss du les dette, skal du veta at eg la igjen noko til deg. Skylt for dei som berre tar det dei vil ha.

English: An expletive filled note pointing to a cache of supplies.
Nynorsk: Eit notat som peikar til ei oppbevaring med forsyningar.

English:
Judging by the amount of blood frozen on this page, the author wasn't doing too well when they wrote it.
 
 "First it was the EXPLETIVE rancid meat. Then the sprained ankle. Then the EXPLETIVE convict out of nowhere. Gave him the slip by falling down into a damn ravine. Of course, that's when the EXPLETIVE wolves came. Dropped my stuff and ran. As much as I could with a sprained ankle. If you're reading this - this is as far as I got.
 
 Should've never tried to leave Milton."
Nynorsk:
Alt blodet som er frose til arket, det stod nok ikkje so bra til med forfattaren då meldinga vart skriven.
 
Fyrst var det det forbaska forderva kjøtet. Deretter ein rengja ankel. Og so den jævla fengselsfuglen som dukka opp ut av det blå. Eg kom meg vekk då eg datt ned i eit klov. Sjølvsagt var det då dei helvetes ulvane dukka opp. Eg slapp sakane mine og sprang so fort som faen med ein forstuet ankel. Viss du les dette, vel, det var so langt eg kom.
 
Eg burde aldri ha prøvd å forlata Milton.

English: Note found in bunker near Skeeter's Ridge.
A storm’s comin. No man knows when, but I can smell it. Can’t stop it. All a man can do is hide out while it blows over.
Note found in bunker near Three Strikes.

All these quakes are a sign. Old world’s comin down around me. Got to be on the move, can't stay still.
Got to get away, got to get up higher. Someplace in the open sky. Past the timberline. Way up.
A Forest Talker memo containing the location of a prepper bunker.
This old guy has struck off who knows where. But there's bound to be some gear left behind. Anyway we're out of options. -- M.
Flyer found in the debris of MacKenzie's plane
Nynorsk: Flygeblad frå vraket av Mackenzies fly.

English: Hand-drawn route to an abandoned rail yard.
Nynorsk: Handtegna kart til eit etterlata verkstadområde.
Verkstadområde. Det kan vera forsyningar der.
Notat om skylt oppbevaring ei hole

English: There are some supplies hidDen under a pile rocks in a cave near the Radio Tower.
Nynorsk: Du kan finna nokon forsyningar under ein steinhaug i ei hole i nærleiken av radiotårnet.

English: "I don't trust anyone anymore. People are getting desperate, and it's only been a few days since the power went out. I'm going to stash some supplies in our special place above town. You know, near where we look at the stars together? We may need them before help gets here.
Nynorsk: Eg stolar ikkje lenger på nokon. Folk begynnar å verta desperate, og det er berre nokon få dagar sidan straumen vert vekke. Eg skal gøyma nokon forsyninger på den spesielle staden vår over byen. Du veit, like ved der me ser på stjernene saman? Det kan vera me treng forsyningane før det kjem hjelp.
Notat om skylt oppbevaring i Milton

English: A note found in a discarded vehicle in Milton.
Nynorsk: Eit notat funnet i eit etterlata køyretøy i Milton.

English: Hey girl -- that grumpy jerk at Orca left the back door open so I snuck in and took some stuff. I thought we might need it for when we get out of here. I can't wait to get over to the mainland with you, where we can finally be together "for real". I'll meet you there tomorrow night like we planned. I stashed the stuff near that big fallen tree in the marshy area behind St. Christopher's. You know, where we met that one time and drank your dad's contraband.
Notes: HidDen cache can be located under a log, near the Church Marsh
Nynorsk: Hei, du. Den surpompen på bensinstasjonen lot bakdøra stå open, so eg sneik meg inn og tok nokon greier. Eg tenkte me kunne få bruk for tinga når me stikk her i frå. Eg ser fram til å koma meg til fastlandet saman med deg, so kan me endeleg vera saman på skikkeleg vis. Eg møter deg der i morgon kveld som avtalt. Eg gøymde tinga i nærleiken av det store, nedfalte treet i sumpområdet bak St. Kristoffers. Du huskar sikkert der me møttest den gongen og drakk smuglarspriten til far din.
Offisiell kunngjering til medlemmar av Milton Bank.

English: Official communication to members of the MCU.
Nynorsk: Offisiell kunngjering til medlemmar av Milton Kredittkasse.

English:
September, 2012
 
 dear members,
 
 Due to global economic realities that are well known to you, we are unfortunately unable to remain in operation. All banking services are hereby suspended until further notice.
 
 - Management
Nynorsk:
September 2012
 
Kjære medlemar
 
På grunn av den globale økonomiske situasjonen er me dessverre ikkje i stand til å fortsetja drifta. Alle våre banktenester er hermed lagt ned inntil vidare.
 
 – Leiinga
