Official typewritten orders to Blackrock security guards with handwritten addendum.

Orders: meet Blackrock Transport bus at PV town. Assist in prisoner transportation. Warning these are dangerous and difficult persons, treat with extreme caution
 handwritten: Guard note - Bus hasn't arrived, setting up roadblock and temporary base at nearby barn
An old ID badge, scuffed and faded.
An old ID badge, scuffed and faded.
A book with details about a local pond and its strange aquatic residents.

Children playing along Pensive Pond know him as Big Eddie. He'd eat every bit of bread, meat or other foodstuffs they would toss into the water, hoping to lure the massive fish to the surface. Of course, being children, their fascination with the creature meant they could spend hours along the banks of the pond, waiting for him to appear.
Others in the Valley, being of more restrained disposition, felt obliged to leave the fish in peace. Who can say what the truth of the story might be?
A book with details about a strange cave thought to exist on the margins of Pleasant Valley.

A right of passage for the few younger folk who remained in Pleasant Valley during recent years, hunting for the cave was one way to seek refuge from the reality of the region's extreme isolation. 
A way to leave, without leaving.
A book with details about a spectral creature thought to inhabit a local farmstead.

Long battered by harsh winters and isolation, Pleasant Valley residents often sought refuge and comfort in nature. A favourite pastime was standing watch for a legendary stag, which the older locals claimed could bring about a special insight. 
That is if you could ever find the wild creature. Whether it was the mysterious animal itself, or the very act of peaceful observation which brought this new awareness to light, no one rightly knows any more.
A book with details about a mysterious presence stalking the forests of Pleasant Valley.

No one knows how long rumors of Sasquatch activity have persisted among Valley residents. But it's common knowledge that the longer people have lived in this region, the more strange tales have emerged about figures in the woods.
A public notice announcement from The Great Bear Water Authority.
Nynorsk: Ein offentleg kunngjering frå Sværebjørn vassverk.

English:
June 30th, 2012
 
 Due to recent seismic activity, the underground water mains in Milton have been shut down. An outbreak of E.coli exposed several faults in the system. We recommend using bottled water until further notice.
 
 Great Bear Water Authority
Nynorsk:
30. juni 2012
 
På grunn av seismisk aktivitet har dei underjordiske vassledningene i Milton vorte stengt. Eit E.coli-utbrudd avslørte fleire svakheitar i systemet. Me anbefalar vatn på flaske inntil vidare.
 
Sværebjørn vassverk

English: Flyer for a local event at the Thomson's Crossing Community Hall.
Note with locations of a few hidden caches.

If you all made it this far, you’ve still got a ways to go. But there’s help.

Look for these supplies on the way. This is all you're gonna get from me. I'd wish you luck but there's none left to go around.

[hand-sketched map with supply locations]
The personal writings of anonymous convict written on loose pages that were hidden in his bag.

They got me set up with the usual hard cases. Nothin I haven't seen before, but this place feels like the end of some kinda road. Have to find a way back anyhow.
Storms out this way are worst I've seen. Days go by, same wind blowin. They packed us away, pop. Froze us up out here. To cold to work, just sit thinkin all the time. Stuck with what I done.

Notes: A note containing the Dam's entry code number

English: A note containing the Dam's Control Room entry code number
Notes: A note containing the Dam's entry code number
Nynorsk: En lapp med koden til kontrollromet i demningen.

English: Jeremiah's code for the Dam's Control Room: 7611 Use it when the aurora is in the sky!
Nynorsk: Jeremiah sin kode til kontrollromet i demningen: 7611. Nytt han når nordljoset er på himmelen.

Notes: A note containing the Dam Control Rooms's entry code number

English: A note containing the Dam's Control Room entry code number
Notes: A note containing the Dam Control Rooms's entry code number
Nynorsk: Ein lapp med koden til kontrollromet i demningen.

English: Jeremiah's code for the Dam's Control Room: 7611 Use it when the aurora is in the sky!
Notes: The Dam Control Room entry code
Nynorsk: Jeremiah sin kode til kontrollromet i demningen: 7611. Nytt den når nordljoset er på himmelen.

English: This door uses a keypad for opening and closing. Requires electricity.

Carter Hydro Dam Maintenance Ticket: The elevator is acting up again. We've checked the mechanicals and they seem fine. Must be something glitchy in the electrical system. Keep an eye on it. It's really the only way to the Turbine Room. If the elevator gets stuck, it'll be a LONG walk before you can get back into the Control Room.
Notes: A memo found in the Dam referncing the elevator problems. (Foreshadowing future elevator breakdown!)
Nynorsk: Notat om vedlikehald i Carter-demningen: Heisen gjer seg vanskeleg igjen. Me har sjekka det mekaniske, og det ser ut til å vera i orden. Det må vera eit eller anna feil med det elektriske systemet. Hald eit auge med det. Heisen er eigentleg den einaste vegen til turbinrommet. Viss heisen vert stående, har de ein LANG gåtur føre dykk for å koma inn i kontrollrommet.

English: 4973. Please remember this time. Don't get locked out.
Nynorsk: 4973. Husk koden denne gongen. Ikkje vert låst ute.

Notes: key for the Admin Office room in the Dam

English: Key to the Administration office at Carter Hydro Energy.
Notes: key for the Admin Office room in the Dam
Nynorsk: Nykel til kontoret til Carter vasskraft.

English: Key to the maintenance stairway in Carter Hydro Dam.
A note found in the Trailers outside Carter Dam.
Notes: Note found in logging trailer next to the Carter Dam gate key.

English:
To: Breyerhouse Winter Teams
Re: Carter Dam Reminder
We know some of you like to hang out in the Dam during your breaks and off-hours, but the whole facility is still a no-go. The place is falling apart and unsafe to enter, especially the Lower Dam.
If you need another reason, our insurance won’t kick in if you hurt yourself in there. You’ll be on your own. 
- Crew 17 Foreman
A satchel full of old blasting caps. Miners use them to detonate dynamite in controlled explosions.

Notes: climb down ladder inside dam elevator shaft (to turbine room)

English: An attachment for manually raising and lowering the mine elevator.
Electrical fuse. Looks old, but appears to be in working order.
Note found accompanying an Emergency Kit
Nynorsk: Notat funnet saman med eit fyrstehjelpskrin.

English:
This Emergency Kit is distributed, free of charge, by the Great Bear Earthquake Memorial Society (GBEMS). Our non­profit work helps guarantee full preparedness for any
  future emergencies on Great Bear.
 Our motto: WE REMEMBER.
Nynorsk:
Dette fyrstehjelpskrinet delast ut gratis av Minneforeninga for jordskjelvet på Sværebjørn (MJSB). Vårt frivilligheitsarbeid hjelp innbyggjarane å vera godt forberedt til eventuelle
framtidige naudsituasjoner på Sværebjørn.
Vårt motto: ME HUSKAR.

English: Dusty case holding medical supplies for the Carter Hydro first aid station. Looks like it hasn't been touched in a while.
Notes: A small package containing various medical supplies.
Nynorsk: Ein støvete boks med medisinske forsyningar til Carter-demningens fyrstehjelpstasjon. Den ser ikkje ut til å ha vært rørt på ei stund.

English: A note with details on weather in the Milton area.

WEATHER WARNING
HEAVY SNOW AND RECORD LOW TEMPERATURES EXPECTED
[Scrawled in handwriting below]
“She won't like it one bit, but we’ll need to check on her. Someone has to.”
No additional treatment needed right now.
Astrid's handwritten note describing a treatment plan for this patient.

Notes: The hardcase found in Astrid's backpack at the crash site.

English: Hardcase found in Astrid's backpack at the crash site
Nynorsk: Metallskrin funne i Astrid sin ransel på krasjstaden.

English: Vials of morphine and injectable antibiotics.
High-quality, injectable medication. The label reads, “FOR EMERGENCIES ONLY”.
Helps to regulate levels of blood glucose.
Search the Forestry Lookout for a hunting Rifle
Find and repair the hunting Rifle.
Use the code to unlock the door.
Jeremiah has told you about the location of a hidDen bunker in the Forlorn Muskeg. There are some letters there he wants you to burn for him.
Nynorsk: Jeremiah har fortalt deg kvar det er ein skylt bunker i den aude myra. Det er nokon brev der han vil du skal brenna for han.

English: Enter the bunker when the Aurora is active.
Nynorsk: Gå inn i bunkeren medan nordljoset er aktivt.

English: Search the cave for your Bear Spear.
If you don't kill the Old Bear, you'll never make it out of Mystery Lake alive. Finish what Jeremiah started.
Nynorsk: Viss du ikkje drep Gamlebjørn, kjem du deg aldri ut av Løyndomsvatnet i live. Fullfør det Jeremiah starta.

English: A man-killing bear is on the prowl, risking Mackenzie's mission to find Astrid. But an old Voyageur legend might hold the answer to overcoming the massive predator.
Retrieve the legendary Spear from the Hunting Lodge.
Find the cured maple cache in Forlorn Muskeg.
Repair the broken Bear Spear at the Forge.
Use your map to track the Bear to his favourite haunts in Mystery Lake.
Nynorsk: Nytt kartet til å spore opp bjørnen der den likar å jakta i Løyndomsvatnet.

English: Bring the Old Bear's Ear back to Jeremiah, as proof of your hunting prowess.
Nynorsk: Ta bjørnen sitt øyre med attende til Jeremiah for å visa at du er ein dyktig jeger.

English: It appears a number of survivors from the Blackrock prison bus crash have found their way into Pleasant Valley. Investigate to see if the events in Milton have followed you through the mountains.
It appears a number of survivors from the Blackrock prison bus crash have found their way into Pleasant Valley. Investigate to see if the events in Milton have followed you through the mountains.
Find guards at the Pleasant Valley Outbuildings.
Follow the storm line to retrieve the guards' ammo stash
Track the fleeing guard to her snow shelter
Search for more signs of the escaped convicts.
Locate and use the keys that unlock Lockers found at the Blackrock Penitentiary.
More help from Astrid's mysterious rescuer. As a local, Molly's help could be vital to surviving the harsh wilderness in Pleasant Valley.
Find and search the car trunk Molly mentioned.
Clear out Grey Wolves from the pond.
Clear out Grey Wolves from the forest.
Search behind the loose boards in the basement.

A thief has stolen an Artifact from the Church at Thomson's Crossing. In such a remote town, it's likely the Artifact has great value to the residents. See what you can do to locate the item and return it home.
Search the Church for more information about the theft.
Investigate the cabin near Skeeter's Ridge, the police suspect was last seen there.
Return the Artifact to the church.
An escaping convict left some hidden caches to help the other convicts following him.
Find all the convict's hidden caches.
Survivors of an airline crash in the mountains have found their way to the Community Hall in Thomson's Crossing. There might be others out there in need of help. Can you save them?
Place Gwen in an unoccupied bed.
Bring Gwen to the Community Hall.
Help any survivors found near the plane.
Use bolt cutters to enter airliner.
Try to climb out of the ravine.
Notes: Used for before you've slept off the injuries

English: You've crashed in the Northern wilderness and are badly injured. Survive long enough for your neve to heal, so you can climb out.
Notes: The plane has gone down, stuck in a ravine with an injury.
Nynorsk: Du har styrta i audemarka i nord og er hardt skada. Overlev til handa din er betre sånn at du kan klyve ut.

English: You've crashed in the Northern wilderness and are badly injured. Do what you can to survive and start the search for Astrid.
If you remain exposed you'll die. Find a cave to shelter from the elements.
Nynorsk: Viss du ikkje finner ly, vil du døy. Finn ein hole som beskyttar deg mot vêret.

English: Start a fire so you don't freeze to death.
Nynorsk: Lag eit bål so du ikkje frys i hel.

English: Produce some water and drink it to stay hydrated.
Nynorsk: Kok litt vann, og drikk det for å unngå dehydrering.

English: Find and eat some food to keep your strength.
Nynorsk: Finn og et litt mat for å behalde styrka di.

English: You have a bleeding wound. Find or make a bandage and use it to stop the blood loss.
Nynorsk: Du har eit sår som blør. Finn eller lag ein bandasje, og bruk han til å stoppa blødinga.

English: Treat the risk of infection before it develops into something more serious.
Nynorsk: Behandla infeksjonsfaren før du får ein alvorlig infeksjon.

English: Ein liten saltvatnsfisk, har fått namnet sitt av sin regnbogeglans.
Nynorsk: Finn eller lag ein ny bandasje

English: Build a fire in the cave that will last the night (9 hrs).
Nynorsk: Lag eit bål som vil vara heile natta (9 timar) i holen.

English: Get your body temperature up. Warm yourself by the fire for a while.
Nynorsk: Få opp kroppstemperaturen. Varm deg ved bålet ei stund.

English: You need food to survive. Scavenge what you can and eat until you're full.
Nynorsk: Du treng mat for å overleva. Sjå om du finn noko, og et deg mett.

English: See if you're strong enough to climb out of the ravine.
Nynorsk: Sjå om du er sterk nok til å klyve ut av slukta.

English: Collect Rosehips and make Rosehip Tea to treat your pain.
Nynorsk: Samle nyper og lag nypete mot smertane.

English: Your neve feels stronger now. It's time to climb out of the ravine.
Nynorsk: Handa din kjennast sterkare ut no. Det er tid for å klyve ut av slukta.

English: Locate and use the keys that unlock various Safety deposit boxes at the Milton Credit Union.
Nynorsk: Finn nyklane og lås opp bankboksane i Milton bank.
Finn oppbevaringa i hola til Alan i Løyndomsvatnet.

English: Find the cache in the Clear Cut in Mystery Lake.
Nynorsk: Finn oppbevaringa i den snauhogde opninga i Løyndomsvatnet.

English: Find the cache near the old Hunting Lodge in the Broken Railroad Region.
Nynorsk: Finn oppbevaringa i nærleiken av den gamle jakthytta i øydelagt jernbane.

English: Find the cache of flares near the cave you entered Mystery Lake.
Nynorsk: Finn blussa i nærleiken av hola der du kom til Løyndomsvatnet.

English: Find the cache at the end of the Ravine in the Broken Railroad Region.
Nynorsk: Finn oppbevaringa i nærleiken av slukta i øydelagt jernbane.

English: Find the cache near the entrance to the Forlorn Muskeg Region from Mystery Lake.
Notes: fixed typo: Forlorn Muskey => Forlorn Muskeg
Nynorsk: Finn oppbevaringa i nærleiken av inngongen til den aude myra i frå Løyndomssvatnet.

English: Find the cache under some tree roots in the Forlorn Muskeg.
Nynorsk: Finn oppbevaringa som ligger under røtene til eit tre i den aude myra.

English: There are several supply caches hidDen around Mystery Lake. Most are left by hunters or campers. Some are left by off-grid "preppers" waiting for the government to fall, or the end of the world, so some such nonsense.
Nynorsk: Det finst fleire forsyningsoppbevaringar gøymt rundt Løyndomsvatnet. Dei fleste er lagt igjen av jegerar eller folk på tur. Nokon er lagt igjen av løyndomsfulle «prepparar» som ventar på at samfunnet skal bryta saman, verda sin ende eller liknande tull.

English: Open and search the Forest Talker Supply Cache.
An explosion has turned the tables on the Mathis. Make your escape.
Reach the Power Plant and meet Jace.
Get to the roof and stop convicts from following
Find a safe way down from the roof
Did Astrid survive the crash? Keep your eyes open for signs of her passing, while you explore the wilderness around you.
Nynorsk: Overlevde Astrid flystyrten? Hald augene opne for teikn etter ho medan du utforskar villmarka.

English: Search the area around the crash site, and beyond.
Nynorsk: Undersøk området rundt krasjstaden og bortenfor.

English: Follow the road. Where does it go? And could Astrid have followed it?
Nynorsk: Fylg vegen. Kvar ledar han? Kan Astrid ha fylgt han?

English: The big old house shows the first signs of habitation since you crashed. Investigate.
Nynorsk: Det store gamle huset er det fyrste teiknet på folk du har sitt sidan styrten. Undersøk.

English: The old trapper is badly injured after a bear attack, and needs strong antibiotics to survive. He might know something about Astrid. You'd better keep him alive, if you can.
Nynorsk: Den gamle pelsjegeren er stygt skada etter eit bjørneåtak, og han treng antibiotika for å overleva. Han veit kanskje noko om Astrid. Det er best å halde han i live om du kan.

English: Find, and enter the abandoned Dam.
Nynorsk: Finn og gå inn i den etterlata demningen.

English: Search for medical supplies that can help the old trapper.
Nynorsk: Leit etter medisiner som kan hjelpe den gamle pelsjegeren.

English: Get the meds back to the trapper before he dies.
Nynorsk: Få medisinane attende til pelsjegeren før han døyr.

English: Jeremiah is convinced the Old Bear will be back. But his rifle broke in the first encounter, leaving you both defenseless. Do whatever you need to do to repair his rifle.
Nynorsk: Jeremiah er sikker på at Gamlebjørn vil koma attende. Men børsa hans vart øydelagt sist han møtte på bjørnen, so de er begge forsvarslause. Vøl børsa hans.

English: Find the Railway Maintenance Yard and get into the repair shed.
Nynorsk: Finn jernbanen sitt verkstadområde og gå inn i maskinverkstaden.

English: Use the hand-driven Milling Machine to repair Jeremiah's rifle.
Nynorsk: Nytt den handdrivne fresemaskinen til å vøle Jeremiah si børse.

English: Look for more info about the Forest Talkers at the old Hunting Lodge.
Nynorsk: Sjå om du finn meir informasjon om Skogpratarane i den gamle jakthytta.

English: Search the Lodge for supplies. Something here could save your life.
Nynorsk: Leit etter forsyningar i hytta. Det kan vera noko der som kan redda livet ditt.

English: Looks like the Lodge served as an informal camp for the Forest Talkers. See what you can find out about them here.
Nynorsk: Det verker som Skogpratarane nytta hytta som ein uformell leir. Sjå kva du kan finna ut om dei der.

English: Find a way into the Admin Wing
Prepare to fly to Great Bear Island.
Load Astrid's gear into the plane.
Look for clues to open the locked cache.
Solve the riddles and unlock the cache padlock.
The Forest Talkers, an eco-activist group, have left supply caches hidDen in different regions around Great Bear Island. They could prove useful if found.
Nynorsk: Skogpratarane, ein gruppe miljøvernarar, har gøymt oppbevaringar med forsyninger i rundt om kring på Sværebjørn. Desse kan koma godt med om du finn dei.
Finn teikningane  i nærleiken av avlen.
Jeremiah har fortalt deg om ein avl i den aude myra. Det er nokon gamle teikningar gøymt der.

English: Go to the Forge in the Forlorn Muskeg
Nynorsk: Gå til avlen i den aude myra

English: Enduring the Quiet Apocalypse will require survival skills. Find the collectibles that can teach you important survival lessons.
Work through the Survival School Lessons.
Find the Radio Parts the Trapper needs.
Grey Mother will need extra food and fuel if she is survive alone for much longer.
Add extra fuel to Grey Mother's woodbin
Add extra food to Grey Mother's fridge
There's a firewood bin outside Grey Mother's house. Stock it with fuel you find around town -- sticks, firewood, broken down furniture, or coal if you can find any.
Nynorsk: Det er ein vedkasse utanfor Gråmor sitt hus. Fyll han med brennefang du finner i byen: pinnar, ved, gamle møbler og kol om du kan finne noko.

English: Grey Mother seems tired. Try talking to her after she's had some time to rest.
Nynorsk: Gråmor verkar trøytt. Snakk med Gråmor etter at ho har fått kvilt seg.

English: Grey Mother seems deep in thought. Return to her once she's restad a while.
Nynorsk: Gråmor ser ut til å vera i djupe tankar. Fer attende til ho når ho har kvilt seg ei stund.

English: Something precious was stolen from Grey Mother. Find it, and return it to her.
Nynorsk: Noko verdfullt er vorte stole frå Gråmor. Finn tingen og ta den med attende til ho.

English: Search the Milton Farmhouse for a Safety deposit box key.
Nynorsk: Leit etter ein bankboksnykel i våningshuset i Milton.

English: Retrieve the contents of the Safety deposit box and return it to Grey Mother.
Nynorsk: Hent innhaldet i bankboksen og ta det med til Gråmor.

English: Find Lily's grave marker and pay service to her memory.
Nynorsk: Finn Lily si grav og gjer ære på hennar minne.

English: Retrieve the climbing gear from Lily's trunk.
Nynorsk: Hent klyveutstyret frå Lily si kiste.

English: Grey Mother will starve unless you stock her pantry with food. Scavenge what you can from the environment around you. Some food sources are easier to find than others.
Nynorsk: Gråmor vil svolte med mindre du fyllar kjøleskåpet hennar med mat. Leit etter mat i omgjevnadane. Nokon matkjelder er lettare å finne enn andre.

English: Find supplies to help keep Grey Mother alive.
[Optional] Break into the gas station and ransack it for supplies.
Nynorsk: [Valfritt] Bryt deg inn i bensinstasjonen og leit etter forsyningar.

English: Gather food for Grey Mother wherever you can find it, and put it in her fridge.
Nynorsk: Samla mat til Gråmor og legg maten i kjøleskåpet hennar.

English: Food Supplies for the Grey Mother
Check the Gas Station for more supplies.
Investigate the tunnel leading out of Milton. Grey Mother wants to know what happened there.
Nynorsk: Gransk tunnelen som leiar ut av Milton. Gråmor vil gjerna veta kva som skjedde der.

English: The old woman might be the last survivor in Milton. She seems to know more than she's letting on. She might be the key to understanding what happened to Astrid.
Nynorsk: Den gamle dama kan vera den siste overlevande i Milton. Det verkar som ho veit meir enn ho vil fortelja. Ho kan vera nykelen til å forstå kva som har skjedd med Astrid.

English: Mackenzie hangs around the Jackrabbit Transport hangar, waiting for something to happen.
Take a nap or make some coffee.
Make and drink a cup of Coffee.
Search Hank's Prepper Hatch and take whatever supplies you need.
Nynorsk: Gransk bunker og ta dei forsyningane du finn.

English: Locate Hank's secret Prepper Hatch, and use the code to gain entry.
Nynorsk: Finn den hemmelege bunkeren til Hank og lås deg inn med koden.

English: Search the Forestry Lookout for Hank's lock box.
Nynorsk: Leit etter skrinet til Hank i skogbruket sitt utkikkstårn

English: An injured Jeremiah needs some help.
Search the location for the cache of supplies.
Mackenzie rescues an Old Trapper, whose knowledge of Great Bear Island, as well his shortwave radio, might be the key to finding Astrid.
Bring the transponders back to Jeremiah.
The Forest Talkers have been raiding Joplin's prepper caches. Whatever supplies remain could help you survive Pleasant Valley long enough to find a way out. Search the caches to see what's left.
Find the journal hidden in the vent.
Return to the Forest Talker in the Lake Cabin.
Nynorsk: Fer attende til skogprataren i hytta ved vatnet.

English: Check on the Lake Cabin tomorrow.
Nynorsk: Fer innom hytta ved vatnet i morgon.

English: Jeremiah says he heard gunshots from across Mystery Lake. Could it have something to do with the Forest Talkers?
Nynorsk: Jeremiah sier at han høyrte skot frå den andre sida av Løyndomsvatnet. Hadde hendinga kanskje noko med Skogpratarane å gjera?

English: Go to the Dam and retrieve the documents hidDen under a loose tile at the bottom of the stairs leading to the Admin area.
Nynorsk: Fer til demningen og hent dokumenta som er skylt under ei laus flis nederst i trappa som leiar til administrasjonsområdet.

English: Fetch supply bag from the Logging Camp trailer.
Nynorsk: Hent ranselen med forsyningar frå traileren i tømmerleiren.

English: Head to the far side of Mystery Lake, near the cabins closed for the season.
Nynorsk: Fer til enden av Løyndomsvatnet, i nærleiken av hyttene.

English: It looks like Astrid made it out of Milton. Follow Lily's path to continue your search beyond the town's borders.
Nynorsk: Det verkar som Astrid kom seg ut av Milton. Fylg Lily sin veg for å fortsetta letinga utenfor bygrensa.

English: It looks like Astrid made it out of Milton. Continue your search beyond the town's borders.
Talk to Grey Mother, find out how to leave town.
Find the Climbing Area on the outskirts of Milton.
Nynorsk: Finn klyveområdet i utkanten av Milton.

English: Find the route that leads through the mountains.
Nynorsk: Finn ruta som leiar gjennom fjellet!

English: You've brought healing and respite to the people at Thomson's Crossing. Your work at the Community Hall is complete. Do what you need to do before leaving Pleasant Valley.
Enter the Mine and leave Pleasant Valley. Once you enter the Mine, you will not be able to return to Pleasant Valley.
Swap burned out fuses with replacements
Find a way to fix the elevator.
Find a way through the mine tunnels.
Grey Mother has one final request from you.
Jeremiah has suggestad using a radio in an old lookout tower to find Astrid. Best lead so far.
Nynorsk: Jeremiah har føreslege at du brukar ein radio i eit gamalt utkikkstårn for å finna Astrid. Beste leietråd so langt.

English: Find out what happened to the lost power workers. Search their last noted work locations.
Find the missing power company workers.
Learn all you can about Blackrock Penitentiary.
Track down the prison truck and medicine.
Find medical supplies for the Warden.
Check on the voice next door.
Find a way to get inside
Grey Mother trusts you enough to tell you about a Distress Pistol stashed away by one of her neighbours. If you can find it, it would make a useful Wolf deterrent.
Nynorsk: Gråmor har god nok tiltru på deg til å fortelja om ein signalpistol som ein av naboane hennar har gøymt. Viss du finn han, har du noko å skremma vekk ulvane med.

English: Search the house and locate the hidDen Distress Pistol.
Nynorsk: Gransk huset for å finna den gøymde signalpistolen.

English: Use directions from the Cave Cache note to locate a hidDen supply cache.
Nynorsk: Nytt retningsrettleiinga på holeoppbevaringsnotata til å finna skylte forsyningar.

English: Use directions from the note to locate a hidDen supply cache.
Nynorsk: Nytt retningsrettleiinga på notata til å finne skylte forsyningar.

English: Use directions from the Grey Mother to locate a hidDen supply cache.
Notes: cache location given as trust reward
Nynorsk: Nytt retningsrettleinga til Gråmor til å finna ein oppbevaring med forsyningar.

English: Locate a hidden supply cache behind a Milton house
In anticipation of something bad happening, some intrepid Milton residents hid supply caches around town. Find the notes that provide directions to the caches.
Nynorsk: I forberedning på at noko gale skulle skje, var det nokon djerve innbyggarar i Milton som gøymde forsyningar rundt omkring i byen. Finn notata som forklarar vegen til oppbevaringane.

English: Learn to mend and maintain clothing.
Add extra food supplies to Grey Mother's fridge.
Find and harvest some medicinal flora native to Great Bear Island.
Find, harvest, and prepare some medicinal flora native to Great Bear Island.
Place a Snare and catch at least one Rabbit.
Return to the farm another day to collect your trappings.
Travel to the Mine and locate the Detonators for Mathis.
Find another way around the mines
Find someone who can help guide you out of Pleasant Valley.
Follow the Blizzard Lines to Molly's Barn.
Molly rescued you from near death. As a local with deep knowledge of the Region, she might be key to surviving long enough to find a way to Perseverance Mills.
Look for clues that might tell you more about Molly.
Molly has phoned from her Barn, and she needs your help.
Find the Key under the Vase.
Collect supplies and craft a Noisemaker
Craft Noisemakers to help defend against wolf attacks
Mathis orders you to find the old Power Plant and look for a way to restore power to solitary.
Find the locking mechanism control room.
Melt the ice to unblock the door.
Find a hammer to smash the machine.
Redirect steam throughout the complex to defrost the Control Room door.
Find and reconnect all the pressure valves
Search for bloodstained pages inside and outside the Blackrock grounds.
Records from Blackrock's official archive have escaped their vault. Find and read the bloody pages to learn more about the notorious maximum security prison.
Return to the Guard Tower to discover a hidden meaning
Mackenzie seizes his chance to escape Mathis.

The man in solitary, the son of Mathis. The reason places like Blackrock exist.

Even post-Collapse, Donner lives apart from anything resembling the regular order of society. And Mathis will stop at nothing in order to unleash his malevolent, unredeemable nature on the world. Starting with Great Bear Island.

A graduate student in astrophysics, Jace normally has her eyes on the stars. Chance, and the Aurora, have brought her to Blackrock.

Whip-smart, Jace has the air of superiority that many academics inherit.  But deep down she is starting to worry that her career choice has left her unprepared for the current situation, especially if the power never comes back.

A hardened criminal and convict with grand ideas about his place in the world, Mathis has a lot to say. But he turns to his fists to get his point across whenever he feels like it -- even to his detriment if someone crosses him or fails him.

Mathis likes to present himself as a leader of men, but only to cowards, or the kind of people who don’t mind seeing him for the evil bastard he really is.

The Warden at Blackrock Penitentiary, Franklin has found himself caught up in Mathis’s deadly schemes.

More an administrator than a disciplinarian, no one is more aware of the notorious prison’s dark history than its Warden. But Franklin is clear-eyed about his purpose on Great Bear Island -- the worst of the worst end up with him at Blackrock. And if someone has to be in charge, it might as well be him.
A handwritten note on grease-stained paper. Most of the text is illegible.

...months without pay. Making us deal with those forest crazies. Now they’re sending me after them? I’ve had it. After this trip, I’m done. No matter what. If you’re coming to help, meet me on the far side of Mystery Lake, near the summer cabins. We’ll start there. Either we…
A note describing the location of hidden emergency supplies
A memo detailing a missing employee.

ATTN: Red Shift Supervisors
CC: Dr. Childs

Once again we are left wondering what it is exactly that Murphy is up to when he arrives late for his shifts. Today marks six times this month. No one seems to know where he is. We know he is off the grounds and on foot instead of in his truck.

Given the current shift requirements the Warden is not ready to initiate an official disciplinary response, so we are copying the doctor on this memo as well. In case medical or psychiatric support is needed for Murphy.

But first we need to find him. He was seen previously heading down the low river near the Blocked Bridge, south of the Penitentiary.

We are all aware of what isolation can do out here, but we have a job to do just the same.

Blackrock Admin Team
Collect the Rifle Ammunition before leaving.
Warning: Finish up any incomplete tasks before exploring the mine.
Note written by a lost and confused worker.

[a page of a journal, torn out]

Keep writing. Writing helps give me focus, and focus keeps me still.

I can’t remember why I’m here, what I do, or who this woman is. I think we work together?? I know her, I think. She watches me scribble this stuff down, but she smiles. Does she know? I try and watch her work on the machines when I wake up. And copy her movements when she goes to bed. She tells me things but they fade unless I write them down. Like the wind picks them up and takes them far away.

I keep seeing a river in my head, rushing water to the edge of something. Into a deep foggy place.

I just can’t remember anymore...

Notes: scene name for large maintenence shed

English: A note describing the location of emergency supplies

Hey Bud, sorry to leave you hanging like this with the storm and the power and everything. But it sounds like it’s all gone to hell out at the upper bridge tonight. Cars broken down, a mess. And some rich Mainlander won’t budge from his truck. Probably thinks we’re all a bunch of bandits waiting to rip him off, usual story.
Anyway  me and Jason are going to go up there and see if we can talk some sense into him, before the storm gets even worse. I’ll sort you out in the morning.
Thanks,
Peter
A note describing the location of a medicine stash in Milton.

Susan, the meds I found on my last trip are at my place, out back. You know the spot. Remember, we have to make these last as long as we can.
I know things are bad right now, but please, help me with this. If you get sick again, I don’t know what I’ll do.
-T
You must go to Signal Hill before leaving Pleasant Valley.

Years on a working farm in a remote corner of Great Bear Island have left their mark on Molly. She’s plain-spoken, often blunt -- she sees the world for what it is. There are no illusions inhabiting Molly’s life and she likes it that way.
Other than the farm and regular subsistence hunting, simple pleasures -- tea and the wanderings of her own imagination -- keep Molly occupied.

Nynorsk: Sterke smertestillande. Ver varsam ved bruk.

English: A key to the farm house on the outskirts of Milton.
Nynorsk: Ein nykel til våningshuset i utkanten av Milton.

English: Note from a neighbour found in the Milton Farmhouse
Nynorsk: Notat frå ein nabo, Funne i våningshuset i Milton.

English:
Hey Martin,
 We found Molly! Alice was so relieved. Thanks for helping us look. Looks like this time maybe a wolf went after her. They seem to be more and more since the quake, and closer to town -- fewer people to keep them in check I guess. Molly’s hurt but I think she’ll make it. Watch out because the wolves might come after your dog too. I know how you feel about wildlife and that you wouldn’t shoot a wolf even if you had to, but I hear they don’t like loud noises. Roadside flare might do the trick. Stay safe and come visit us when you can. It’s not good to spend too much time on your own.
 ­- John
Nynorsk:
Hei, Martin
Me fant Molly! Alice var so letta. Takk for at du hjalp oss å leita. Det verkar som ein ulv hadde prøvd seg på ho denne gongen. Det ser ut til å vera mange fleire av dei etter jordskjelvet, og dei er nærare byen. Det er vel færre folk til å halde dei i sjakk, vil eg tru. Molly er skada, men eg trur ho klarar seg. Ver forsiktig, for ulvane prøver seg kanskje på hunden din òg. Eg veit kva du synes om ville dyr, og at du ikkje kjem til å skyte ein ulv sjølv om du er naudt, men eg har høyrt at dei ikkje likar høge lydar. Bluss vil kanskje fikse biffen. Ver forsiktig, og kom på besøk når du kan. Det er ikkje bra å vera for mykje åleine.
 – John

A note with information about how to use plants to cure maladies

ANNOUNCEMENT:
This came up the last time that Mainland doctor dropped in to see us, and now we’re ready to kick it off. To add to our shrinking pharmacy here in town, we’ll be keeping an inventory of local plants that might supplement some of our traditional meds. So if you’re out in the woods, or even just around town, things to keep an eye out for are the following:
*Reishi Mushrooms, to brew into an antibiotic tea.
*Old Man’s Beard lichen, for its natural antiseptic properties. You can bind cuts, scrapes, and wounds with a dressing made from the stuff.
*Rose hips, which we can process into an anti-inflammatory, pain-killing tea.
Stuart has volunteered to maintain the inventory and record the items as we collect them, as well as check for quality. This is especially important with the mushrooms. We don’t want to make anyone even sicker, or worse.
We know times are tough, but some of us have been through this sort of thing before. We can make it.
A collection of misc. electronics odds and ends torn out of old radios.
A string of prayer beads from Father Thomas.
A handwritten note detailing the location of a prepper hatch.

If you're reading this you’ve gone and found my cache behind the old Bricklayer place.

I’ve reopened my old bunker. Things are getting bad round here.

Head north from Foreman’s Clearcut, go beyond the road and then up a small rise into the rocks. Follow the meadow grass and you should be just fine. We should be able to wait this thing out there.
A memo detailing the occasional sightings of a suspicious person.

ATTN: Officers and Staff

We are getting additional reports of a suspicious person wandering the valley. For security purposes we are asking that any additional sightings note the place and time.

The most recent report indicates that the person’s path intersects with the old stone cabin on the lake east of Blackrock.
Key to a lock box belonging to a Blackrock Penitentiary employee.
An official document with details on a prisoner release.

Medical Evaluation -- Inmate #5627

Board Summary:

Extensive evidence of both pre- and post-incarceration trauma.

*Spiral fractures of the humerus on both arms
*Cervical ligament damage
*Radiology studies suggests multiples shoulder dislocations
*Patient reports post-concussion syndrome

**Recommend evaluation under compassionate release criteria (see attached inmate history for background). Psychological survey suggests very low risk of recidivism.

Regards,

Blackrock Penitentiary Medical Committee
Hand written notes mentioning various local conspiracy theories.

Those lights keep coming back, over and over. Never stops. Ever since that first night. And the wolves are strange critters now. It’s gotta be down to somethin at Blackrock, but I just don’t know...

It’s all gettin fuzzy around the edges. I keep dreaming of the sea, being back on the water again…see myself tumblin down the mountain, can’t stop myself. River swallows me up.

Never shoulda stayed round here after I got out. Was like a big hole and now I’m sitting on the edge of it looking back down. Down where I already was.

Like the doc said back then, keep writin...if you’re writin you’re breathin.
A memo detailing a particularly aggressive wolf in the area.

ATTN: Officers and Staff

To make a tough winter even tougher, we have got some new reports of that unusual wolf we dealt with last year. It’s back, apparently. We had hoped its roaming had taken it far afield and away from the grounds, but these sightings, and its aggressive behaviour, are conclusive.

To help us understand if this is an issue with a single animal or part of some larger pattern on the island, we have engaged the Regional Ecologist to conduct a short study and give us some options.

In the meantime, stay vigilant when outside the grounds or away from your vehicles when traveling.

D. Gordon
Blue Shift Supervisor
Notes from a person who has been studying the increased aggresion of the wolves on Great Bear Island.

[a journal page, partially torn and soaked with blood]

...mistake to come here. The Staging Report from the Blackrock Admin. was incomplete. Clearly this animal has survived some deep trauma or starvation period to develop aberrant predatory behaviours to this degree.

I’m going to recommend sedation, tagging, and relocation in order to give it a fighting chance. Blackrock meant well in bringing me out here, but I need to give them an option besides culling.

It’s a magnificent creature and worthy of study.

There’s an unusual…

English:
Affable and quick to laugh, even in crisis Father Thomas is lifted by his faith rather than weighed down by it. While erudite when he needs to be, he treasures the immediate, pragmatic spiritual needs of life on remote Great Bear Island -- births, baptisms, and funerals, mostly.
Just how and why Father Thomas came to find himself in Pleasant Valley remains a mystery. But it’s clear his devotion to the tiny parish in Thomson’s Crossing has helped bind the community together.
Map marked by Father Thomas showing the entrance to an Old Mine, and a possible way out of Pleasant Valley.
Parts scavenged from old radios. Might be used to boost a shortwave signal.

Nynorsk: Purrebrev funne i våningshuset i utkanten av Milton.

English:
OVERDUE ­­ FINAL WARNING
 
 dear Mr. Barker,
 
 You account with Mainland Power Corp. is now severely past due. Your account is in arrears to the tune of: $1,256.45
 
 despite our attempts to contact you to remedy this situation, on this third and final warning we regretfully report that we are left with no choice but to interrupt service immediately. We have dispatched a recovery crew to repossess your leased SOLAR BLOCK MOdeL BK1. Once your account has been brought up to date, we will be more than happy to restore your service.
 
 Please note that all meter readings are carried out by impartial drones deployed by our Remote Monitoring station on Great Bear. If you would like to dispute the reading, please contact your local Ombudsman, which according to our records is located at [***MISSING DATA***].
 
 Mainland Power Corp. is the primary service provider of grid­based power for the Southern Great Bear region. We pride oursjølves in our dedication to customeir service, and have been awarded the MUSK GREEN SERVICE MEDALLION for the past three years running.
 
 If you would like to make a payment, or communicate with us about your account status, we invite you to contact us by phone, email, social media, or drone mailer according to the contact information provided below.
 
 Thank you, and have a nice day.
 
 MAINLAND POWER CORP.
Nynorsk:
PURRING – SISTE ÅTVARING
 
Kjære herr Barker,

Fastlandet Straum AS krev at du betal straumrekninga snarast mogleg. Du er gjeldbunden: $ 1256,45
 
Me har prøvd å kontakta deg for å lausa situasjonen, men etter denne tredje og siste åtvaringa har me dessverre ikkje noko anna val enn å avbryta tenesta med umiddelbar verknad. Me har sendt eit mannskap ut for å inndrage ditt leigde solbatteri av modellen BK1. Om det uteståande gjerast opp, vil me meir enn gjerna la deg fortestja tenesta.
 
Ver oppmerksom på at alle måleravlesningar vert utført av presise droner som sendast ut i frå fjernovervåkingsstasjonen vår på Sværebjørn. Om du ikkje er samd i ei avlesing, kan du ta kontakt med din lokale ombudsmann, som etter våre opplysningar er å finna i [***DATA MANGLER***].
 
Fastlandet Straum AS er den primere leverandøren av straum til den sørlege delen av Sværebjørn. Me er stolte av kundeservicen vår, og me har vorte tildelt eit grønt muskmerke tre år på rad.
 
Viss du ynskjer å foreta ein betaling eller diskutera kontoens status med oss, må du gjerna kontakta oss via telefon, e-post, sosiale medier eller dronepost i samsvar til kontaktinformasjonen som er oppgitt nedanfor.
 
Takk, og ha ein fin dag.
 
FASTLANDET STRAUM AS.

English: I'd eat snow if the hypothermia wouldn't kill me.
Nynorsk: Eg hadde gafla i meg snø hvis ikkje hypotermi hadde tatt knekken på meg.

English: That guy who drank his own pee doesn't seem so crazy right now...
Nynorsk: Han karen som drakk sitt eget piss, virker ikkje fullt so gal no...

English: I would do anything for a drink right now.
Nynorsk: Eg ville gjort kva som helst for noko å drikke no.
Det byrjar å verta mørkt. Må finne ly.
Hadde vært sjå om eg finner litt vatn.

English: Oh this is a shitty way to die...
Nynorsk: Snakk om å døy på ein jævlig måte...

English: Oh man...of all the ways to die...this is the worst...
Nynorsk: Av alle måter å døy på... dette er den desidert verste...

English: Oh boy...it feels like my stomach is burning...
Nynorsk: Guri malla, det er som at magen min er i full fyr.

English: That's going to slow things down...
Nynorsk: Det kjem nok til å seinke farten.
Eg må få tak i hjelp.

English: Going to have to stop that bleeding somehow.
Nynorsk: Eg må stanse den blødninga på ein eller anna måte.

English: Gotta stop the bleeding before it gets worse.
Nynorsk: Eg må stanse blødninga før den vert verre.
Eg kjem til å blø ihjel snart.

English: Oh no...blood. All over. My blood.
Nynorsk: Å nei... blod. Overalt. Mitt blod.

English: Climbing into the fire...not a good idea.
Nynorsk: Gå rett på ilden... ingen god idé.

English: It feels like it's still burning...
I'm gonna to kill you and eat you ya bastard!!
Nynorsk: Eg skal drepe deg og spise deg, din jævel!

English: It's not gonna be that easy for you!!
You're gonna have to do better than that!!
Nynorsk: Du må prestere betre enn som så!

English: I would drink just about anything right now.
Nynorsk: Eg ville drukket nesten kva som helst akkurat nå.

English: I need to find something to drink.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne noko å drikke.

English: I'm so thirsty I can't think straight.
Nynorsk: Eg er so tørst at det går rundt for meg.

English: I need somethink to drink, and soon.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne noko å drikka, og det snart.

English: I'll die if I don't drink soon.
Nynorsk: Eg dør viss eg ikkje drikk noko snart.

English: I can't carry this any further.
Nynorsk: Eg kan ikkje bære dette lenger.

English: I'm going to have leave some of this gear behind.
Nynorsk: Eg må legge frå meg noko av utstyret.

English: This pack is getting kinda heavy.
I'm not sure I can carry much more.
Nynorsk: Eg vet ikkje om eg kan bære noko mer.

English: I wonder if I can drop any of this gear...
Nynorsk: Lurer på om eg kan legge frå meg noko av utstyret...

English: I'm not going to be able to carry this load for much longer.
Nynorsk: Eg klarer ikkje å bære alt dette stort lenger.

English: This pack is getting too heavy to carry.
Nynorsk: Ranselen byrjar å verta for tung til å bære.

English: I can barely walk with this much gear.
Nynorsk: Eg har so mykje utstyr at eg knapt kan gå.
Eg føler meg ikkje helt i form.

English: I'm not sure I'm going to make it.
Nynorsk: Eg vet ikkje om eg klarer meg.

English: Things are starting to look pretty grim.
Nynorsk: No ser det ganske so mørkt ut.

English: If I don't rest soon I'm going to faint.
Nynorsk: Tar eg meg ikkje ein hvil snart, svimeir eg av.

English: I think I need to lay down.
Nynorsk: Eg tror eg må legge meg ned.

English: I need to find a place to rest.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne eit plass å hvile.

English: I'm going to need to rest soon.
Nynorsk: Eg treng ein pust i bakken snart.

English: So tired I could just lay down right here.
Nynorsk: Eg er so trøtt at eg kunne legge meg rett ned her.

English: I could lay down and have a little sleep right here.
Nynorsk: Eg kan legge meg og sove litt her.

English: I just need to close my eyes.
I'd lay down right here if I thought I'd ever wake up again.
Nynorsk: Viss eg trodde det var mulig å våkne igjen, ville eg lagt meg ned her.

English: Man, I am too tired to think straight.
Nynorsk: Faen, eg er for trøtt til å tenke.

English: I've never felt so cold in my life.
Nynorsk: Eg har aldri vært so kald før.
Eg er for kald til å tenke.

English: I'll die if I don't warm up soon.
Nynorsk: Eg dør viss eg ikkje får varmen i meg snart.

English: I'm so cold...just want to lay down for a bit...
Nynorsk: Eg fryser... eg har lyst til å legge meg ned litt...

English: Wait...I'm so cold I'm warming up a bit.
Nynorsk: Vent, eg er so kald at det byrjar å føles varmere.

English: I think this might be the end.
I'm going to die out here.
Nynorsk: Eg kjem til å dø her ute.

English: Things are starting to look pretty grim.
Nynorsk: No ser det ganske so mørkt ut.

English: Not going to pull through this time...
Nynorsk: denne gangen klarer eg meg ikkje...

English: In the end...did any of it really matter?
Nynorsk: Til syvende og sist... var det i det hele tatt noko som betydde noe?

English: Where can I find something to eat?
Nynorsk: Hvor kan eg finne noko å spise?

English: I'll die if I don't get some food soon.
Nynorsk: Eg dør viss eg ikkje får i meg mat snart.

English: My stomach feels like an empty pit...
Nynorsk: Magen føles som eit tomt hull.

English: Never thought I'd be dying from starvation.
Nynorsk: Trodde aldri eg kom til å dø av sult.

English: I think my stomach is eating itself.
Nynorsk: det føles som om magen spiser seg sjølv.
Eg har ikkje følelse i fingrene.

English: The cold is making my head feel thick...
Nynorsk: KulDen gjer at hodet føles tykt...

English: I need to find some place to escape this cold.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne ly for denne kulden.
Eg har ikkje følelse i beina.
Eg har ikkje følelse i hendene.
Eg byrjar å føle meg nummen.
Må få varmen i meg på eit vis.

English: Did I say I hate being cold, because I really do!
Nynorsk: Sa eg at eg hater å fryse? For det gjer eg faktisk!

English: I could eat anything right now.
Nynorsk: Eg kunne spist kva som helst nå.

English: I've never been so hungry in my life.
Nynorsk: Eg har aldri vært so sulten før.

English: All I can think about is food.
Nynorsk: Alt eg kan tenke på, er mat.

English: I'm going to need to eat soon.
Nynorsk: Eg er nødt til å spise snart.
Eg kunne spist kva som helst.

English: I'd eat anything right about now.
Nynorsk: Eg kunne spist kva som helst akkurat nå.

English: I would drink almost anything about now.
Nynorsk: Eg kunne drukket nesten kva som helst akkurat nå.

English: Surrounded by snow, and nothing to drink...
Nynorsk: Snø overalt, men ingenting å drikke.

English: I'd eat snow if the hypothermia wouldn't kill me.
Nynorsk: Eg ville spist snø om hypotermi ikkje hadde kunnet ta livet av meg.

English: That guy who drank his own pee doesn't seem so crazy right now...
Nynorsk: Han fyren som drakk sitt eget piss, virker ikkje fullt so gal nå...

English: I would do anything for a drink right now.
Nynorsk: Eg ville gjort kva som helst for noko å drikke nå.

English: Man, I could use a drink.
Nynorsk: Faen, eg treng noko å drikke.

English: Oh this is a shitty way to die...
Nynorsk: For ein jævlig måte å dø på...

English: Oh man...of all the ways to die...this is the worst...
Nynorsk: Av alle måter å dø på... dette er den verste...

English: Oh boy...it feels like my stomach is burning...
Nynorsk: Å nei, det kjennes som om magen står i brann...

English: Not much to do with this.
Ooooohh...I feel like I'm going to die...
Nynorsk: Åhhhhhh, eg tror eg er i ferd med å dø.

English: Oh what a way to die...I just want to die...
Nynorsk: For ein måte å dø på... eg vil berre dø.
Magen... det gjer so vondt .. Å, so vondt...
dette er alvorlig... skal vi se... greit.

English: Hurts a bit but I'll make it.
Nynorsk: det gjer litt vondt, men eg klarer meg.

English: I'm going to need some first aid, soon.
Nynorsk: Eg treng fyrstehjelp, og det raskt.

English: Should find some use for this.
Have to be vigilant...no matter what.
I could find some use for this.
This stuff will come in handy.
Nynorsk: det her kan eg få bruk for.
Eg må vera forberedt på alt.

English: Never know, could end up being useful.
Nynorsk: Du vet aldri, kjem kanskje til nytte ein dag.

English: I think I can use this.
Nynorsk: Den kan eg få bruk for.

English: Good to keep this lantern topped up.
Need to hang on to this.
Better add this to my pack.
Can only use this if I have it with me.
I'll find a use for this.
I can make use of this.
Have to keep enough water around.
No room left in my pack.
One too many things to carry.
Too heavy, have to leave something behind.
I have to leave some of these things.
This stuff is weighing me down.
No room for this in my pack.
Ha! Had just ran out of this.
Could do with more of that.
Need to find more of those.
Doubt I'll see more of those soon.
Never would have thought to look here.
Nynorsk: Trodde ikkje eg skulle finne noko her.
Eg håper ingen treng dette mer.

English: I wonder who owns this stuff.
Nynorsk: Lurer på hvem som eier dette.
Lurer på om eieren er i nærheten.

English: Looks like this has been here a while.
Nynorsk: dette har nok ligget her ein stund.

English: So cold...make a fire. Yeah, make a hot fire...
Notes: Vocalization for when the female survivor is very cold.
Nynorsk: Låsar opp ei teikning som visar korleis ein lagar ei provisorisk øks.

English: Looks like I made it through another night.
Nynorsk: Ser ut til at eg klarte meg gjennom enda ein natt.

English: Thank goodness...made it through another night.
Nynorsk: Takk og lov, eg klarte meg gjennom enda ein natt.

English: Looks like a new day is dawning.
Nynorsk: Virker som ein ny dag har begynt.

English: What do you know. Looks like I survived another night.
Nynorsk: Har du sett. Virker som eg overlevde enda ein natt.
Kjennes ut som om natten er på vei.

English: It's dusk so night can't be far behind.
Nynorsk: Det er skumring, so natten kan ikkje vera langt unna.

English: It's getting dark out here. Time to look for shelter.
Nynorsk: Det byrjar å verta mørkt. Må finne ly.

English: The sun is setting. It's going to get a lot colder soon.
Nynorsk: Sola går ned. det vert snart kaldere.

English: Gah! Don't do this to me.
Nynorsk: Faen. ikkje gjer dette mot meg.

English: Come on little fire. Come On.
Nynorsk: Kom igjen, lille ild. Kom igjen.

English: Come on little fire. Come On.
Nynorsk: Kom igjen, lille ild. Kom igjen.

English: Oh ya. That's a good one.
Ooooohh...I feel like I'm going to die...
Nynorsk: Åhhhhhh, eg tror eg er i ferd med å dø.

English: Oh what a way to die...I just want to die...
Nynorsk: For ein måte å dø på... eg vil berre dø.
Magen... det gjer so vondt .. Å, so vondt...

English: Hurts a bit but I'll make it.
Nynorsk: det gjer litt vondt, men eg klarer meg.

English: I'm going to need some first aid, soon.
Nynorsk: Eg treng fyrstehjelp, og det raskt.

English: Pease, please, please. I just want to sleep.
I'm exhausted but I just can't fall asleep.
Wonder if this is any good to eat.
Hope I can still eat this.
This stuff will come in handy.
I think I can use this.

Nynorsk: dette kan eg få bruk for.
Eg håper ingen treng dette mer.

English: Looks like this has been here a while.
Nynorsk: dette har nok ligget her ein stund.

English: You never know when you might need to defend yourself.
I can always use more food.
Don't want to run out of water.
I'll die if I run out of water.
Let's hope I never have to use this on anyone.
I'm just out of this stuff.
I gotta get out of here...
If this is a nightmare, I want to wake up.
If this is a nightmare, I want to wake up.
This is like something out of a horror movie.
This is like something out of a horror movie.
This is like something out of a horror movie.
This bad ankle's going to slow me down.
I'd better lay low til this ankle improves.
I'm tired but I can't sleep.
I close my eyes but I just can't sleep.

Notes: Vocalization for when the male survivor sprains his wrist.

English: Holy...I hope my wrist isn't broken.
Notes: Vocalization for when the male survivor sprains his wrist.
Nynorsk: Jeg … eg håper håndleddet ikkje er brukket.

English: Can't do much with that neve until my wrist heals up.
Notes: Vocalization for when the male survivor sprains his wrist.
Nynorsk: Kan ikkje gjera stort med den handa før håndleddet er bedre.

English: I have to be more careful. A sprained wrist could mean death out here.
Notes: Vocalization for when the male survivor sprains his wrist.
Nynorsk: Eg må vera meir varsom. Forstuer eg håndleddet her, kan det vera slutten.

English: This carcass could save my life.
Doesn't look too good, but what choice do I have?
I think I'm going to make it.
Only one way to go -- up.
That should help warm things up.
Nynorsk: No vert det nok litt varmere.

English: That should help warm things up.
Nynorsk: No vert det nok litt varmere.

English: There's gotta be something useful in here.
Nynorsk: det må da finnes noko nyttig her inne.
Hvor er alle de bra tingene?

English: Never would have thought to look here.
Nynorsk: Trodde ikkje eg skulle finne noko her.

English: I wonder who owns this stuff?
Nynorsk: Lurer på hvem som eier disse greiene?

English: I wonder if the owner's around?
Nynorsk: Lurer på om eieren er i nærheten?

English: Hmm, I'll see if I can help.
I'm going to check you over.
Let me have a look, OK?
Easy, just going to see if I can help.
On the other side of that tunnel.
I’m a doctor. Dr. Astrid Greenwood.
More like lab coats and test tubes. A researcher.
I need to get to a town, up north.
Perseverance Mills. You know where that is?
Ok, well there are some sick people there. And they need my help.
And the thing I lost in the plane crash...
I need it if I’m going to help those people.
That’s why I need to get there.
So...the power’s been out for a while?
Can you call for help? Find out what’s going on out there?
So...when you came in, I heard you locking a padlock.
Same thing when you went out.
I appreciate everything you’ve done to help, but I’d like to leave.
I have to find my friend and...get on with my work.
Seems like more than one adult lives here. I assumed...a husband.
Looks like I’m not the only one with secrets.
Looks like maybe the barrel exploded?
No no... I'm uh... I'll be okay.
Who has you surrounded? Are you in trouble?
But...but wolves don’t usually bother people.
Ok, but you...locked me in here, remember?
I, um... I found the body.
You said we’re in your house.
Hmm. An old flyer for a town meeting of some kind.
Looks like the town’s not too far from here.
If Mackenzie did pass through, he might have ended up there.
Either way, someone there’s bound to have some answers.
...crash site? How did you know about the...
But how did I get here?
So...these people are all survivors of a crash?
How long do you think this weather will last?
Will someone come to check on the town?
Clear the roads so you can get out?
But...what will happen to all these people?
I’m a...doctor. I can have a look at the survivors and uh...see how to help them.
I’ve had a look at the survivors.
Most are in fairly good condition, given the circumstances.
I think I can find most of what these survivors need.
But there is a diabetic in the group.
They’re going to need insulin, and soon.
Do you know where I might find some?
That means their body can’t produce insulin.
If they don’t get it, they’ll eventually go into shock and...probably die.
I will. Any suggestions you have would be very useful.
How will I know which luggage is theirs?
Ok. You keep an eye on everyone and I’ll be back as soon as I can.
Well uh...thank you for finding me.
Yes. It’s well known that the mind and body are inextricably linked.
I’ll do what I can to find IDs...documents...anything that can help identify the people who didn’t make it.
I mean no disrespect, Father, but do you really believe this will help?
But there are people in the town who won’t be if I don’t get going.
I would like to help the crash victims, yes.
Would you trust someone with a dead body in their basement?
I’m here. I’m here to help.
You’ve been in a crash. You’re in shock.
Just let me start a fire...
You’ve lost a lot of blood.
But it’s ok...it’s going to be ok.
I’m a doctor. I can help you.
She didn't make it through the crash.
He didn't make it through the crash.
She was lost in the crash.
He was lost in the crash.
She didn't survive the crash. I'm so sorry.
I'm sorry...I couldn't find who you were looking for. I hope they survived, and they're safe somewhere.
I'm sorry, I couldn't find them
I'm sorry. I...I could not find who you were looking. Um...I hope they survived. They may well be OK.
I’m so sorry. I know you’re in pain...and you just want it to end.
But I won’t let you die out here.
What...how did you know I was here?
Um, what do you want, Molly? I’m kinda busy.
I don’t really have time for this right now, Molly.
Sorry if this sounds harsh but...you don’t seem too broken up about it.
I assume he’s the one in the basement.
I guess that depends on the circumstances. And the intent.
All I remember is the tunnel, and wolves...
Prayer’s your thing, Father. You handle that.
Between the plane crash and the houses in the area, I’m going to pull together whatever supplies I can find.
Maybe between the two of us, we can keep these people alive.
I’m sorry. I couldn’t find who you’re looking for.
I hope they survived, and have found shelter somewhere else.
Like the world had no end.
Do you think while looking favourably on me, he could also help me find a way out of here?
I’ll take my chances. I really need to get to Perseverance Mills.
If things are this bad here, they’ll be worse...
Look, I just need to get there. Can you help me?
I...I don’t know what you mean.
Look...thank you Father, but religion isn’t really...
Look around you, Father. I think the lord may have his hands full right now.
Whatever burdens I may have, they’re mine to bear.
I’ll keep it in mind, Father.
Here. You should take this back.
Well, I don’t seem to get a lot of other calls out here.
I was in a small town.
I’m not sure. But I don’t do it for that.
I’m sure you could have, Molly.
What did you call to tell me, Molly?
But...why’d you wait so long to tell me?
Well, that trip was a waste.
I should get some shut-eye, and strike off for the mine Father Tom mentioned in the morning. It’s time to say bye to Pleasant Valley.
Damn! Why can’t I get anything...
Shit. I can hear him but he can’t hear me.

- We need a...doctor… or medical assistance. Anything.
- Shit. I can hear him but he can’t hear me.
And on your way to Perseverance Mills.
Molly...why are you telling me this?
I mean, the people are gone.
The convict, outside with the arrows in his back.
I’m not sure revenge is the answer, Molly.
Let’s just say...I wouldn’t want to find him with an arrow in his back.
Thank you, Molly. I hope you can find some peace too.
The aurora. The weather. The wildlife.
It somehow feels like Mother Nature is crying out.
Or maybe she’s warning us of what’s to come.
People like Molly, or Father Tom, or the crash survivors...they’re just the ones left behind.
Damaged people. The hopeful and the hopeless.
What will this new world do to them?
Will it make them harder? Will it break them?
I’m not sure I can help them.
And I don’t know what I’ll find when I get to where I’m going.
But what I do know is this: Mackenzie is alive, and he’s heading to Perseverance Mills.
And that means...I have to get there before it’s too late.
I may not be able to stop this darkness from coming.
But I’ll be damned if I’m going to let it happen without a fight.
So you set up a bed in here?
I was in a plane crash. In the mountains.
That’s how I ended up in Milton.
I got separated from...from a friend.
I told you not to call here.
I’m going as fast as I can.
I can’t just...it’s in a secure area of the lab. I can’t just walk out with it. There’s security protocols and...
I...I will. As soon as I can figure out how to…
I’ll find a way to get it to you.
N...no. It’s been years since we...
I will. I’ll fix it. I promise I will get there.
I tried to find him but...I couldn’t see anything in the blizzard.
And then I ran into trouble.
I’m sure he made it out fine.
Nothing could break that stubborn skull.
This place...am I really trapped in here?
What the hell is going on?
Might as well bring this along. For the wolves...or worse.
There are the lines to the barn.
A road to the Community Hall? Let's hope.
Smoke. Maybe that Community Hall from the flyer?
And there’s something I need from the plane.
Smoke. Signs of life, at least.
That's got to be the Community Hall.
Mining town...or used to be, anyway.
That's got to be the crash the priest was talking about.
Hard to believe anyone survived this.
This might improve the odds a bit.
Looks like the plane's passenger manifest.
Still some names missing from the passenger manifest.
Became delirious and wandered off, maybe.
If I could signal them somehow, let them know I am close?
Electricity...must be reacting to the lights in the sky.
The lights...so much energy moving through the air.
The radio tower...so I have a chance at least.
A radio tower...I can't believe it.
But then again nothing in this place makes any sense.
I need to find him. I need to get it back.
Can only hope the radio in here is in better shape than everything else in the valley.
It's a mine alright...air is thick.
No way to know how deep it goes.
Dead end...right. Have to find another way.
I can probably duck under those rocks...
You haven’t seen a man pass through here?
This elevator looks like the only way out of here.
And more arrows. Now to find those supplies.
This should make the Priest happy. I should check back tomorrow.
Some more help from Molly. Let's hope these work.
I must be starting to feel better because that actually sounds good.
Don't let this new world break you.
Nynorsk: Ikkje la denne nye verdenen knekke deg.

English: Don't close your eyes, not yet.
I can see it, we're almost there.
Don’t give up, I won't leave you.
I've got you, we're going to make it.
Hang in there, we can do this.
Just stay awake, we're getting closer.
Don't fall asleep, stay with me.
Don't fall asleep, stay with me.
Don't fall asleep, stay with me.
Just have to put you down.
Just have to put you down.
Just have to put you down.
Have to get you out of here.
I'm a doctor, I'm here to help you.
Going to check you out now.
I'm going to get you out of here.
Listen to my voice, I'm right here.
I see you, I'm right right here.
Don't close your eyes, stay with me.
Get some rest now, you need it.
You'll feel better after you sleep.
Not what I wanted to hear.
More than one by the sound of it.
Look at the size of that thing.
Need to give it plenty of space.
You're not going to get me!
You're not going to get me!
A locked metal case is a thing of the old world, stranger.
Nynorsk: Låste metallskrin tilhører den gamle verdenen, fremmede.

English: A world of closed doors and things being off limits.
Nynorsk: En verDen av stengte dører og adgang forbudt.

English: I was part of that world. But that world’s over.
Nynorsk: Eg var ein del av den verdenen. Men den er ikkje lenger.

English: This is my world now. And in my world, I make the rules.
Nynorsk: dette er min verDen nå. Og i min verDen er det eg som lager reglene.

English: In my world, there are no locks.
Nynorsk: I min verDen finnes det ingen låser.

English: Your ID says you’re a pilot.
Nynorsk: Legitimasjonen din sier at du er pilot.
Har du eit fly eit sted?

English: Ya. Should I show you what happened to the last person who lied to me? She didn’t look so pretty after I was done.
Nynorsk: Hei, skal eg vise deg kva som skjedde med den forrige som løy for meg? Ho so ikkje pen ut da eg var ferdig.

English: So now he’s ready to talk.
Nynorsk: No er han visst klar for å snakke.

English: Don’t worry, Pilot. You’ll be with her soon.
Nynorsk: Fortvil ikke, pilot. Du treffer henne snart.

English: Don’t worry, Pilot. You’ll be with her soon.
Should I show you what happened to the last person who lied to me?
She didn’t look so pretty after I was done.
Don’t worry, Pilot. You’ll be with her soon.
Mathis gonna be mad as hell...
Mathis gonna be mad as hell...
Mathis gonna be mad as hell...
First we carry this guy, now this?
First we carry this guy, now this?
First we carry this guy, now this?
We have to find this guy?
We have to find this guy?
We have to find this guy?
You think he's really a pilot?
You think he's really a pilot?
You think he's really a pilot?
Gonna lose a toe out here.
Gonna lose a toe out here.
Gonna lose a toe out here.
No way we find this guy now.
No way we find this guy now.
No way we find this guy now.
We're gonna clip your wings now, pilot!
We're gonna clip your wings now, pilot!
We're gonna clip your wings now, pilot!
Where the hell is this guy?
Where the hell is this guy?
Where the hell is this guy?
Can't stay out here much longer...
Can't stay out here much longer...
Can't stay out here much longer...
We need a...doctor… or medical assistance. Anything.
If you hear this, please...send help...whatever’s happening, it’s getting worse.
All I wanted was to go home.
All I wanted was to go home.
All I wanted was to go home.
All I wanted was to go home.
Did you come from the crash site, like the others?
...but you can sit by the fire, warm up a bit.
The crash site? Don’t you remember?
No no...you crashed yesterday. In the hills.
I even heard it over the howling blizzard.
Well, please stay and warm yourself by the fire until we can figure out where you belong.
This is the old community hall, in Thomson’s Crossing.
We gathered people here when the weather started turning bad three...or was it four days ago?
The houses became too cold and it seemed better to bring everyone under one roof.
Then yesterday, the crash survivors started showing up.
There were maybe half a dozen people in and around the townsite when the blizzard first hit.
Over the past day or so, the rest have slowly arrived.
Most of them from the crash site.
A passenger airliner, best I can tell.
Most of the people who arrived were too weak to talk about it.
But judging by the thundering sound and the size of the fire on the hills...
...whatever crashed up there, it must have been something big.
Are you sure you don’t remember the crash?
You’re not from around here, are you?
Whoever named this area “Pleasant Valley” had a pretty good sense of humour.
We get some of the harshest weather on all of Great Bear.
Yes...another storm blew through about a few weeks ago.
The worst I’ve seen in years.
Blocked the roads in and out.
I’m afraid we’re stuck here until the roads clear.
We’ll have to wait for nature to take its course.
We’re down to our last food.
We can melt snow for water but that will only get us so far.
This time of year...there’s always another blizzard around the corner.
Things might be different if the power hadn’t gone out.
The best thing we can do is try to keep these people warm and fed and...
...then we’ll see what the Lord has in store.
You seem disoriented, but you’re in much better shape than the others.
That sounds like a good place to start.
Once you’ve had a chance to check on them, come back and we can try to figure out...what can be done for them.
You’ll find the ones who were less fortunate in the basement.
May God take mercy on their souls.
They died from their injuries, or were found dead.
We put them downstairs to keep the bodies cold, and also...
...well, there are wolves around, you see.
Well, then we need to find some.
And soon, before the blizzard becomes too powerful to even risk going outside.
I need to remain with the survivors, minister to them, but you...
...you can go and look for the medicine they need.
Most of the surrounding houses will be empty, but you may find some of the minor supplies you need to treat the survivors.
The diabetic came in from the plane crash...a day, maybe two days ago.
So...your best chance to find their insulin will probably be to find their luggage.
You’ll have to search everything you find, and hope for the best.
Many of these survivors are in bad shape.
But I’ve seen this sort of thing before.
And if they can’t have hope, they need some closure.
People here...many of them weren’t travelling alone.
They’re broken-hearted, worried sick about their loved ones.
Feeling guilty...why did they survive when others didn’t?
You can help them find some closure.
But chances are, searching the crash site won’t be a pleasant experience.
Yes, you’re a doctor so you understand the fragility of human life.
The fragility of the human spirit is more my domain.
For the ones who’ve lost loved ones...
...if you can bring them some closure, that will help to start their healing process.
...any information that would help to identify those who did not survive the crash...
...that information might be a salve to these poor broken souls.
Then perhaps they’ll have a chance to face tomorrow.
In turn, take this, my child.
It’s not for you. Please, humour me.
At least until I can minister to those souls myself, having you carry this rosary while you investigate the crash site...
...it would bring an old priest some comfort.
It will be the closest thing to my being able to pray for them.
Perhaps, in the end, faith is all we have.
Thank you my child. This is a big help.
I fear another blizzard is on the way.
The farmers of Pleasant Valley have been part of my flock for years now.
Over that time, you start to see the patterns of things.
Blizzards are common this time of year.
We’re due for another one, any day now.
Normally, we’d hunker down with a stack of firewood, a full pantry, and wait it out.
Even with what you’ve done, we’ll have to pray we survive long enough for the weather to clear.
May God watch over you, my child.
The storm is coming and the people are vulnerable.
The storm is coming and the people are vulnerable.
You’re making good progress. Your efforts are making a difference.
You’re making good progress. Your efforts are making a difference.
But there’s still work to be done.
But there’s still work to be done.
Nearly there, my child, nearly there. Be careful, but you are nearly done.
Nearly there, my child, nearly there. Be careful, but you are nearly done.
There’s not much time left, my child. Please...hurry. I beg you.
There’s not much time left, my child. Please...hurry. I beg you.
You have likely saved the lives of all these people.
They now have a fighting chance to last through this storm.
You have done God’s work here and he will forever look favourably upon you.
As I said, the usual paths are blocked.
But, the blizzard...it may have displaced enough snow to...
There is another route. It’s a dangerous one.
An entrance to the old coal mine.
If the blizzard moved enough snow, you might be able to get in there. It passes through the mountain.
An entrance to the old coal mine.
Follow the highway and, god-willing, you’ll get to Perseverance Mills.
Here...I’ll draw it on your map for you...
My thanks to you, my child.
And if you’ll permit an old priest an indulgence.
I’d like to share some wisdom with you.
Your burden. I see it weighs heavily on you.
You do not have to carry it alone.
I don’t say this as an attempt to sway your thinking or help you find faith.
But find something...someone...to help with your burden. Otherwise, it will consume you.
However crowded his table, there is always a seat for you, my child.
Keep it, my child. I fear you will have need of it before this long winter is done.
Just...leave me alone. I'm not opening this door for anyone.
I am... but I'm not letting you in, they killed my friend. How do I know you aren't one of them?
Seems like I don't have much of a choice.
We left most of our supplies at the old Logging Camp while we fished here. Can you get them for me?
There's more. In that abandoned dam...we found evidence that proves there shouldn't be logging in Mystery Lake. I need that evidence.
Documents nobody wanted to be found. We hid them until we could retrieve them. Under a floor tile at the bottom of the stairwell.
If you can help me get the documents back...wow, it would be a huge win for the environment.
If you care about, you know, living in the world.
Here's the key to the trailer where we stashed our supplies. I'll slide it under the door.
Did you find our stuff yet? The supplies? And the documents? I need both.
Hey...that's great. Thank you. But...I hope you understand if I ask you to just leave them outside the door.
Thank you, stranger. You may not care, but you've made a huge difference to our cause.
Yeah...I'm still weak. Going to rest up here, until I'm ready to move on.
I'll die out here without my gear.
You know, if you care about living in the world.
Well, he’s locked up in Blackrock, isn’t he?
Listen. Mathis is bad, but Donner is something much worse.
I’ve seen a lot of criminals in my years and Donner...
...he’s one of those guys that keeps Wardens like me up at night.
He’s the kind of guy they make prisons like Blackrock for.
There’s no redemption for guys like Donner.
There’s no way back to living in “regular society” again.
They just want to destroy the world you and I live in.
If Mathis is bad, Donner is...biblical bad.
Built a hundred years ago and updated a few times.
Built a hundred years ago and updated a few times.
They came back three days later, half-dead, begging us to take them back.
And that was in the middle of summer.
Oh yeah. We go way back.
He was in for murder on the Mainland about ten years ago. He did seven and then got off on parole.
I was Warden at one of the federal pens there and...
...well let’s just say Mathis isn’t sending me any Christmas cards these days.
Mathis is bad, but he’s...old school bad.
Murder. Larceny. The occasional heist and grand theft auto.
But Donner...he’s a chip off the old block. And then some.
Well, he’s locked up in Blackrock, isn’t he?
Listen. Mathis is bad, but Donner is something much worse.
I’ve seen a lot of criminals in my years and Donner...
...he’s one of those guys that keeps Wardens like me up at night.
He’s the kind of guy they make prisons like Blackrock for.
There’s no redemption for guys like Donner.
There’s no way back to living in “regular society” again.
They just want to destroy the world you and I live in.
If Mathis is bad, Donner is...biblical bad.
Power went out here a couple of weeks ago now.
The backups held for a while but eventually the cons were able to break out and overwhelm the guards.
They grabbed the keys to solitary and went to get Donner, which...
...well that would have been the end.
But they couldn’t open the gates to solitary.
Something has them locked down tight and it’s driving Mathis crazy.
I haven’t seen any of the other guards since they locked me up in here and...
And now that Mathis is here...
There are mechanical fail safes in the system.
Keep in mind most of this jail is pretty old.
But that’s not the full answer to why Donner is still locked up.
Well...best I can tell, they should have been able to break him out by now.
But something...or someone...has been getting in the way.
But sounds like Mathis is as mad as a hornet because of them, and that brings me no small pleasure.
Shit...they’re coming. Get back to your bunk!
****...they’re coming. Get back to your bunk!
The whole jail is in some kind of weird lockdown.
It all happened before you got here.
I...I don’t know anything about it.
Nothing is working the way it’s supposed to right now.
You...you seem to know a fair bit of first aid.
With friends like Mathis, I’m not surprised.
We’d better hurry before the guards come back.
There’s something I need to tell you about the prison.
It’s...it's on its own locking circuits.
Separate from the rest of the prison.
Mathis and his guys...they haven’t figured that out yet.
When they do, they’ll get Donner out and there will be hell to pay.
Mathis thinks I used some kind of override to keep Donner locked in there...
...even when the rest of the cells went haywire.
I can’t figure it out, but someone is out there, messing with the system.
The old rotary phone system would still work.
Redundancy for when the sat phone goes down.
Just don’t let them find you in here.
If you get to talk to whoever it was on the phone again, do whatever they ask.
‘Cause right now, they are the only thing keeping us all alive.
The enemy of my enemy is my friend.
Hey...I can hear you moving around.
Any luck at the power plant?
Whoever’s out there messing up Mathis’ plans?
Well, then we have to do whatever we can to help them.
We have to find a way to slow Mathis down...
Stand on the toilet and you can reach the window.
Haven’t you done enough to my prison?
We kept it in storage because we didn’t have a safe way to get it back to the mainland.
...b..but I know where you can find some.
Old mine...in the hills just above the prison.
