It was shut down suddenly for safety reasons after the quakes, but most of the gear was left up there.
I...I bet there are some detonator caps up there.
Yes well, normally I’m on the other side of the bars.
Name’s Franklin. I’m Warden here at Blackrock.
You and I are locked up in here.
Mathis and his gang of thugs are trying to break someone out of solitary.
We’re still alive, for now, so they must need us for something.
The power’s been out for days.
Built a hundred years ago and updated a few times.
You notice the walls on your way in?
Ok, well they aren’t that high or that impressive really.
Because whatever dumb sonofabitch tries to escape from this place has to get through about fifty clicks of brutal terrain...
...full of dangerous wildlife before they can even think about finding a road that leads out of here.
Yeah...but are you going to get out?
About twenty years ago a pair of cons escaped.
I don't recognize your voice and you haven't left like the other cowards so...must be a Mainlander. Someone who doesn't know any better.
Nynorsk: Eg kjenner ikkje stemmen din, og sidan du i motsetning til de andre feigingene ikkje har dratt, må du vera ein fastlending. Ein som ikkje vet bedre.

English: You think because my eyes are covered, I can't see you? Make the wrong move, say the wrong thing...you'll see how good a shot I am.
Nynorsk: Du tror kanskje eg ikkje kan se deg fordi øynene mine er dekket til? Ein feil bevegelse, ett feil ord … so får du se kor god eg er til å skyte.

Notes: [Hesitates a minute, then puts the rifle down]

English: If you're here, things must be worse than they thought.
Nynorsk: Viss du er her, må situasjonen vera verre enn de trodde.

English: You're already doing better than the others. You found the fuel, but did you find any answers?
Nynorsk: Du gjer det allerede betre enn de andre. Du fant brensel, men fant du nokon svar?

English: It's just as I told you. They're all gone.
Nynorsk: det er akkurat som eg sa. Alle har dratt.

English: The power went out. Who knows the reason. People started to get cold, hungry. They panicked. Started to talk crazy.
Nynorsk: Strømmen gikk. Hvem vet hvorfor. Folk begynte å verta kalde og sultne. de fikk panikk. Begynte å snakke i tunger.

English: Others walked here from the highway...some, belonged here. Others, were Outsiders like you.
Nynorsk: Andre kom gående hit frå motorveien. nokon hørte til her. Andre var fremmede, som deg.

English: There was an outsider woman. I heard her pass through. She wasn't alone. There were angry voices, and...but the storm was too loud.
Nynorsk: det var ein kvinne som ikkje var herfra. nokon sa at hun kom forbi. Ho var ikkje alene. det var sinte stemmer, og … men stormen lagde for mykje støy.

English: I lost the voices and I couldn’t get them back.
Nynorsk: Eg mistet stemmene og klarte ikkje å få dem Attende.

English: Nevermind. You did well with the fuel. Now, do the same with food. Or I won't last the winter.
Nynorsk: Glem det. Bra gjort med brenselet. No kan du gjera det samme med mat. Ellers klarer eg meg ikkje gjennom vinteren.

English: Friend...yes, she passed through. Some people heard her. In the storm.
Nynorsk: Venninne … Ja, hun kom forbi. det var nokon som hørte henne. I stormen.

English: She passed through town. Too many closed doors, broken houses. Nowhere to run, to hide.
Nynorsk: Ho var innom byen. For mange stengte dører, Øydelagt e hus. Ingen plassar å flykte til, ingen plassar å gjemme seg.

English: Yes, why didn't they? They should have!
Nynorsk: Ja, hvorfor gjorde de ikkje det? det skulle de ha gjort!

English: They should have found her before it was too late.
Nynorsk: de skulle ha funnet henne før det var for sent.

English: They said there were bad men who came from the tunnel. Your friend...the woman...she must have passed through there.
Nynorsk: de sa det kom slemme menn frå tunnelen. Venninnen din … kvinnen … hun må ha kommet gjennom der.

English: The only way through the mountains. The only way she could have gone.
Nynorsk: Den eneste veien gjennom fjellet. Den eneste veien hun kunne ha dratt.

English: Grey Mother wants to know what happened in the night! I heard the angry voices, the angry wind, but the rest is a mystery.
Nynorsk: Gråmor vil gjerne vite kva som skjedde om natten! eg hørte de sinte stemmene og den sinte vinden, men resten er eit mysterium.

English: Go to the tunnel and tell me what you find.
Nynorsk: Gå til tunnelen og fortell meg kva du finner.

English: If the tunnel is blocked, that's the end for Grey Mother.
Nynorsk: Viss tunnelen er blokkert, betyr det slutten for Gråmor.

English: No, not the only way through. But...my only way through
Nynorsk: Nei, ikkje den eneste. Men den eneste for Gråmor.

English: Grey Mother is tired now. Leit her rest for a while...
Nynorsk: Gråmor er trøtt nå. La henne hvile ein stund …

English: There's only one thing left to be done. You need to put her to rest.
Nynorsk: det er berre ein ting igjen å gjøre. Du må glemme henne.

English: On the other side of town, there's a farmhouse.
Nynorsk: På den andre sidan av byen er det eit våningshus.

English: You'll find a key to a safety deposit box somewhere in there.
Nynorsk: Du finner ein nykel til ein bankboks eit plass der inne.

English: Go to the bank, and bring me the box that matches the key.
Nynorsk: Fer til banken, og bring meg bankboksen nykelen passer i.

English: Then you'll understand what happened to her.
Nynorsk: Da vil du forstå kva som skjedde med henne.

English: They left her, didn't they? She needed help and they let her go.
Nynorsk: de forlot henne, gjorde de ikke? Ho trengte hjelp, og de lot henne dra.

English: This is how we make it right.
Nynorsk: det er slik vi gjer det godt igjen.

English: In the bank. You'll find the answers. Now go.
Nynorsk: I banken. Du vil finne svarene der. Fer nå.
Ha troen, fremmede. det vil den.

English: Do one last thing for me, and then I will tell you what you need to know.
Nynorsk: gjer ein siste ting for meg, so skal eg fortelle deg det du treng å vite.

English: Then you will die like the others.
Nynorsk: Da vil du dø, akkurat som de andre.

English: Just one more task for Grey Mother, man who fell from the sky.
Nynorsk: Bare ein til oppgave for Gråmor, du mann som falt ned frå himmelen.

English: And then you'll get the answers you need.
Nynorsk: Så får du svarene du trenger.

English: Right a wrong from the past, Outsider. That's all I ask.
Nynorsk: Å gjera rett noko frå fortiden, fremmede. det er alt eg ber om.

English: You have a good heart, Mackenzie. You see things others would miss.
Nynorsk: Du har eit godt hjerte, Mackenzie. Du ser ting andre overser.

English: The years have made me angry. Lily was my daughter...our daughter.
Nynorsk: Årene har gjort meg sint. Lily var min datter … vår datter.

English: I am also a Barker. The Farmeir was my husband.
Nynorsk: Eg er òg ein Barker. BonDen var min ektemann.

English: She wanted to summit all the peaks on Great Bear.
Nynorsk: Ho ønsket å no alle fjelltoppene på Sværebjørn.

English: She was young, but already very talented.
Nynorsk: Ho var ung, men allerede veldig dyktig.

English: One day she wanted to head out on her own.
Nynorsk: En dag ville hun dra ut alene.

English: I said no, but he said yes.
Nynorsk: Eg sa nei, men hun sa ja.

English: "Leit her go, she needs to face it alone."
Nynorsk: «La henne dra, hun må få prøve seg alene.»

English: So she faced it alone. And fell.
Nynorsk: Så hun prøvde seg alene. Og falt.

English: They were my mother's. I gave them to Lily on her 16th birthday. The year she died.
Nynorsk: de var min mors. eg ga dem til Lily på hennes sekstenårsdag. Året hun døydde.

English: I wanted the pearls buried with her, but her father wanted to keep them to remember her.
Nynorsk: Eg ville at perlene skulle legges i graven, men hennes far ønsket å beholde dem for å minnes henne.

English: We fought bitterly, and never spoke again.
Nynorsk: det var ein bitter krangel, og snakket aldri sammen igjen.
… som å miste ditt eget liv.

English: But now maybe you can save your friend. And Lily's death doesn't have to be for nothing.
Nynorsk: Men no kan du kanskje redde din venn. So vil ikkje Lilys død vera helt uten mening.

English: Take this key. Upstairs, in my Lily's old room, is a trunk with her old climbing things.
Nynorsk: Ta denne nykelen. Ovenpå, i Lilys gamle rom, er ein kiste med det gamle klatreutstyret hennes.

English: Take the rope and the map. Follow Lily's path, and you'll find the back way through the mountains.
Nynorsk: Ta tauet og kartet. Flyg Lilys rute, so finner du bakveien gjennom fjellet.

English: It's the only way to find the route to Perseverance Mills.
Nynorsk: det er den eneste veien til Trottug Møller.

English: I'm content to sit here and think of my Lily, resting with her favourite pearls.
Nynorsk: For meg er det greit å berre sitte her og tenke på min Lily, som no hviler sammen med favorittperlene sine.

English: You've done a lot for me, Mackenzie. I won't forget about you.
Nynorsk: Du har gjort mykje for meg, Mackenzie. eg kjem ikkje til å glemme deg.

English: My journey is finished. But yours is only beginning. Go, and don't think of Grey Mother, or Milton. We're of the old world now.
Nynorsk: Reisen min er ved veis ende. Men din har nettopp begynt. Dra, og ikkje tenk på Gråmor eller Milton. Vi er ein del av den gamle verDen nå.

English: The new world is for the strong to survive.
Nynorsk: Den nye verDen – den er noko de sterke må prøve å overleve.

English: But that’s what they said to do, after the quakes -- if there was ever another emergency.
“Go to the coast, and help will come.”
They wanted me to go with them, but I’m not ready to leave Milton.
I’m not alone. I have my Lily.
The power went out. Who knows the reason. People started to get cold, hungry. They panicked. Started to talk crazy.
Others walked here from the highway...some, belonged here. Others, were Outsiders like you.
There was an outsider woman. I heard her pass through. She wasn't alone. There were angry voices, and...but the storm was too loud.
I lost the voices and I couldn't get them back.
We needed help years ago. After the quakes. Then during the Collapse. When money mostly went away.
But nobody on the mainland cared.
So Milton faded. Great Bear too.
Out of sight, out of mind, right?
Not different. Not for Milton. Not for Great Bear. Not for Grey Mother.
The power’s always been spotty here, since the quakes. No money to fix the broken stuff left behind. And nobody from the Mainland seemed to care enough to do anything about it.
I’ve learned to hear the difference between something quiet, and something abandoned.
This goes deeper than just a stillness.
It feels like the moments before the world goes to sleep.
We’re just the last ones left awake to notice it.
It’s what you are, isn’t it? From the Mainland? An outsider?
You don’t really belong here, do you?

We lost everything in the Collapse. People didn’t realize how dependent we’d become. Some were fine with it. Others didn’t want the scraps from your table. It created deep rifts in families, communities. Scars that never healed.
The Mainland had become our lifeline. And it was suddenly cut. And so, we suffered.

I’m not surprised. You Mainlanders have always been focused on your own story. Only interested in Great Bear when it had something to give you. If you can’t cut it down or dig it out of the ground, what use is it to you?
The memories are grey...misty. I’m trying to remember.
It was...windy. The blizzard was already waking up. But I heard yelling. A scream.
I'm not sure. The voices were...thin. Far. The blizzard was waking up. Soon there was only wind and...darkness.
I don't know. I don't remember. It's all cloudy now.
If they were outsiders, they might have stayed in the old schoolhouse.
In the months after the quakes...people used to huddle there for the warmth of the school's old coal burner. Rare outsider coming through Milton might stay there the night.
If your friend came through Milton, chances are she ended up there.
I’m back in that night. The wind howling.
Voices passing through town. I can hear them just outside the window. It’s windy but the voices carry. They are yelling.
Her voice...it passes through town. She’s running.
She’s alone. Calling for help. But no one comes.
Yes, why didn’t they? They should have!
They should have found her before it was too late.
They said...men came from the tunnel.
The only way out of Milton. The only way through the mountains.
It’s the only way she could have gone.
It's been a while since Grey Mother had anyone to make meals for. Please...take some soup before you go...
If the tunnel is blocked, that's the end for Grey Mother.
No, not the only way through. But...my only way through.
There's only one thing left to be done. You need to put her to rest.
I remember something...a farmhouse. On the other side of town.
That night...the memories are confused. But...somehow I remember the farmhouse.
You'll find a key to a safety deposit box somewhere in there.
Go to the bank, and bring me the box that matches the key.
Then you'll understand what happened to her.
They left her, didn't they? She needed help and they let her go.
This is how we make it right.
In the bank. You'll find the answers. Now go.
I'm old. Sometimes the mind wanders, Outsider. Travels to other places. Other times.
I think about her. Cold and alone.
You think she passed through the tunnel?
A word from the old days. Why would she write that?
Or maybe reminding you not to?
Why? Because you mean so much to her?
I seem to recall...a town somewhere up north. Far. What was it called...
Old logging and mill town. Used to be an important place. Now it’s mostly dead, like Milton.
By car, before the quakes, when the roads were clear.
That will be a long road.
You’ve done more for me than you can know, Mackenzie.
I thought I was helping you...
Now that I have her pearls...
I needed the pearls to remember her. But now you can take her things...upstairs.
In her old room. Her climbing gear. Her maps.
They can help you get out of Milton...the path through the mountains.
Yes. My Lily was a climber.
Take the rope. The map. Follow her path.
It’ll lead you out of Milton and deeper into the mountains. North.
Now...leave me to my memories, outsider.
Go out there, and find your friend.
And don’t stop to think about Milton, or Grey Mother, again.
We’re of the old world. This new world is for the strong to survive.
You want to understand Lily’s story, man who fell from the sky?
Go find her. Take the pearls and give them to Lily.
And then I can rest in peace.
They were the last gift I gave her...on her 16th birthday.
She wanted to leave Milton. To be free. She had grown up here in the mountains...a climber. She wanted to leave to summit all the tallest peaks on Great Bear.
I was afraid to let her go. We fought bitterly. And she left.
She died out there...in the mountains. In the wilderness.
Is like losing your own life.
You have a kind heart, Mackenzie. But it’s a heavy one.
Go..find your friend. Use Lily’s climbing gear and her map.
And maybe then her death won’t feel so empty.
You’ve done a lot for me Mackenzie. I won’t forget about you.
I don't recognize your voice and you haven't left like the others so...must be a Mainlander. Someone who doesn't know any better.
You think because my eyes are covered, I can’t see you?
Make the wrong move, say the wrong thing...you’ll see how good a shot I am.
If you’re here, things must be worse than they thought.
Milton. A forgotten town deep in the mountains.
I’ve lived here all my life. Not much use for the outside world
Milton’s the last of the old mountain towns.
Now it’s almost impossible to get to. Or get out of.
Only people left here are either too poor or too proud to leave.
I have what I need. At least, I did before the bad men came.
Now...I’m not sure I have enough to get through the winter.
My mind is...fuzzy. Some things come through so sharp and others...like a dream.
Let me think. Let me rest.
Maybe I can pull some memories out of the fog. Maybe I can find something that could help you find your friend.
The men...they passed through town. The night of the storm. The night of the lights.
The old quake closed down most of the roads in and out of town. That was years ago.
Blizzard just swept through town. After the power went out.
As for help -- you won't find any out there.
You're on your own. We both are.
The “bad men” took everything. The others in town who would have helped me are gone. The ones left will have their own worries.
What about your friend? Aren’t you in a hurry to find her?
Grey Mother can’t promise she can unlock the secrets in the dark cupboards of her mind, but she’ll try.
I had a name...once. But for years the townsfolk have called me “Grey Mother”.
A name takes on its own life, such that at one point the name becomes the thing it belongs to.
Then, the old names fade and can only be remembered by the young and the true.
You should call me Grey Mother also.
All I know is that I heard screams and could smell smoke...
The bad men. The bad men came.
Took my things. Tried to take my house.
They thought they were safe, because Grey Mother can’t see.
Everyone thinks being old means you’re weak.
Doesn’t sound like anyone from Milton.
Most of the elderly have gone or died.
I’m the only one left...the only one from the old days.
Someone came here...one of the townsfolk. Tried to convince me to leave.
They said there were houses...burning, in the town.
They said people were scared and were leaving for the coast...on foot.
Please...I want this to be over.
Mathis says carry the asshole, we carry him.
Mathis says carry the ***hole, we carry him.
Don’t believe everything you hear, dumbass.
You figure that out all by yourself?
This shit with Donner has him half-crazy.
This **** with Donner has him half-crazy.
Nevermind the wolves, we gotta find him fast.
Look, you dumbass. Mathis says the pilot’s our ticket off this damn island.
Don’t you want to get back to the Mainland?
Let’s go find this guy, before Mathis loses his temper again.
You know what he’s like when he’s angry.
Right. You clean up the warden and I’ll tell you all about it.
So there was this really tight plan, Mathis had months to set it up.
Everyone had their part to play.
It was like...out of a fucking movie.
It was like...out of a ****ing movie.
So we bust out, and all hell breaks loose.
We're gonna clip your wings now, pilot!
We're gonna clip your wings now, pilot!
We're gonna clip your wings now, pilot!
We get to the front gates, it’s a mess, right?
Where the hell is this guy?
Where the hell is this guy?
Where the hell is this guy?
And the driver who’s supposed to pick us up.
Can't stay out here much longer...
Can't stay out here much longer...
Can't stay out here much longer...
So the driver pulls up, like...two minutes late.
Alarms going off everywhere, it’s like...the prison guards are coming after us, we’re going to get grabbed at any second.
We’re yelling at Mathis, “Come on man let’s go. Let’s get outta here!”
Looking like...he wants to eat the guy.
Mathis walks over to the van, slowly.
We’re all jumping in and yelling to get out, and we...
...and we can *see* the fucking guards coming.
Like, we are done. We need to GET OUT.
...he pulls the driver out of the van, looks back at us, and...
...with this totally wild look in his eyes...
...just says...”Go”. Like totally calmly, but with this wild edge.
And he just starts beating the living shit out of the driver.
And he just starts beating the living **** out of the driver.
Yeah I mean we took off.
...it took five cops to pull him off that driver.
He cared less about being caught than he did about the driver being late.
Mathis is not a patient man.
He does not like it when a plan does not come together.
He does not like to be let down.
And right now, his plan for getting Donner out of here is totally fucked.
And right now, his plan for getting Donner out of here is totally ****ed.
And it’s just a matter of time before he...
[snaps finger]...snaps, like he did in Montreal.
If he dies, it’ll be worse for us.
We need to get him patched up.
Great! Go there and grab some supplies.
Don’t be an asshole. Go do it.
Don’t be an ***hole. Go do it.
Hey, who went back to look for Leclerc when he went missing?
No way I’m going back out there.
Just keep quiet and hope that Mathis doesn’t start paying attention to you.
Listen, pilot. Why don’t you shut the fuck up?
Listen, pilot. Why don’t you shut the **** up?
You’ve been...out in the bush all this time.
I’m sure you’ve figured out how to deal with a few wolves by now.
We let you out, you get the supplies.
And maybe...we keep Mathis distracted so he doesn’t lose his shit on you next time.
And maybe...we keep Mathis distracted so he doesn’t lose his **** on you next time.
Time to save the day, pilot.
Mathis said to give you this.
It’s a bit of a map.
Shows the way to the dam.
Looks like you can just...follow the power lines or something.
Do I look like a guy who gives a shit?
Do I look like a guy who gives a ****?
You don’t want to freeze out here?
Yeah, dog. Time to get back out there.
I think Mathis wants to let off some steam.
Can’t see shit for all the smoke right now.
Can’t see **** for all the smoke right now.
You’re never going to find her.
We burned them all, you know. In the old school.
It was so easy. Just shoved them in there and locked the door.
It just happened. All the lights went out, damn bus lost control and crashed into the tunnel. Brought the roof down on us. Barely crawled out of there alive. Hell, some didn’t.
People all hanging around...trying to get warm after the power went out. All huddled together. Scared and freezing.
Man, I would have liked to have seen that.
But we sure warmed them up!
We put them all in the old school house so we could keep an eye on them. And then something happened to the lights...the power...it was like sparks everywhere and then fire.
..it was like sparks everywhere and then fire.
Your scarf lady found us while the school was burning. She tried to help get them out. But it was already too late. Smoke already did ‘em in.
She fought like hell to try to get them out. She stuck a knife or...screwdriver...not sure...into one of our guys. Cut me too. Then ran out into the blizzard.
She fought like hell to try to get them out.
You want to know about your lady?
We caught up but...she’s a fiery one. Still had the knife. Got me real good. You can see.
We tried to stop her but she ended up on the bus...somehow, she was small enough to crawl through the crushed part.
She got away, whatever good it’s gonna do her.
We barely clipped her wings. She wasn’t hurt too bad.
No way out of here now. Roads are all blocked.
I told you what I know. Are you gonna help me or what?
Pull this knife out of me...it’s stuck in deep and I can’t feel anything below my waist. I need it out.
Hey...you think they put me on that bus for my good behaviour? That’s the bus to Blackrock.
You think they put me on that bus for my good behaviour?
Yeah, you know. Blackrock Federal Pen. Where they put the worst of the bad people...the bad people, bad people.
Yeah, you know. Blackrock Federal Pen. Ha ha.
Where they put the worst of the bad people...
People too bad for the Mainland.
It’s like an old penal colony or some damn thing.
They know there’s no easy way for us to get back.
That’s better...now...I’ll just sit here for a while. I think I’m warming up...
You working for those assholes in prison?
You working for those ***holes in prison?
Then what you doing out here?
Soon, you’re going to have to figure out whose side you’re on in this little stalemate we have going on.
Whooee...that question has a long damn answer.
Right now, I’m safe from those prison assholes.
Right now, I’m safe from those prison ***holes.
But I cannot say the same for you.
So, they let you out of the prison?
Then they’re going to just let you back in?
Something about this situation...about you...doesn’t fit.
Shit man, you can’t even help yourself.
**** man, you can’t even help yourself.
Maybe I am, maybe I’m not.
Either way, I'm not telling you.
How do I know you aren’t really one of Donner’s boys?
Wake up man, this is all about Donner.
And I’m the only thing standing between that fucker rotting away in solitary...
And I’m the only thing standing between that ****er rotting away in solitary...
...and an evil bastard being unleashed on the rest of this frozen hellhole.
Take care of yourself, Mr. Mackenzie.
Those wolves sound pretty hungry to me.
So, they sent you to check on the power plant.
You always do what hardened criminals ask you to do?
You know you won’t be able to get the power back on, right?
...have nothing to do with the power plant.
Well I don’t know about you, but I’m not here to work on my tan.
That psycho Donner makes it out of solitary and we’re all in trouble, Mack.
Listen. You want to know what’s going on, with the power and all that, I can tell you.
But first, prove yourself to me.
Car broke down when the first aurora appeared.
Well, not so much “broke down” as just stopped working.
It was freezing so I got out and started walking down the road, to see if I might find someone else.
Got turned around in the darkness and snow...
Followed it, and found a guard tower.
Next thing I knew, I heard gunshots.
The shots were...there were so many.
Crept up and I could see them, slumped against the wall.
I had to get out, but, I know the area a bit.
There’s nowhere to go, really. Not on foot.
I don’t know if anyone’s coming to help, but I figure...
...I gotta do what I can to keep those fuckers locked up.
...I gotta do what I can to keep those ****ers locked up.
If he gets out, nobody within a hundred clicks of this place will be safe.
And if this thing last as long as I think it will...
...that would be very, very bad for all of us.
Nevermind. I just know stuff, ok?
It’s not more than lights in the sky.
Let’s stay focused on Blackrock, ok?
I guess you don’t follow the news much, huh?
They have a law about something, this guy’s broken it.
I hear his old man Mathis isn’t much better.
This is worse than I thought.
...he will make it his personal mission to find and hurt every living human he can get his hands on...
We gotta keep him in lockdown.
That’s the only thing that matters right now.
That’s how we’re going to keep him in.
You want to prove you’re trustworthy?
Leave Blackrock and let the chips fall where they may.
If you don’t know what’s inside the case, how do you know you need it?
Well, maybe we can help each other.
You do something for me, and I’ll find a way to help you with your little problem.
Even with the power out, there are physical mechanisms that the convicts can manipulate to get Donner out.
I mean, they are morons, but even morons get lucky sometimes.
We need to fix things so that they can’t accidently break him out.
Well, it just so happens, I have the plans to this ancient thing.
I mean, a lot of the original structure and prison systems are...probably Victorian era.
But the stuff under solitary...still old as shit.
But the stuff under solitary...still old as ****.
We get underneath, and we bust up the systems that manage the locking and unlocking mechanisms, and we basically...
...well, we turn the gates into walls.
We seize up the system, and it’s so old, so heavy...
...it’d take a goddamn nuclear bomb to break them out.
You get into the old steam tunnels.
You’ll find an access door in the rock face just outside the power plant.
According to these blueprints, they lead you -- more or less -- right to the old locking mechanisms under solitary.
Well, there are some stains on the map.
And a few areas that are a little fuzzy, engineering-wise.
But yeah, eventually you will get to the locking mechanisms.
You tear out or smash anything that looks remotely like a switch, fuse, panel, cable, wire, vacuum tube...you get it?
You do that, and Donner is locked in for good.
Hey...I’m not a prison designer, ok?
But yeah, as I read these blueprints...probably.
I mean, it’ll definitely buy us some time.
So, how’d it all work out?
Relax, Mack. Figure of speech, right?
We’re out of time. I’ve been gone for too long.
Just said we’re running out of time.
She’s the only reason I’m out here at all, Mackenzie.
So, it just so happens that this part of Great Bear offers one of the best unoccluded zones...
ideal for setting up certain sensitive instruments for my research so that...
You have to see...my thesis advisor?
You aren’t making any sense, Mackenzie.
O...ok. How do you know about her?
If they make it out, there’s a good chance they end up finding Atwood.
And that’s a big part of what I’m trying to prevent.
That’s where I was headed when my car stopped working.
I’ve been living there, doing research, for months.
Mackenzie, if the convicts find out about the radio telescope...it’ll be bad.
It’s an old government facility, so there’s all kinds of supplies there...
They could hunker down for weeks, months.
It’d make a hell of a base of operations for all manner of evil shit they might get up to.
It’d make a hell of a base of operations for all manner of evil **** they might get up to.
They could...prey on everyone within 100 clicks.
Blackrock is a fortress, but it’s broken.
It’s been broken by the aurora and everything that’s going on right now.
I’m not a hundred percent sure.
Due to the kind of work they do there.
There’s a good chance that all the shit that’s been going on out here...
There’s a good chance that all the **** that’s been going on out here...
...that it hasn’t been affected in the same way.
It means, Suzuki may be the key.
Good luck to us both, Mackenzie.
This is your friendly neighbourhood prison hacker checking in to say...
Uhh...Mack. Whatever you’re going to do, you’d better do it soon.
You made it to the Warden’s office? Good.
You better get what you need and get the hell out of there. Quick.
I might have nudged it a bit. But mostly those idiot convicts did it to themselves.
The PA and lockdown, however. That was all me.
Ok! Here we are. Warden’s office...
Ok, so...end of the hallway you just came out of.
You’ll end up on the roof.
Cross over the building and you’ll find a fire escape thingy.
Come down there, and you should recognize where you are.
I’ll meet you at the power plant.
The whole security system has gone haywire and I have no idea how long the lockdown will last.
Mathis and Donner could be after you in a minute.
Thanks for your help back there.
That was one hell of an explosion, huh?
Well...I might just have had a little bit to do with that.
Ha! That guy had it coming to him.
Hacked into the security cameras across the prison.
That’s how I was able to keep an eye on you and...the rest of it.
This is as far as my plan went.
I still don’t get it, but yeah we do.
I’m worried about her, with all this going on.
That was faster than I expected.
I dunno? This was the extent of my plan, Mackenzie.
Isn’t this prison escape gig more your thing?
This is not how I thought this would end.
And things were just starting to look up.
I’m not afraid of you, asshole.
I’ve been fighting guys like you all my damn life.
First time I’ve missed the place.
Nevermind. I just know stuff, ok?
It’s not more than lights in the sky.
Let’s stay focused on Blackrock, ok?
You said you would, and you did.

Nynorsk: Du ser for jævlig ut, Mackenzie.

English: I see you’re an interior design critic now.
Damn...not bad for a pilot. You’re full of surprises.
Nynorsk: Du verden, ikkje verst for ein pilot. Du er full av overraskelser.

English: Maybe he can make it after all.
Nynorsk: Kanskje han kan klare seg likevel.

English: Woah. Slow down. A rifle will get you out of a jam, but survival’s about what you know.
Nynorsk: Hei! Rolig nå. Eit børse kan få deg ut av trøbbel, men overleving handlar om kva du kan.

English: And right now, you don’t know shit.
Nynorsk: Og akkurat no kan du ikkje ein dritt.

English: No. What I suggest is Jeremiah’s Survival School. Student population: one. Let’s see if we can keep you alive long enough to graduate.
Nynorsk: Nei. det eg foreslår, er Jeremiahs Overlevingskurs. Antall elever: ein. Vi får se om vi kan holde deg i live til du uteksamineres.

English: I have a little graduation present for you.
Nynorsk: Eg har ein liten uteksamineringsgave til deg.

English: You’ve earned it. And I have a feeling you’re going to be needing it before you’re through.
Nynorsk: det er fortjent. Og eg har på følelsen at du kjem til å trenge den før du er ferdig.

English: Like I said before, Mackenzie. There’s only one way out of here -- through that Dam.
Nynorsk: Som sagt, Mackenzie: det finnes berre ein vei ut herfra – gjennom demningen.

English: I’m the only one who can get you through. And I want to help you, I really do.
Nynorsk: Eg er den eneste som kan hjelpe deg gjennom. Og eg ynskjer virkelig å hjelpe deg.

English: Listen, Mackenzie. There’s more at stake here than you realize. This is about more than you, or me, or your friend.
Nynorsk: Hør, Mackenzie. det står meir på spel enn du tror. dette handler om meir enn deg, meg eller vennen din.

English: Just...listen. If you can’t get past the bear, the rest doesn’t matter. If I was well enough I’d take care of it myself. But I’m wrecked. We’ll die here unless you finish it off.
Nynorsk: Bare hør etter. Resten har ikkje noko å si om du ikkje kjem deg forbi bjørnen. Viss eg var frisk nok, skulle eg tatt meg av den sjølv. Men eg er eit vrak. Vi dør om ikkje du dreper bjørnen.

English: You can pull a trigger, can’t you?
Nynorsk: Du kan vel trykke på ein avtrekker?

English: Get out there. Keep you wits about you. He’s out there. Waiting. But you’re going to have bait him, so the fight can happen on your terms.
Nynorsk: Dra. Vær konsentrert. Han er der ute. Han venter. Men du må lokke han til deg, slik at kampen kan skje på dine premisser.

English: Bears can smell blood from over 20 clicks away. You get out there, cut yourself enough that you bleed, and he’ll come to you. I’m sure of it.
Nynorsk: Bjørner kan lukte blod frå over 20 kilometers hold. Fer ut dit, lag eit kutt som gjer at du blør, so kjem han til deg. det er eg sikker på.

English: He’ll come for you when you're not expecting it. But you won’t miss it. It won’t be subtle. It’ll sound like a ton of muscle and bone bearing down on you like a freight train of hate and hunger.
Nynorsk: Han kjem etter deg når du minst venter det. Men ikkje uten at du legger merke til det. Den vil ikkje vera forsiktig. Den vil høres ut som eit tonn muskler og bein som kjem mot deg som eit godstog fylt med hat og sult.

English: You stand your ground. Do not flinch. You raise your rifle. You sight him. And when you can see between his eyes -- you squeeze that trigger.
Nynorsk: Bli stående. ikkje vik unna. Legg an børseet. Sikt. Og når du kan se mellom øynene hans, trykker du på avtrekkeren.

English: He won’t go down with one shot. He’ll run off and it’ll seem like you got him but he’ll be back. He always comes back.
Nynorsk: Han går ikkje i bakken av ett skudd. Han vil løpe vekk, og det vil virke som du tok ham, men han kjem Attende. det gjer han alltid.

English: You do it again. And again. As many times as it takes to bring him down.
Nynorsk: Skyt han ein gang til. Og igjen. Helt til han går i bakken.

English: You bring me the Old Bear’s ear, and I will get you out of here. I will give you everything you need to find your friend.
Nynorsk: Bring meg Gamlebjørns øre, so skal eg hjelpe deg ut herfra. eg skal gi deg alt du treng for å finne vennen din.

English: Remember, Mackenzie. Wait til you see the whites of his eyes. Then squeeze the trigger.
Nynorsk: Husk dette, Mackenzie. Vent til du ser det hvite i bjørnens øye. Først da trykker du på avtrekkeren.

English: It’s not something you can understand with your head, Mackenzie. No man can know if he has what it takes to face the bear until he’s faced it. And then...it’s not about what’s in here, its about what you've got in here.
Nynorsk: det er ikkje noko du kan forstå med hodet, Mackenzie. Ingen mann kan vite om han har det som skal til i eit møte med ein bjørn, før han står der. Og da handler alt om kva som er her inne.

English: You aren’t going to kill the bear with your head. You’re going to kill him with your heart.
Nynorsk: Du kan ikkje drepe bjørnen med hodet. Du må drepe han med hjertet.

English: Holy...I wasn't sure you had it in you, Mackenzie.
Nynorsk: Du verden, eg var ikkje sikker på om du hadde det i deg, Mackenzie.

English: I’m impressed. I’m really impressed. Shit. The Old Bear! Gone. Finally.
Nynorsk: Eg er imponert. Skikkelig imponert. Utrolig. Gamlebjørn! Borte. Endelig.

English: I’m actually going to miss that guy.
Nynorsk: Eg kjem faktisk til å savne karen.
Greit, pilot. Du har gjort deg fortjent til det.

English: Here’s the thing. The old Carter Dam -- it’s a mess. Multiple quakes have left it pretty unstable. Nobody really goes in there anymore.
Nynorsk: Her er greia. Den gamle Carter-demningen er berre kaos. Flere jordskjelv har gjort den ganske ustabil. Ingen begjev seg inn der lenger.

English: Upper floors aren’t too bad but it gets hairy deeper in. If you can navigate through the guts of it, you’ll find yourself on the other side of Carter River.
Nynorsk: de øvre etasjene er ikkje so ille, men lenger inn vert det skummelt. Klarer du å navigere deg gjennom demningens innvoller, havner du på den andre sidan av Carter-elven.

English: Follow the River, and you’ll find your way to a place called Kosedalen. Big mother weather service shortwave at a place called Signal Hill -- should be powerful enough to reach Perseverance Mills. If your friend isn’t there, at least you can get a message out.
Nynorsk: Gå langs elven, so kjem du til eit plass som kalles Kosedalen. På eit plass som heter Signalåsen, finner du ein stor kortbølgesender. Den skal vera kraftig nok til å no Trottug Møller. sjølv om vennen din ikkje skulle vera der, kan du i det minste få ut ein melding.

English: No guarantee the aurora will power the radio, but it’s your best shot.
Nynorsk: det er ingen garanti for at nordljoset vil gi strøm til radioen, men det er din beste sjanse.

English: And if it doesn’t, at least you’ll be on the right track. Follow the road North, through Kosedalen, and you’ll start seeing signs leading the way to Perseverance Mills. It’ll take you days to get there on foot. But at least now you have a fighting chance.
Nynorsk: Viss ikkje so er du i det minste på rett spor. Flyg veien nordover gjennom Kosedalen, so vil du finne skilt som leder deg til Trottug Møller. det vil ta dagar å komme seg dit til fots. Men no har du i alle fall ein mulighet.

English: First, I had to be sure you’d make it.
Nynorsk: Først måtte eg påse at du ville klare det.

English: I need you to do something for me. Get a message to someone. It’s important. More important than you know.
Nynorsk: Eg vil at du skal gjera noko for meg. Gi ein beskjed til nokon. det er viktig. Viktigere enn du vet.

English: You don’t have to get it, Mackenzie. You just have to do it.
Nynorsk: Du treng ikkje å forstå, Mackenzie. berre gjera det.

English: Listen carefully. An old friend of mine, lives alone in a cabin in the hills near Perseverance. Goes by the name Atwood. People in town will know how to find them. You need to get them this message as soon as possible.
Nynorsk: Hør godt etter. eg kjenner nokon som bor alene i ein hytte i åsen i nærheten av Trottug Møller. Navnet er Atwood. Folk i byen kan veien til hytten. Du må få levert denne meldingen so raskt som mulig.

English: Do you understand, Mackenzie? It’s important. It might be the most important thing.
Nynorsk: Forstår du, Mackenzie? det er viktig. Kanskje det aller viktigste.

English: Yes. It’s important. Don’t you get it? Oh damn it...to hell with it. I’ll do it myself.
Nynorsk: Ja. det er viktig. Skjønner du ikke? Faen, til helvete med det. eg gjer det sjølv.

English: You have to take that message, Mackenzie. Promise me.
Nynorsk: Du må overbringe den meldingen, Mackenzie. Lov meg.

English: Be careful. I didn’t keep you alive this long to see you die from making dumb mistakes. You still have a long way to go. But first...the Dam.
Nynorsk: Vær forsiktig. eg holdt deg ikkje i live so lenge berre for å se deg dø av dumme feil. Du har langt igjen. Men først, demningen.

English: The keypad to the control room -- it won’t work without power. You’ll need to get in there when the aurora is in the sky.
Nynorsk: Kodelåsen til kontrollrommet fungerer ikkje uten strøm. Du må komme deg inn der medan nordljoset er på himmelen.

English: Whatever you do, once you get inside Carter, you need to get out before daylight. Otherwise, you may get stuck in there for good.
Nynorsk: Uansett kva du gjør, so må du komme deg ut av Carter før det vert dag. Ellers kan du verta sittende fast der for godt.

English: Nah...I’ll be ok. A couple of weeks of going nuts in here and I’ll be good as new.
Nynorsk: Næh, det går bra med meg. Eit par uker med å verta gæren her inne, so er eg so god som ny.

English: Then again...if you have any of that Morphine left.
Nynorsk: Når det er sagt … Om du skulle ha litt morfin igjen …

English: Get on outta here, Mackenzie. Like you keep saying -- your friend may be out there waiting. Hope she has more sense than you.
Nynorsk: Stikk nå, Mackenzie. Som du plassig sier, so kan det vera venninnen din venter der ute. eg håper hun har meir vett enn deg.

English: Wedding ring and that look in your eye when you talk about her.
Nynorsk: Gifteringen og det blikket ditt når du snakker om henne.

English: You too, Mackenzie. Remember Wintermute. And maybe I’ll see you again some day.
Nynorsk: Du òg, Mackenzie. Husk Wintermute. So ses vi kanskje igjen ein dag.

English: Good luck, pilot. You’re going to need it. And now, I have my own path to tread.
Nynorsk: Lykke til, pilot. det treng du. eg har min egen sti å følge.
Smertene … eg treng noko mot smertene.

English: Old...dam. Map. Back of the door... [gurgles and passes out]
Nynorsk: Den gamle … demningen. Baksidan av døren …

English: [suddenly wakes up coughing and spitting blood]
...thanks...cause my insides hurt like hell. What’d...you find?
Nynorsk: Takk. For eg har jævlig vondt. kva … fant du?

English: What the hell you doing out here anyway?
Nynorsk: Hva i helvete gjer du egentlig her ute?

English: Only thing you should be looking for is a way to kill that bear.
Nynorsk: det eneste du bør lete etter, er ein måte å drepe bjørnen på.

English: He’ll be back soon enough. And when he is, I’ll be ready.
Nynorsk: Han kjem nok snart Attende. Og da skal eg vera klar.

English: That bear’s a mankiller. If we don’t finish him off...no telling what savage fury he’ll unleash.
Nynorsk: Den bjørnen er ein drapsmaskin. Viss vi ikkje dreper den, er det ikkje godt å si kva slags vrede den ville slippe løs.

English: Ha. Listen stranger. You aren’t going anywhere. Like it or not, you and me have a problem in common.
Nynorsk: Hør her, fremmede. Du skal ingen steder. Enten du liker det eller ikke, so har du og eg eit felles problem.

English: Neither of us is going to survive unless we kill that damn bear.
Nynorsk: Ingen av oss vil overleva om vi ikkje dreper den forbanna bjørnen.

English: Yeah…I saw ‘em. We see the Northern Lights lots this far up, but I’ve never seen anything quite like that.
Nynorsk: Ja, eg so det. Vi ser nordljoset ofte her oppe, men eg har aldri sett noko som det der.

English: Shit nothing town a few hours North?
Nynorsk: Eit høl av ein by nokon timar lenger nord?

English: You’re the first person I’ve seen in months. I haven’t seen your friend.
Nynorsk: Du er den fyrste personen eg har sett på flere måneder. eg har ikkje sett din venn.

English: Could be. Wildlife’s been acting weird too. Wolves, mostly. Hanging around more than usual. Like they’re waiting.
Nynorsk: Kan være. Dyrene har òg oppført seg rart. de har hengt rundt her meir enn de pleier. Som om de venter.

English: I dunno…but I have a bad feeling about it.
Nynorsk: Eg vet ikkje … men eg har ein dårlig følelse.

English: Look. Maybe we can help each other.
Nynorsk: Hør. Kanskje vi kan hjelpe hverandre.

English: I have an idea that might help you find who you’re looking for. But with that bear out there and me laid up in here...well, you’re as good as dead.
Nynorsk: Eg har ein idé som kan hjelpe deg til å finne den du ser etter. Men med bjørnen der ute og meg liggende her inne … vel, du er so godt som død.

English: With that bear on the prowl, you’ll never survive long enough to find your friend. And I can’t do shit from in here. But I can guide you. You do what I say, and I’ll keep you alive.
Nynorsk: Med den bjørnen ute på jakt so vil du aldri overleva lenge nok til å finne vennen din. Og eg kan ikkje gjera ein dritt herfra. Men eg kan veilede deg. gjer som eg sier, so skal eg holde deg i live.

English: We’ll talk about that. But first...you need some protection.
Nynorsk: det kan vi snakke om senere. Men først treng du litt beskyttelse.

English: What I was afraid of. That shot you took hurt the rifle more than the bear. My rifle’s done.
Nynorsk: det var det eg var redd for. det skuddet du fyrte av, gjorde meir skade på børseet enn på bjørnen. Børseet er ødelagt.

English: No. No backup. But I know where you might be able to fix it.
Nynorsk: Nei. Ingen i reserve. Men eg vet korleis du kan reparere det.

English: Old railway yard, about a day’s travel south, along the tracks. There’s a machine shop there. I used to trade for time on the tools, to keep my gear in order.
Nynorsk: det ligger eit gamalt verkstedområde ein dagsreise sørover langs toglinjen. der er det eit maskinverksted. eg pleide å bytte til meg tid med verktøyene, for å holde utstyret mitt i orden.

English: Bush pilot like you should be able to handle ‘em.
Nynorsk: Du som er pilot, får nok til å bruke dem.

English: Stay along the tracks. Keep your eyes open for the Old Bear. If you see him, hide and pray he doesn’t pick up your scent. Don’t get cocky, or we’ll both end up dead.
Nynorsk: Hald deg langs toglinjen. Se opp for Gamlebjørn. Viss du ser ham, må du gjemme deg og håpe at han ikkje får ferten av deg. ikkje vær arrogant, for da dør vi begge to.

English: Good luck, pilot. Maybe we’ll make a survivor out of you yet.
Nynorsk: Lykke til, pilot. Kanskje vi kan skape ein overlever av deg likevel.

English: HA! Not the way you shoot.
Shit...he got me good this time.
Me and the Old Bear go back a ways.
You mean like a hospital? Out here?
Radio’s been dead for the past few days. I can’t raise any of the usual channels. Not sure why.
Closest help is probably in Milton, back the way you came.
I’m wrecked, but if you leave now you might be able to...
But...we can only reach them by radio.
Might find some comms gear, or parts, in the old Carter Dam.
Probably ancient stuff though. Place’s been abandoned for years.
Used to have a first aid room. Might still be some old meds there too.
Something strong enough to maybe numb this pain.
The Old Bear. He’s still out there.
He’ll be wanting to finish the job.
You won’t kill him but you might...scare him off again.
Time? We don’t have time. We need to get a message out. It’s important.
Help me up so I can look at the radio.
See if the parts you brought back are any good.
Well...the parts look fine, so whatever’s wrong with the radio goes deeper than that.
Something to do with the power. Fuses? Transformers maybe.
We have bigger problems to deal with first.
That bear’s out there. Hunting us.
He’s a smart old bastard. He’ll keep us from getting out, getting supplies, finding help.
He’ll keep us from getting out, getting supplies, finding help.
Eventually...he’ll either get us, or starve us out.
Ugh...I gotta lay down. Help me back to the bed.
Help me back to the bed.
Every time we meet, we make a little trade.
Oh, I’m sure it will be. For one of us.
Bah...won’t find too many people out here.
That’s kind of the whole point.
What makes you think she came through here?
Well...the roads from Milton don’t lead this way.
Wherever she’s headed, you’ll have to cross the mountains to find her.
Not an easy path, even for the most experienced outdoorsman.
You won’t get far with that bear on the prowl.
What we need is to get my radio up and running, so we can find out what the hell is going on.
Maybe someone out there has seen your friend.
Yeah...the place was cracked open by the quake years ago, and never recovered.
It was already half-dead at the time.
Dam dates back to the 60s. Industrialist from the mainland wanted to use it to power a mining town he was planning to build.
But, bottom fell out of the price of coal and he had to abandon those plans.
Some fool tried to get it running again in the 80s but then the Forest Talkers got involved and that was the end of it.
Pretty sure the quakes finished the job once and for all.
Eco-terrorists. Activists, some call them. Depends on who you talk to I guess.
Well...they’ve been active for years. They come and go.
Mostly here to throw a wrench in the works for a variety of resource projects -- mining and forestry mainly.
They want Great Bear to remain a “pristine wilderness”.
Oh! I have no love for industry. But this is the way of the world.
You have something they want -- they take it. Nothing much you can do to stop it.
Well, that’s good news for you. Keep your eyes open for supply caches they might have left behind.
Well...this whole area takes its name from Mystery Lake, nearby. It’s a kind of wilderness preserve, though you wouldn’t know it from the logging trucks.
Not much around there apart from some lake cabins that’d be locked up for the season.
Railroad passes through the area. Trains come through once in a while. Fewer every year.
The whole area’s mostly dead, most of the year.
You gotta understand. The Collapse destroyed Great Bear.
There’s nothing here to stay for.
You meet anyone out here, chances are they’re hiding from something.
Shit-nothing town, north part of the island?
Well, normally I’d make some calls on the old shortwave.
The whole area’s been damn quiet since those lights in the sky. Even the wildlife’s acting strange.
But I might have an idea...
You live out here long enough, you get a sense for the patterns in nature.
Right now, the patterns are broken. Critters aren’t behaving the way they should.
It’s like they’re spooked, or something.
Best way I can say it is -- things don’t feel right.
Well...it’s a long-shot. But I may know how we can find out about your friend.
This shortwave. I use it to keep an ear open for what’s going on.
No reason I can see why it shouldn’t be working.
We might find another radio. But I think I have a better idea.
Problem is...it’s no use with the Old Bear out there.
Your path to a working radio -- and our survival -- is through that bear.
We have to find a way to deal with him first.
I’ve been hunting and trapping for years, and I’ve shot a lot of bears, but I’ve never encountered anything quite like him.
Special bear like that needs special magic to bring him down.
Don’t worry. I’m not delirious. I don’t mean literal magic.
But we need the old knowledge. The old ways.
There’s an old story. Local legend maybe...about one of the original settlers of this place. Spence.
The story goes something like this.
Spence shows up and sets up his claim shanty, with his young family in tow.
For generations, the family had been traders in the Hudson’s Bay company. Old “voyageur” stock, they say. Hard people. Survivors.
For generations, the family had been traders in the Hudson’s Bay company.
Old “voyageur” stock, they say. Hard people. Survivors.

One day a bear shows up and menaces the homestead. Spence takes a shot at the bear but it doesn’t seem to do anything. Bear wanders off, but Spence’s wife...she takes a turn. Slips into fever. For days. Delirious. She screams about the bear. Local doctor can’t do a thing for her. Neither can the priest.
Week later, a hired hand goes missing. They find him. Just a body. Ravaged.
Spence fears for his wife and kids. He’s convinced some evil bear spirit is trying to kill them. Revenge for some...slight in the past maybe? Something in the family history.
Spence gets some men together for a hunting party. They go out into the muskeg and track something big, for days. Eventually corner it.

It’s a big sonofabitch. Biggest bear they’d ever seen. Mankiller. Story goes, they empty their rifles into the bear and it just walks away. Like it’s made of stone. They call it the “demon bear” after that.
Wife’s dying now. Spence believes the bear’s evil spirit is killing her...eating her soul. He can’t get anyone to join him on another hunting party. They know rifles don’t work.
Spence believes the bear’s evil spirit is killing her...eating her soul. He can’t get anyone to join him on another hunting party. They know rifles don’t work.

So he forges a spear -- like a boar spear, but bigger. From some Old Hudson’s Bay trapper’s wisdom, apparently. He goes out, into the muskeg. Disappears for days. Then one morning, the wife’s fever breaks, but nothing from Spence. Some men go out looking for him. They find him, half dead. Blood all over him. Body torn almost in two. The bear’s work.
The last thing he says is, “Spear stole the bear’s soul. My wife is now free.” And then he’s gone.
Nobody knows. Never found a carcass. They buried Spence, took the spear back and hung it over the mantlepiece in the Spence homestead. Never saw that bear, or any other, again.
Years later, after the Spence family faded to obscurity, wealthy land baron bought the spear to hang in his hunting lodge.
Just so he could tell that story, I imagine.
I might spend all my time alone in the wilderness, but I’m not crazy.
But the old stories sometimes have truths hidden in them.
Spence might have been superstitious but he had the right idea.
Ten inches of cold hard steel might do what a bullet can’t. I’m convinced -- a spear’s the way to kill that bear. And you need to get Spence’s bear-killing spear if we’re going to survive the winter.
The old hunting lodge is still there. A couple of days journey South. Follow the tracks the other way, through the Muskeg, and you’ll find it.
If the spear’s there...get it. It might be our best hope.
You deal with the bear and let me worry about the radio.

Notes: Split version of SUBTITLE_SMJerR16110, please translate.

English: and let me worry about the radio.
Notes: Split version of SUBTITLE_SMJerR16110, please translate.

English: Good luck out there. Watch out for our “demon”.
Then maybe the legend is also real.
Let’s hope so, for your sake.
Did you see the lights in the night sky, the aurora?
Well, when that flared up, the radio came to life. It just lit up, and started spitting out noise, but it was all gibberish.
I think it needs more range...a more powerful signal.
If we could find a way to boost the signal strength when the aurora’s active...we might be able to get a message out.
You’re starting to get it, Mackenzie.
I was digging through some old geological survey maps...
This survey shows a series of radio transponder towers that cross back and forth across Great Bear.
Good question. But for another time.
Each tower has some electronics that’d serve like a signal booster, to make sure the message gets to the next relay.
Well...you get me two, maybe three of those, and I might just be able to rig us up our own signal booster.
Don’t be silly. Spence’s bear would be long gone by now. That was...150 years ago.
But, there’s definitely a bear out there. And he’s definitely interested in you.
You’ll just have to take your chances.
Damn it. You think I *want* to be in here?
I need to get a message out and this might be the only way.
There’s more at stake here than you and your friend. Please, Mackenzie. Get me those boosters.
I’ll fix the radio, and the first call we’ll make will be to Perseverance Mills, I promise.
Good! You’re up. And just in time.
You passed out. I let you rest, since I needed time to fix the radio.
Ha. And what did I tell you? Those transponder parts did the trick. They were perfect. You did good, Mackenzie. You did good.
Signal strength looks like it might be sufficient. But who knows how long it’ll last, with this unpredictable aurora in the sky.
I’ve already set the frequency. Just toggle the CALL button and cross your fingers.
You need to find your lady friend.
I need to reach someone too.
And that was my only chance.
You need to take my message. You need to deliver it for me. It’s important. You need to do it for me Mackenzie.
You need to take my message. You need to deliver it for me. It’s important.
It’ll be weeks before I can travel that far...you need to do it for me Mackenzie.
You don’t understand what’s coming, Mackenzie.
You have to take my message.
Or else...none of the rest of it matters.
It’s only a little detour for you, on the way to Perseverance Mills.
A little detour that can change a lot. Maybe everything.
Go through Carter. You’ll need to get the old elevator system working.
With the Aurora...it just might work.
Go through Carter, the lower part of the dam. Look out for...
Right, right. Through Carter, out the other side.
You’ll find your way to Signal Hill.
Old weather service radio there. More powerful than my shortwave.
You should be able to reach them.
I’ll give you the frequency. Ask for “Atwood”.
Atwood will know what it means.
Once you’ve done that...keep following the road North, and you’ll eventually get to Perseverance Mills.
You’ll start seeing the signs a few days walk out.
A couple more days to recover.
Relax, Mackenzie. It’s a short trip, but one I gotta take.
And with the Old Bear out of the picture, I may have half a chance now.
Good luck finding your lady, Mackenzie.
I hope she’s ok. This upside-down world won’t be easy on the good people.
I'd better get back on track.
Nynorsk: Eg må komme meg på riktig spor igjen.

English: I'd better look for signs of Astrid.
Nynorsk: Eg må se etter spor etter Astrid.

English: There's gotta be some sign of her having been here.
Nynorsk: det må da finnes spor etter henne her.

English: I'd better stay focused on finding Astrid.
Nynorsk: Eg må konsentrere meg om å finne Astrid.

English: She could be out there, injured. I need to keep looking.
Nynorsk: Ho kan vera der ute eit sted, skadet. eg må fortsette å lete.

English: I can't afford to get distracted.
Nynorsk: Eg kan ikkje la meg distrahere.

English: Wow...this must have been really nice, once upon a time.
Nynorsk: Du verden, dette må ha vært veldig pent ein gang i tiden.

English: I have to stay focused on the task at hand.

Nynorsk: Eg tror eg har gått meg vill.

English: I don't have time to mess around.
Nynorsk: Eg har ikkje tid til å rote rundt.
Eg kan ikkje gå den veien.

English: I don't think that's the right way.
Nynorsk: Eg tror ikkje det er rett vei.

English: I don't think that's where I need to go.
Nynorsk: Eg tror ikkje det er dit eg treng å dra.

English: Not much for guns, but...after what I’ve been through lately -- better to be safe than sorry.
Nynorsk: Eg er ikkje so glad i våpen, men etter det eg har vært gjennom i det siste, er det best å vera på den sikre siden.
Ørene må spele meg eit puss.

English: There's no going back that way.
Nynorsk: det er ikkje mulig å gå attende den veien.

English: Well, I guess there's only one way to go from here.
Nynorsk: Vel, da er det nok berre ein vei videre.

English: I don't see any way to get down there.
Nynorsk: Eg ser ikkje nokon vei ned dit.

English: I don't see how I can get up there.
Nynorsk: Eg kjem meg nok ikkje opp dit.

English: Hmm...looks like I'm going to need a rope.
Nynorsk: Hm, eg treng visst eit tau.

English: Batteries probably dead. Still...might come in handy at night.
Nynorsk: Batteriene er sikkert flate. Men den kan komme godt med om natten.

English: Can't climb that without a rope.
Nynorsk: Kan ikkje klyve opp der uten tau.

English: Don't think I'll make it up there without a rope.
Nynorsk: Eg tror ikkje eg kjem meg opp uten tau.
Eg må komme meg ut herfra.
Høres ut som nokon er i trøbbel.

English: I'd better check in on that old Trapper.
Nynorsk: Eg må nesten stikke innom den gamle pelsjegeren.
Eg lurer på korleis det går med Jeremiah.

English: I shouldn't leave Jeremiah for too long.
Nynorsk: Eg bør ikkje vera borte frå Jeremiah for lenge.

English: If the old trapper gets sick and dies...what he knows will die with him.
Nynorsk: Viss den gamle pelsjegeren vert syk og dør, so dør det han vet, med ham.

English: That trapper's my key to getting out of here. He'd better not die on me.
Nynorsk: Pelsjegeren er nykelen til å komme seg vekk herfra. Han må ikkje dø.

English: Ah...that must be the railway yard Jeremiah mentioned.
Nynorsk: det må vera verkstedområdet Jeremiah nevnte.

English: The first aid locker. Let's see if this is Jeremiah's lucky day.
Nynorsk: fyrstehjelpsskapet. Vi får se om dette er Jeremiahs lykkedag.

English: Looks like I'm stuck out here until the old trapper needs me again.
Nynorsk: Virker som eg må vera her ute til den gamle pelsjegeren treng meg igjen.

English: Hmm...locked. Guess I'll wait til he's well enough to unlock it again.
Nynorsk: Hm, låst. eg får vel vente til han er frisk nok til å låse det opp igjen.

English: I'm done with him. Time to move on.
Nynorsk: Eg er ferdig med ham. Må komme meg videre.

English: Locked. Can't get in here yet.
Nynorsk: Låst. Kommeir meg ikkje inn her ennå.

English: I'll need to find the way in.
Damn it...can't get in without a key.
Nynorsk: Faen, eg kjem ikkje inn uten nykel.

English: I need to find some way in.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne ein vei inn.

English: No way I'm getting in here without some electricity to power this panel.
Nynorsk: Ikkje snakk om at eg kjem meg inn her uten å skaffe strøm til panelet.

English: No power, no panel. No panel, no opening this door.
Nynorsk: Ingen strøm, ikkje noko panel. ikkje noko panel, ingen åpen dør.

English: Looks like I could get a nasty shock.
Nynorsk: Eg kan få eit ekkelt støt.

English: I think I liked it better when the power was down.
Nynorsk: Eg tror likte meg betre her uten strøm.

English: Thanks. I love what you’ve done with the place.
Nynorsk: Takk. eg liker det du har gjort med stedet.

English: Yup. Found one of my own, too.
Nynorsk: Jepp. Fant eit til meg sjølv òg.

English: Now what? I really need to get going. My friend is out there, and with all this wildlife on the loose...
Nynorsk: Hva nå? eg må komme meg av gårde. Vennen min er der ute, og med alle de ville dyrene …

English: What do you suggest? Books on tape?
Nynorsk: Hva foreslår du? Bøker på kassett?

English: Yeah, well...thanks for the help. I think I’m ready to get out of here.
Nynorsk: Vel, takk for hjelpen. eg tror eg er klar for å dra.

English: I have a feeling you might be right.
Nynorsk: Eg føler på meg at du kan ha rett.

English: Look...I appreciate your help in learning how to survive out here. I really do. But...my friend is still out there, and they may need my help.
Nynorsk: Hør, eg setter pris på at du hjelper meg å overleva her ute. det gjer eg virkelig. Men … vennen min, som fremdeles er der ute, treng kanskje hjelp.
Eg må komme meg av gårde.

English: Ok. So...how do I get through it then?
Nynorsk: Ok, so korleis kjem eg meg gjennom den?

English: I’m tired of being jerked around, Jeremiah. I need to get out of here.
Nynorsk: Eg er lei av all hersingen, Jeremiah. eg må komme meg vekk herfra.

English: I’m a pilot with a bit of survival training. I’m not an experienced hunter. What can I do?
Nynorsk: Eg er pilot og har litt overlevingstrening. eg er ikkje ein erfaren jeger. kva kan eg gjøre?
Hva i … lokke ham? Med hva?

English: So...you want me to use myself as bait?
Nynorsk: Så … du vil eg skal bruke meg sjølv som åte?

English: There’s no way I’m doing this. This is crazy.
Nynorsk: Ikkje snakk om at eg gjer dette. det er galskap.

English: And if I make it...how will I know when it’s done?
Nynorsk: Og viss eg klarer det … korleis vet eg at eg er ferdig?

English: You sure this is the only way?
Nynorsk: Er du sikker på at dette er den eneste måten?

English: Ok. Well, you’d better hope this works.
Nynorsk: Ok. Da får du håpe dette fungerer.

English: Yeah. Or I’ll be sending the Old Bear back for you.
Nynorsk: Ja. Ellers sender eg Gamlebjørn etter deg.

English: There. Your damn bear ear. Now can I get the hell out of here?
Nynorsk: Her. det forbaska bjørneøret ditt. Kan eg for faen dra nå?

English: Maybe you can visit him and talk about it some time. Meanwhile, I’ve done everything you’ve asked -- it’s time for you to do something for me.
Nynorsk: Kanskje du kan besøke han og snakke om det ein gang. I mellomtiDen har eg gjort alt du ba meg om, so no er det på tide du gjer noko for meg.

English: Ok, got it. Through the Dam, follow the river, find the radio tower.
Nynorsk: Greit, skjønner. Gjennom demningen, langs elven, finn radiotårnet.

English: After this bear business, this sounds easy. Why didn’t you just tell me this in the first place?
Nynorsk: dette høres lett ut etter bjørnen. Hvorfor sa du ikkje berre det til å begynne med?

English: I already told you that I don’t get it, but I’ll take the message. What is it?
Nynorsk: Eg har allerede sagt at eg ikkje forstår, men eg tar hintet. kva er det?

English: You want me to find this Atwood person and tell them a single word?
Nynorsk: Du vil at eg skal finne denne Atwood og fortelle vedkommende ett enkelt ord?

English: Are you ok, Jeremiah? You don’t sound so good.
Nynorsk: Går det bra, Jeremiah? Du høres ikkje helt frisk ut.

English: Ok, ok -- take it easy. I promise. I’ll deliver your message.
Nynorsk: Ok, ok – rolig nå. eg lover at eg skal overbringe meldingen.
Eg kan ikkje bruke armen ennå.

English: Got it. You going to be ok? I can come back for you if I find better meds...
Nynorsk: Skjønner. Vil du klare deg? eg kan komme attende viss eg finner betre medisiner …

English: Who said anything about a she?

Nynorsk: Ta vare på deg sjølv, Jeremiah.

English: There’s no telling if I’ll be able to make it back up this way after I go down. I’d better make sure I’m ready to leave Mystery Lake.
Nynorsk: det er ikkje godt å si om eg vil klare å komme meg opp igjen etter turen ned. eg må vera sikker på at eg er klar til å forlate Løyndomsvatnet.

English: Now to find the way out of here and get to the radio tower Jeremiah talked about.
Nynorsk: No må eg finne ein vei ut herfra og komme meg til radiotårnet Jeremiah snakket om.
Hallo? Er det nokon der ute?

English: Hmm. This whole area looks like it’s been abandoned for a while.
Nynorsk: Hm. det virker som hele området har vært etterlataein stund.

English: Maybe this will tell me where the hell I am.
Nynorsk: Kanskje dette vil fortelle meg kor i helvete eg er.

English: Hmm...my grandfather used one of these way back before we could look up the weather online.
Nynorsk: Hm, bestefaren min brukte ein av disse lenge før vi kunne sjekke været på nett.

English: Need more time to gain strength.
Nynorsk: Eg treng meir tid for å komme til hektene.

English: Looks like he’s been frozen for a while. Poor bastard.
Nynorsk: Han har nok vært frossen ein stund. Stakkars jævel.

English: A farmhouse. If she’s alive, Astrid might have taken shelter there.
Nynorsk: Eit hus. Viss Astrid er i live, har hun kanskje søkt ly der.

English: Truck seems to be dead. Engine won’t even turn.
Nynorsk: Lastebilen er visst død. Motoren starter ikkje engang.

English: Door’s locked. Maybe the keys are around.
Nynorsk: Døren er låst. Kanskje det er ein nykel eit sted.

English: It should be warmeir inside that house.
Nynorsk: Det er nok varmere i huset.

English: I don’t think I can climb this yet.
Nynorsk: Eg tror ikkje eg kan klyve opp her ennå.

English: Or...maybe it’s not warmeir in here after all.
Nynorsk: Eller kanskje det ikkje er varmere her inne i det hele tatt.

English: Doesn’t look like Astrid made it here after all.
Nynorsk: det virker ikkje som Astrid har funnet frem hit likevel.

English: Passing the night reading Latin hymns. Shit. How depressing.
Nynorsk: Lese latinske salmeir for å få natten til å gå. Faen so deprimerende.
Faen … virker som nokon havnet i trøbbel.

English: Damn it. Must be locked from the inside.
Nynorsk: Helvete. Må vera låst frå innsiden.

English: This is from Astrid’s jacket. Thank god she’s alive.
Nynorsk: dette er frå Astrids jakke. Takk Gud, hun er i live.

English: She definitely passed through here, and in a hurry.
Nynorsk: Ho kom utvilsomt forbi her, og hun hadde det travelt.

English: Astrid...where did you go? And what were you running from?
Nynorsk: Astrid … kor dro du? Og kva flyktet du fra?

English: Damn it. Doesn’t look like there’s any way to follow her.
Nynorsk: Svarte. det er visst ikkje mulig å følge etter henne.

English: That’s all I have in me. Need to lay down before I fall down.
Nynorsk: det er alt eg klarer. eg må legge meg ned før eg faller om.

English: Seems like this side of Milton is cut off from the rest of the island. I’ll have to go the long way around.
Nynorsk: det virker som denne sidan av Milton er avskåret frå resten av øya. eg må ta den lange veien rundt.

English: I’m not sure I understand what you mean.
Nynorsk: Eg forstår ikkje helt kva du mener.

English: We’ve sinned. Now we’re paying the price.
Nynorsk: Vi har syndet. No må vi betale prisen.

English: Is this about the lights in the sky?
Nynorsk: Handler dette om lysene på himmelen?

English: The wonder of humanity and all its creations, laid bare.
Nynorsk: En blottlegging av menneskeheten og dens kreasjoners under.

English: Soon we’ll all be tested. We’ll all have to choose how far we’ll go to survive.
Nynorsk: Snart vil vi alle verta satt på prøve. Vi må velge kor langt vi er villige til å gå for å overleve.

English: What do you mean, this has happened before?
Nynorsk: Hva mener du med at dette har skjedd før?

English: I’m no hero. I’m just looking for someone. Doing my best to survive in the mean-time.
Nynorsk: Eg er ingen helt. eg leter berre etter nokon. I mellomtiDen gjer eg mitt beste for å overleve.

English: That plane’s taken me a lot of places.
Nynorsk: det flyet har tatt meg mange steder.

English: I’m sorry to leave you here, old girl.
Nynorsk: Beklager at eg må forlate deg her.

English: But right now I gotta find Astrid.
Nynorsk: Men no må eg finne Astrid.

English: I have a bad feeling I’m never going to see this place again.
Nynorsk: Eg har på følelsen at eg aldri vil se dette stedet igjen.

English: You’re losing blood. Just stay awake. We’ll get there.
Nynorsk: Du mister blod. berre hald deg våken. Vi skal komme oss dit.

English: Don’t die on me, mister...what’s your name?
I need to stop the bleeding. You have any first aid supplies?
Nynorsk: Eg må stanse blødningen. Har du fyrstehjelpsutstyr?

English: I need to get a fire going.
That should warm things up a bit. You still with me?
Nynorsk: No vert det varmere. Er du våken?

English: Here...take these. They should help with the pain.
Nynorsk: Her, ta disse. de bør hjelpe mot smerten.

English: You’re going to need more than some pills and bandages.
Nynorsk: Du treng nok meir enn nokon piller og bandasjer.

English: You’re hurt, badly. That bite will get infected. Maybe worse.
Nynorsk: Du er alvorlig skadet. det vil gå betennelse i det bittet. Kanskje noko verre.

English: We need some strong antibiotics. You have anything like that?
Nynorsk: Vi treng sterke antibiotika. Har du noko slikt?

English: Can you hear me, old man?
Hmm...Railway Yard. Must keep a First Aid kit there.
Nynorsk: Hm, eit verkstedområde. der er det sikkert fyrstehjelpsutstyr.

English: Hello? The signal is bad. I can’t hear you.
Nynorsk: Hallo? Forbindelsen er dårlig. eg hører deg ikke.

English: Where are you? Who’s bleeding badly?
Nynorsk: Hvor er du? Hvem som blør so mye?

English: Good to see you’re still breathing. I found some supplies that should help.
Nynorsk: Godt å se at du ennå puster. eg fant nokon forsyninger som vil hjelpe.

English: Some meds. Painkillers, antibiotics...and what looks to be some old vials of Morphine.
Nynorsk: Litt medisiner. Smertestillende, antibiotika … og nokon gamle hetteglass med morfin.

English: Let’s hope your pain doesn’t get bad enough to need any of that.
Nynorsk: Vi får håpe smertene ikkje vert so ille at du treng akkurat det.

English: I heard a phone ring...on the railway line.
Nynorsk: Eg hørte ein telefon ringe. Ved togsporene.

English: Answered it but the line was all choppy.
Nynorsk: Eg svarte, men linjen var hakkete.
Hvil deg. eg skal ta ein titt.

English: I’m...Mackenzie, remember? I helped you here. After the bear.
Nynorsk: det er meg, Mackenzie, husker du? eg hjalp deg her. Etter bjørnen.

English: I see you’re feeling better. Good.
Nynorsk: Eg ser at du føler deg bedre. Bra.

English: Maybe you can answer some questions for me.
Nynorsk: Kanskje du kan svare på nokon spørsmål.

English: Sounds like a pretty quiet place.
Nynorsk: Høres ut som eit ganske rolig sted.

English: You have some way to call out of here? Like a radio?
Nynorsk: Har du mulighet for å ringe ut herfra? ein radio eller noe?
Du liker kanskje ikkje folk noko særlig?

English: You see those lights in the sky a few nights ago?
Nynorsk: Så du lysene på himmelen for nokon netter siden?

English: Those lights took my plane down.
Nynorsk: de lysene gjorde at flyet mitt styrtet.

English: Now I need to find my...
I had a passenger with me.
Nynorsk: Eg hadde ein passasjer med meg.

English: We were on our way to Perseverance Mills. You know it?
Nynorsk: Vi var på vei til Trottug Møller. Kjenner du byen?

English: Sounds about right. How are folks there holding up?
Nynorsk: Høres riktig ut. Korleis går det med folk der?

English: You think it has something to do with the flash of light?
Nynorsk: Tror du det har noko å gjera med det lysblinket?

English: I’d love to help you more, but my friend...she could be out there right now.
Nynorsk: Eg skulle gjerne hjelpe deg mer, men venninnen min … hun er kanskje der ute nå.

English: I need to get back to looking for her.
Nynorsk: Eg må fortsette å lete etter henne.

English: Hmm. You know something about where she might go?
Nynorsk: Hm. Du vet ikkje noko om kor hun kan ha dratt?

English: I’ll take care of getting some more supplies, and we’ll talk more when I get back.
Nynorsk: Eg drar og skaffer nokon flere forsyninger, so kan vi snakke meir når eg er Attende.

English: Yeah, but I don’t plan to be around much longer.
Nynorsk: Ja, men eg har ikkje tenkt å verta her særlig mykje lenger.

English: I’ve gathered enough supplies to last you a little while.
Nynorsk: Eg har samlet nok forsyninger til at du klarer deg ein stund.

English: Give you some time to gain some strength.
Nynorsk: det vil gi deg litt tid til å samle krefter.

English: You think of anything that might help me find my friend?
Nynorsk: Har du kommet på noko som kan hjelpe meg å finne vennen min?

English: Ok. You should have enough wood to keep the fire burning until...
Nynorsk: Greit. No bør du ha nok ved til å holde ilDen i gang til …
Takk. Du skal få den Attende.
det virker som nokon har vært her.

English: Let’s see if they left anything useful.
Nynorsk: Får se om de har lagt igjen noko nyttig.

English: Shit...looks like Hank was going a bit stir crazy out here.
Nynorsk: Huff, Hank var visst i ferd med å verta sprut sprø her ute.

English: I guess I would too if I had to sit in a tower all day with nothing but a radio for company.
Nynorsk: det ville sikkert eg òg ha vorte om eg måtte sitte i eit tårn hele dagen uten annet enn ein radio til selskap.

English: Did...you see those lights in the sky?
Nynorsk: Så du de lysene på himmelen?

English: I found the shortwave in the lookout.
The radio picked up a signal while the lights -- the aurora -- was in the sky.
Nynorsk: Radioen plukket opp eit signal medan lysene – nordljoset – var på himmelen.

English: Sounded like a distress beacon of some kind.
Nynorsk: det hørtes ut som ein slags nødsender.

English: The radio shorted out before I was able to find anything out about my friend.
Nynorsk: Radioen kortsluttet før eg kunne finne ut meir om vennen min.

English: Ok...so, get through the Dam, follow the river, and find the radio tower. Got it.
Nynorsk: Greit. Gå gjennom demningen, følg elven og finn radiotårnet. Skjønner.

English: I don’t have any more time to waste.
Nynorsk: Eg har ikkje meir tid å kaste bort.

English: Sounds like getting to that Radio is my best hope of finding her.
Nynorsk: Å finne den radioen er visst min største sjanse til å finne henne.

English: Maybe it can power the Dam’s locks too.
Nynorsk: Kanskje det kan gi strøm til demningens låser òg.
det er der sjansen min ligger.

English: You’ll be fine for a few days.
Nynorsk: Du klarer deg i nokon dagar.

English: I’ll come back and check on you.
Nynorsk: Eg kjem attende og ser til deg.

English: Fair enough. I’ll send help if I can.
Nynorsk: Greit nok. eg skal sende hjelp om eg kan.

English: This looks recent. Someone living in here?
Nynorsk: dette ser nytt ut. Bor det nokon her?

English: Hmm...looks like this might be where those eco-terrorists were hiding out.
Nynorsk: Hm, det var nok her de øko-terroristene skjulte seg.

English: This must be the radio tower Jeremiah talked about.
Nynorsk: dette må vera radioen Jeremiah snakket om.

English: Finally, we’re getting somewhere. Now to find that radio...
Nynorsk: Endelig byrjar det å skje noe. So var det berre å finne radioen …

English: My plane wouldn’t do you any good.
Nynorsk: Flyet mitt kan ikkje hjelpe deg.

English: I’ve gotta get out of here.
Nynorsk: Eg må komme meg ut herfra.
Hallo? Er det nokon der ute?

English: Hmm. This whole area looks like it's been abandoned for a while.
Nynorsk: Hm. det virker som hele området har vært etterlataein stund.

English: Hmm...smoke from the chimney. Someone's home.
Nynorsk: Hm, røyk frå skorsteinen. nokon er hjemme.
Ok, ok, berre ta det rolig.

English: I saw the smoke from your chimney.
My plane...I crashed in the mountains nearby.
Nynorsk: Flyet mitt … eg styrtet i fjellet her borte.

English: Listen...could you maybe point that gun somewhere else?
Nynorsk: Du, kunne du kanskje peke våpenet i ein annen retning?

English: All I've found are wolves, bad weather, and an empty town.
Nynorsk: Eg fant ikkje annet enn ulver, dårlig vær og ein etterlataby.

English: What really happened here? Seems like people were here recently.
Nynorsk: Hva skjedde egentlig her? det virker som det var folk her nylig.

English: Where did they go? Why didn't they call for help or...just drive out?
Nynorsk: Kvar fór dei? Kvifor tilkalte dei ikkje berre hjelp eller … køyrte sin veg?

English: Did anyone see a woman? Brown hair, would have had a tan jacket...scarf with...birds on it. Possibly injured.
So...you're all set for food and fuel.
Nynorsk: Så … du har altså nok mat og brensel.

English: I'd like to hear what you know about my friend now.
Nynorsk: No vil eg gjerne høre kva du vet om venninnen min.
Hvorfor var det ingen som hjalp henne?

English: Yes. I'm still looking for my friend.
Nynorsk: Ja, eg leter fortsatt etter vennen min.

English: Anything you can remember might help.
Nynorsk: det kan hjelpe dersom du husker noe.

English: It was there, like you said.
Nynorsk: Den var der, som du sa.

English: No sign of her. The tunnel's blocked. Looks like maybe...an avalanche. But I think she got through before that happened.
Nynorsk: Ingen tegn til henne. Tunnelen er blokkert. Ser ut som det kanskje var … eit skred. Men eg tror hun kom seg gjennom før det skjedde.

English: So the tunnel is the only way through the mountains?
Nynorsk: Så tunnelen er den eneste veien gjennom fjellet?

English: I can't be here any more. My friend is out there and she needs my help.
