Nynorsk: Eg kan ikkje vera her lenger. Venninnen min er der ute, og hun treng min hjelp.

English: Please...tell me how to find her, and I'll do whatever I can to help you get out of here.
Nynorsk: Vær so snill … Fortell meg kor eg kan finne henne, so skal eg gjera alt eg kan for å få deg ut herfra.

English: Put her to...I'm not giving up yet!
Nynorsk: Glemme … eg gjev ikkje opp ennå!

English: Wait...farm? Bank? What's this have to do with my friend?
Nynorsk: Vent … Gård? Bank? kva har dette å gjera med vennen min?

English: Here's the safety deposit box from the bank. I still don't understand...
Nynorsk: Her er bankboksen. eg forstår fortsatt ikkje …

English: You sent me to steal...jewelry for you?
Nynorsk: Sendte du meg ut for å stjele smykker for deg?

English: You said this would help me find her.
Nynorsk: Du sa at denne ville hjelpe meg å finne henne.

English: I'm finished with this. I'll find my own way out of here...
Nynorsk: Eg har fått nok av dette. eg skal finne veien ut herfra sjølv …

English: What's this last thing you need from me?
Nynorsk: Hva er dette siste du treng frå meg?

English: But the name -- Lily Barker...related to the farmer? You said they were liars and cheats.
Nynorsk: Men navnet – Lily Barker – er hun i slekt med bonden? Du sa de var løgnere og juksepaver.

English: I need to find some shelter from this wind.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne ly mot vinden.

English: Thank you. What will you do?

Nynorsk: Eg skal prøve å komme Attende.

English: Or I'll send help for you.
There's bound to be someone out there who can help...
Nynorsk: det er nødt til å vera nokon der ute som kan hjelpe deg.

English: I gotta find something to eat.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne noko å spise.

English: It’s...f-f-freezing out here. Gotta f-f-find something to start a f-fire with.
Nynorsk: D-det er iskaldt her. Må f-finne noko å lage eld med.

English: Looks like debris from the crash site above.
Nynorsk: Ser ut som skrot frå krasjstedet.

English: Guess I'm stuck in some kind of ravine.
Nynorsk: Eg sitter visst fast i ein fjellkløft eller noe.

English: I might be stuck here a while. Better see what I can use.
Nynorsk: Her kan eg verta værende i ein stund. eg får se kva eg kan bruke.

English: I don't feel so good. I need to rest up.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: Eg føler meg ikkje helt i form. eg må hvile.

English: I think that's about all I can get done today.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: Eg tror ikkje eg får gjort meir i dag.

English: I'm too weak to keep going. Need to rest through til morning.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: Eg er for svak til å fortsette. eg må hvile til i morgen.

English: That's pretty much all I can do today. Time to rest.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: det er omtrent det eg kan gjera i dag. På tide å hvile.

English: I need to rest before morning.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: Eg må hvile før det vert morgen.

English: I'm feeling weak. I need to rest before I get worse.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: Eg føler meg svak. eg må hvile før eg vert verre.

English: Not much more I can do before morning.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: det er ikkje stort meir eg kan gjera før det vert morgen.

English: I think I can make that climb now.
Nynorsk: Eg tror eg er i stand til å klyve nå.

English: May as well rest up. No telling what tomorrow will bring.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: Eg kan like hjerne hvile meg. det er umulig å si kva morgendagen vil bringe.

English: I should rest up before my injury gets worse.
Notes: Days 2-4: Lines for "this day is done".
Nynorsk: Eg bør hvile meg før skaDen vert verre.

English: Looks like the weather's taking a turn for the worse.
Nynorsk: Ser ut som været vert dårligere.

English: I don't like the look of that sky. This snow could turn into a blizzard.
Nynorsk: Eg liker ikkje korleis den himmelen ser ut. denne snøen kan verta til ein snøstorm.

English: The weather's turning bad. I'm going to need a good long fire to keep from freezing to death.
Nynorsk: Været vert dårligere. eg treng eit solid bål slik at eg ikkje fryser i hjel.

English: It's getting colder. If I don't have enough firewood to last the night...I might not make it.
Nynorsk: Det byrjar å verta kaldere. Skaffer eg ikkje ved nok til hele natten, vil eg kanskje ikkje klare meg.

English: It's cooling down. I'd better make sure I have enough wood to keep this fire going through the night.
Nynorsk: det vert kjøligere. eg må sørge for at eg har nok ved til å holde bålet live gjennom natten.

English: Thank god...this fire should keep me alive.
Notes: Day 3: Shivering; the fire is finally big enough.
Nynorsk: Takk Gud … dette bålet bør holde meg i live.

Notes: Day 3: Shivering; the fire is finally big enough.
Nynorsk: Eg må … få varmen i meg.

English: Fire looks good. Now to warm up before I freeze to death...
Notes: Day 3: Shivering; the fire is finally big enough.
Nynorsk: Bålet ser bra ut. eg må få varmen i meg før eg fryser i hjel …

Notes: Day 3: Warmed up and ready to go to sleep.
Nynorsk: No er det godt og varmt. Føler meg … søvnig.

English: That should last me through the night. So...tired...
Notes: Day 3: Warmed up and ready to go to sleep.
Nynorsk: det burde vare natten gjennom. So … trøtt …

English: The storm's finally cleared. Looks like the wind brought down more debris.
Notes: Day 4: Storm has cleared; need food.
Nynorsk: Stormen har endelig stilnet. det virker som vinDen blåste ned meir skrot.

English: The blizzard finally broke. Time to get out there and search for something to eat.
Notes: Day 4: Storm has cleared; need food.
Nynorsk: Snøstormen har endelig gitt seg. eg får dra ut og lete etter noko å spise.

English: I thought that storm would never end. I need to find some food.
Notes: Day 4: Storm has cleared; need food.
Nynorsk: Eg trodde aldri stormen ville gi seg. eg må finne noko mat.

Notes: Day 4: Storm has cleared; need food.
Nynorsk: Takk og lov … Stormen har endelig gitt seg.

English: Looks like that wind blew down more plane debris.
Notes: Day 4: Storm has cleared; need food.
Nynorsk: det ser ut til at vinDen blåste ned meir flyskrot.

English: I need to find something to eat before I starve to death.
Notes: Day 4: Storm has cleared; need food.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne noko å spise før eg sulter i hjel.
Eg føler meg sterkere i dag.
Handa kjennes sterkere ut i dag.

English: That was a hell of a storm last night. Blew that tree clean over.
Notes: Day 4: Notices that a big tree has fallen down in the night.
Nynorsk: det var ein helvetes storm i går. det treet ble blåst rett over ende.

English: Looks like last night's blizzard brought the whole tree down.
Notes: Day 4: Notices that a big tree has fallen down in the night.
Nynorsk: det virker som snøstormen i går blåste treet rett ned.

English: I might be able to use it as a bridge.
Notes: Day 4: Notices that a big tree has fallen down in the night.
Nynorsk: Kanskje eg kan bruke det som ein bro.

English: Hmm...looks like I might be able to get across using this.
Notes: Day 4: Notices that a big tree has fallen down in the night.
Nynorsk: Hm, det virker som eg kan komme meg over til den andre sidan her.

English: Hmm...looks ilke I might be able to use this to get across.
Notes: Day 4: Notices that a big tree has fallen down in the night.
Nynorsk: Hm, det virker som eg kan bruke treet til å komme meg over til den andre siden.

English: Hmm...looks like the only way out of here.
Notes: Day 4: Notices that a big tree has fallen down in the night.
Nynorsk: Hm, det ser ut til å vera den eneste veien vekk herfra.

English: Might be able to climb that.
That might be the way up and out of here.
Nynorsk: det kan vera den eneste veien opp og vekk herfra.

Notes: Day 4: Not strong enough to climb out
Nynorsk: Niks, handa er fortsatt for svak.

English: Whatever is in this case, Astrid was ready to die for it.
Nynorsk: Hva som enn var i skrinet, so var Astrid klar for å dø for det.

English: Shit...I'm still too weak to get out of here.
Notes: Day 4: Not strong enough to climb out
Nynorsk: Faen, eg er fortsatt for svak til å komme meg ut herfra.

English: Damn it. If my neve was a bit stronger, I could probably climb out of here.
Notes: Day 4: Not strong enough to climb out
Nynorsk: Helvete. Viss handa var litt sterkere, kunne eg sikkert klyve ut herfra.

English: Damn it...looks like I'll have to wait until I'm stronger.
Notes: Day 4: Not strong enough to climb out
Nynorsk: Helvete, eg må visst vente til eg vert sterkere.

English: Damn it...my hand's still too weak to climb that rock.
Notes: Day 4: Not strong enough to climb out
Nynorsk: Helvete, handa min er for svak til å klyve opp den steinen.

Notes: Day 5: Managed to get to crash site

English: Damn...looks like the old girl's seen better days.
Notes: Day 5: Managed to get to crash site
Nynorsk: Faen, den gamle jenta har sett betre dagar.

English: Poor girl. This isn't how things were supposed to end.
Notes: Day 5: Managed to get to crash site
Nynorsk: Stakkars jente. det var ikkje slik det skulle ende.

English: Ok...let's see if Astrid made it.
Notes: Day 5: Managed to get to crash site
Nynorsk: Ok, får se om Astrid har klart seg.

English: My plane...not sure which of us looks worse.
Notes: Day 5: Managed to get to crash site
Nynorsk: Flyet mitt … eg vet ikkje hvem av oss som ser verst ut.

English: I sure hope Astrid's not in there.
Notes: Day 5: Managed to get to crash site
Nynorsk: Eg håper virkelig ikkje Astrid er der inne.

English: I hope she hasn’t already died for it.
Nynorsk: Eg håper hun ikkje allerede har dødd for det.

English: There must be signs of Astrid around here somewhere.
Nynorsk: det må vera spor etter Astrid her eit sted.

English: Someone's been here recently. Could it have been Astrid?
Nynorsk: nokon har vært her nylig. Kan det ha vært Astrid?

English: Looks like some kind of collapse here recently. Wonder what caused it.
Nynorsk: Ser ut som noko kollapset her nylig. Lurer på kva årsaken var.

English: I might be able to climb up that.
Nynorsk: Kanskje eg kan klyve opp der borte.

English: I should be able to get up there.
Nynorsk: Eg bør kunne komme meg opp der borte.

English: There must be a way to get up there.
Nynorsk: det må gå an å komme seg opp dit.

English: I need to find the way up there.
Nynorsk: Eg må finne veien opp dit.

English: How do I get up there?
I bet I can climb this.
Nynorsk: Eg vedder på at eg kan klyve opp her.

English: Woah...a road? I must be closer to civilization than I thought.
Nynorsk: Oi, ein vei? eg må vera nærmere sivilisasjonen enn eg trodde.

English: A road! Great. I'm not as lost as I thought.
Nynorsk: En vei! Flott. eg har ikkje gått meg so vill som eg trodde.

English: Wait...a road? But where does it go?
Nynorsk: Vent, ein vei? Men kor går den til?

English: Milton? Hmm...guess Astrid could have ended up there?
Nynorsk: Milton? Hm, kanskje Astrid endte opp der?

English: Town of Milton. Never heard of it.
Nynorsk: Milton by. Aldri hørt om den.

English: Milton. Hmm...must be a town nearby.
Nynorsk: Milton. Hm, det må vera ein by i nærheten.

English: A church? Promising. I should check it out.
Nynorsk: En kirke? Lovende. eg får ta ein titt.

English: That church looks like it could be a good shelter.
Nynorsk: Kirken kan verta eit godt ly.

English: If I were a farmer, where would I hide a key?
Nynorsk: Viss eg var bonde, kor ville eg gjemme ein nykel?
Den må vera her eit sted.

English: Where the hell is that key?
Nynorsk: Hvor i helvete er den nykelen?

English: The safety deposit key has to be here somewhere.
Nynorsk: Nøkkelen til bankboksen må vera her eit sted.

English: The old lady said the key was here somewhere.
Nynorsk: Den gamle damen sa at nykelen er her eit sted.

English: I can't leave without the key.
Nynorsk: Eg kan ikkje dra uten nykelen.

English: I have to keep looking til I find it.
Nynorsk: Eg må lete til eg finner den.
Hm, denne nykelen ser viktig ut.

English: Looks like a house key. I should check it out.
Nynorsk: Ser ut som ein husnykel. eg får prøve.

English: This must be the key to the bank manager's house.
Nynorsk: dette må vera nykelen til banksjefens hus.

English: Now where would they hide the combination for this vault?
Nynorsk: Mon tro kor banksjefen har gjemt kombinasjonen til hvelvet?

English: Where did the bank manager keep the code for this vault?
Nynorsk: Hvor oppbevarte banksjefen koden til hvelvet?

English: Now where would Mcdermott hide that weapon?
Nynorsk: Lurer på kor Mcdermott har gjemt det våpenet?

English: Old Mcdermott must have hidDen that weapon in here somewhere.
Nynorsk: Gamle Mcdermott må ha gjemt våpenet her inne eit sted.

English: That secret stash must be hidDen here somewhere.
Nynorsk: det hemmelige oppbevaringet må vera gjemt her eit sted.

English: Now to find that secret stash.
Nynorsk: Så var det å finne det hemmelige oppbevaringet.

English: Now to find that hidDen supply cache.
Nynorsk: Så var det å finne de skjulte forsyningene.

English: Looks like the weather's getting bad.
Nynorsk: det virker som været vert dårligere.

English: Weather's changing. Looks like for the worse.
Nynorsk: Været er i endring. Til det verre, virker det som.

English: Feels like the weather's changing. Getting worse, I'd reckon.
Nynorsk: Været er visst i ferd med å endre seg. det vert verre, tror jeg.

English: Feels like the weather is taking a turn for the worse.
Nynorsk: Været later til å verta dårligere.

English: Looks like the weather's clearing up.
Nynorsk: Været byrjar visst å verta bedre.
Været klarner opp, takk og lov.

English: So thirsty. Gotta be a way to melt some snow.
Nynorsk: Eg er so tørst. eg må finne ein måte å smelte snø på.

English: I knew I'd find something here.
Nynorsk: Eg visste eg ville finne noko her.
det var det eg so etter.

English: Well well...what do we have here?
Nynorsk: Se her, ja. kva er so dette?

English: What the hell...I guess that rope was older than it looked.
Nynorsk: Hva i helvete. Tauet må ha vært eldre enn det so ut.

English: Damn...guess I'm not getting back up that way.
Nynorsk: Faen. Da kjem eg meg ikkje attende den veien.

English: At least it broke when I was near the bottom.
Nynorsk: det røk i det minste da eg var nær bakken.

English: I knew using that rope was a bit of a gamble.
Nynorsk: Eg visste at det var risikabelt å bruke det tauet.

English: Well..there it is. No way back up.
Only one way to go from here: forward.
Nynorsk: Da er det nok berre ein vei videre. Fremover.

English: Shit...that cut smarts. Better make sure it doesn’t get infected.
Nynorsk: Faen, det kuttet svir. eg må passe på so det ikkje går betennelse i det.

English: Easy...easy. You’re ok now. The bear’s gone.
Nynorsk: Rolig, rolig. Du er trygg nå. Bjørnen er borte.

English: Name’s Mackenzie. I found you when...the bear was...
Nynorsk: Eg heter Mackenzie. eg fant deg da … bjørnen …

English: It ran away. I think I hit it. Or scared it off.
Nynorsk: Den løp sin vei. eg tror eg traff den. Eller skremte den vekk.
Eg er glad hukommelsen din vender Attende.

English: I got a fire going. That should warm things up a bit.
Nynorsk: Eg har laga ild. det bør gjera det varmere.
Her, ta disse. de bør hjelpe.

English: Listen. You’re going to need more than some pills and bandages. You’re hurt, badly. That bite will get infected. Maybe worse. You have any stronger meds?
Nynorsk: Hør, du treng nok meir enn nokon piller og bandasjer. Du er alvorlig skadet. det vil gå betennelse i det bittet. Kanskje noko verre. Har du nokon sterkere medisiner?

English: Can you hear me, old man?
Hmm...looks like an old hydroelectric dam not too far from here. Might be a good place to look for supplies.
Nynorsk: Hm, det ser ut til å vera ein gamal hydroelektrisk demning ikkje langt herfra. det kan vera eit bra plass for å se etter forsyninger.

English: Hang in there...whatever your name is.
Nynorsk: Hald ut, kva no enn navnet ditt er.

English: Carter Dam...hmm. This place has seen better days.
Nynorsk: Carter-demningen … dette stedet har sett betre dagar.

English: Who would build a dam way out in the middle of nowhere?
Nynorsk: Hvem bygger ein demning midt i huttiheita?

English: What the hell happened here, anyway?
Hmm...looks like this thing isn’t opening unless I can get the power working again.
Nynorsk: Hm, eg må visst få strømmen til å fungere igjen for å få Opnt denne.

English: Maybe the Trapper knows more about it. I’d better find those first-aid supplies and get back to him.
Nynorsk: Kanskje pelsjegeren vet mer. eg får finne det fyrstehjelpsutstyret og ta det med til ham.

English: This is what I’m looking for.
Nynorsk: Her er det eg so etter.

English: There -- that should help. And...morphine? Looks expired but...you never know.
Nynorsk: der … det burde hjelpe. Og … morfin? Ser ut til å vera gått ut på dato, men man vet aldri.
Hei, lever du? kva heter du?

English: I went to the Dam. I found some supplies that should help.
Nynorsk: Eg dro til demningen. der fant eg nokon forsyninger som vil kunne hjelpe.

English: General meds. Painkillers, antibiotics...and what looks to be some old vials of morphine.
Nynorsk: Generelle medisiner. Smertestillende, antibiotika … og nokon gamle hetteglass med morfin.

English: Easy. Hopefully your pain won’t get that bad.
Nynorsk: Forsiktig. Forhåpentligvis vert ikkje smertene dine for ille.

English: Hey...don’t get excited. I’m just looking for someone.
Nynorsk: Hei, rolig nå. eg ser berre etter nokon.

English: Ready for what? You can barely sit up.
Nynorsk: Klar for hva? Du kan knapt sitte.

English: We? I’m...I’m just on my way through the area. That bear’s got nothing to do with me.
Nynorsk: Vi? eg … eg er berre på gjennomreise. Bjørnen har ingenting å gjera med meg.

English: You see those lights in the sky a few nights ago?
Nynorsk: Så du lysene på himmelen for nokon netter siden?

English: I’m a bush pilot. Those lights took my plane down. Nearly died in the crash. Now I need to find my...
Nynorsk: Eg er pilot. de lysene gjorde at flyet mitt styrtet. eg døydde nesten i styrten. No må eg finne …

English: I had a passenger with me.
Nynorsk: Eg hadde ein passasjer med meg.

English: We were on our way to Perseverance Mills. You know it?
Nynorsk: Vi var på vei til Trottug Møller. Kjenner du byen?

English: The phone lines are down. Nothing electrical seems to be working. You think it has something to do with the flash of light?
Nynorsk: Telefonlinjene er nede. det virker ikkje som noko elektrisk fungerer. Tror du det har noko å gjera med det lysblinket?

English: I don’t know. I need to get out there and look for my friend.
Nynorsk: Eg vet ikke. eg må komme meg vekk herfra og se etter vennen min.

English: Thanks for the vote of confidence. What do you have in mind?
Nynorsk: Takk for tilliten. kva tenkte du på?

English: And what’s in it for you?
Nynorsk: Og kva har du å tjene på det?
Huff, beklager. Har du eit i reserve?

English: I’ll see what I can do.
Nynorsk: Eg skal se kva eg får til.
Han ser ikkje so frisk ut.

English: Hmmm...what’s that on the floor beside him...
Nynorsk: Hm, kva er det på gulvet ved sidan av ham?

English: Forest Talkers? Sounds like some kind of indie band.
Maybe this guy was one of them. I guess I should check out this Lodge.
Nynorsk: Kanskje denne karen var ein av dem. eg får vel sjekke denne hytten.

English: I’d better fix Jeremiah’s rifle and get out of here.
Nynorsk: Eg får fikse Jeremiahs børse og komme meg ut herfra.

English: Damn...I must have hit my head harder than I thought.
Nynorsk: Faen, eg må ha fått eit kraftigere slag i hodet enn eg trodde.

English: How long was I out for?
What's with you and dark places, Mackenzie?
Remember what Jace said -- locking mechanisms.
The Warden doesn't have much time. I have to hurry.
What a blizzard. I won't be much use to Franklin if I get myself killed.
Any idea what he’s doing here?
Stick to the road. Get to the mine.
Wolves, convicts, voices on the phone...what's next?
There's the entrance to the mine.
Blocked. Need to get around this.
Have to cut my way through.
I need something to break these down.
Rope! I have to find some rope.
Back at the mine entrance, maybe?
Steam tunnels. Jace said over, then down.
Have to stay out of sight.
Convicts...Mathis must be on the move.
The steam tunnels...have to get there.
Shit. So, some kind of twisted family reunion.
****. So, some kind of twisted family reunion.
So, Donner is a very bad guy.
Mathis came here to spring him.
Tell me again why we aren’t dead yet?
But with the power down, what’s keeping the gates locked?
You mean...there’s someone else still out there?
Yeah. But just seeing you gives me a headache.
I gotta get out of here.
I need something to cut this rope.
I need something to cut this rope.
I need something to cut this rope.
I need something to cut this rope.
Rusty saw blade. Might be sharp enough to cut this rope.
Rusty saw blade. Might be sharp enough to cut this rope.
Rusty saw blade. Might be sharp enough to cut this rope.
Rusty saw blade. Might be sharp enough to cut this rope.
Can’t climb with my hands tied up like this.
Can’t climb with my hands tied up like this.
Can’t climb with my hands tied up like this.
Can’t climb with my hands tied up like this.
I need to get my hands free.
I need to get my hands free.
I need to get my hands free.
I need to get my hands free.
I need to untie my hands.
I need to untie my hands.
I need to untie my hands.
I need to untie my hands.
Damn it, up to my ankles.
Damn it, up to my ankles.
Damn it, up to my ankles.
Won't be able to move that again...
Won't be able to move that again...
Won't be able to move that again...
Have to push my way through.
Have to push my way through.
Have to push my way through.
Gotta get some fresh air in here.
Gotta get some fresh air in here.
Gotta get some fresh air in here.
Won't last long in this gas...
Won't last long in this gas...
Won't last long in this gas...
This has to be the way...
This has to be the way...
This has to be the way...
Can't let this gas stop me.
Can't let this gas stop me.
Can't let this gas stop me.
Let me out, and I’ll get the supplies.
He dies, and you guys take the rap.
I told you I was stubborn.
What do you have to lose?
I go out there, get attacked by wolves.
You let me out. I get the supplies. The Warden lives.
I could ask you the same question.
I mean, no. Not working for them.
Where are you calling me from?
I don’t know anything about a stalemate.
And I’m not on anyone’s side.
Where are you and what do you want?
I’m just trying to keep him alive.
Look, why don’t you tell me where you are and maybe I can help you.
Are you the one that’s messing up the convict’s plans?
Well...I mean I hear it’s nice in the summer.
I found stuff to help the Warden. Medical supplies.
I’m your neighbour in cell fifteen.
I cleaned you up the best I could.
You might have a broken rib...maybe more.
Mathis opened up a couple of bad cuts on you, so I stitched them up.
Gave you a shot of antibiotics...hopefully that'll prevent serious infection.
Oh, Mathis is no friend of mine.
I might have an idea of who it is.
But I talked to someone on the phone.
And why am I going to do that?
What do you have in mind?
I told you. I have no idea what that is.
That doesn’t look like a coat.
I won’t find the dam if I freeze before I get there.
Y..yeah. I mean, that’s what they asked me to do.
Ok. Nice to meet you, Jace.
So what are we doing here, exactly?
How do you fit into all this, Jace?
Well...it’s better than “Mister Mackenzie” I guess.
How did you end up at Blackrock?
What do you mean if this lasts as long as you think it will?
Do you know something about what’s going on?
Sounds like you think it’s more than just...lights in the sky.
Yeah, I can confirm that Mathis is not “Father of the Year” material.
He’s how I ended up here.
But yeah...he’s here to break Donner out.
What’s the worst that can happen if he gets out?
He gets stuck out in the wilderness and...freezes to death or gets eaten by something.
You worried about anyone in particular?
Ok, so...how are we going to make sure he stays in solitary?
I mean...I want to help, yeah.
And he’s got something I need.
I’m not hiding anything from you. I really don’t know.
It’s important to someone who’s important to me, and they were ready to die for it.
So I need to get it back.
I feel like I’m going to regret this, but...
And how do we do that?
Alright. How does that help us?
...you don’t have a nuclear bomb do you?
Well, ok. Let’s find those steam tunnels.
I made it to the power plant.
The whole place is dead. Nothing obvious to be done to get it running again.
If by “luck” you mean I managed to not get the power back up and running...
Then yeah...you could say I had some luck.
Not really. But I spoke to them again.
Whoever they are, they really don’t like Donner.
A little hard to do that from inside a cell...
I have no idea what that is.
I’ll do it. I’ll be quick.
Well...I managed to sabotage the locking mechanism.
Well...I managed to sabotage the locking mechanism.
And soon...thanks to me, he’ll have detonators too.
That doesn’t seem to be working out too well for you.
He plans to blast through to solitary and get Donner out that way.
But, I thought you said you didn’t have a...
What are you going to do?
It’ll take too long to explain.
We need to get out of here and get to Atwood, as soon as possible.
But what the hell is going on right now?
So, how do we get out of here, and stop Mathis and Donner at the same time?
Yeah...we have to stop meeting like this.
You monster. He didn’t do anything.
What the hell is going on?
I can see...lights in the prison yard. Fire.
Yeah. I’m trying to figure out what happened there.
You should have seen Mathis’ face.
Could you...see what was going on?
We have to get to Atwood.
Ok well, uh...you have the blueprints, right?
How do we get out of here?
There has to be another way out.
You have no idea how stubborn I am.
Seemed like a good idea at the time.
You’ll be warm in no time.
That is not a good sign, Jace.
Just...just wait. Hang in there. It’ll be fine.
Everything is going to be fine.
Got to be some way up...
Got to be some way through...
Has to be another way around.
Now to find some meds for the Warden...
Bastards. At least this map looks real enough.
I can still make out the road. I should follow it.
Need to look for supplies along the way.
These cars...dead. Like all the others on Great Bear.
Some kind of farm or homestead. All burned out.
That tower...I must be on the right track.
Abandoned...some kind of substation control. And shelter, for me anyway.
I have to find a way up and around.
A rope...looks like the only way down. Hope it holds this time...
That...that must be Blackrock. High walls...like a fortress
Aha! More power lines. Must be close.
Now let's see about that power.
Steam tunnels. Have to find that spillway first.
Argh! That thing burned me bad...
Argh! That thing burned me bad...
Argh! That thing burned me bad...
Feels like another record cold snap on the way.
I’d better get a fire going before the pipes freeze up again.
Great Bear Island. Dad used to fly there all the time. He said it used to be beautiful. Not much reason to go there these days...since the quakes and all.
Jackrabbit Remote Transport. Zero flights a day to the Mainland communities and...well...anywhere really.
What really happened here? Seems like people were here recently.
Where did they go? Why didn't they call for help or...just drive out?
Did anyone see a woman? Brown hair, would have had a tan jacket...scarf with...birds on it. Possibly injured.
Surely...someone will come looking. Someone will send help. Search and rescue? The military? The government?
You don’t think help is coming?
That was a long time ago. Things would be different now.
The power seems out all over town.
I’m sure...someone will come and fix it.
How can you be so sure?
You keep calling me a Mainlander. Why?
Ok, but you sound bitter about it.
I guess I don’t know much about that history.
Do you remember what you heard?
The old man outside of town...Methuselah. He said he’d seen other people...walking towards Milton.
Where would they be? Maybe my friend was with them.
Have you been able to remember anything else about that night? Anything that might help me find my friend?
Anything else you can remember might help.
I must be losing my mind. Smells like food cooking in here.
It was there, like you said.
No sign of her. The tunnel's blocked. Looks like maybe...an avalanche. But I think she got through before that happened.
So the tunnel is the only way through the mountains?
I’m starting to get pretty worried about my friend.
Put her to...I'm not giving up yet!
Wait...farm? Bank? What's this have to do with my friend?
You seem...distracted. Tired. Are you ok?
Are you talking about my friend?
She was there at the tunnel, at the bus. I’m sure of it.
I’m not sure, but she was there. I found a piece of her scarf.
I’m not sure, but she was there.
She left me another sign. A word: Perseverance.
She left me a sign. A word: Perseverance.
She’s telling me she won’t give up.
Why write such a long name, though. It has to mean something more.
Because she wrote it in blood.
Perseverance Mills. How do I get there?
I managed to get into the bank and...
Here’s the safety deposit box you asked for.
You said this would help me find her.
I need to find my friend. Do you think you’ll be ok here by yourself?
I didn’t come across anyone in the farmhouse or bank that seemed like a Lily.
Maybe you thought Lily and my friend were the same?
I don’t think you’re in any danger anymore.
You should have enough supplies to last a while now...I’m sure help is on the way.
I think I know enough about loss to understand why you wanted her pearls.
Lily’s still here, in Milton? Why didn’t you say so?
Damn...I didn’t catch the pipes before they froze. I’ll have to melt some snow on the old wood stove.
That scarf wrapped around your arm. Where’d you get it?
What did you do to my friend?
Damn...I was right. Pipes froze up again.
Where did you see her after that?
Damn it. Tell me where she is!
If you so much as hurt...
You have no idea how stubborn I am.
You go after the old lady in the house too? As well as letting those people in the school burn to death?
Imagine...how lucky you are. All those people in Milton...scared, and dying, and you getting to live.
You hurt my friend. Maybe even killed her for all I know. You scared an old lady half to death. You let all those people die.
A knife in the gut is the best it’s ever going to get for you.
This what you do? Hang around campfires and share wisdom?
Is this about the lights in the sky?
What do you mean, this has happened before?
I’m no hero. I’m just looking for someone. Doing my best to survive in the meantime.
You mean the...convict? How’d you know about that?
That bastard deserved to die all right, but it’s not for me to pass judgment on that.

Look...my friend is out there. I’m going to find her, and then we’re going to get out of here. The power’s going to come back, they’ll get the roads back open, Milton will recover...everything will go back to being the way it’s supposed to be.
...I must have gone right through the windshield.
Good luck, old man. Enjoy your apocalypse.
This what you do? Hang around campfires and share wisdom?
Is this about the lights in the sky?
What do you mean, this has happened before?
I’m no hero. I’m just looking for someone. Doing my best to survive in the meantime.
Avenging ange...wha...you talking about the convict?
How do you know about that?
The guy was a killer. If I let him go, he’d have killed again. Or worse.
I did the world a favour by putting him down.
Look...we’ve lived through lots of power outages and the thing is...the lights always come back on.
Good luck, old man. Enjoy your apocalypse.
Cheap electric crap. Never works when you need it.
Astrid hasn’t come looking for me, which means she can’t come looking for me...
I’d better get back up to the crash site.
So thirsty. Gotta be a way to melt some snow.
I might be stuck here a while. Better see what I can use.
Looks like debris from the crash site above.
Name’s Mackenzie. I’m the one who saved you from the bear.
I don’t think so...but I hit it. Maybe scared it away.
I bandaged you up but you’re in bad shape.
Is there anywhere to get medical help?
I see you have a radio. Can we call for help?
Well, you’ll need some stronger meds to avoid infection, and for the pain.
But, I’ve been around doctors enough to know you’ll be in trouble soon, unless you get some better help than I can give you.
Err...there’s nobody left to help you there.
The town’s pretty much deserted. There was a fire...and...
You won’t last days like this.
So we’re back to where we started.
There’s gotta be somewhere nearby that might have medical supplies, or another radio we can use?
Hang in there. I’ll be back as soon as I can.
Wai..what? What do you mean unstable?
This must be the way into Carter Dam.
Locked up tight. Must be a key or something around here...
Unfinished business with the bear, he said.
This place looks like it’s been empty for a while.
Seems like the quakes did some damage here.
Must be what the old guy meant about “unstable”.
Looks like this thing isn’t opening unless I can get the power working again.
But that’s a problem for later. I have to get those radio parts.
Looks like a whole mess of radio parts here.
Must be something we can use to fix the shortwave.
Aid Station. That sounds like what the trapper needs.
Notes: trapper refers to a fur trapper, someone who traps animals for their skin.

English: Let’s hope we don’t need it.
Take it easy. You’re pretty banged up and probably a bit delirious too.
I just gave you a shot of some heavy antibiotics. Might feel funny for a while. But it’ll help, and you’re going to need some time to recover.
Message? You mean...to your friend, asking for medical help?
That’s a military shortwave, isn’t it?
I know a bit about radios. That’s not like any surplus I’ve ever seen...
What’s this unfinished business between you and the bear?
The main reason I’m out here is...I’m looking for someone.
Dangerous...you can get hooked on this stuff.
I don’t remember needing my parka this early in the season. It seems to get colder every year.
She may have passed through here a few days ago. She might have been injured.
She passed through the tunnel leaving Milton, but then...I’m not sure.
The dam was pretty busted up, like you said.
You don’t sound like you agree.
Well, judging by what I saw in the Dam, I’d say the Forest Talkers are still active.
Can you tell me anything about where we are?
You sound like you like it that way.
So, no other people living out here?
And you? Why are you here?
The woman I’m looking for...she might be on her way to a place called Perseverance Mills.
Notes: Perseverance Mills is a place name in The Long Dark.

English: We were on our way there, my passenger and I, when we crashed.
I need to find a way to get there, or...contact her. See if she’s alright.
What do you mean -- the wildlife’s acting strange?
You said you had an idea.
What do you have in mind?
So how do we get the radio working?
Ok..so we have to “deal” with the bear.
But you’re half-dead and rifle shots don’t seem to do much, so...
What do you have in mind?
So, do you...believe it? The story of the demon bear? And the spear stealing its soul?
Listen old man, I’m not sure...
This...can’t be. It doesn’t make sense.
So...this is some kind of recurring aurora borealis?
And it’s...affecting the electricity? The power?
I’ve had a lot of trouble with wildlife lately. Is it always this dangerous around here?
What do you think is spooking the wildlife?
So...you think the aurora is...influencing the wildlife too?
Methuselah...you appear in the strangest places.
I’m not sure this is the right time for...
You know...it’s been a hell of a slog out there, nevermind that damn bear. I’ve nearly died more times than I care to count.
It couldn’t have been easy for you, either. But you seem strangely calm about the hostility of this place.
As strange as it is to run into you again, it is good to find a familiar face in all this frigid wilderness.
And keep to your paths. If this is a reckoning, as you say, I hope ours cross again.
Your best flights may be behind you, but you’re still beautiful to me.
Wha...town? What are you talking about?
Escaped the town? No...I just arrived.
What do you mean, the passing...
Damn...looks like one little detail got missed in the trapper’s “legend” of the old bear:
The spear didn’t survive the fight.
Must be something I can use to fix it in that old machine shed.
If wildlife doesn’t like light when the aurora is in the sky...
I’d better keep this with me.
Guess I can add “blacksmith” to my growing list of skills.
Let’s hope I don’t have to put this spear to the test.
Ahhh...not feeling so cocky now, huh?
And all it took was for me to go full-on Grizzly Adams.
I’d better get out of here before he comes back.
New world? What are you talking about?
I’m looking for my friend...she was with me when my plane crashed.
But it looks like she must have made it out alive.
Have you seen anyone pass by here?
What is this town? I don't recall seeing it on any maps...
I’d sure love to give you one last great adventure.
The legend might be bunk, but the spear is real.
Yeah...the bear is definitely tracking me.
You have any luck with the radio?
Let me guess. You have an “idea”.
Those look like military insignia stamped on there.
Now why would those be there?
And I guess I need to do this while Old Bear decides if I’m going to become the next chapter in his legend?
Hmph. Maybe he has...I don’t know...genetic memory.
Says the guy safely inside the wooden cabin.
What message? What does this have to do with me contacting my friend?
Ok. I’m on it. I’ll be back with the transponder parts.
What do I have to worry about? I have a legendary 150 year old demon bear hungry for my blood.
Bullets don’t stop him, but I’m armed with basically a medieval weapon which I’m sure will do the trick.
I’m stuck in this winter wasteland where lights in the sky make the power flicker and electronics explode, and the only people I seem to meet are all slightly crazy.
And this is all after I crashed my plane deep in the wilderness and somehow lost my ex-wife along the way, and I’d really kind of like to find her back.
Hmph. Let’s get on with it.
Ok...the first tower. Now to find those booster parts.
Holy shi....ok this time I’m ready for you.
Phew...I can still feel my face.
I need to find my friend.
That bear has an uncanny sense of timing.
BEAR! COME ON OUT WHERE I CAN SEE YOU.
Look. I don’t want to do this.
But I have things I have to live for. And if you come at me once more...
I didn’t want to kill you.
But this new world will make murderers of us all.
Any idea why all the cars are stalled and left behind?
Ok...so can we call Perseverance Mills?
He...hello? Is this the radio station at Perseverance Mills?
Is this the radio station at Perseverance Mills?
Hello? Is this the radio station at Perseverance Mills?
Hello? What do you mean, quarantine?

- Mackenzie.
- What do you mean, quarantine?
Is there a doctor with you?
Getting pretty late in the day. Guess I could make some coffee or...take a nap?
Well...we can find another radio. Or repair this one. Get new parts...
Ok, Jeremiah. I’ll take your message.
Well...don’t make all my hard work keeping you alive be for nothing.
Thanks. She’s out there somewhere. And she’s a strong one.
Getting pretty late in the day. Guess I could...take a nap?
Yeah...and this whole place feels...strange, and empty.
She’ll make it. And I’ll find her again.
There’s no telling if I’ll be able to make it back up this way after I go down. I’d better make sure I’m ready to leave Mystery Lake.
Might as well get some Coffee going.
Now to find the way out of here and get to the radio tower Jeremiah talked about.
Just need to grab my parka and we can go.
Then what are you still doing here?
It’s probably just...the storm. Power failure. I’m sure everything will be back to normal in a few days.
It's ok...I'm not here to take anything from you. Are you with the Forest Talkers?
You don't, but I'm not. Name's Mackenzie. And I'm way too stubborn to just leave you out here all by yourself. You'll have to trust me.
You don't, but I'm not. Name's Mackenzie. Seems like your back's against the wall and I know the feeling. Maybe I can help?
Notes: alt line for Lake Gunshots side mission

English: I have a feeling "the world" has bigger problems right now, but I'll see what I can do.
I've got your supplies and those documents you wanted here.
Right. I'll...uh...leave it all here for you, just like you asked.
Hey? You still alive in there?
Looks like I'm not alone out here.
Wolves. Need to give them room.
If I keep my distance, he might leave me alone.
I have a bad feeling about this.
Can't tell if anyone made it.
This day just keeps getting worse.
Come on!! Come and get it.

Notes: [Various non-verbal exertions for getting hit/struck, scratched, pummelled, etc.]
[Various exertions for pushing spear into bear]

English: I hope I never have to do that again.
Only one of us was going to make it.
If I don't keep my distance, I'm done. Got to find that spear.
There it is! The spear. Somehow, I gotta grab it. That'll even the odds.
There's the spear! Gotta grab it to even the odds.
Let’s see. Two people plus enough fuel to get us out to Great Bear and back leaves...hmm...almost no capacity for cargo.
If we’re too heavy we’ll burn through our fuel before we get there.
I’ll have to be careful about what else I take with me.
Astrid’s travelling pretty light. Wherever she’s going, she must not be planning to stay long.
The mysterious case. Astrid definitely doesn’t want to talk about what’s inside. Which means...she’s probably not supposed to have it.
The distress pistol kit is heavy, but I’d hate to end up in an emergency situation without it.
Woah. Looks like some kind of radio tower. I must be closer to civilization than I thought.
Great. A town. Maybe I can find help there.
Woah. Someone's just...sitting here. Frozen. What the hell?
Woah. Someone's just...sitting here. Frozen. What the hell?
Astrid’s a doctor so we’re covered there, but...probably best to have some extra meds just in case.
Water, energy bars, purification tablets. Breakfast of champions.
I saw the smoke from your chimney.
My plane...I crashed in the mountains nearby.
I’m looking for someone who crashed with me. A friend. She might be injured.
Listen...could you maybe point that gun someplace else?
But...where are we on Great Bear?
My plane came down in a storm and my compass was acting funny...
I need to find my friend, but...I’ll do what I can to help.
She crashed with me when my plane came down in the mountains.
Do you think she could have come through and been caught...by these bad men?
Ok...well, any idea how I can get out of this town? I need to find help.
I crashed without much food or gear myself.
And if these “bad men” cleaned you out, we’re going to need to find some food and fuel, or neither of us is going to make it through the next few days.
You have any idea where we could find some supplies?
I’ll do what I can, but I’ll need your help.
There must be somewhere in town to get food, fuel. The essentials.
Yes, I am. And I’ll be looking for signs of her. But there’s a lot of ground to cover, and without gear I won’t make it.
So while I’m looking for supplies, you see what you can remember about the night of the lights, and if she might have passed through town.
That way, maybe we can help each other.
Sitting here with a rifle in your hands...you expecting trouble?
The bad men -- did they try to hurt you?
On the way into town...there was an old man.
Glasses, big beard, walking stick...he seemed... a little odd.
Not what I wanted to hear.
More than one by the sound of it.
Look at the size of that thing.
Need to give it plenty of space.
You're not going to get me!
So, pilot. You’re back in the land of the living.
You’re lucky I used the nice end of the hatchet.
Ha ha...just seeing you makes me want to hit people.
Looks like we have a little problem.
I still can’t get into solitary.
You have any idea why that might be?
Don’t you ever say his name.
My guys say someone’s been tampering with the system.
Every time they take a step closer to breaking into solitary something new gets in their way.
Didn’t you use to run this place?
So, you telling me you have no idea how it works?
You don’t have much left, unless we get that door open.
COME AND GET SOME YOU FUCKERS!!!!
You’d better get him or there’ll be hell to pay...
Looks like I finally found a use for your metal case.
Use your head if you have to!
Use your head if you have to!
Use your head if you have to!
It's me or the wolves, take your pick.
It's me or the wolves, take your pick.
It's me or the wolves, take your pick.
If you think the wolves are bad...
If you think the wolves are bad...
If you think the wolves are bad...
If you let him get away...
If you let him get away...
If you let him get away...
Turns out you have a damn hard head, pilot.
Oh, you mean the one you asked about in the dam?
She had nothing to do with you.
Just some...old lady lost in the woods.
Wandered into the dam when I was there.
She saw me and wouldn’t stop screaming so...
Ha, ha. Oh, you have no idea.
Why you so worried about her?
Ha ha...these idiots think I’m a fool.
They don’t think I can figure out what happened here.
That they were too chicken-shit to take care of the Warden themselves...
That they were too chicken-**** to take care of the Warden themselves...
...and sent you out into the cold to do their dirty work.
And you...risking your life to save a guy you don’t even know.
Don’t you see that in this new world, Mackenzie, boy scouts will be the first to die?
If you’re going to make yourself useful...
...you’re going to make yourself useful to me.
Could it have anything to do with this?
Go find out what’s wrong with this place.
Well, obviously there’s something wrong with the power.
Though he’s been no help, map in the Warden’s office shows this place has its own power plant.
Get me some power so I can open the gates to solitary.
...the Warden gets it for real this time.
We’ll find a way to open it, very soon.
And then we’ll both know what’s inside.
That heavy bastard may be our ticket off this rock.
So carry him. And like the man says -- shut the fuck up.
So carry him. And like the man says -- shut the **** up.
Look what my guys found while investigating the old parts of the prison.
Someone is seriously fucking with me.
Someone who clearly knows more about this prison than they should.
Knew exactly what to sabotage to keep us from getting into solitary.
You know anything about this, pilot?
Whoever did this took a big risk, and went through a lot of effort.
A big-ass key that will unlock the door to solitary.
Or any other door we want.
It’s time to get back to work.
Can’t do shit with this dynamite, unless we find detonators.
Can’t do **** with this dynamite, unless we find detonators.
Since we found the dynamite in one of the machine sheds, the detonators should be around somewhere.
Of course, we can’t find them.
So...I’ll probably have to go a few more rounds with my friend the Warden here, to find out where they are.
You just sit tight and I’ll tell you when I’m done.
You may want to plug your ears.
You heard the man. Get going.
Well I guess the Warden was telling the truth after all.
Now, we blow a hole in the wall.
But first, let’s you and I have a little chat.
But every dog has its day.
Is that you keep lying to me.
You see...that’s exactly the kind of thing that...
First, you pretend not to know anything about the case.
Then, you go around behind my back, purposely trying to mess up my plans.
I know! He was so innocent. Just one of the “good guys”.
But he sang like a bird when we laid into him.
He couldn’t give you and your friend up quickly enough.
I know about your pathetic activities to slow me down, Mackenzie.
It makes me laugh because...the only reason I kept you alive, was I thought you could fly us out of here.
But, I’m starting to understand that here...here...we can be kings.
Back there is nothing but fire and cold. The old world.
My crew and I...we’re going to rule Great Bear.
Nobody can stop us. Not you, not your friend, nothing.
So you’ve outlived your usefulness to me, pilot.
And when I’m done with you, I’m going after your little helper.
I suppose you’re pleased with yourself.
You’d better hope nothing’s happened to my...
I am going to destroy everything you love.
You’re like a bad penny, Mackenzie.
You know, it’s amazing to me that a smartass like you has made it this far.
Too bad being stubborn isn’t the same as being smart.
And this must be the fly in the ointment.
This is the end of the line for you and your friend, pilot.
Well, today you lose, in more ways than one, girl.
This wouldn’t have happened...if not for you.
You’ve been a pain in my ass for too long, pilot.
It’s time for the bad penny to pay the ultimate price.
But first, you can watch me deal with the girl.
Good. I like them to struggle before they die.
YES!! That’s what I like to see, Mackenzie.
A little fight. A little will to live.
I knew you had it in you.
[a growing howl of homicidal anger that builds up over a few seconds]
I told her not to come up. I told her you couldn’t fly in this weather. For once, would you not be so damn stubborn and listen to me...
She just showed up. Said you’d see her. Said you’d fly her North. I know you need the money, but the weather service says...
The night is unforgiving. Join me by the fire.
Nynorsk: Natten er nådeløs. Sitt ved bålet mitt.

English: I’m Methuselah. I’m out here to witness the passing of an age.
Nynorsk: Eg er Methuselah. eg er her ute for å vera vitne til enden av ein tidsalder.

English: These are confusing times. Leit me see if I can help you make sense of them.
Nynorsk: dette er forvirrende tider. eg kan hjelpe deg med å forstå dem bedre.

English: I’m an old man. I’ve seen many things. Some would say, too many. I’ve seen this happen before.
Nynorsk: Eg er ein gamal mann. eg har sett mye. For mye, vil nokon si. eg har sett dette skje før.

English: The lights in the sky are a reckoning.
Nynorsk: Lysene på himmelen er oppgjørets time.

English: Mother Nature’s. The signs were there, for those willing to see them. This has all happened before.
Nynorsk: Moder Jord. Tegnene var der, for de som ønsket å se dem. Alt dette har skjedd før.

English: Big change is coming. Are you ready to face it?
Nynorsk: Store endringer er på vei. Er du klar til å møte dem?

English: Then I hope you find who you’re looking for.
Now, I think your journey takes you beyond this moment.
Stay and warm yourself if you like.
The world you are leaving won’t be the same when you return.
You won’t find what you’re looking for here. Your path lies forward.
The light is the key. Lose the light, and you’ll lose the way.
I have nothing more to say, friend.
...you know, Icarus fell from the sky, too. Hmm...
Nynorsk: Ikaros falt jo òg ned frå himmelen. Hm.

English: These are confusing times. Let me see if I can help you make sense of them.
I’m an old man. I’ve seen many things. Some would say, too many. I’ve seen this happen before.
We’ve sinned. Now we’re paying the price.
The lights in the sky are a reckoning. The wonder of humanity and all its creations, laid bare.
Mother Nature’s. The signs were there, for those willing to see them. This has all happened before.
Soon we’ll all be tested. We’ll all have to choose how far we’ll go to survive.
Big change is coming. Are you ready to face it?
The end of Milton’s story is a sad one. Too many people lost, after already too much suffering.
You chose to take mercy, to save a life that probably didn’t deserve to be saved.
Let’s hope you hold on to your merciful ways, and the new world doesn’t just grind you to dust.
How do you know this isn’t how things are supposed to be?
You keep your luck, stranger. I have a feeling, you’re going to need it.
These are confusing times. Let me see if I can help you make sense of them.
I’m an old man. I’ve seen many things. Some would say, too many. I’ve seen this happen before.
We’ve sinned. Now we’re paying the price.
The lights in the sky are a reckoning. The wonder of humanity and all its creations, laid bare.
Mother Nature’s. The signs were there, for those willing to see them. This has all happened before.
Soon we’ll all be tested. We’ll all have to choose how far we’ll go to survive.
Big change is coming. Are you ready to face it?
Perhaps. Yet you take the role of the avenging angel, choosing who will live and who will die.
Was it easier to do it, thinking nobody would ever know?
You might have. But “Die by the sword” could be a tough philosophy for a civilization that’s just been undone.
You might dispel the darkness at times, but the light is never coming back.
You keep your luck, stranger. I have a feeling, you’re going to need it.
How goes the war, my friend?
The war between man and nature, of course. The lights in the sky. You and the bear. The cold. Hunger. The old fights, returning.
There was no bear when I found you.  Perhaps it isn’t yet time for your paths to cross?
You still believe things are going to go back...to the way they were?
Remember...I said they were a reckoning.
It doesn’t make sense. And yet, it has happened.
And everything dependent on it. Animating it. Or destroying it. Perhaps both.
No. But it was only a matter of time. This has all happened before.
I’ve seen many strange things, of course.  But the birds and beasts? Their rhythms are their own.
The patterns of nature have been interrupted. Broken. Even those who once knew how to read them are now confused.
I can’t say for sure. But...the lights in the sky may hold the answer.
There is much in nature that we cannot understand. Would it be so strange?
Ho, Mackenzie! So you’re still alive.
You’ve left your mark. And have overcome great odds, so far. But...this part of the world still holds some secrets.
There are still stories that need to be told, if you wish to play a part in them. There is always time, for that.
But, if you are in a hurry -- by all means, go. Nobody would fault you for continuing your journey. Onward.
I have wandered these paths a long time, friend. I was a walker, now I’m a watcher. I’m here to observe these times, and help where I may.
Well...another stranger. Have you escaped the town?
Not a refugee from the highways then.
You look weary, traveller. Come, warm yourself by the fire.
I’m nobody. But you can call me Methuselah.
I’m here to witness the passing of an age.
You’re at the beginning of the new world, my friend.
Many people have passed. All have gone into the town.
I haven’t seen any come back.
Follow this road to the end. Look for the water tower.
It’s a town of the old world. Discarded. Left behind.
I’m not sure you’ll find any friends there.
I'm not sure you'll find any friends here.
They all stopped running. People abandoned them.
My heart weeps for you, stranger.
My days are nearly finished. But you’ll have to live with what remains.
The quakes changed everything here, years ago.
Great Bear’s back was broken, and it’s been laid low ever since.
Aren’t we here to witness an apocalypse of an apocalypse, you and I?
No one thought the world would end this way.
But how could they not have seen it?
I’m not sure anything will ever be back to normal.
Go safely, and good luck to you.
I hope you find what you’re looking for.
Found you out in the snow...
...almost dead. You were half-frozen and then...
Judging by those cuts, you’ve been dealing with more than just the bad weather.
...so to be honest a bit of storytelling’d be a nice distraction right about now.
Nice to meet you, Dr. Astrid.
Like, a head colds and babies doctor?
Oh ok, so not the useful kind.
I don’t get out much, but yeah I’ve heard of it.
The thing the stubborn guy you left in the plane crash might have?
So what you’re saying is the thing you need is on the other side of that collapsed tunnel in the mountains?
In the place where you ran into trouble?
Know what? You coming here. To Great Bear...
So the people up north. In Perseverance Mills.
...I’d say the trouble ran into you.
You must have some ideas, or...why travel all this way?
But you aren’t going to tell me what they are.
And the thing your friend in the plane crash has...
...the thing you need to help them.
You aren’t going to tell me what it is either, are you?
Well. You are a lady with a lot of secrets.
Well...we’re used to the power going on and off out here in Pleasant Valley.
So we’re usually prepared for it.
Feels like we run this farm on generators for better part of the year.
Problem is...now the generators won’t start.
Or the cars. Tractor. The TV’s dead. Radio won’t work.
Basically...the only thing that works is the old land line and rotary phone.
I guess it's cause it’s pre-electronics?
The old party line from when this farm was originally put in...
I’m not exactly sure how or why it still works, but it does.
Hmph. Nobody who’d help if you asked for it.
It’s better for you to stay indoors.
Lots of wolves out there, and it’s cold.
You aren’t strong enough to go out there yet.
Trust me, it’s for your own safety.
Like I said. It’s for your own good.
You’re a doctor. You should know that.
You should just mind your own business.
Rest up and we’ll talk more later.
What the hell took you so long?
Yeah it’s me. Listen up, doctor.
It’s those damn wolves! They've cornered me in the barn.
It sounds like they’re trying to find a way in.
Shit lady. Haven’t you been paying attention?
I need you to bring me something from the house.
Flower vase. Key to the basement’s under it.
Look for the gun locker. Grab the rifle rounds.
Take the old revolver for protection.
Might not be stop a wolf but it’ll slow one down.
Follow the blizzard line from the house to the barn.
Get here quick and we’ll figure it out. Hurry!!
Go straight to the gun locker. Stay out of everything else. Got it?
Look, sorry I bailed on you, but I couldn’t take a chance and wait.
One of those big bastards broke into the barn.
And as luck would have it...I’d left my bow in here last summer.
Anyways. Took care of that sonofabitch.
I told you to stay out of my shit!
Came across you in the snow.
You’d been out there for hours...
You heading up to the plane crash?
Yeah. Crow, or maybe a raven.
You risked your life to come here to help some sick people.
You came to help me when I was stuck in the barn.
You’re not going to leave a bunch of crash survivors to die in the cold.
I wouldn’t get your hopes up.
A few days in this weather, and with the wolves prowling...
...doubt you’ll find anyone alive out there.
Yeah, well...I left you a little present.
Relax. You have to trust someone, right?
But if you want to live, check out the trunk of that blue sedan, over by the swingset.
Almost like it was guiding me.
All the calls go to every phone in the area.
All I have to do is wait for you to pick up.
Yeah, I saw you found a survivor at the crash site.
You want to tell me what happened to your man?
You asked about my husband, when we were in the house.
Is failing to help someone the same as killing them?
Now you sound like a lawyer.
But my intent was for him to die.
Wasn’t sure you’d make it, to be honest.
Yeah. In the woods. In the dark.
You can wander for days until you get so hopelessly lost...
...there’s just no way to get back to where you were.
Woah, I hate to be a foregone conclusion.
Why did you work so hard to help those strangers?
Would they have done the same for you?
I doubt they would. You probably work all day, every day.
Bust your ass to help people.
Delivering babies or researching or whatever it is you do.
You don’t do it for recognition because, you don’t get any.
I could have been something, too.
Notes: Edited subtitle -- line shortened to one sentence.

English: Something more than a farmer’s wife.
Something more than a cattleman’s daughter.
Other side of the mountains. Old town.
I could have been something, but I let him stop me.
I let myself be small so he could feel like somebody.
I gave up everything for him, and to him I didn’t even exist.
I let him make me small. Less than nothing.
There’s different ways to hurt people.
Some ways heal. Other ways never do.
And I told you, the wolves killed him.
Nevermind that. I called to tell you something.
Old radio tower. Top of the hill overlooking my farm.
You can see the tower from my porch.
Not sure if you can get it working, but the radio up there’d be good enough to reach Perseverance Mills.
You could maybe find out about your guy.
The precious mystery thing you hope he has.
Well, I didn’t know if it’d work.
You must have wandered a ways, for me to find you where I did.
Girl gets lonely out here, I guess.
It was nice to have someone to talk to.
We have a lot in common, you and I.
We both left our men behind.
We both like to be alone.
We’re both hiding from our pasts.
I didn’t kill him, you know.
I just never had the courage.
And as bad as it got at times...at least I wouldn’t be alone.
I didn’t kill him, but I may as well have.
I watched while the wolves surrounded him.
I had a rifle in my hands.
It all happened, in slow motion.
Like there was no other way it could end.
And I just stood there, frozen.
He was yelling at me to shoot.
They circled, and then they were on him.
Because it’s important for someone to know.
That I don’t regret it. Not for a second.
Yup. They’re all going to pay now, Astrid.
All of them. We’ve been in the background, in the shadows.
It feels good to be on this side of the hunt.
So I’m making up for lost time.
Your pilot. The one you left behind?
He one of the good ones?
Then I hope to never meet him.
It’s been good talking with you, Astrid.
For a little while, you took the loneliness away.
I hope you find what you’re looking for.
I hope you can help those people up in Perseverance Mills, and...
You’re alright now. Don’t get too worked up.
That does funny things to people.
By the time I got you here, there was no way I was carrying you upstairs.
This is the warmest room in the house.
This cook stove is probably keeping us alive.
They were in the crash too?
So you left him out there?
Yeah? How are you so sure?
Nobody that sounds like your guy.
Like I said. Nobody that sounds like your guy.
You’re going to need energy to heal...
I’ll be heading out early to hunt.
And...it’s not safe out there so just stay in the house.
Ah! You’re awake. Thought you were resting.
Managed to bag a stag not far from the farm.
This’ll keep us fed for a bit.
I put it on for tea. So we can have tea and...
It’s amazing what hunger does to the mind.
If you’re feeling better, you can start answering some questions.
Like what the hell are you really doing out here?
We need a...doctor… or medical assistance. Anything.
We need a...doctor… or medical assistance. Anything.
Must not be a quarantine breaker then?
But not drowned like the others.
Why do we have to carry this sack of shit?
Why do we have to carry this sack of ****?
You hear about what happen to Leclerc?
Arrow in the chest, man. The chest.
Something’s hunting us out here and it ain’t just wolves.
What the hell we even doing out here?
Like...we might still need him...to get...”HIM”...out.
Ever since the bus crash...he’s been getting wild.
No. Nothing. But those fucking wolves...
What the hell. Let him run. He won’t get far with those wolves hunting him.
But Heller. The arrow in the chest, man.
Let’s go. Between Mathis and the wolves...I have a bad feeling about this place.
How the hell did he expect this to turn out?
Oh yeah, I mean remember that place on St. Catherines with the girl who...[slapped]
First we carry this guy, now this?
First we carry this guy, now this?
First we carry this guy, now this?
Mathis gonna be mad as hell...
Mathis gonna be mad as hell...
Mathis gonna be mad as hell...
We have to find this guy?
We have to find this guy?
We have to find this guy?
You think he's really a pilot?
You think he's really a pilot?
You think he's really a pilot?
Oh yeah...I wasn’t there but I heard about it.
Gonna lose a toe out here.
Gonna lose a toe out here.
Gonna lose a toe out here.
No way we find this guy now.
No way we find this guy now.
No way we find this guy now.
[knocked to the ground by a wolf]
[knocked to the ground by a wolf]
[knocked to the ground by a wolf]
I knew it went bad in Montreal but I didn’t know that story.
What are we going to do?
Well...we passed some kind of first aid building on the way in.
You hear all those wolves out there?
You do it. Why do I have to be the one who...
This is a bad idea. Mathis has plans for this guy.
The Warden doesn’t have much time left.
And in case you’re thinking of running away.
Remember...we still have your precious case.
I guess you’re tougher than you look.
Yeah, you’d better get in there to see him.
But first, you gotta let me frisk you.
Mathis’d have my balls if I let you sneak a knife in here.
...how long we have to carry this heavy bastard for?
Shit, looks like I lost that bet.
****, looks like I lost that bet.
Any luck with the job Mathis gave you?
Too bad. Mathis will be disappointed.
Oh well...back in your cage, dog.
It’s getting worse. We have to do something.
You said you had something that could help her.
Astrid...it’s getting worse. You have to do something.
You understand that better than anyone.
Find a way. And get up here as soon as you can.
We don’t have time for this, Astrid. You need to do this, and soon.
I’m afraid it’s happening again. I’m afraid we’ll lose her this time.
It was at the beach. Just pictures in my head, feelings.
One of those beaches where the sand goes way down to the water, no drop off.
I remember a... a grey day and dark water. No wind, no waves.
I was alone...looking around a lot.
I didn’t understand what was happening.
Wha...what do you think when you’re that little? Always wondered why it was that day, that trip that stuck with me.
They lost me...just a little kid.
Uh...the sun was out, but it was cold at the river’s edge. There was a group of us that day.
Ha..lots of laughing. Yelling. Summer in our heads.
Ha ha...no one was getting in the water. I guess I liked being first.
I didn’t even jump, just, hrmph...slipped in quietly away from everybody.
Uh the water was clear but...bitter cold. I thought the bottom...was closer.
My head went under right away. God, I was a lousy swimmer.
Uh...no one noticed me struggling in the deep pool.
Ah...my hand reaching for a flat, grey stone at the water’s edge. I...I grabbed it, I pulled my head out of the freezing water. A breath. The sun shining through the trees...above us. Was...
Was the sun out…? I thought...ah, the rain…no, no, no. I don't know, that, that wasn’t it.
It starts the same as every other time. A dark room, square. I feel the wall behind me and I can barely make out the walls to the right and left. Smooth, like steel or glass.
I can’t see the wall opposite me...it’s too dim.
I walk forward and that’s when I notice it. Every time. The pit.
Just...uh, a hole in the floor, really. Haha. It’s funny, the floor seems to slope a little bit as it reaches the edge.
But the floor is made of bricks. Bricks that start to bend.
Hmm...from across the pit, where the other wall should be. Something...darker than everything around it. Sort of...floating?
It moves to the edge of the hole. No face, just a moving shape. Uh...a shadow.
Is it me? My face? Goddammit.
And that’s when I wake up. Every damn time.
We just wanted to get out...to burn it all down. Or did we? Ha. I had it there, but I lost it again…I can’t remember what it was.
He said he’d stand with us if something went wrong.
Wha...what did we do? What did they make us do? They can’t get away with this.
Session 14, Project Medical Officer interviewing Patient 7.
Return to the first instance. What did you see?
Focus on the ending, the final frame.
Session 5, Project Medical Officer interviewing Patient 7.
Let’s visit the second instance again, first occurrence. What do you remember?
Carry on from where you were last session. Find the ending sequence. What do you see?
Keep hold of that image. It’s OK if it fades a little. Breathe. Try going again. Second instance.
Session 12, Project Medical Officer interviewing Patient 7.
Back to the third instance. Find the bridge between them.
And the end? The last image you can remember?
What shows up? Can you describe it?
We have attempted various psychological interventions with the team members.
Interviews reveal that the deeper the recall exercise, the greater the distortion. Consolidation failures appear in each patient, no matter the subject content.
So far, these have yielded little actionable data.
We do, however, hold out hope for a treatment strategy to apply away from their work environment. Proximity to the site of exposure is my last, best guess.
Behavioural changes are becoming more alarming. I will be including the following transcript excerpt in my summary report, to be filed with project leads before team extraction (should it occur):
We’re almost finished. Please stay calm. Where has your mind settled then? Focus on the last image please.
The island hasn’t been making our lives any easier.
Hauling loads from the coast to the inland bases has been slow and costly. And people are starting to notice our operation around the Airfield and Mine.
It's getting harder to stay under the radar.
But the character of the locals, both here and far inland, seems in our favour.
There aren’t any helping hands. Outsiders get ignored and then forgotten.
The mine is a real shithole. If my job is to shepherd the men, then their job is to keep the roof from landing on all of us.
But this week we found a decent chamber to start building Rüdiger's gadget.
Teams 1 and 2 are with the program, but on shaky ground. Team 3 is getting volatile again.
And while it’s unclear what they have planned, I’ve called for additional security to fly in immediately.
The Medical Officer has been conducting alignment interviews and has made some troubling observations.
I’m still considering the implications, both for the men as well as project viability.
My hope is the crew can keep their shit together long enough to finish phase one, and we can get out of this godforsaken place.
It's starting to get to me.
We ran power to Rüdiger's machine for the first time yesterday.
It was nothing like what they predicted, even at half-energy.
I still have no idea what the endgame for all of this will be. The whole project.
And I’m seeing now that few of the men building it do either. It’s all over their faces.
All this time underground isn’t helping their morale, but I’m confident our fragile truce will hold until we’re finished.
We worked hard to make it this far after what happened to Team 3.
Whatever happened here, it’s not a virus, or any known pathogen. At least, that's what the doctor tells me.
There are no visible injuries, only invisible ones.
My symptoms have just started, but they track what the others have gone through. Things are starting to get fuzzy, just like with them.
Faces I can’t remember. Like an old photo, blurry around the edges. Crumbling.
The few men left up here can’t be trusted to care for themselves. We've had to lock them in their quarters to keep them from wandering off.
We tried going a different way, more psychological. We had a little luck at first, and then it all collapsed again.
Rüdiger hasn’t been back to see us since we took the machine offline. I’m struggling myself, and holding out for the resupply he promised.
Will it get here in time?
I've changed, somehow. The men, the medical officer, all of us. But not him. Not Rüdiger
He’ll want the research. It shows some bizarre benefits, even if it’s come at a price. Rüdiger found what he was looking for.
Was our first day back down below since the boss and his people arrived.
He called us together and had us all sign new paperwork.
Boilerplate stuff, but it had us wondering.
Then he gave a speech, as he likes to do.
Only this time in front of the gadget.
I almost bought it, but then again I’ve never been too practical.
At least not enough to see what’s good for me.
He talked for a long time, but in the end we were able to restart our work on the machine.
We also re-bolted the track connecting the Concentrator to the ridge above.
Better access if we need to move in more generators.
This thing needs all the juice we can find.
Did I mention I need to get the hell out of here?
All our temp scaffolding is coming apart now.
Earthquakes and nervous hands will do that.
The final cables are set and insulated.
We still don’t know if it’s enough.
The generators they brought in could power a small town through the winter, but I don’t trust ‘em.
This is gonna blow up in our faces.
Their latest big idea is to bring some kind of doctor in.
None of the guys on my team believe a word of it.
Ever since we flipped the switch on that machine, no one seems settled.
We want to get paid, sure.
But we want to make it out of his hole in the ground, too.
I’ve gotta put a stop to this.
I’ve been walking the tunnels, up and down.
It’s like they turned the lights off in my head.
In every man’s journey there is a moment of total clarity.
When a blue sky or an empty road shows the way forward.
I have had several moments like this during my life.
But they always carried with them a spark of unpredictability.
An energy I did not control.
Was it these moments, these great creases in time that brought me my wealth?
My institutions and engines of influence and power?
I have explored many corners of the planet, and subjected myself to many dangerous and foolish undertakings seeking the answers to these questions.
Often in spite of myself and my ambition to define the absolute edges of my own existence.
But as the wheel of my life makes its final turn, I have decided they are the wrong questions altogether.
I am making new questions and with them, new answers.
It is only a matter of WHEN, and it is in uncovering the WHEN that I will define my own moment.
I have seen the new horizon.
If this reaches you, it means they made it out, and to the Mainland.
I sent them your way after we managed to get a chopper flight-worthy.
By now they shared my old call sign with you, from the Alaska days.
I hope that, and this note from my logbook, convinces you.
Do you recognize the book? Do you remember it?
It's gone bad over here, and strange beyond anything.
But it's on me now. And there are others still missing down below.
Take care, and keep an eye on the horizon.
I can probably make it back to the surface before the weather turns again.
Recording as much as I can, the writing helps keep me here.
To the sea. To small ships and deep water.
I tried to reason with him, to get him to see what this had all cost us.
The transmission site over the mountains.
He’s always had a way out, always.
So I came back down. To try and smash this thing. Or do something.
I think I’ll just close my eyes for a little while.
I wanted to see you again.
I wanted to feel your hand on my hip, your smile in my eyes.
I can’t picture what this thing is without that. Or you.
I keep seeing my spot up above, near the waterfall.
All that water, on its way to the sea.
The only thing I know is if I write it down it might get to you.
Looks like I made it through another night.
Nynorsk: Ser ut til at eg klarte meg gjennom enda ein natt.

English: Thank goodness...made it through another night.
Nynorsk: Takk og lov, eg klarte meg gjennom enda ein natt.

English: Looks like a new day is dawning.
Nynorsk: Virker som ein ny dag har begynt.

English: Looks like I survived another night.
Nynorsk: Eg overlevde visst enda ein natt.
Kjennes ut som om natten er på vei.

English: It's dusk so night can't be far behind.
Nynorsk: Det er skumring, so natten kan ikkje vera langt unna.

English: It's getting dark out here. Time to look for shelter.
Nynorsk: det byrjar å verta mørkt. Må finne ly.

English: The sun is setting. It's going to get a lot colder soon.
Nynorsk: Sola går ned. det vert snart kaldere.

Notes: Vocalization for when the male survivor sprains his wrist.

English: Can't afford to have a sprained wrist out here.
Notes: Vocalization for when the male survivor sprains his wrist.
Nynorsk: Kan ikkje forstue håndleddet her ute.

English: Gotta rest that wrist or it could get worse.
Notes: Vocalization for when the male survivor sprains his wrist.
Nynorsk: Må hvile håndleddet. Viss ikke, kan det verta verre.

Use the repaired Transmitter network to search Forsaken Airfield for signs of additional Bunkers.
Search Bunker Omega for clues about the fate of Rüdiger's project.
Search the Langston Mine for remnants of Rüdiger and his project.
Use the Handheld Shortwave to locate any signs of life.
Read the old journal entry found among the remains.
Use the Handheld Shortwave to track down the crashed helicopter mentioned in the Journal Entry.
Search the crash site for information and tools.
Search the Concentrator and Headframe facility for clues or tools to help locate Rüdiger's experiment.
Search the deepest corners of the Langston Mine.
Find a way to the tracks connecting the Concentrator to the ridge above.
Search the rest of the Mine for a way into the locked zone.
Return to the locked zone and use the key to enter.
Explore the locked zone of the mine for any signs of Rüdiger.
Check the Foreman's Reports for details on where to use the Mine Gate Key.
Investigate the Machine Chamber and Control Room.
Lay the Security Chief's bones to rest near the waterfall from her Logbook Polaroid.
